reviews.text: We came for some yummy Cheesecake Factory and cashier Raul C was super unprofessionally and awfully rude. We were deciding on what to get for the several cheesecakes we wanted but Raul demanded us to hurry up. There was no line behind us so I don&#39;t understand why he was so persistent for us to order quick. He talked back to us and raised his voice without literally no reasons Manager please speak to him because it&#39;s not helping the restaurant specially at times like this.

Came in for desserts for four and they said the wait was 30 mins or we could be sat right away at the bar high tops. We opted for the bar high tops and it took a while to get noticed by the server let alone our desserts to come out. Water took about 15 minutes to even touch our table. And the server was just all around acting weird. Waited a long while    for two orders of Oreo cheese cake and a strawberry short cake. Who knew it took that long to cut a slice of dessert and to put ice cream on hard bread! Definitely didn&#39;t walk out happy which is sad because we love our local Cheesecake Factory.

Love the area, love the layout, love the location! We&#39;ve lived nearby for years and this place is always a special night out. Easy to park (free for first 90 mins), easy to access, great views, good shopping, easy to walk to nearby stores or the pier for sunset.

What really constitutes one star is the stunt pulled by our waitress.  We came with a larger party of six for a birthday; after the meal was finished we wanted to have birthday deserts.  Still undecided on what everyone wanted the waitress informed us her shift was about to end and she wanted us to close out our bill.  She continuously stopped by our table to see if we had paid yet; at one point basically stood there until someone got out cash and paid her.   Over the booth I could see her arguing with the woman who was to take her shift.  After we had to pay, no one else wanted desert and we left. <br><br>  Some of the food choices are great and some just taste horrible. The spicy cashew chicken is just gross. I could barely eat half my plate and I was starving

I don&#39;t understand how the restaurant was literally 70% empty and there was still a 15 minute wait for a table for 2...how?<br><br>We finally get seated and no one came to help us for at least another 15 minutes. Again how is this even happening right now?<br><br>Time to eat and of course the utensils are really dirty save one fork that was redeemable with a wipe from some water and napkin. We got spaghetti and meatball which was okay but really overpriced...just had a craving haha. The rest of the meal was fine.<br><br>I normally love Cheesecake Factory but I would not recommend this location. Pass.

Coming here and seeing how the seating process was I knew I was in for a long one. I headed to the bathroom and saw that many tables were empty. A entire section was empty but we had a 15 minute wait on a sunday afternoon. So they were definitely understaffed which is unfortunate. Looking at the other reviews people are complaining about similar things so it&#39;s pretty spot on. When we got to the table all the silverware was left out on the table instead of on the napkin. Not the cleanest and most presentable thing to do. Also saw some silverware on the ground along with stuff lodged in between the seats. The bread was definitely shipped in and warmed up, like a Panera bread or Zoup! I got the herb crusted salmon with white rice and broccoli there wasnt a lot of broccoli but there was plenty of white rice. The taste was alright nothing great. Also tried a little bit of the the 4 cheese pasta with chicken and tomato basil, the sauce was okay as well. Another person at my group said there salmon wasnt cooked good, so she didn&#39;t eat part of it. The dulce de leche cheesecake was actually tasty, I enjoyed that. The oreo cheesecake was alright to. Being a cheesecake place I&#39;d hope it be good. Atleast they were.<br>The server was alright as well, she had many tables so she couldnt get to us and check up on us.<br>Cant expect to much from here, most cheesecake factory&#39;s always have sketchy service. I&#39;ll come back when I&#39;m invited I wont come back by free will.

Worst customer service ever!!!! We waited to get a table hour an half. Once we get in also waited 15 min to order food like wth!!! When food came pasta was so watery couldnt even eat. I&#39;d never come back!!!!!!!

This is a really nice Cheesecake Factory location. I highly recommend a reservation or getting there earlier the wait will be long. The service is good, and quick. Lots of options like every Cheesecake Factory! I also hadn&#39;t realized they have a Jamaican meal on the menu.
Food was almost cold when it was delivered to us. No spoons or forks plus they forgot to put a cheesecake. Poor service.

The location is awesome especially with the outdoor seating they offer. What ruined the moment is a group of people arguing over a stupid bill. This place would be awesome if there weren&#39;t as many loud mouthed people. Other than that, the server was amazing and so was the host.

This location of The Cheesecake Factory is absolutely *HEART EYES* ! It&#39;s located on the third floor, so its view overlooks some shops of the promenade. Seating on the outside is preferred, which is why there&#39;s like 30+ minute wait; but dining inside is just as nice, honestly. <br><br>FOOD<br>Lunch special is served until 5 PM, and I honestly think it&#39;s worth the most of your buck. The Cheesecake Factory does have a variety of food to choose from, but it&#39;s kinda like you&#39;re still left not knowing what to order.. Honestly, the food is a-okay-- it&#39;s food thats not as great-tasting as you&#39;d think, but you can still keep eating. <br>+ Ordered (mostly) Lunch Special:<br>* Asian Lettuce Wrap Taco ($8.95)-- not fresh.. the lettuce was rather soft than crunchy.. overall, it had a sweet taste<br>* The Everything Flatbread Pizza w/ Caesar Salad ($14.95)-- pretty filling, probably the only thing I actually liked out of what we ordered <br>* Pasta Da Vinci ($14.95)-- little bland w/ slight sweet taste.. the sauce just slides right off as well<br><br>SERVICE<br>Pretty much mediocre. The waitress began with a good impression until she took her break shortly after helping my family and I, then switched out to another waitress who barely paid any attention us. My family and I had to ask more than 2 times for anything.. <br><br>Try The Cheesecake Factory (at least once) for:<br>* HUUGEE SLICES OF CHEESECAKE !<br>* Wide Selection of Food<br>* Aesthetically Pleasing Ambiance  <br>-- it&#39;s kindaa SWEET !

Went here yesterday. The food was amazing. Ofc like always their bread was delicious. Our waiter was nice. He was very friendly. Idk his name but he was a male with nice brown or black hair. Stud earrings. I got the lasanga verde and Oreo cheesecake gotta say they were both delicious. Thank you staff!!

It is 9:30PM...There is absolutely NOBODY in the waiting lobby and the host told my family and I that the wait was 1.5-2 hours due to them not having servers on site. Mind you this place closes at 11pm today. I drove all the way from Gardena,CA for this crap!? If you don&#39;t want to serve us then just let us know. <br><br>NEVER AGAIN!

Jake our server seemed like a friendly guy. But the overall experience was terrible. I ignored all the bad ratings from fellow yelpers .. because I do love the food and have some favorite selections. First of all Jake didn&#39;t offer us any water or bread and the wait time was extensive about 20 minutes. I finally waved him<br>Down and asked if we can have some water . He came back and brought one only ? Than Jake said oh you wanted two ? I am sitting with my boyfriend so that was obvious .. than I watched Jake interact with a friend at the table<br>Next to us .. he ordered bang bang chicken and got water and bread before we even got our food order. He was so busy chatting with his buddy we were left sitting and waiting.<br>Another issue.. don&#39;t get me wrong I am<br>A dog lover but if I want to eat with dogs I would&#39;ve wanted a section designed for people with dogs at the outdoor seating. Reason being the customer who has a white fluffy dog had hair flying and landing on my boyfriends dinner plate ok so it missed the food we decided to be quiet and continue on eating until<br>A second hair landed in his beer.. ok now I was left upset lost my appetite asked<br>For to go boxes and didn&#39;t eat the food at all. I wasted 100 dollars on a lunch ? Hmm I finally asked for the manager on duty..I explained the overall experience.<br>The fries were cold too.. one ear out the other. <br>Thai wraps and Bang bang chicken are two of my favorites but the Mac n cheese burger was terrible.<br> Pot stickers had a weird taste overall didn&#39;t like it !<br>Expensive lunch that all went to waste.I left upset he didn&#39;t listen at all and just brushed it off and said he would mention my concern about the dogs at his meeting.<br>When I went to pay the bill .. the beer was on the bill still after Jake said it would be removed .. and we never got a replacement beer waiting and waiting for check .. still didn&#39;t get the beer and had to cancel<br>That too ! This location honestly doesn&#39;t deserve any stars. Terrible service

The worst part wasn&#39;t my wilted/rotten salad or the stale bread. The absolute worst was the server/runner that commented on our tables food choices. I ordered the pizza and so did my son. Let me just start by saying that my son is autistic, making his food choices very limited due to sensory processing issues- VERY COMMON IN AUTISTIC PEOPLE. With as few words as possible, getting my son to eat is difficult. So if my son wants a pepperoni pizza- guess what i let him have it. And one more thing I&#39;m this insanely offended because i have a 4 year degree in nutrition and dietetics. Not only did he say &#34;good luck surviving this thing, heart attack waiting to happen&#34; upon delivering our food but he also followed it with a &#34;oh, look you survived!&#34; After we had eaten it.  dude just shut your mouth ! You work at this place, if it doesn&#39;t align with your diet choices then WORK SOMEWHERE ELSE! We rarely get to eat out, and this just made our experience well shitty. Anywhoooo! The other staff was wonderful, our server was really kind. The view was also spectacular, very cute spot for a date or just to hangout. But man they need to work on their service etiquete.

This review is for their cheesecake.  They are always so good for pickup.  I never enjoyed dining at any CCF locations.  I find it their menu a headache to read.  There&#39;s too many items to choose from and big portions that are wasted.  They need to recycle!

Waiter was a bit rude, and was just okay.<br>The wait time was about 30 minutes for a sunday night.<br>Ask the waiter for the brown bread, and she said she doesn&#39;t have it, when the table next to us got it...<br>waiter did not smile, and gave us an attitude.  please work on customer service.  <br>Food was just okay, ordered the chicken pasta, tasted like something I can make at home.

So its the long weekend, and I wanted a quick bite. <br>I needed a table for 2. <br>I was seated IMMEDIATELY. <br><br>Chris, our server was attentive and delightful from the moment he introduced himself to the table. Thanks! <br><br>(The food here is always consistently good) <br><br>Thanks for making my day by the beach even better!

I want to just genuinely compliment the management team on a great front desk greeter his name was Alex, in the mist of all the craziness in the world he was very calm and welcoming and very patient with us and all of our questions. Bravo management !! Such a great experience !!
First time going to this location! Prepare to wait for more than 2hrs. Unfortunately you have to pay for parking

I honestly wish I could leave no star. A little over a month ago I ordered takeout for dinner. I spent $140. There were no utensils provided. When I asked for bread &amp; butter I was told that they no longer &#34;do that&#34;. The portions were child size.... &amp; to top everything off at the bottom of my nachos there was a shrimp tail. NO where in my order was there SHRIMP. There was literally trash in my nachos. A shrimp tail is trash, someone else&#39;s trash. The next day I called &amp; spoke to the manager David, who said he would take care of everything. A week or so after that I received a gift card for $20.... what a joke! I spent $140 to get a shrimp tail &amp; child portions. I don&#39;t ever plan on going back to this location. I honestly I don&#39;t ever want to go to any cheesecake factory location. If the manager David thinks a $20 gift card is taking care of everything, something is seriously wrong with him... <br><br>Please don&#39;t waste your time eating here or getting takeout. Don&#39;t waste your time or money.

The food was good. The service me and my wife had this time was very poor. It was are anniversary. This was the place i took her on our first date. I came back because of the beautiful scenery. Sad to say, the service hear was very poor. Took 10 minutes to get ketchup. Took 20 minutes to get a box for our food. Not happy about that. And plus are server seemed very annoyed

Honestly I&#39;ve never been more disappointed in a Cheesecake Factory. I go to Cheesecake Factory locations all over the place and decided to try this one. <br><br>If there was a 0 star option that&#39;s what I would give it. The service was okay and only 1 item (out of 5) was decent. <br><br>We ordered the lunch portion of the chipotle chicken pasta..it was decent.<br><br>The other things that we ordered were the ahi tartare, fried zucchini, and crab &amp; artichoke dip. <br><br>I wanted to die the second I put the crab and artichoke dip in my mouth. I spit it out. It tasted so fishy and disgusting and it was SOOOO beyond oily. I felt like I was eating food straight out of the ocean. <br><br>I wouldn&#39;t recommend this location. Especially if you&#39;re a Cheesecake Factory lover. <br><br>I am nauseous to my core and the rest of my group is not feeling too hot either. NASTY.<br><br>Wait, there&#39;s more. <br><br>The complimentary bread and butter that comes with any Cheesecake Factory meal was stale beyond belief. Honestly could&#39;ve chipped a tooth on that is happening. The butter is this whole other story, also nasty af.<br><br>Basically, you&#39;re paying for the view of this location. <br>The food? McDonalds is better.
The RUDEST seating process ever<br><br>We had 90 minutes on a meter.  We never good seated when they told us it was aa  15-20 minute wait. No pager. Then pager. Crazy. Rude

Honestly, only leaving this review because our waitress Jevae (so sorry if I&#39;m butchering her name!) was the nicest waitress I had encountered during my 2 day stay in LA. She was phenomenal all around, answered questions, quick with the drinks, and helped decide on food items. First time at the cheesecake factory, will come back next time I&#39;m in the area.

I had dinner with my former coworkers yesterday at Cheesecake Factory at this location. I particularly like this location because it&#39;s located in a shopping center third street promenade Santa Monica.  The Santa Monica pier is just across the street.  So convenient! You can take a stroll on the pier/ go shopping and have dinner! All within walking distance.  They have a parking garage that is not too far from the restaurant- very convenient.  It&#39;s free first 90 minutes and they charge about 2 dollars the next hour (which I think very reasonable for west la/ Santa Monica area).  <br><br>I always like the complimentary bread and butter here. It&#39;s excellent.  <br><br>They have a large menu and it can be overwhelming if it&#39;s your first time here.  The most popular appetizer is probably avocado egg rolls.  Anything on the specialties menu is good.  I like all the pasta dishes here.  They also have a good selection of drinks and desserts.  This place is perfect for gathering and any celebration with a large group.  Anyone can easy find something on the menu.

We knew what to expect when we came here. Cheesecake Factory is pretty standard and it&#39;s a chain so no surprises. We had time to kill while waiting for our hotel room to be ready and we were hungry so we opted to have lunch here. We were seated promptly and provided with water and fresh warm bread after we ordered. My son ordered off the kids menu mini corn dogs with fries and the sliders (he said he was hungry!), my daughter and I split the pasta carbonara (dinner size). The carbonara was on point, arrived piping hot. Yum! My son&#39;s corn dogs were a good size, thick beef dogs and the sliders he said were tasty. He ended up only eating 1 corn dog after eating the sliders. He was full. We had way too many fries we didn&#39;t make a dent at all. I must say that we enjoyed our food. It&#39;s a solid lunch spot as they have lunch portions for reasonable prices. We knew what to expect but was pleasantly happy with all our entrees.

We are from Orange County and usually like to take the family to eat at Cheesecake Factory..<br><br>We came here yesterday and we got treated by some of the rudest workers where they looked like they hated their life working there! <br><br>The food was absolutely disgusting the wings we preferred for appetizer were extremely dry and cold! We had to ask the waiter for them to be reheated! The pasta dishes we received were also cold and just didn&#39;t seem like you were eating at a nice restaurant.<br><br>4 people we spent $200 dollars and after this visit we will never walk into a Cheesecake Factory again, not even if we were offered free food.<br><br>What a shame to a once used to be a good family casual restaurant. <br><br>Left very unhappy and will never be returning again.

There was a cockroack in our table!!!<br>Bad experience. After I saw it, I didnt want to continue eating our food. The manager dropped our check and didnt charge us for our food. But I will no longer will be coming here.

This was my first time eating at this Cheesecake Factory. We sat in a lovely booth with comfy seats located on the outside terrace, overlooking third street promenade. There is a nice, private elevator to take you straight there from the street level. <br><br>Our server was excellent! My family tried a few of the new menu items. The chipotle shrimp salad was delicious! It is very tasty, and a perfect portion for one. The portion is much smaller than the other menu items. The poke bowl is a skip it! Taste wise, it is decent. But it should be renamed rice bowl with a tiny sprinkling of finely diced poke. I would not order the dish again. <br><br>We planned on trying both of the new cheesecakes, cherry and cinnamon. Our server strongly steered us away from the cherry that we were already on the fence about. Instead, he raved about the pumpkin. My husband and son love the pumpkin cheesecake! The cinnamon cheesecake was tasty, but I would not order it again.  <br><br>We had no wait on a Wednesday at 12:45pm. I was shocked at how empty the restaurant was. Now that is off tourist season, Santa Monica is so much more pleasant again!

Was here last week and had a great experience! Food was delicious, drinks were on point! I want to give a shout to Giana she was our waitress so attentive and friendly! My next visit I would definitely would be requesting her service! :) thank you

The service here is definitely horrible. Came here on a not busy Friday afternoon and weren&#39;t even acknowledged by the person at the front desk. She never even looked up at us and just asked how many people we had in our party. Didn&#39;t say anything and just told another person to sit us. <br><br>Once we were sorted the actual server was equally as horrible. The guy was rude from the get go when asking for small requests like water or giving us a min to look over the menu. <br><br>Overall the customer service at this place sucks. The food was good, but I don&#39;t wanna eat at a place where they have rude people. I would rather eat at the food court instead of dealing with this place.

Served by Freddie. He provided us an excellent experience. I would go as far to say I learned a thing or two from my experience tonight with the way he carried himself tonight. The restaurant had outdoor seating available for dinner. We were provided QR codes for menus which I thought was a great idea. Felt comfortable here. Thank you guys for a great night.

Came here for food and drinks. We ordered whisky sours, which tasted like concentrated sour mix. We didn&#39;t even get tipsy after the third one each. We asked for bread and ordered our food. The food came first (about 40 min wait before we got the food btw). <br>It tasted and looked completely different than usual. We got a spicy chipotle pasta that tasted like the sauce burned while it was cooking. It didn&#39;t have honey or cream in it so it tasted very very intense. We asked the waiter to send it back and have them fix it. It tasted better after, but the burnt flavor just killed the whole plate. <br>We got a chicken bellagio,too. The sauce usually tastes like basil but this time it tasted like mushrooms and cream. Very disappointing.<br>We got the bread after we got the check, btw. <br>The restaurant was about 40% filled btw. <br>Train wracks.

We arrived as soon as they opened. We were seated on the outside patio. We ordered our drinks and food. The food arrived at a good time, however, our food arrived before our drinks did. All we ordered was lemonade nothing fancy or alcohol. I did notice our server was busy. He seemed to have several tables. So I don&#39;t know if it&#39;s an issue with staffing or they didn&#39;t know so many people were going to show up at opening time. <br><br>Try to get seated outside. It has a really nice outdoor view and you can see the sea.

WORST SERVICE EVER!!! After we got seated, no one even acknowledged us to take our order. Waited 30 minutes until I got up to ask someone to demand someone to come by. I mean WTF, no one even came by to give us water! Took another hour to get our food after I asked them to follow up.<br> <br>Funny how we got our check immediately when I asked. That&#39;s the key thing to highlight from this location, you have to ask to get any kind of service, such BULLSHIT!<br><br>This regular patron will never come back to this location.

I came here today with my mom and my bf to have late lunch. It took probably 20 minutes to get our appetizers then another 30-35 minutes after the appetizers were served before we got our entrees. If I didn&#39;t follow up our order it would probably take it longer. I love the complementary bread and butter but I was so hungry waiting for my meal that when we got finally got it, I&#39;m already full from my the free bread. The cheesecake tastes good and creamy but Overall, the food was underwhelming for the price.<br><br>I understand that it&#39;s Sunday and it&#39;s also LA Marathon day, but it took forever to get our food. They should have made sure that they had enough staff to cook and serve the food knowing that it&#39;s gonna be a busy and packed day for them. The food is expensive and I felt underwhelmed by the experience that I have to go to another restaurant for dinner. (I don&#39;t usually eat out more than once a day)<br><br>Pros: The patio/ambience was really nice. The server was very nice and friendly too but he was very busy attending to a lot of tables that he didn&#39;t have the time to refill our water. I feel bad because I usually give 18% tip but I feel that the amount of time we waited for our food and the service we got would not justify it. I don&#39;t think I&#39;m coming back here :(

Came in for the cheesecake, absolutely nothing noteworthy, the white sugar used wasn&#39;t fully blended, and was crunchy, the flavors were rich, but other than being sweet, had very few distinguishable flavors. The crust did have a lovely crunch, and the house made whip creme was a nice touch.

50 minute wait at 730pm on Saturday. Not bad actually. Just walk around the mall. Food is always good--chicken littles with mashed potatoes and corn succotash; herb crusted salmon, truffle honey chicken are all good. The menu has so many choices, everyone should find something to satisfy their hunger. Then......desserts--cheesecakes --all sorts of flavors--banana cream, cookie dough, snickers, lemon, chocolate, strawberry --all my favorites<br><br>  Today, 4/16 came to celebrate my son&#39;s birthday and at check in we asked for inside table. There were many available tables inside at 715 but 3 parties were called at the same time and we were walked to the outside patio. It was a bit windy even though they had heaters it was still cold. We were wondering why&#39;d they sit us out here when there were many empty tables inside --then I noticed that we 3 different parties  of 4-6 people (we were 5) were all Asians!  Hmmm, is the outside patio for Asians?!!!!  I don&#39;t like to bring this type of stuff up but we specifically asked for inside and I heard one of the girls in the other party also said they wanted inside and the guy said &#34;if you want inside it&#39;s a longer wait or be seated now&#34; kinda weird when there&#39;s empty tables inside.  Food is still good and service was fine
The pizza was very tasty!  The restaurant is nice and clean, but the service left something to be desired.

I hardly go to The Cheesecake Factory, but I got a gift card for Christmas that I wanted to use.  Instead of ordering an entree, I decided to buy three slices of cheesecake--Very Cherry Ghirardelli Chocolate, Cinnabon Cinnamon Swirl, and Mango Key Lime.  The first two flavors I&#39;d never had before.  After tasting each one, they were all rich and decadent.  I had a cold glass of milk to go with it.  Mmm!

Beautiful cakes. Rich and creamy, can get a little too sweet after a few munches.<br><br>Excellent ambience to the restaurant.<br><br>Priced at the upper end.<br><br>Taste: 8/10<br>Presentation: 8/10<br>Service: 8/10<br>Ambience: 10/10<br>Value for money: 8/10

Is this thing on? <br><br>I just want to start by say I eat at Cheesecake Factory a lot. Like not once a month a lot like 4+ times a month a lot. Topanga, Glendale, Sherman Oaks, Santa Monica are my mains. <br><br>It was a busier than normal night for this location which is understandable but it was a pretty messy night all the way through. <br><br>Now that you&#39;re comfortable here&#39;s why; there was half of Santa Monica waiting outside to be seated yet we were quoted 20-25 minutes, my boyfriend and figured it was due to a bunch of two tops about to leave. Well about 45 minutes later I decided to check on our table. I was told that they were waiting for tables to leave. Again understandable as people like to sit and chat after a meal. At around the 65 minute mark our buzzer buzzed. I handed it over and was told to wait in Cheesecake&#39;s infamous secondary holding pattern until our name was called. <br><br>We waited, and waited, and waited. We watched a lot of people get called, in fact everyone was called and I noticed the ticket holder was empty and new tickets were added. Without a doubt we knew that we were forgotten about. Cheesecake&#39;s iron class system had failed for what you will find out not the first time. Again I asked what was going on and immediately the host realized the screw up and finally after an 1 hour and 20 minutes we were finally sat. We were both pissed to say the least. <br><br>We knew exactly what we wanted and our server was extremely accommodating apologizing for his slow response (it was busy) so we understood. Side note our server was the best part of the experience. <br><br>We ordered food and drinks at the same time. I ordered a Makers Manhattan Up. For those of you who have no clue what that is it&#39;s Makers Mark, sweet vermouth shaken in a tin (not stirred) poured into a martini glass (UP) and garnished with a cherry. Our Bartender was one of the ones who had no clue what this was. I was asked if I wanted it with ice or no ice. That doesn&#39;t make sense I asked for it up. Then I got just makers mark shaken to death in a martini glass with only god knows what else in it. I received it 20 minutes after I ordered it. It tasted like a beginners whiskey watered down. No cherry no sweet vermouth. I reordered a Makers Neat. I was hoping the bartender that meant with no ice. It took a minute so I&#39;m sure he googled it but I got it neat. <br><br>Our food came out seconds after I finally got my first drink. I ordered the Tomato Basil Pasta my boyfriend the orange chicken. The pasta should have grilled chicken on it at least it used to. This one has about two cubes of something that resembled chicken. At this point I don&#39;t care I&#39;m not saying a word. My boyfriend looks at me with a look I dread. Disappointment. His orange chicken was okay but his white rice was definitely old it was dried out it was everything you don&#39;t want white rice to be. Now before you say, &#34;why would you order white rice and orange chicken at an American restaurant?!&#34; I urge you to try it it&#39;s delicious. Like who would have known?! <br><br>The next day while at work we tend to talk food and as I rehashed my experience I decided to chip into corporate about the experience which I did. Thus far, crickets. Not a good sign considering this is a service related issue. <br><br>Anyways my thumbs are tired. Cheers!

I got half of a meal and waited 30 minutes even though I had ordered takeout ahead of time. DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE I ordered a hibachi steak and got 6 baby pieces literally barley half a meal such a rip off and super long wait times even if you order for takeout.

The food was good the low review is strictly on the service. <br><br>I requested a booth outside and was told to return in 30min. When returning I asked the host if our name had been called (since they didn&#39;t have pagers to hand out) she responded with attitude that we were next. They ended up calling every name but ours. So I went again to ask where we stood in line and they said our name was not on the list &#34;it got lost&#34;. After about 45 min we got our table but inside ... we decided to just go for it. <br><br>Finally excited about food! My pasta was served and I was asked if I wanted any cheese for my pasta ... the cheese never came around. <br><br>The price is not worth it!

I love the Cheesecake Factory! Especially the Santa Monica location. Such a fun place! The food and drinks are good. The horrid of Veuve is only $80, everywhere else 150 and up. I was surprised but it&#39;s great.
Main meal was very tasty, service and server friendly and helpful..that being said, our appetizer of sauté Brussels sprouts was, terrible...left overs is what comes to mind...do not order this ..

You can get take out at Mother&#39;s beach in MDR. The happy hour has cheap delicious food and overall this is the best franchise restaurant! The portions are big enough to share and in always satisfied with their service, promptness, and dining.

Dear Cheesecake Factory...I am the QUEEN of happy hour...and your H.H. actually Knocked my socks all the way off...if I were wearing any!  Do yourself a favor and find the nearest Cheesecake factory and save it under your bookmarks as your &#34;go to&#34; when in need of H.H.  Oh...my...mother...of what!?!  Everything on the Happy Hour menu is $5.95, all drinks and food!  We were saving our appetite for the monthly food truck extravaganza in Venice later that evening so we settled on two items to share:<br><br>Pork Belly Sliders: Slices of Slow roasted smoked pork belly with barbecue sauce, Cole slaw and fried pickles...I wanted to call my momma <br> so we could meet up...and I could slap her this was SOOOOOOOOO good!  But I&#39;m not violent so... :)<br><br>Chicken Pot Stickers: Pan Fried in the classic tradition served with soy-ginger sesame sauce-a must!

Happy to give four stars for the quick &amp; friendly service at the take-out cheese cake bar. The friendly server quickly assembled our order and upon request got us some water to-go as well. The quality and richness of their Godiva Chocolate Cheese Cake remains consistent.

Cheesecake Factory is located inside of Santa Monica place on the third floor where most restaurants are placed. I came with a few friends and one of which ran the LA marathon. There were a total of six of us and once our beeper went off we were seated right away. We were seated at a table that was half booth and half chairs. <br><br>We were given menus and asked what beverages of choice. We were all given waters; I ordered a ginger beer (ginger is good for digestive system) and I don&#39;t remember what the rest of the group ordered. Once we all had our drinks we were ready to order our food dishes. I won&#39;t go into what everyone ordered. I normally get the vegan salad as it&#39;s really good here, but on a whim I decided to go with the Korean cauliflower as it is also quite tasty. I wasn&#39;t super hungry and that would fill me nicely.<br><br>When the food arrived everything looked rather lovely. Lasst uns Essen--That means let us eat! The Korean cauliflower was as good as I remembered it last. It was not spicy and it had a nice flavor. Food filled the table and needless to say we consumed it all. A glass shattered to the ground in far off distance in the background once or twice but that did not put a dent in our overall experience. Nevertheless, our waiter was nice and attentive. Once we were finished our waiter gave us the bill, we paid, and we were on our merry way. <br><br>&#34;One positive thought in the morning can change your whole day!&#34;<br>-unknown

(Review only for to go services)<br><br>This Cheesecake Factory is located at the Santa Monica Place Mall, on the 3rd floor. You can either take the elevator or escalator to get up here. <br><br>After seeing a show nearby, I really wanted to get myself a slice of the special celebratory cheesecake since I was unable to get a slice when I was at another Cheesecake Factory location a week prior (the service was so lousy that I decided to just get myself a slice at another location). <br><br>So I came by this location with my husband on a Saturday night, around 10:30 pm. We walked in and headed directly to the bakery. I made my order of:<br><br>Celebration Cheesecake, $8.50 prior to tax- This cheesecake has layers of vanilla cake in between a layer of cheesecake, strawberry, chocolate and vanilla mousse. Also a cream cheese frosting, adorned with sprinkles (what birthday cake would be without it?). Yum and absolutely delicious! The creaminess and crumb of the vanilla cake go so well together and melt in your mouth. There was also a dollop of whipped cream on the side. This cheesecake was consumed over 3 days and each day was still very moist and perfect for dessert. My husband has never been a fan of anything birthday flavored (birthday flavored ice cream, cookies, etc) but did like this cheesecake. <br>-------------------------<br>(Total= $9.42 after tax)<br><br>Service was friendly and fast. I was wished happy birthday by the 2 employees helping me (since I had told them that I was purchasing this for myself because of the festivities). Included in my to go order were some napkins and 2 plastic spoons, in case I wanted to have it right away. <br><br>The overall rating for this restaurant location 2.5 stars with over 550 reviews. I am sure that if I had dined in at this restaurant, my experience may have been different (just read some of the other fellow Yelp member&#39;s reviews... long wait, mediocre food and service is the common theme). But for now, I am rating this place with an overall rating of 5 stars based on this service that I had received. <br><br>By the way, for the parking situation, you can park at the mall&#39;s parking structure that provides the first 90 minutes for free. The hour thereafter cost $1 and then $1.50 for 30 minutes after that.

This was hands down the best service I&#39;ve received from any other Cheesecake Factory. The management staff got involved in seating my family and got us a great table, our waiter was extremely attentive, polite and fast. And my food was great. My wife, kids along with myself had a wonderful experience. Thanks s bunch guys. And thanks for complimenting my Kobe Dodgers Jersey.

Food was good, Lighting was terrible. I thought we were the only ones who&#39;ve noticed but seeing people with their phones out on the other table just confirmed it. Hope to have a better dining experience when we come back, at least have us see the menu and our food better.

Absolute terrible experience from entering.<br><br>The hostess didn&#39;t greet us... it was colder than ice. The food was horrid. I cannot give this place any compliment. When your food takes forever to get there, is bad and all you get is we are extremely busy when that is a lie. It was not packed. The waiters and waitresses are standing around out of site just talking about how bad they dont like their jobs.

Cheesecake Factory has sat on my anytime favorites list since high school! I&#39;ve enjoyed lunch, dinner, and drinks at the Santa Monica location multiple times and would wholeheartedly recommend it (hmm..surprised to see so many negative Yelp reviews). <br><br>AMBIENCE (4/5): Did you know that the first Cheesecake Factory opened in Beverly Hills in 1978? One of ~200 locations, this location features classic Cheesecake Factory decor: gold and jewel tones, dark woods, Egyptian columns, a dreamy cheesecake display and to-go counter, solid bar area, and lots of seating including tables and comfy booths. <br><br>FOOD (4/5): Cheesecake Factory&#39;s consistent and consistently good experience across ambience, food, and service is the key reason for my perpetual pleasure in dining here. This location is no different! Like many people, I always feast on the delicious unlimited warm brown and sourdough breads with butter to start. From the insanely extensive menu filled with delicious offerings, I&#39;ve ordered the following dishes here: <br><br>Sweet corn tamale cakes (yum! enough for a meal)<br>Chicken mango avocado salad (also good and plenty big enough for two)<br>Cajun chicken littles (a perennial favorite - huge)<br>Chicken and biscuits (oddly sweet with un-fluffy biscuits - the only dish at CF that I haven&#39;t enjoyed)<br>Farfalle with chicken and pasta (pretty good)<br><br>The food is always good, the portions ridiculously plentiful. <br><br>SERVICE (4.5/5): Each time I&#39;ve visited, service at this location has been friendly, prompt, and professional. Servers have sometimes proactively brought a second bread basket upon seeing the first one ravaged! Bar service is equally solid.
Great food and drinks!! But the best part was LAURA, our waitress!!!<br>Right on Laura!!

I accidently wrote a review to the Cheesecake Factory in Newport Beach, when I actually experienced the one in Santa Monica...SO, copy - delete -<br>paste on the worthy, correct location...so sorry guys!<br><br>We thoroughly enjoyed our time for lunch here.  We came shortly after the doors opened and were seated right away.  The service was awesome... the views of the promenade and a peek of the ocean was awesome...the food was good-good, and the overall experience was fantastic!<br><br>We ordered the Mac and Cheese balls...oh, damn delicious!  I ordered the Skinny Turkey Burger (tasted skinny! ). But to counter balance the enjoyment, I ordered the sweet potato fries (with ranch)...Jammin&#39;!!<br><br>My son ordered the fish and chips...He enjoyed.  My little girls spaghetti and meatballs, perfect.  <br><br>All the food was mighty abundant and delicious.  You must close with one of their exceptional cheesecakes, or else...it&#39;s a Sin!  <br><br>The Godiva Chocolate and chocolate moose cheesecakes lured us in...Godiva had a more decadent taste...that was heaven.<br><br>LOVE this location.  The service, wonderful.  By the way...Try the cucumber lemonade...Wow!  Can&#39;t wait to come back!

This location is a joke. At first we felt rushed and the server was ready to get us drinks when we haven&#39;t had a chance to look at the menu.  It definitely ruined the whole dining experience. I wouldn&#39;t go there again.

My friend and I decided on Cheesecake Factory for dinner after looking at all the options nearby. We figured it&#39;s a classic, and we were craving pasta - I&#39;ve only had pleasant experiences with pasta at Cheesecake Factory over the years, so it came as a huge surprise when we were served what resembled cardboard with canned tomatoes on top for a whopping $18.<br><br>I don&#39;t really understand how you could mess up two pastas - especially when the recipe and preparation should be the same, considering it&#39;s a chain restaurant. Soo disappointed. We are both college students who work hard for our money, and spending $18 for dinner isn&#39;t a problem for us if it&#39;s somewhat tasty. I feel like we were ripped off, that no one should have to pay for such tasteless food. There was no flavor (how they managed to do that with a carbonara and 4-cheese pasta, I have no idea), and the pasta was hard and uncooked.<br><br>If you happen to come across this review while you are deciding on a place to eat in the area, please take your business to other establishments! I guarantee you, they WILL be better.

Dumb ass worker took more than TEN minutes just to take our order &#34;right&#34;. When we got to the restaurant to pick up our order the cashier asked if we ordered a pasta with no pasta and just the sauce? We were literally confused as f... lol. She fixed it and we left. Ordered two Fettuccine Alfredos with shrimp and they were both so different. Color, taste, texure, and just about everything about them were different and I even layer puked everything out. One of the plates almost tasted burnt... like my shrimps were burnt as f? Lmfaooo just don&#39;t go here. I&#39;ve tried other cheesecakes that literally taste bet like. They disappoint every time!!!!! Stupid workers and trash was food. Get new management and workers PLEASE. Y&#39;all doing a terrible job

Really great service! We were initially told 30 mins and waited much longer. I asked for the manager and the young lady who helped me as well as our waiter were so helpful and made up for everything. Great job!

Anytime you leave that place and your belly is full, and you have a big smile, then it&#39;s a victory. Obviously I would like other people to join in on the smile&#39;s so I would recommend the cheesecake factory at Santa Monica because this one is one of my favorites.
Good food, great service, and fantastic rooftop!<br>We love Sherry -  always smiling and welcoming you as your coming off the elevator.

Sherri. Is. The. Best.<br>Come to this Cheesecake factory. Dont mess around with the other guys. Sit on the roof. Enjoy the service. Ask for Oscar.<br>Great team! Greater cheesecake! Go for the Hershy chocolate.<br>Eat more cheesecake.

I read reviews before coming to this location last night but decided to give it a shot. The hostess was absolutely amazing, she was very interactive with everyone checking in and she was so patient and kept the line moving. Unfortunately before our party checked in, she went on her lunch and was replaced with a rude male host. He seemed bothered that we were there which I mean- I get it- COVID, but we work around and the area and had just gotten off and there was nothing else good open. Whatever- we wait to be seated and then when we finally get the text that our table is ready, they have us waiting inside the restaurant for an additional 10 minutes because it turns out our table hadn&#39;t been cleaned. Still, we&#39;re unbothered. We finally get seated and our waitress, Racheal, is the most dull and bored person ever. She looks absolutely miserable. When she took our order her arms were literally crossed. We ask her if we can order appetizers first and then place the entree order after and she looks so bothered. She then proceeds to fill our waters and spills the water all over me and the table. She goes back to the outdoor register system she has while I&#39;m using the cloth napkin to clean myself and the table up. She comes back 3 mins later with ONE paper napkin, finishes picking up the mini puddle of water on the table and says &#34;Sorry bout that&#34; Okay..?? You walked away before not saying a word? I understand with COVID , no one wants to be at work and dealing with customers but sheesh.. we were just trying to have a nice meal after we got off. The bill was $100 and the food wasn&#39;t great. Honestly- if I was able to request a refund, I would.

I was a little hesitant about this location after reading a couple of the negative reviews, but my family loves the Cheesecake Factory so we decided to stop in anyway. Those negative experiences must have been chance and bad luck, as we all (even my kids!) had a wonderful experience. We were provided with great service and social distancing, and were thankful of how clean and well kept the restaurant was which made us feel safe and at ease. The servers didn&#39;t miss a beat and the food and drinks were excellent. Nice place, great times!

After a 1 year hiatus we are back in Santa Monica to visit as we moved to OC. Covid hit and we wanted Cheesecake as our honorary meal and ordered take-out from the 3rd Street Promenade Santa Monica location. I am very disappointed tonight . When I picked up my order I requested cutlery and was assured they were in the bag. The bag was sealed so I trusted your staff. I even asked twice. When I got to my car there was none! I&#39;m am very disappointed as we have a 1 hour drive home and 2 very hungry kids in the car to feed. Fortunately, I had a spare set to share between the 3 of us. Not only did you guys leave us high and dry, you didn&#39;t give us any napkins either, the pasta was way over cooked and broken, you forgot to chop the onions, left whole cloves of garlic and the chicken was so dry it felt like day old bread. It was the worst meal we&#39;ve ever had at Cheesecake and I know, everyone is struggling these days but it&#39;s no excuse to overcook my food and forget cutlery. It was a pretty miserable trip home. 3 year olds are pretty unforgiving and I&#39;ll admit, the food was pretty retched. We couldn&#39;t even eat a quarter of it. If that says anything!
Charged $4 for soda water from the tap. Not a soda, not bottled water, tap water. That&#39;s never happened here before and I won&#39;t be coming back. Ridiculous.

I am a frequent diner at Cheesecake Factory (Santa Monica, Glendale, and Santa Clarita). Tonight I was disappointed. Waiter was nice, but did not refill our drinks. I also ordered a lemon herb chicken and my meal came out completely burnt. I didn&#39;t want to be one of those customers, but I could not eat it. The manager was kind, however he asked if I had tried it and stated that the chicken comes that way. I looked up other photos of this dish and this was not the case. When it came back, it was the same piece of chicken but they cut off the portion that was burnt??? And the sides were now cold. At this point, I lost my appetite. <br><br>Oh and I forgot to mention they tried to charge me twice for the dish. :/ This location has definitely gone downhill.

I had an amazing experience this evening at cheesecake factory our waiter Patrick was absolutely amazing, the food was delicious, I had the steak hibachi and my wife had a chicken chicken dish that was amazing.  We started out with the avocado eggrolls with having a great fruit tangy taste with a hint of nut,  the entree was just as gooD if not better... the steak was tender and tasty, mashed potatoes not overdone.

American chain located on the third floor of the Santa Monica Place Mall known for decadent, calorie bomb food. Cheesecake Factory has consistently good memories for me and is also consistent in its offering. A group of us (7 total) came during lunch around 11:45 am and got seated immediately. We got a table outside and our waiter (I believe her name is Alyssa) came immediately to take introduce herself and ask for our drinks. She was super friendly and proactive with refilling waters and bringing extra bread when needed (shout-out to cheesecake factory&#39;s brown bread which also is apparently also available at Vons). They have the lunch specials go on until 5pm so I got the lunch portion of the Louisiana chicken pasta which is not spicy but really yummy regardless. They ask if you want cheese on it and I recommend you do add some to offset the bell peppers. We split an Oreo cheesecake and an Adam&#39;s peanut butter cheesecake. Both were good and I&#39;m so glad we shared (you can ask them to cut the cheesecakes in half to have multiple plates at the table) but I personally preferred the Oreo. Apparently the original, strawberry, salted caramel, and Oreo are the most popular flavors. Bathrooms are located inside and it&#39;s very spacious with plenty of tables. If you come around dinner it&#39;s really busy but during lunch on a weekday, definitely try to sit outside to enjoy the ocean breeze. Cheesecake Factory just needs to create a cheesecake sampler on their menu as I&#39;ve written into corporate, but other than that, I consistently love going to Cheesecake Factory.

SUNDATE FOR CHEESECAKE<br><br>Santa Monica doesn&#39;t offer a lot of dessert options. Weird, right?! We walked down multiple streets, around the waterfront, searching for something sweet that we had settled for cheesecake at the Cheesecake Factory. HA! Of all places. The venue was a little fancier than the average CF I&#39;ve seen, we were seated on the outside patio terrance to bask in the afternoon sun on a December late afternoon (SoCal is awesome for this). <br><br>CELEBRATION CHEESECAKE - it looks sweet, sounds sweet, but after first bite it wasn&#39;t death by sweet. Loved how it had layers and texture; mix of cake and cheesecake layers! Loved the cheesecake but the frosting top was death by sweet and I had to chuck it off to enjoy the remainder. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

Came here with a couple friends about a week ago. The service was suuuuuper slow. <br><br>We had been out all day shopping &amp; hiking then walking down the Santa Monica pier. We were very hungry and very thirsty. We didn&#39;t get our drinks until a few minutes before our food came. About 15 minutes after we had been seated. The bread came about 5 minutes after being seated. <br><br>The food was good but the 3 star rating is for the slow service. Our server seemed like she was very busy as she had both the patio seating as well as a large section indoors.

Ahhh, I am so sad at how disappointing the food was here because I usually love Cheesecake Factory (other locations I&#39;ve been to).<br><br>The menu may be the same, but the way the food was prepared was awful. Dry chicken, not even sauce / taste.<br><br>I thought this location would have great quality since it&#39;s such a popular downtown busy area in santa Monica, but I can see why this location&#39;s reviews are so low :( maybe their 1) chefs or 2) ingredient quality will get better in the future..
Went here and almost spent $10 on a cheese cake and when I looked in the bag after driving back home my cheesecake wasn&#39;t in the bag.
No wait, we got a table within 5 min of arriving. The hostess and waitress were very nice, food, beverage, and dessert was great! Cheesecake Factory never disappoints!

Came here on a Monday, place wasn&#39;t busy at all. Ordered 2 salads, very specifically stated multiple times that I do not want chicken. Very easy straightforward order. After waiting 30 mins, I asked the waiter about the status. She says it&#39;s coming right out. 15 mins after that, my salad comes out filled w chicken. The only reason I gave this place 3 stars was bc the mngr came out and apologized. Wouldn&#39;t recommend this place unless you&#39;re starving.

I haven&#39;t been &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34; in a long time. It used to be one of my favorite places to go for pasta. I went with a friend, we got seated quickly. I love their comfy booth, kind of like a bouncy chair haha. <br><br>One of my favorite appetizer from the Cheesecake Factory is there &#34;Deep Fried Mac &amp; Cheese Ball&#34; I can eat those for days. It&#39;s a huge portion and my stomach can be full just eating 2 of them. I got the &#34;Cajun Style Pasta&#34; it was fairly tasty. Perfect seasoned and they put some extra Cajun spice on the side of my bowl as for decoration and if you need to mix a bit more to your pasta. It was a little spicy for me but I can&#39;t stop eating them. The Cajun spice just makes me wanting more. It is definitely one of my new flavors for pasta. I didn&#39;t finish my pasta, so I took them home and have left over for lunch the following day. <br><br>Our service was very nice and attentive. My glass of water never went under half way. I feel bad because I was going to give him a Kudo mention his name here, but I forgot his name so that&#39;s a bummer. Anyway, I feel like he is a great example of how service should be. I definitely left a great gratitude for the excellent service he provided for us. Overall, will be back shortly for more pasta and cheeseballs.

The Cheesecake Factory has a formula that works and never goes wrong.<br>You come in hungry and leave full and with to go bag.<br>The restaurant is beautiful. The food is always delicious. If something goes wrong they go out of their way to please the customer.<br>The one in Santa Monica is very beautiful inside.<br>My favorite one is on San Francisco <br>The staff are always nice and well trained.

Have been to multiple Cheesecake Factory restaurants and this is the WORST one I&#39;ve been to.  We were a large party was given a timeline. They gave me an attitude when I asked how much longer after the time they quoted had gone over. Won&#39;t go to this one again.

This location just doesn&#39;t care. My husband and I frequently go to cheesecake and this one does it NO JUSTICE. <br><br>Was seated with no menus. Took the waitress 20mins to even notice. Cups of water came late. Bread came out after the appetizer which was not hot like they should have been. <br><br>Pasta came out with an extra small amount and uncooked ends. <br><br>The only thing that came to our table fast was the check. <br><br>Very dissatisfied with this location. VERY! Also, two table near us seemed to be very dissatisfied with their experience as well. I could overhear their frustration from the waitress not taking their orders correctly and having to send food back.<br><br>----<br>Cheers to their generic response below they give to everyone. Makes nothing better.

My friend and I went around 12pm.  There were plenty of empty tables. They led us to the one by the door so we asked for a different table more inside. They said no. We asked for a second time for a table anywhere but by the door  but they said no. There was a booth available between where people are sitting. They said there is no server to serve the table! We felt discriminated! We will never go back there.

The service from the jump was very bad. 20 mins to receive bread that came out smashed and then asked for more and still never received it. I love Cheesecake Factory in Sherman oaks but to come to Santa Monica&#39;s cheesecake and receive such lack in customer care is very sad for the owner of this particular establishment. Better hiring and customer attention is definitely needed at this location.

Horrible service. I had 4 different serves and none of them could keep it together. I asked for a manager, 25 minutes still no manager!!!! I walked over towards the kitchen and spoke to the kitchen manager who was able to assist us and answer questions. He put our order in and when our order came out we were missing items and some items we&#39;re not properly cooked. I ended sending half out order back. Worst cheesecake experience ever!!! Definitely will never come back here EVER AGAIN!!!!

Felt like I wasted my time and money here, Half the time I was waiting  instead of eating and enjoying my meal, Nobody attended us for 20 min and when attended, we were completely left in the dark, the other tables were being attended better. Service just lacked and wasn&#39;t able to even order dessert.

Update: from 3 stars to 1 star <br>came to visit this place again yesterday Sunday the 20th. I hate to say it but this time the bathroom was full of pee. I could even have my daughter who couldn&#39;t hold herself go there. We walked all the way to the food court to use their restrooms. This makes me really sad for sure. <br><br>We visited cheesecake on Sunday afternoon for brunch and to celebrate my father in laws birthday. It was early when we showed up so there was practically no wait. I did tell the host that we wanted to sit inside so she handed me a buzzer until an indoor server showed it. I gave the buzzer to my daughter who was super excited about it. The moment it started buzzing, she screamed out of excitement as this was probably the first buzzer she has ever held. We came inside right away and waited for someone to show us to our table. We waited about 10 minutes which was weird since the restaurant was empty :/. <br><br>They gave us a table that was roomy for 8 people so we were happy about that. I ordered the corn dogs and the fruit plate for my little ones. They placed the order right away and brought it out. The kids were super excited about it. Two bites into the first corn dog and they didn&#39;t want to take another bite. The fruit plate looked old and wasn&#39;t fresh. <br><br>We all placed our order and were waiting a good 30-40 minutes before the food came out. We ate all the bread on the table and got two rounds of refills on our water before the food came out. The server was really funny and kept making jokes until the food came out. I believe they may have been short handed on the kitchen staff. <br><br>I got the shrimp tacos off the skinny menu. They were very delicious but were lacking a little in overall flavor. I did ask for a side of pico to turn up the flavor a little. The beef medallions were also very flavorful. The cheesecake was delicious. I mean I would assume it had to be for the restaurant to live up to its name. Haha<br><br>Now my biggest issue besides the wait for food was the restroom. I had to take my daughter in and it was filthy. I was afraid to even let her sit on the toilet. <br><br>Overall my visit was average and really not worth the big price tag that came along with it.

When you&#39;re traveling, not always the best to go to chains, but nice if you just want to enjoy the company.<br>***<br>Locals <br>Right on the top floor of the mall, perfect to just shop and go to the beach and boardwalk of Santa Monica before heading up for a meal!<br>***<br>Travelers <br>Santa Monica is known for the boardwalk and shopping, and right on top of this mall is the Cheesecake Factory! They give you a pager so you can walk around, but only if you stay on the top floor.<br>***<br>My Recommendation <br>Their complimentary bread was amazing. We asked for four rounds (shameless people we are). And everyone had big portions of food so come with a big appetite! I had the Louisiana Chicken Pasta! So delicious. They are known for pastas, burgers, and salads. And of course, cheesecake.<br><br>IG: @foodisseur

I&#39;m a pretty big fan and longtime customer of the Cheesecake Factory, so it pains me a little bit to leave a review like this. I&#39;ve been to a variety of locations, though I go to 3 consistently: the ones at the Topanga Mall,  the Grove, and this one in Santa Monica. And it&#39;s only this one that I&#39;ve had consistently bad experiences at.<br><br>I went with my friend for an early dinner at around 4 o&#39;clock. It wasn&#39;t very crowded and so we assumed that service would be good. We were very wrong, however, as we experienced the worst service ever. It was very slow--not just in terms of how long we waited for our food, but our waitress checked on us ever 10, 15 minutes? We waited around to order our food, waited a while for refills on our drinks.<br><br>And honestly, a couple servers were incredibly rude. Since our own server hadn&#39;t walked by in around 15 minutes, my friend just asked random server walking by, politely might I add, if she could get a straw. This server, with the most attitude I&#39;ve ever seen any waitress ever give a customer, put her hand up, as though to say stop, said, &#34;Don&#39;t bother me, I&#39;m off the clock,&#34; and walked away. And another waiter was just behind her, clearly heard all this, looked at us, and just kept walking by. I&#39;ve never experienced something like this at a restaurant, especially a place like the Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>And finally, I&#39;m a little mad about the fact that our server did not give me back my credit card. I got my receipt and everything, but she did not give me back my credit card. Which leaves me a little suspicious, since it&#39;s not easy to charge a card, prepare the receipts and pen and everything, and not give back the card.<br><br>The food was fine, though the bread was stale and cold. I just can&#39;t believe the service was this awful. And this isn&#39;t the first time that the service has been bad. I wouldn&#39;t base my entire opinion off of one negative experience. I&#39;ll continue to dine at the Cheesecake Factory, just never again at this location.

Thank you for your response., so I give it a try and this time I could see a very good improvement., we sat outside again with nice clean table and great &amp; polite service., happy to be back and see the great improvement., keep up the good work

Basically if you want to eat anything after 9pm in Santa Monica, it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory and that&#39;s about it. Being from NYC, it&#39;s always mind blowing that things close before 11pm when I&#39;m traveling. CF was open till 11.  We had two adult beverages, two apps and brought home two slices of cheesecake. It was almost $70! You know what you&#39;re getting at a CF, but this just screamed tourist trap. Unfortunately for us, we were tourists. Anyway, our server was pretty good. They also offer outdoor seating. I was also shocked that these areas are not well lit and super shady.  It was all right. I won&#39;t be in Santa Monica anytime soon, so i won&#39;t be back here either.
Love the 3rd floor seating outside. Perfect ambience to relax and they have space heaters in the ceiling to keep you warm. Fast service, and great food!

Wow surprised at how much Cheesecake factory has gone down.  I&#39;m a huge fan of CCF.  Its our go to when we&#39;re in the States especially when we&#39;re in a big group.  I feel like it accommodates everyone. When I checked in I was surprised at how low the star ratings for this location was.  My 16 year old niece has never been so we all decided to come here.  It was early and the had just opened.  Our server was very nice and attentive.  But the food was not what I remember it to be.  I ordered the chicken biscuits and gravy, my go to as I cant get this back home, biscuits were meh, gravy looked yellow tasted bland, overall not good.  The rest of my family was not impressed either but it is what it is.  We barely eat our meals.  Disappointing.  I always look forward to coming here, I think this will be the last time, sadly.
Worst service. I was seated  for 20 minutes and still hadn&#39;t gotten my drinks or even ordered food. Eventually, we got up and just left.

AMAZING dining experience. Cheesecake factory is 1 of my favorite restaurants. When i travel i like to check them out so i thought i&#39;d give this one a try. They blew the other locations out of the water. Excellent service and food. Manager Ryan really made sure we felt welcome and was extremely accommodating. Cleanliness was on point, they took the concerns about Covid very seriously. Highly recommended.

The ambiance of this Cheesecake Factory was super nice. That is the one thing that stood out to me about the particular location. I felt like everything was very calming and romantic because of the lights and decor <br>Now onto the food and service. So we were a party of 11 and we went on a Saturday night so our wait time was 2 hours. I really wish Cheesecake Factory took reservations, it would really save us time. Our food came in a decent amount of time. We ordered the chicken jambalaya pasta, BBQ pizza, and the avocado rolls for 4 out of the 11 people and it filled us up. Gotta love their portion sizes! The chicken jambalaya pasta has been changed from the last time I ordered it which was maybe 2-3 years ago and I liked it better back then. The BBQ pizza came burnt. I&#39;m usually never the type to send food back because I hate wasting food but this was way too burnt to consume. The avocado rolls were perfect though, I loved them the most. <br>Our waitor was really nice. He was serving our party of 11 very patiently and meeting all of our needs. He was really friendly and understanding. <br>Overall, I&#39;m giving the restaurant a 3 because I felt like the food was average and a tad bit overpriced for the quality. The ambiance and servicing made up for it though
Fantastic service, even when they are slammed! Every time I&#39;ve gone here I&#39;ve sat in different sections and had a wonderful experience with great food every time :)

A new server Cory. I think his name was. We were there for my wife&#39;s birthday. Waited 20 minutes or more for bread to be served at our table.<br>9 people at our table, Cory took everyone&#39;s order except mine. I waited for<br>him to take my order after my wife&#39;s. But he left our table. And returned sometime later. I asked him if he took my order, he said, &#34;I told him that I was going to share with my wife&#34;. No comp or apology.

This Cheesecake Factory was so sad. I think they completely forgot about us after they seated us. People who came in afterwards got their bread and we didn&#39;t. And everyone knows that Cheesecake Factory bread is NO FREAKING JOKE. When we flagged down a waiter to ask for the bread, you know what they said? Are you ready for this? They said THEY RAN OUT OF BREAD.<br><br>....<br>......<br>...............<br>...<br>...<br><br>What? How do you run out of bread? That&#39;s like Papa John&#39;s Pizza saying they ran out of cheese. What gives!??!!? Anyways, they said more bread was being baked and that we should just wait.<br><br>Um, okay. So we waited. Anyways, when the bread finally arrived, we had been seated for a good ol&#39; 25 minutes already, and they gave us one measley portion of each. Lol. Ok. I swear they used to give like 4 slices per table.<br><br>We ordered the Farfalle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic, the Combination of Steak Diane and Herb Crusted Salmon w/ Mashed Potatoes, the Tira Misu, and the S&#39;mores Cheesecake. Surprisingly our food came quicker than I expected. I was also decently impressed with how soft and tender the salmon was. It literally fell apart at the touch of my fork - that&#39;s how tenderly cooked it was! The steak was quite good too! V enjoyable.<br><br>Anyways, food is food and Cheesecake Factory&#39;s is pretty standard. But the negligence of the staff here. oh MY. What&#39;s sad is that this restaurant chain is such a big corporation that it doesn&#39;t even matter to them if they improve their staff service / ignore me and other fellow yelper&#39;s complaints about their service, because people will continue going to Cheesecake Factory anyways.<br><br>Yelp 100 Challenge 2017 (98/100)

Terrible service. Actually check that. NO service. 20 min on a Monday night at a bar table. Not busy at all one server cruised by and said someone would be with us in a minute. 15 min go buy and nothing. I do not recommend. And I will never go back.

The service leaves a lot to be desired <br>Twice calling us to seat and taking us back to the front  they gave a buzzer that went off only to take it back and say wait till we call you <br>Having returned the Buzzer , we waited and waited <br>After a good 10 min they called us a second time  <br>Waiter not offering to bring the bread and when we asked felt his reluctance   Took them 10 min and he brought some butter with no bread ! <br>It took them 7-8 min for the bread to arrive ...<br>This was lunch time on a Sunday. There were no lines in the front and it was light crowd ...

I was given a gift card so I tried it. Service was meh. The server seemed a little overwhelmed and did not check in nearly enough. I&#39;ve spent half my life waiting tables so I&#39;m pretty forgiving when it comes to service. I ordered a steak, medium rare. It came out well done. Finally flagged down the server, she immediately apologized took it way to be me remade. The manager came and apologized as well. We were in a hurry to catch a movie so before the remake came out we ordered desert and asked to pay the bill. Remade steak came out - well done. No server in sight. I ate the sides and ten minutes later left the steak uneaten on my plate, no check in from server or management. I will absolutely never return to this location .

This place cant get any worse!!! <br><br>The customer sercvice sucks. If they say wait time is 30-40min expect 2 hours. If you sit at the bar forget about customer service. We waited over an hour to get service. Waiters and waitresses are just standing around doing NOTHING!!!! <br><br>I will not recommend anyone coming here for lunch.<br><br>Anyway they need to get it together for a busy place like this!

I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in so long! I came here on a Sunday for brunch, and the place was pretty empty (the restaurant itself is huge).<br><br>Considering how extensive the menu is, I expected more selections for brunch (the regular menu was available too). But there were definitely enough items to choose from, and I ended up ordering the Fried Chicken &amp; Waffles Benedict. To my surprise, the eggs were nicely poached! The fried chicken was served crispy enough, but the texture of the meat was off (tasted like frozen chicken). The waffles were a bit soggy. Our table shared the Lemon-Ricotta Pancakes, which tasted decent but could&#39;ve been fluffier.<br><br>Service was a bit mixed. The waiters were much friendlier than the hostesses, but everyone did accommodate us when needed.<br><br>This is located at Santa Monica Place, so there is free parking for 90 minutes in the structure.<br><br>Considering the number of restaurants in this area, this isn&#39;t the best spot for brunch. But there is a good variety of dishes to accommodate large groups with varying tastes (which was the case for us).

We were told we could seat ourselves in the bar<br>We found a table facing the playoff. We were ignored for 15 minutes then told we were not in the right section even though we were in the bar area<br>We had a chicken quesadilla app (hohum) and took our cheesecake to go. We did not want to stay<br>The severs seemed to congregate and pay us no attention. I&#39;ve always wanted to try a Cheesecake Factory but I won&#39;t be going back even to our local place in San Diego

We go to Cheesecake Factory almost once a week. This location is always packed and most of the times we dont really get the best service here. Tonight we had an amazing server who came to our table couple of times to make sure we dont need anything. JOSE DUBON was extremely nice and professional. Before writing this review i asked his name and last-name just to make sure i get the right JOSE here. Lol Thanks for the great service :D

I was there with my family, the hostess didn&#39;t greet us.<br>their service was terrible and the hours long waits , waiters are standing around out of site. I ordered pizza for kids and waited for a long time to get kids meal. DO NOT WAIST YOUR TIME IN THE RESTAURANT.

A couple of weeks ago (on October 5), we took a group of friends on a trip to Santa Monica. They were all staying with us for a few days and we were showing them around the L.A. area. Three of our friends were from Switzerland, one from Russia, and one from Bulgaria. <br><br>Our Swiss friends wanted to go to Cheesecake Factory so we all stopped in the Santa Monica location and were immediately greeted by Sherri (sp?) at the reception area. We are a very friendly group and she made us all feel right at home right off the bat. Her smile was big and genuine, and we had a blast that evening with her and the rest of the staff there that evening. The food was great, and of course everyone loved the desserts.<br><br>You definitely need to know how well Sherri represented your organization and how much she added to the evening for us and for our guests. <br><br>She&#39;s an absolute gem.

The food is a crowd pleaser: yummy and there&#39;s something for everyone since they have such an extensive menu.<br><br>We tried the pasta Npolenta today and it was amazing also. Slightly salty but very good with the charred pepperonis, sausage, and garlic Parmesan with tomato sauce on pasta.<br><br>The pumpernickel bread is always good. <br><br>Tip: The firecracker Salmon is to die for! Tender salmon wrapped in spinach and a crispy thin shell with a delicious sauce and purple cabbage salad. It&#39;s one of my favorites in the world! <br><br>It&#39;s also very pleasant to sit outside on the balcony overlooking the Third street promenade. <br><br>They took our favorite dish, the firecracker salmon off the menu. So we tried the chicken pot pie and taco salad from the Skinnylicious menu. Both were around 500 calories, BUT DELICIOUS! You couldn&#39;t tell they were low calorie dishes! The rest of their regular menu items were around 1200 calories.

Made a reservation 2 hours before hand, showed up 10 mins early, the lady in the counter said it would take about 15 mins, I explain to her I made a reservation. I was seated 20 minutes later and am now seated but a waiter has not come by and it&#39;s been 15 minutes. Tried to ask for a waiter and am still waiting. Extremely disappointed
Rude waitress who didn&#39;t want to work with me and my two food allergies. Walked away from the table angry at ME for asking and we got up and left. Never returning. The hostess was rude too.
Great food and great service. Attentive staff. The chicken Romano is one of my favorites and so is the miso salmon.

I came here to celebrate my birthday and my two cousins birthdays. The staff was extremely friendly and they even came to sing us happy Birthday. The food was absolutely delicious. I have never felt so welcomed at a restaurant before. The restaurant is very clean. I had a great experience and recommend to come here to celebrate any occasion. Will definitely be coming back for more great times.

Long wait but the food was quite worth it. Although the wait is dreadful, the food wasn&#39;t. One of the specialties we tried was the Thai curry rice and the Hibachi steak. Both were quite tasty, and the cheesecake is always to die for. Service was a bit lacking, but I enjoyed my time here.

Be here 2 times. Worst service! Today I am waiting for WATER 20-30 minutes!!! You guys has a bad team as never make a good service for your guests! Your cook make cheesecake very oversweet and I was trying to order some lunch but I didn&#39;t do that because if they bring me water after while,I believe they bring my lunch tomorrow. Wherever,never come again.

I&#39;m a fan of the Cheesecake Factory and this one in Santa Monica is the best because of its views and atmosphere. Awesome atmosphere being rooftop and having to take an elevator to reach the restaurant. The Blood Orange margarita that the server in the bar recommended was on point too.

Been to this Cheesecake Factory two times and both times i&#39;ve had a good experience. Got seated fairly fast and also the drinks were good ! Food is could be better but the outside view makes up for it! I would say I would come back again plus its in 3rd st who doesn&#39;t love 3rd st promenade?

This was the first time for us visiting this location. <br>We had to wait up til 30 min, our table was ready after 24 min. <br>Two of our company are lactose intolerant so our waiter had his hands full of checking ingredients. <br>Forgot his name, Edgar?? Not sure. <br>Anyway,  he did it with an honor. We felt very sure with our orders and it tasted great. <br>Why not give it 5 stars? The restaurant is a bit to noise for our taste. Other than that, super!<br>Can recommend CF in SMP. <br>Yay!!

We love coming to the Cheesecake Factory especially for Happy Hour! Sherri greeted us with a warm welcome and gave us a VIP table with a beautiful view. Service was great and the manager came around to check in on us. Food is consistently good and there&#39;s a great variety of food so there&#39;s a dish for everyone. Stop by and enjoy!

Wow, LAURA needs to go home and come back to better training. Had absolutely the worst attitude and service I&#39;ve ever experienced! I&#39;ve NEVER left without tipping a waiter but it was easy to walk away from this one.<br><br>She literally gave US attitude when we went to ask if we could pay the bill up front because we couldn&#39;t find her for 20 minutes. She then asks us in the most rude and tacky way: &#34;Y&#39;ALL EVER BEEN TO A CHEESECAKE BEFORE!?&#34; Umm yes honey, you were just non existent- where do you think you work? Some Michelin star restaurant? <br><br>We were a party of four that ordered 3 cheesecakes and four coffee drinks- this girl brought everything out separately and forgot a cheesecake while our coffees went cold. She literally made like six trips far in between to get everything to our table. I understand our table didn&#39;t order much and it should&#39;ve been easy for her or at least she thought it was so she slacked with our service but we could&#39;ve done without the attitude. <br><br>She probably would&#39;ve gotten our order right if she wasn&#39;t inputting someone else&#39;s in the system and taking our order over her shoulder then shocked when she got it wrong- which she ALSO gave us attitude about! <br><br>Should&#39;ve known as soon as we got there when she made eye contact with the only guy in the group, asked what he wanted to order then cut him off halfway with some weird attitude and said &#34;OH NO HONEY YOU&#39;RE GONNA ORDER BEFORE THEM???&#34; (them being us, the ladies) and proceeded to laugh about it. Umm Laura no one thinks this is funny anymore, even if it was a joke your delivery is far from gracious, and you literally looked right at him and asked WHAT WOULD YOU LIKE TO ORDER.<br><br>Just an awkward, rude, and annoying experience to enjoy some cheesecake. That was still good!
Food was really good. Our waiter super nice, but damn...we had to wait 45 minutes for our food to arrive! That&#39;s insane. I&#39;ll probably avoid this location in the future.

Do I even exist? It was horrible from the start. THESE HOSTESSES ARE RUDE AND HORRIBLE. The first one didn&#39;t acknowledge my friends and I at all. She made no eye contact and was talking on the headset the entire time she was interacting with us. The wait was relatively short but when we requested to sit outside we were told it would be longer so we opted for first available and were told to walk all the way to the other end of the restaurant which is probably their main entrance?
