Just to walk all the way back to where we started and were seated outside anyway. Mild inconvenience but that&#39;s just the beginning. <br><br>We get to our table and wait 7 minutes (We timed it after already waiting a little while) to get greeted. The server takes our order and asks if we wanted bread and water and of course the answer was yes. She walks away and we wait another 10 minutes just for bread and water. <br><br>Then our food comes out One. By. One. There&#39;s only three of us. After our server dropped the last plate she was never to be seen again. Literally. She disappeared and we had to get a different server to get our bill. She never came to check if the food was ok, we never got any refills or any kind of indication that we were being taken care of. Just a horrible experience considering it looked promising since it&#39;s actually a very nice location. <br><br>TLDR: the hostesses need to be retrained on customer service (if they even get training in the first place) and servers need to be more attentive.

See this lady in the middle? She&#39;s the sweetest woman I have ever met! Mama Sherri really made my day! She treated me like family and it&#39;s so difficult to receive a service quality like that anywhere. Thank you Sherri for making my friend and I feel at home at the Cheesecake Factory. I will definitely be coming back because as a host, she set the tone for the entire restaurant. Keeping being you girl! And keep hiring people like her!

Wow:-)  Best Cheesecake Factory I have ever been too.  Good food, great service and a very atmospheric and festive experience.   I was pleasantly surprised by how well they prepared the food.  I recommend this place to families from out of town as there is something for everyone on the menu.

Wow our server was incredible! Shout out to Piffany (Piff), she made our night! Cheesecake Factory, this server needs to become a trainer/supervisor/lead because she has the service goods! She explained menu plates beyond detailed enough to make us happy with our choices! She was fast, not once did I see her stop walking quickly. She had lots of tables but still managed to give time to every time. She is the only reason I gave it 4 stars. If it wasn&#39;t for there it would be 2 STARS!<br><br>Food<br>Spicy chicken Chipotle pasta<br>Very dry, not as creamy and little amount of chipotle sauce as I have tasted it at the grove or other locations.<br><br>Cajun jambalaya pasta<br>Hardly any flavor, noodles were plain. Shrimp were decent.<br><br>Fried calamari<br>SMALL Portion compared to other locations. (Pictures as reference)<br><br>NEGATIVES:<br>-Food is poorly executed<br>-Restroom is has overflowing wastebasket and NO TOILET PAPER. I used the toilet seat covers, I even texted my guest to tell the male staffs to bring toilet paper but I used the covers instead.<br>-There is a 10-15 minute wait for a table when the restaurant is huge!?! They still make you wait even after the buzzer rings.<br>-I would not come back, thank you for the experience the service of the year though Piff!

This Cheesecake Factory is amazing. Sherri was so pleasant! She was so helpful and she is now family! Everyone that works here was great but Sherri stood out!! She&#39;s the best!! We will come back just for Sherri

Excellent service to begin with , the receptionist Sherri is the best I ever met. Once we got the great welcome from Sherri then our waitress Ally was equally great. Food and drinks were great. But the service was the best I ever had

This place is rad if you enjoy broken glass in salad. <br><br>As a local this location of TCF is in my back yard so I have been here a few times. However after what happened this holiday weekend I am pretty sure I am done.<br><br>Service has always been slow here, I suppose that is to be expected with 9291 items and 243 uncomfortable seating arrangement (for real, the benches are so short they cut off circulation and are painful for anyone over 6 feel tall). So of course this was the case for this particular meal.<br><br>Two of our bread plates and a spoon were dirty. This is not the first time I have noticed this at this location.<br><br>My kids food came out roughly 15 minutes before ours. I ordered a chicken sandwich and my wife a turkey burger. My sandwich came out and we were told there was a delay in my wife&#39;s food and it would be out very soon. Patiently waited and when it finally came out half of the patty was broken and it was the saddest driest turkey burger on the face of the planet. But hey they threw in a complimentary side salad which is where the intro to this review came in. There was a piece of glass that my wife ended up biting into. <br><br>When we alerted the staff they asked if we wanted a complimentary cheese cake. We didn&#39;t and they seemed offended. I explained why we didn&#39;t want dessert and they just walked away. Add the fact that the table next to us left mid-meal after several flubbed orders and it is clear that this place is just a disaster.<br><br>Chances are with discounted rent and being a tourist hot bed this place will survive, but chances are after several disastrous and slow meals, poor quality food and did I mention GLASS in salad, I won&#39;t ever suggest eating here again.

Came here with the family, the service wasn&#39;t so great had to ask for the bread three times....and we still didn&#39;t get it, they said it was in the oven but the people who got seated next to us(after us) got served the bread. After this we waited over 1 hour for the food, food came out and it was cold, fries were stale. We asked for lemon and we got onions instead (literally). Over all disappointed with this location. Won&#39;t come back.

If I can give a zero star, I will!! I have never seen this quality of pasta from this restaurant. I paid $20 for this half size portion of pasta when the description on the menu clearly stated full size portion. Unbelievable! I will never order from this location again!

Shoutout to Jake S. Best server I&#39;ve ever had at any Cheesecake establishment. Really came in clutch and hooked me up with all the brown bread I could ever ask for. Will be coming here again just for the service and brown bread. Highly recommend this location to anyone who is a fan of The Cheesecake Factory. Specifically ask for Jake S as your server, you will not be disappointed.

Today my son and I went down to the 3rd Street Promenade to buy a pair of hiking boots, but before we could even think about shopping we had to eat a bite. We decided on The Cheesecake Factory and I&#39;m so glad we did! From the moment we walked in until the time we left, our experience exceeded my expectations. Our hostess, Sherri was one of the nicest restaurant employees I&#39;ve encountered in a long while. I know we weren&#39;t the only patrons in the restaurant, but she made us feel like we were. Also, our server was helpful and attentive. We ordered the veggie burger with sweet potato fries and the chicken pot pie, both tasted great. Because it&#39;s rare these days that I have the time for one-on-one with my son, the kindness from Sherri and everyone else made our lunch even more special.

I went to the Cheesecake Factory for dinner with my fiancé.It didn&#39;t take long until we got seated. Our waiter name Irina B. took a long time to get our drink order. She bought the drinks and it took her about 15 minutes to being us straws after we asked her twice. In addition,<br>we sat in between two other tables. I felt she was acknowledging the other tables because they weren&#39;t Hispanic. I felt discriminated and uncomfortable. Also, she took our order and I wanted to modify it but, she was making faces when I asked her. So, I left how it was. My fiancé wanted to buy a tacos on the side but, she said they didn&#39;t sell none. The waiter went to lunch and we got another waiter who was very polite and fast. The new waiter did a better job them her. The waiter came back and I asked for a box and she bought me them to pack them myself. But, she packed the other family order and was having a small talk with them. I have always came to have dinner at that location and never had bad customer service. It gets me upset that we cant eat somewhere in peace because of our ethnicity. Never again.

I went today with my friends. I ordered two meals and drinks. The waiter dropped our check and we hadn&#39;t even gotten our food yet. He apologized and I guess put In the order, we asked for it to go because it had been a while. I know these times are hard and I&#39;m privileged to be complaining about dining out, but I still had to pay over $80 for this meal. I feel the least they could&#39;ve done is take some off the bill.

I am usually not into chains but I have a soft spot for Cheesecake Factory.  No matter what, you will always find something you like here.  I love coming here with my family because there is something for everyone.  I had stopped coming here at one time because it was just not worth it with all of the other foodie places in the area.  In the last few months, I have come here more frequently because the atmosphere is so much more pleasant and I think that is because of some new staff, one in particular, Sherri.  She is like a ray of sunshine.  So accommodating and very considerate with families.  I love coming here just to see how she&#39;s doing.  She always remembers everyone&#39;s name and is so warm.  In fact it has been a while since I have seen her and I actually miss her!  I think I have to pay another visit this weekend and get some avocado egg rolls!!!
Stopped by for a quick snack and drinks. Then we had to have a dessert and was out of this world. Our server Cory was very attentive with us. Great customer service.

The chips were too hard. There wasn&#39;t enough cheese. I asked for cheese and they gave it to me but the overall experience wasn&#39;t the best. We tipped the waiter before we even received our food. I didn&#39;t plan on tipping him afterwards because he wasn&#39;t concern about my overall experience. Derrick was super nice in the beginning and started to flirt with my friend which is super unprofessional. He gave my friend a number with Keith&#39;s number on it and told her to call it. I hope there are waiters who understand that hitting on the guest is super uncomfortable. Everyone else&#39;s food was good my nachos were just over cooked.

This is really not a clean CF. Fork had old food stain on it. The butter served with bread had clearly melted before and then refrigerated. The to-go box given to us had liquid on the outside. And I found a curly white fur (from cloth maybe?) in my food.

Well I&#39;m sorry to say that this was my worst Cheesecake Factory experience. My server today was Andrea who was not very friendly at all. My order was wrong and she was not apologetic, she just simply said &#34; oh yeah they didn&#39;t put the onion straws on like you ordered&#34;. She saw that we were about halfway done with our meal and she brings the check, never asking if we wanted to order anything else or if we&#39;d like desert.  She did however make sure to circle the gratuity grid on the bill.<br>Sad to say but this is my first and last time visiting this location.
This is a nice choice if you need food fast as most places on the pier and around have a super long wait. <br><br>Make sure you ask to be sat outside! Enjoy the view :)

This was quite literally the worst experience I have ever had dining at a restaurant. Seated 45 min after our reservation on my friends BACHELORETTE NIGHT. Finally ordered after waiting 20 minutes for our waiter. Had to ask repeatedly for our drinks to be brought to us. After we placed our dinner order we waited 20 more minutes for our waiter to come back and tell us they ran out of turkey burgers. My friend then had to reorder. About 15 minutes after THAT they come back to tel us they&#39;re actually out of ALL turkey and two more of my friends had to reorder. By the time we got our food, one of the members in our party had to leave for the airport and didn&#39;t even eat. The audacity of the manager to come to our table 20 minutes after we ate to apologize was absurd. Keep in mine one of the members of our party STILL HADNT EATEN. We&#39;re all just sitting her having fully finished our meals waiting for her absolute trash chicken pot pie to arrive. Our waiter was apologizing constantly which made the whole thing just fucking weird and horribly uncomfortable. The whole thing was absolutely wack. They thought doing us a &#34;favor&#34; for making this evening a disaster was to offer us their low quality cheesecake that had been sitting in the glass case in the front of the restaurant for likely 6-8 hours. <br><br>Fuck. This. Place.

Had an extremely dissatisfying meal after many great ones. Not sure what&#39;s going on at the Santa Monica location, but the hosts were uninterested, they ran out of items that we generally order, our food was served cold and over spiced. The manger&#39;s offer of a complementary slice of cheesecake was appreciated, but we won&#39;t be back to this location.

I wish I could give this place zero stars. The worst customer service ever. Came here for happy hour and sat at the bar. The bartender gave us menus, and never came back. We watched as each waiter walked passed us without bringing us any water or bread. Everyone around us was being served, but us. I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt because it was busy, however we were literally were the only ones sitting at the bar and everyone behind us was being waited on. We tried to catch eye contact and get their attention, but it seem like each one of them was intentionally trying not to look our way. I had enough. I was ready to walk out, but fiancee insisted that we wait (don&#39;t know why) a few more minutes. The final  straw for me was when a guy just walked up, placed an order and the waiter immediately took his order and made his drink in front of us. I got up and walked out. My fiancee spoke to the manager about the service. But at this point I was over it. I was hungry and ready to go. Will never return.

Visited last week and I can say this is the worst location, reviews don&#39;t lie. Our server was <br>H o r r i b l e. Took him 20 minutes to come to our table to ask if we wanted to order drinks. He did not offer nor bring us bread until we had to ask. Additionally, another 45 minutes for our food to come. To add, his attitude was extremely rude and after countless times of us being nice to him he didn&#39;t do the same. Something needs to be done about this because it is far more than &#34; not ok.&#34;

Went to this cheesecake location with a couple friends, the service was good and the server was more than amazing. On the other hand we ordered the Korean cauliflower for the table to share and it tasted like burnt bread. There was no cauliflower to it, everyone at the table tried it and had the same option. With myself working in the restaurant industry I usually never like to send food back, but this was not something edible. We had all apologized to our server, and told her very nicely what was wrong with it. She had apologized and said she would take it off the bill and bring the table something new. 15 minutes later the manager BARBARA came to our table and told us that nothing was wrong with the cauliflower and her kitchen has done beautiful work. When we tried to explain to her how none of us could eat that she proceeded to tell us that we were in the wrong. Never have I ever experienced this at a restaurant before, and or seen something like this. She offered to box the cauliflower up for us to take home, that was sitting in the back of their kitchen for over 15 minutes, during a global pandemic. And told our table there was nothing she could do and didn&#39;t want to take it off the bill because it looked very &#34;amazing&#34; to her. My friends and I definitely won&#39;t be returning to this location after the terrible experience that we had.

I came all the way from OC, and after a long drive and hectic time trying to find parking and make it to third street promenade, due to the LA marathon,  my friend and I decided to go to cheesecake. We were concerned it would be a long wait, but the hostess Sherri sat us quickly and gave us outside seating like we requested. We also had a very great server name Robyn , who was attentive, made great  recommendations, and provided enjoyable service. My friend and I are happy to come back.

I just went again to the cheesecake factory and once again I was disappointed to say the least. I was sat by the host and then they came over an told us we had to wait another 20 min. it was my friends birthday :( what a sad way to spend a birthday, with horrible service. I am never coming back here again I don&#39;t even know why I came back here.

OMG this is what I have been yearning for....amazing food! Everything from the French fries to the salmon, to the salad dressing, to the shrimp, pasta, pizza, veggie burger....to the EVERYTHING else! I eat at restaurants every day of the week, and this place is by far A+++++! Please don&#39;t change a thing. So many places change so radically they mess up.

Although the food here isn&#39;t spectacular and the hours long waits can be arduous, I love to stop by this Cheesecake Factory location at odd times for the cocktails and excellent service.<br><br>During previous visits to this location, I have ordered the chicken Bellagio - which tastes okay but is nothing spectacular. I have also tried the prosciutto and arugula flatbread, which left a similar impact.<br><br>The service at this location, however, is absolutely fantastic. Every time I have come, all of my servers have been kind, funny, and super attentive.

The manager at Cheesecake Factory  this place is absolutely wonderful and very family friendly. We love dinning at this particular branch. Sherri is an absolute wonderful person, genuinely nice and professional

Great place to be in California!<br><br>Sherri, the hostess is Wonderful! The atmosphere is unlike anything else!<br>The talented people who work there, have to be supernatural.<br>They take care of you and your family, as well!  In fact, when you are finished with your experience Sherri and other employees stop by your table to make sure you have enjoyed every minute of it!!

On a Saturday night expect a wait. Not too bad, only about 20-30 min. Our waiter was from Italy. He was a bit of a space cadet but Very friendly.  My husband and I split the shepherds pie. OH MY GOSH!! It was so yummy!    <br><br>We&#39;ll definitely eat there again.
Great night on the 3rd street promenade!!! Can&#39;t go wrong with this favorite!  Love Cheesecake Factory!!

We walked by Cheesecake Factory and stopped in. We were greeted by Sherri and she was able to find us a window seat within 5 mins. She&#39;s super sweet and made our evening such a blast. We wish she was able to take a break with us and hang out!!! Oscar was our server and was super on it! We never come out to LA and it was the best experience ever. Thanks for your hospitality everyone !
Came in to celebrate mom&#39;s birthday and I was greeted by the warmest and sweetest hostess &#34;Sherri&#34;.  She really made our lunch so much more special!!!!!

Food here is the usual for any cheesecake factory. The fries are usually hit or miss. I had the fried shrimp basket and it was lovely. The Cole slaw was cold and creamy and wet. The shrimp were cooked the way i like them. <br><br>Service overall here is very slow even though there are a ton of employees doing something other than helping me. I wasn&#39;t in a hurry, so that&#39;s ok.<br><br>It&#39;s par for the course and you can sit in the bar area without waiting. I&#39;ll be back in sure because the food doesn&#39;t offend

Where to start? The food is excellent. The view from the patio superb. But to top it all off the people here are the nicest and friendliest people there are. Sherri absolutely made our day . We&#39;ll come back here just for her.

Update: To the person who replied, had it not been my friends Bday, I would have complained on the spot , however it was her choice and I wasn&#39;t going to upset her birthday. At first i gave the server benefit could have been bad day but when he was unwilling to make recommendations or substitutions it didn&#39;t help the level of annoyed. He clearly was not happy to be there. Thanks for the reply but still not coming back. <br><br>Probably the worse TCF experience. The food has really gone down the tubes.  The small plates and small salads are now like two bites. I asked for items that weren&#39;t garlicky and the waiter says everything has garlic in it. Ugh. Seriously .. He didn&#39;t seem super happy to be working that day or to recommend anything else, at which point if it wasn&#39;t my friend&#39;s birthday and her choice I would have left and taken her to Nordstroms instead for lunch . The restaurant was pretty empty for a weekday lunch . The only reason for two stars was the cheesecake.. that still rocks.  They changed their menu and its not that great anymore. Service was sketchy but we all have bad days. It was mostly the quality of the food that I was disappointed in . We had one entre salad, two small plate appetizers and they charged for the birthday cheesecake so the bill for lunch was around $96 . That&#39;s crazy for two people with the quality of food they serve now. Won&#39;t be back to this location .

Came to this location on july 13th, my son ordered chicken parmesan pizza style and were told that it wasn&#39;t available...not sure why?? Such a huge and popular location!! Anyhow he ended up ordering something else. A few days later I placed a complaint on line and a manager from this location called me, I didn&#39;t catch her name but she had a heavy accent..anyhow her excuse was that they didn&#39;t order enough ingredients for that weekend.  First of all to me that was the stupidest excuse in the world knowing again how busy this location is. Second of all she didn&#39;t even seem to care that it bothered us. This manager needs to be retrained on how to treat people and at least pretend to show that she cares. I will call your corporate office to complain about her as well.

I had the best time here! Cheesecake is always a good go to and easy you know what you&#39;re getting etc. However this one is my favorite I met the coolest lady she&#39;s hilarious and so sweet! Accommodated my needs to change tables and just was pure joy setting the tone to a lovely lunch with my family. Thank you Sherri you&#39;re truly the best I would come back just to hang out with you.

Forgot that they had Cheesecake Factory here &amp; so we were quite excited to try a new location out. This space is actually quite big for being where it is. It&#39;s pretty too. Our servers name was Tyler &amp; MAAAAAN did he look like Conor McGregor! I even asked him if he&#39;s gotten told that &amp; he said quite often! I&#39;ve included a picture in case ya&#39;ll are wondering lol. He was so nice &amp; was such a good sport for my picture!<br><br>Asked for the multi grain bread only &amp; plenty of butter. I honestly could come here just for that. But I didn&#39;t, I ordered the Cajun chicken Littles! They&#39;re my favorite things to get at Cheesecake Factory (aside from the bread &amp; cheesecake) <br><br>Every time came out pretty fast &amp; was delicious! I&#39;m sad to see other yelpers had such bad experiences though.

Great location! <br>This ones actually really nice! I love the outdoor seating <br>-the chicken biscuits were pretty yummy! Super hearty and a good for the soul <br>-honey fried chicken was super crispy and very sweet but it had a good taste to it <br>-lettuce wraps were pretty bomb! I loved it when they use to let you make it yourself

Was second time and don&#39;t think it&#39;s one of the good places there. Well food is overpriced however service started really good but ended with 15 minutes waiting check and out waiter forgot about us. Maybe because order was not so huge compare to close table which order 5-6 meals for 2 kids and one adult. We shared one BBQ chicken pizza this time and 2 camomile lemon tea so in general we payed 27$ so which I think is a lot for small sized pizza with big thick crust. Btw last time we took fish tacos and they didn&#39;t said it comes spicy cuz I&#39;m not allowed to eat spicy even a lit. But if u hungry it&#39;s better than food court opposite but be ready to pay 20-25$ per person just for little dinner. (Drink +1 meal)<br>When we arrived at home after 1.5h driving were already hungry.

I just love the Cheesecake Factory. I go here with my friends when we want to get s little wild. And crazy. The jumbalay is my favorite and the Oreo cookie cheese cake is my all time favorite. I just can&#39;t get enough. Normally I order one for after my meal then I get one togo to eat as a midnight snack. Yum!

Normal don&#39;t have an issue with this place but my boyfriend and I wanted our food to go today so I tried to call in, TWICE, and each time I was on hold for 10 min. It took me longer waiting on hold than it did to get from point A to this location. I get it, it&#39;s a Sunday and it&#39;s busy, but it shouldn&#39;t take that long for me to be on hold just to place an order.

Poor service even before we decided to eat. I went to the counter to sign in, I asked how long was the wait because my mother is diabetic. The attendant said 30 minutes, I said ok. 40 minutes came and went. I went to the counter to ask what was going on, the same attendant said &#34;sorry 5hat he would fix it&#34;. Another 20 minutes went by and I just left due to the fact my mother needed to eat due to her medical condition. Very very unhappy with this poor service, especially they don&#39;t care about the elderly.

Usually you can&#39;t go wrong with Cheesecake Factory. We were seated quickly. Our waitress was friendly. I ordered the lunch special of fish and chips. It just didn&#39;t taste fresh. Like it had been in the freezer too long. The Fireman had the lunch special of Chicken Parm which was awesome. I finished it. I looked adorable with two plates in front of me lol. We finished off with cheesecake to go.

We ordered steak Diane &amp; chicken madeira, and of course cheesecake for dessert. Pretty poor experience, especially since we are Cheescake factory fans. Food wasn&#39;t cooked right (raw steak, unseasoned chicken) and our server was downright rude and dismissive. We won&#39;t come back!

For many, we all know what Cheesecake Factory is all about. A novel of a menu with a good variety that&#39;s perfect for big groups. Given the brand, you&#39;re paying a premium over the volume and butter driven entrees, but it&#39;s hard to complain when the food ends up clearing the bar for what you&#39;re already expecting. The orange chicken was a crowd pleaser though could be a little dryer and surprisingly not as saucy as your local Panda. The pastas are basic and doused in buttery sauce but you&#39;re not here seeking rich al dente pasta anyway. The avocado egg roll is a great starter and good for sharing. <br><br>Be sure to get here somewhat early or expect a short wait. Lots of Santa Monica parking lots nearby.

Cool spot ;) and yes the plates are big and good for sharing - recommend the mac and cheese balls 100%!<br>Not sure why people all love the bread so much, they are not bad but not amazing! We were so full but felt the need to try the Cheesecake when you&#39;re at Cheesecake Factory so we went for the lime cheesecake (and added ice cream- yes they come with 2 scoops haha) (and the hot fudge too! It was phenomenal I must say- it&#39;s more dark chocolate that blended in so well with the whole dessert!)

Wow! I been to multiple cheesecake location but I never really had such an amazing experience like this one! Our server was very attentive and helpful, we got everything in time with no problem! But the game changer was one of the manager Alexander!! He guided us through the menu and recommended some of his favorites as well as our drinks. Everything he recommended was absolutely delicious, especially the chicken madeira... I didn&#39;t know chicken breast could be cooked so soft and juicy. <br><br>Amazing service, amazing food and amazing staff. My boyfriend Aaron and I had a wonderful anniversary dinner. Thank you very much.

Ever since the San Vicente location in Brentwood closed, I&#39;m glad they opened a CF in SM. I don&#39;t like the Marina Del Rey location at all. Here, It&#39;s right on the grandious 3rd floor aka rooftop level of the SM mall where &#34;Sandia&#34; use to be. If you come during busy times, just expect to wait. Otherwise you&#39;ll be seated promptly. Service is decent from my visit here. My favorite dish is the Hibachi steak.

Not sure why this location gets so many bad reviews. Must be because people in the area are so upscale. This location is my favorite because it&#39;s so big. The marina location is tiny and you usually have to wait awhile. I&#39;ve never been to this location where I&#39;ve had to wait. We always get seated right away. Menu has a lot of options of course and who can say no to cheesecake for dessert??

Went to Cheesecake factory today. We were greeted by a wonderful woman. Sherri. She graciously sat us right <br>AWAY and made sure we had anything we needed. I typically visit the Marina rest., however Santa Monica will be my new home restaurant. I had a enjoyable experience, which I will refer others to Santa Monica to experience Sherrie&#39;s pleasant approach to dining. <br>Awesome Sherri.!!!

Sherri made us feel welcome and found the perfect spot for us as soon as we arrived! She was so friendly and fun. Then Giana served us and was very patient and gave us some great food suggestions! The service was fast and the food was excellent! Both ladies made us thankful we chose to visit this restaurant. Thank you!!

Huge shoutout to Sherry!!!! Sherry was Ammmmmmazing ! She went above and beyond guest satisfaction. She greeted my 9 year old daughter and her best friend with the most amazing smile. Sherry and the girls even had a mini dance party on our way to our table. She stoped by a few times to check on the girls. Absolutely the best customer service I have had in a long time. When we left she gave the girls a hug good by and the girls taught her a few dance moves. We will definitely drive down from Valencia to see her again!!
Came into Cheesecake Factory to celebrate Queen Leslie Birthday &amp; Sherri made it extra special   Will definitely come back to see Sherri &amp; celebrate more ...

Dropped in last night with our group of 6 plus my dog. We had called ahead and double checked with the restaurant if they allowed Emotional Support Animals in the outdoor area and they assured us that they did.<br>Waited for 45 minutes for a table and were eventually seated out the back (my dog walked through the entire restaurant to get there) and then waited for our waitress for almost 35 minutes. In this time a manager came and tried to tell us my dog was not permitted in the restaurant as he was not a Service Animal. I politely explained that we had called ahead and double checked he would be allowed to sit with us despite him not being a Service dog and were told this would be totally fine. She tried to argue with me and asked what time we had called and we must be mistaken. Eventually we were allowed to stay, as it was their mistake, but honestly the manager was so unpleasant and the service was so slow that I would never come back. It&#39;s a shame because the food is pretty tasty.

We frequently dine at Cheesecake Factory in Phoenix so we thought it was a given they it would be great.  Not so much.  I ordered a frozen drink and after it was delivered was told there were no straws... they were out!  Then another service staff member said no they were just discontinuing all straws... um really, give me a paper one for Pete&#39;s sake or tell people that they won&#39;t get a straw when they order a frozen drink.  The waitress<br>was stretched way to thin and only caught half of what you said because she was busy trying to get to everything. Food was eh, bread was great.

Another day another experience that blew our minds. We were approached by a lady sent from the heavens. Thank you Sherri , I&#39;ve never met such a wonderful positive person that gave us a once-in-a-lifetime experience throughout our whole dinner. It was my sister&#39;s birthday. I don&#39;t remember seeing my sister and my wife ever this happy. Cheesecake Corporation is most lucky to have such a person working for them and she really does deserve a promotion way above. Next Rachel take care of us with the food order at our table. Such a wonderful positive girl full of joy. She kept attending to us and made sure we were happy every step. This place is really turning around. Only because people like them. They better take care of them. God bless

Not only was the service horrible, but the waitress Elizabeth decided to take the liberty of adding a $10 additional tip on my credit card for herself. We came for dinner here and the servers basically acted like we didn&#39;t exist. Water and bread never came until we asked multiple times. We ordered soup for an appetizer, waited 20 minutes for it, and after asking where it was, they told us they ran out of soup. They were also out of artichokes which we also ordered as an appetizer. There are many better places to dine in LA. I don&#39;t recommend wasting your time here.

This was a horrible experience. I ordered chicken nachos it came cold and burnt. I sent it back and they pulled the burned chips off and brought it back to me. It came with a bug and a glob of chips. Don&#39;t come

I have been  to this location a numerous time<br>Including tonight. We went to a children&#39;s museum, cayton on the same floor and decided to eat at this location. We like cheesecake food but we will never go back.  <br>It wasn&#39;t the first time but tonight was the worst customer service.  We were Seated after 30-40 min wait which is normAl at cheesecake on a Saturday night. No me came by after we were seated. We waited 20 min for someone to come by but no one did. We were sO thirsty!!! <br>We asked another server to call our waiter for us but still no one after additional 10 min wait. Waited another 5 min. We had to ask another waiter to get a server for us and she was nice enough to just take our order.  It took a total of 45 min to get water after we were seated.  Took Another 40 minutes to get our food, and my sides were missing.  I ordered chicken Madeira and I only got chicken. The waiter who helped us was super friendly and offered to bring the side but I finished my food before and left.  I was hungry and ate my food in 15-20 min. Of course when we asked for a check (different waiter), it came within 5sec (literally).  Who ever was supposed to work in our area never showed up for like an hour.  I&#39;m glad we asked another server e to help us and she was super friendly but I would never go back to this cheesecake.  This is not the first time this happened at this location.  I will go to to grove or the food court or third street to eat.<br>The worst cheesecake ever. Review is based on only customer service

HORRIBLE. Incompetent staff. Took us to the patio area to be sat, but our table was still dirty. Made us wait on the site, completely forgot about us, and sat two other groups of two while we were waiting. AND they sat the two other groups on tables that were AVAILABLE at the time they made us wait. Total incompetence. They finally sat us after we told them we&#39;re still waiting on the table. Then it took 10 minutes for a server to come. Got so pissed that we decided to get only a cheesecake and not stick around. Zero stars. AVOID this place.

Had a very disappointing dinner tonight - kids corn dogs were so greasy and nauseating and the chicken tacos were so dry and bland. When we asked for ketchup for my daughter and salsa for the tacos it took forever and our food got cold. The waitress was visibly busy okay, but every time we asked for something she said she would &#34;get to it when she could.&#34; What could we say to that? Never again...

Visited this location yesterday as we have been wanting to go for a while and eat by the terrace,we always go to other CF in Orange County but we wanted to enjoy a nice dinner while in Santa monica so we went in- no terrace sitting available so we settled for a booth.<br>Considering it was Father&#39;s day the wait wasn&#39;t that bad (45 mins table of 4) our waiter was energetic and helpful to start our drinks order, then about 15 mins after, he introduced another waiter to take care of us...<br>We figured they would be busy too so we expected the service to be a little delayed.<br>However, it was not A Little Delayed.. it was horrible <br>It took almost 50 mins for the appetizer to come out, then about 10 minutes later, our meals, I ordered a chicken madeira and it was salty, my fiancée ordered a Rib eye steak and it was the most tasteless steak we ever had, zero zero flavor, our daughter had a salad that almost had no dressing... super simple and flavorless<br>Needless to say we will not be returning to this location because the disappointment on the food was real and to top it off, our waiter was the most inattentive one.

This is a note for people who are vegan.  You can order the vegan Cobb salad or &#34;Evelyn&#39;s favorite pasta&#34;.  Just be sure to ask that the pasta be tossed in olive oil instead of butter.  Also say no parmesan cheese.<br><br>The pasta was really good, with a nice mix of veggies which weren&#39;t over cooked.  The pasta was semi al dente which was cooked perfectly.

Here is my workplace and I love my job as server and try to be productive as possible, teamwork is the one that makes our job so fun and easy as we work  and help each other as possible , such an energetic workplace and with most efficient manager teamwork , everyone try their best to make the best guest satisfaction as our purpose is in Cheesecakefactory Santa Monica, <br>Come join us with your family and friends and we promise we do our best to help you and make memorable time for you. <br>Thanks<br>Jafar R.<br>Cheesecakefactory Santa monica

This business has violated ADA laws right in front of my eyes. I came in with my friend who has a serious medical condition and in a wheelchair. They told us the wait would be 40 min. I kindly asked them if they could seat my friend faster since they had multiple tables available and he is sick and in a wheelchair and by law he goes in front of the line. Manager  Davaugh( African American man in this 30s) started screaming at me that he doesn&#39;t care that my friend is in a wheelchair and then forcibly grabbed a buzzer out of my hand and told us to get out. <br>Davaugh is by far the most unprofessional, rude absolutely disrespectful, and just mean manager I have ever seen. Instead of settling down the issue by following the law, he insulted us and escalated the conflict by yelling, being disrespectful and not even trying to help or be apologetic. <br>I will report this branch to ADA first thing tomorrow morning.

My fiancé and I just ate here and all I have to say is that the service is absolutely horrible. We love Cheesecake Factory and go to plenty of the other locations and we&#39;ve never had such horrible service. The service was crap the moment we walked in the door. The hostess said they don&#39;t have any tables available where we can have a high chair placed so we waited 25 minutes to be seated in the OPEN SEATING BAR AREA! We could have went and sat there ourselves and saved ourselves of the 25 minute wait. They had 1 server bartending and serving the bar area by himself with the help of some kitchen staff bringing out food here and there. One of the plates that the kitchen staff brought out to us was messed up and he must have never planned to bring it back because we had to ask our server for it once it was already time to pay the bill. We ended up just taking it to go. We&#39;ll definitely never come back to this location. The hostess seemed very rude, lazy, and unwelcoming. I say lazy because when he seated us he didn&#39;t bother bringing the high chair that we had previously requested. We waited a little until going to ask for it and it was obvious he didn&#39;t plan on bringing it.

Came here to celebrate a birthday with family the food was great but our server Jesse was pretty rude! After we had finished our dinner and wanted to celebrate the birthday girl we told our server that we were ready to sing happy birthday he refused to bring out a celebration dessert he said NO go find some one else I&#39;m not to preppy for that and walked away I have never had an experience like I was very disappointed I tired to email but I never got a response back! I would not go back aging at least not to this location

Came to the Cheesecake Factory in Santa Monica. Ordered the Orange Chicken at the bar and waited over 30 minutes for my food. When it &#34;finally&#34; came out, the rice was cold and hard. No big deal, I asked for some hot rice. But unfortunately they brought me more cold rice. It&#39;s not hard to make fresh rice. I was very disappointed. I enjoyed the orange chicken, but it sucked not having a hot bed of rice. SMH. Why did my wife pick this place for an anniversary. I guess you get what you pay for.

Thank you Miss Sherri for amazing service and such a friendly attitude!! You rescued me and four teenage boys after a long day at the beach! We accidentally thought we had put our name in, walked away to come back 45 min later only to find out we weren&#39;t actually in line for a table! Yikes! It didn&#39;t phase you one bit! You immediately took us in and got us a beautiful table! Thank you! These boys were starving! The food was great!!!

I came for Sunday brunch with a group of 6.  I was actually surprised there was no wait, because at any other CF I&#39;ve been to on a Sunday at brunch time, there&#39;s at least an hour wait.<br><br>We entered on the side with the elevator, and sat on the patio near that entrance. If you sit on the permitted by the glass wall, you get a great view of the 3rd Street Promenade.  Our group was too large for those tables, so we sat In a booth on the opposite wall. The patio is covered, which is great, so you still get the feeling of sitting outside, without sitting under the sun. They also have heaters above the table in case it gets cold. <br><br>I didn&#39;t realize how HUGE this restaurant was until I had to use the restroom. This is probably the biggest CF I&#39;ve seen, in terms of the number of tables. <br><br>Our server greeted us quickly after we were seated, and the beverages and bread followed quickly.  However, waiting for the meal to arrive took an unusually long time, especially for CF, where the service is usually speedy. Most locations have the speed-of-service down to a science. Not so much with this place. However, after I saw the size of the restaurant, it&#39;s clear to me that the kitchen is just too small to handle the volume of tables -- and the restaurant was half empty when I was there. <br><br>When it did arrive, everything looked fine. I ordered the California Omolette. You can see by the photo I attached that the plate looked fine...until I tried to eat the toast.  The bottom of the toast was nearly burned BLACK! And the cook obviously tried to hide it by serving the toast black-side-down.  How is this place going to survive if their cooks can&#39;t even make toast correctly?<br><br>I gave my review 3 stars because our waitress gave great service, and I didn&#39;t have to wait for a table.  But the reason I come to CF is for the food, and for this experience, the food came out late and not well prepared.  This was by far the worst CF meal I&#39;ve ever been served. <br><br>Note to management: please get your act together at this location.  Most of the traffic on 3rd Street is tourists, and when they see a Yelp average of less than 3 stars, they&#39;re not going to dine here.<br><br>UPDATE - January 9, 2016<br>I&#39;ve reduced my rating from 3 stars to 1 star for the following reasons...<br><br>I returned to the restaurant with 3 family members for dinner, and we sat at a table in the bar. Our waitress was great, very attentive.  When we ordered, two of us customized our orders. Nothing that difficult, just replacing cheese with avocado on a salad. <br><br>The first time the salads came, we realized there was cheese and no avacado. We each took a few bites of the salmon that was on the salad before we realized this.  Our assigned waitress had gone on break, so we told our sub-waitress and she took them back. <br><br>She returned about 10 minutes later with the salads. This time with no cheese or avacado. Also, they put the same half-eaten salmon back on the salads. So we asked for the manager, hoping that he could remedy the situation.  When he came to our table, he apologized for the mistake. <br><br>He returned about 10 minutes later with our two salads, again with half-eaten salmon on them. We pointed out to him some pretty obvious things that he should have spotted as the restaurant manager. First, he was serving new salads with cold, half-eaten salmon on them. Second, how would he have known who gets which half-eaten salmon?  <br><br>He apologized again, and took the salads back for a third time. At this point, the other two people at the table were almost done with their meals, so the manager said he would like to buy them each a cheesecake, so we are not eating alone by time the salads comes back out for the 4th time. He also said that he would not charge us for the salads. He returned about 5 minutes later with the salads, but no salmon. He said the new salmon was still cooking, but he didn&#39;t want us to be waiting for our meals any longer.  About 5 minutes after that, he brought the salmon. <br><br>When the check came, the two desserts were listed as free, but they were still charging us for the salads.  So we had to ask for the manage AGAIN to fix that error. This meal turned out to be way more frustrating and stressful than enjoyable. <br><br>This restaurant has a long way to go to reach the level of high quality food and customer service that the Cheescake Factory has spent decades to build at their other locations.

My experience yesterday was one of the better I have had at a Cheesecake Factory in awhile. My friend and I got sitted right away. Our service promptly greeted us and got our drink order in. The food was great and arrived fairly quickly. My only complaint would be when I ask for a straw please bring it to me the first time. It shouldn&#39;t take 3 times of me asking.

This place is ok.<br>The service here could be much better, I waited for a while couple of times for a waiter to come to me.<br>The waiting time to be sat was also pretty long, and the food wasn&#39;t bad.<br><br>Not the best Cheesecake Factory in town for sure
Outstanding flavorful Sundried tomato with bowtie pasta. Great Service, nice scenery, good vibes.

My family and I are on vacation in California and we scheduled the cheesecake factory as part of our trip.<br>This location did not disappoint!<br>We were seated on the patio overlooking a busy touristy downtown area.<br>This location was so well maintained, there was a lively buzz throughout the place, great atmosphere; just everything you hope for and expect while on vacation. <br>Our girls had burgers and they loved&#39;em! I had something coconut chicken with some green sauce.... O.M.G  seriously.... toooo good!<br>My husband has the sesame chicken (a bit dry, but we told the waitress And she quickly brought him some extra sauce).<br>Everything was just super good.

We came to Cheesecake Factory to have dinner the night started off rough, but the hostess Sherri changed the whole situation around and accommodated us and she was very nice and friendly. And she made sure we got a seat in the section that we wanted. And she even came and checked on us and she is the nicest host that we have ever had at any restaurant and we are only coming back because of her

I am so disappointed in the service we received today. We are out of town visiting and decided to stop by to get some dessert the man at the front desk was greeting everyone. We stood in line but the man never looked up or greeted us I said hello but he ignored us. I went to the man next to him and I told him that the man ignored us and he apologized. The man proceeded to greet everyone after us as if we were never there. You&#39;d think there wouldn&#39;t be a race issue anymore but clearly everyone after us was white. How unbelievably uncomfortable. I personally gave him the timer back as we no longer felt comfortable to eat there.

The worst the worst of the worst don&#39;t go here the portion they gave me look like a child&#39;s or an appetizer size my son ordered nachos and I had a shrimp tail and it nobody ordered any insurance we asked for Bread and they said they didn&#39;t have any bread they&#39;re disgusting and cheap and ghetto do not go to this location you will be horribly disappointed

Stopped in before the movie at arc light didn&#39;t have but 45 minutes before asked for a rush, the food arrived great percance delicious and the request was honored. If your going to spend money for food at sunset place this is your best option. Beware they don&#39;t validate anywhere there for parking.

The Cheesecake Factory was a fun experience!  I love their menu. When you have gluten allergy they really take care of you!  Especially Nemo!  He is on top of his service.  He really is an awesome waiter.

One of the worst if not the worst Cheesecake Factory we&#39;ve ever been to the hostess was rude the waiter was disrespectful. He tried explaining his attitude by saying he was sick and showing us the amount of tips people leave him. <br>Never again

Really not a bad place at all. The service was nice and attentive, the heated patio is great, and the food was delicious. We got a thin crust pizza with a lot of toppings, and some avocado toast with a few drinks and it was just the right amount of food for my party of three. The drinks took about 15 minutes each to come out, and the waiter said the bar was extremely busy and apologized. Also, it seems like they use smaller shots in their cocktails (which are upwards of $10. I&#39;ll be back to give them another shot at 5 stars because I really like this location in the heart of the beautiful Santa Monica Place.

Came in around 5 pm for Valentine&#39;s Day and waited 20 minutes to be seated on the patio. It was maybe 40% full. Asked to switch tables and the host said that table was waiting for another party, but stayed completely empty for like 30 minutes until a party next to us asked to switch to that table. We ordered avocado rolls and asked for extra sauce three separate times (once to our waiter and twice to other waiters). The sauce finally came AFTER we finished our appetizer. The two of us ordered ribeye steaks. I ordered two sides of asparagus instead of the green beans and mashed potatoes. The ribeye was burnt and flavorless and the asparagus tasted frozen and lacked any flavor whatsoever. Absolutely disgusting and mediocre. Salt and pepper only does so much to food like this. After a disappointing meal, we received the bill only to find that I was charged for ordering a soda water. Literally every other Cheesecake I&#39;ve been to doesn&#39;t charge for soda water. Thanks waiter for letting me get charged $3 extra w/o knowing this fact!! He wasn&#39;t even sorry either. Just wanted us to pay the bill and leave. Go to the Grove&#39;s Cheesecake factory for better service and food. Will not come here again.

We came here for dinner. What a mess! Out of everything. I understand having an 86 list but why would you have someone wait 30 mins for a table with no mention of your delivery and many of your menu options not being available? Confusing and kinda ridiculous. We sat, you&#39;re out of bread. I attempted to order five different menu items to be told you don&#39;t have any of them. We ordered cocktails and had to cancel them because you were out of everything to eat. You&#39;d might as well just provide a menu with items you do have since I searched ten pages of food trying to find an option to be told you&#39;re out of all of them. Such trash.

This cheese cake factory has by far the worst service ever ! Showed up and was told the wait time for 3 people would be 15 minutes. After 20 mins and seeing other people who arrived after me being taken I went to the front desk and was told they had been ringing my ringer thing. When I showed her it wasn&#39;t vibrating the girl just said &#34;ohhh it&#39;s off&#34; just wait here after waiting to finally get seated they didn&#39;t offer us bread until 10 mins after because it was still in the oven ... ok cool I don&#39;t mind but I was so hungry and frustrated from waiting because the ringer was &#34;off&#34; that I ordered my food right away . Once AGAIN everyone getting there after us received their food before us. I had my 1 year old with me and he was starting to get fussy so I had to get up and ask for my food Or at least my babies food. When I ask they said oh we can&#39;t give you all your food because we&#39;re waiting for the fries .... are you kidding me ? Once our food was finally brought the ONLY item that was fresh were the fries . My sons chicken was dry , the mash potato looked like it had been sitting for the longest . My chicken was super dry on my chicken and waffles . My boyfriends avocado club was so hard and the lettuce,tomato looked like it had been sitting for a while and reheated over and over . I didn&#39;t want to tell them to re do it because by then my 1 year old was already getting fussy and I was not about to wait another 40 mins for them to remake my food !

Such a horrible experience here at the Cheesecake Factory. I received my food one hour after and it was all cold. They took forever and barely even checked on us to see if we needed for beverage refills. I would recommend a different cheese cake factory because it just isn&#39;t worth anyone&#39;s time. Hope this review helps and y&#39;all can avoid this horrible experience. The only good part was the bread and water we had other than that it was bad.

The food is okay but they have got to figure out their waiting situation. For two people we were told the wait time would be approximately 10 minutes (which is totally reasonable) and handed us a buzzing device. After ten minutes our buzzer went off and we went to get our table. We handed it in and were told to wait off to the side. We ended up waiting an additional 20 minutes before I finally decided to ask if we were missed. The person at the counter was pretty rude and said that he was waiting for us, printed my name and put me at the end of a long queue. My name should have been added to the queue after I handed in my buzzer, that&#39;s the point! We ended up leaving before they called our name.

Let me start with this snaggle tooth ass bitch with cheap pink lipstick as a hostess not even welcoming me into the restaurant. No type of customer service. Continuing with my experience, waitress was friendly and able to take down my order correctly. I found it very unnecessary for two different managers to come to my table and apologize about the delay for my order. It took almost an hour to receive our food on a Monday afternoon. After speaking with the manager(Daniel) about our experience he seemed unprofessional and not caring about our troubles. The restaurant shows signs of internal issues and individuals not capable of managing a restaurant.

The stars are for beautiful view from the back porch!! All the staff was nice. They were somewhat busy but not busy enough to merit the slower service but perhaps it&#39;s just the laid back vibe? The sangria was disappointing, tasted like watered down fruit juice. It was pretty &amp; decorated with fruit, mostly apples &amp; grapes.  Our server may have noticed we weren&#39;t drinking our sangria, she came over asking how our drinks were. When we answered honestly she replaced them with the drink of our choice. The Tiki Punch was good. We almost didn&#39;t eat here because of the mixed Yelp reviews. Service was so slow that we decided to leave after our first appetizers and one drink each. Originally we planned to either share several apps &amp; drinks then indulge in cheesecake bec, &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34;. They lost a few $$ but we did have plenty of time to enjoy a couple hours of pleasant conversation and the beautiful views. IMO With 400+ restaurants in Santa Monica the only reason to come to this Cheesecake Factory is the view. Location, location, location!
Waitress got ordered wrong 3 times, spilled a side cup of dressing all over my jacket and then my friend found hair in her pasta.

While the food and atmosphere were great, the service sucked. We actually had 2 servers, it took forever. We actually had to request our check more than once. The 3 stars are because the food was really good and the lunch portion of the herb crusted salmon was filling. I even had a to go box! Maybe our server was new and just needed a bit more training. I recommend sitting outside, it&#39;s beautiful.
Good food at a great price. Nice location. Nice decor,. Only suggestion is too dimly lit. Just a bit brighter would be nice.

I actually did not have a service nightmare during my experience thankfully! Flavia (?) was attentive to our needs, and brought food out promptly. We had to wait about 5 minutes for a table during sunday dinner hours<br><br>My issue continues to be about the food. The cheesecake factory menu in general reflects identity crisis. How can you expect to serve good food if you try to serve a gazillion different cuisines? <br><br>Ordered the crispy pineapple chicken and shrimp - while the batter was nicely fried and the inside was tender, the sauce was off, and too sweet for me. <br><br>The chicken and biscuits were ok, but the biscuits were not fluffy enough, and the mashed potatoes were bland<br><br>The eggroll sampler is nice to share - you get 4 different rolls with 4 different sauces. The firecracker salmon roll was definitely overcooked.<br><br>I think I will only come back for cheesecake...
Thank you to the great restaurant. Insanely delicious food, very large sizes. I love it.

It is 11:42am on Sunday morning, I&#39;ve been sitting here at the high top table in the Bar since 11:25am , only few feet away from the bartender, a scores of servers, hosts/ hostesses including a female manager have passed by me no one have stopped to asked yet what can get for you, I am gonna sit here and see how long it takes for someone to acknowledge me and get me some food and beverage, 1153am now still no one have stopped by, wow cz cake factory your standards are really going downhill lately. Funny thing is it looks like they&#39;re overstaffed and barely just opened- like 50 minutes ago everybody is just hoping around, the Bartender asked every passer by employee how they are doing except me, this is bad. Bartender just buying the bar not even one customer yet he still has it on his Ali B last half an hour has been only a few feet away from you can&#39;t believe this has anyone helped you yet. Really thank you to Brian Who Came From Another section just to help me out thank you Brian so much , going to speak to the manager soon, this was bad.

Love this Cheesecake Factory SHERRI and the crew provide quality and excellent service. They are all extremely kind, caring and helpful in every way possible . We asked for a table and she was able to seat us at a table with a beautiful view if the Santa Monica Promenade.  Highly recommend everyone to this restauraunt! SHERRI Was simply amazing!!

What can I say about my visit on Sat 10/13. Pretty awesome that&#39;s what! Considering my visit to Benihana in Arcadia on 10/12). Jose was our server, professional, witty and met our needs. Kept coming back to our table to check on us. Food was Delicious (and less expensive than Benihana in Arcadia, yes I&#39;m going to put it out there). Group of servers came to our table to wish and sing Happy Birthday to my friend. This was a bday dinner redo. Would Definitely go back to SM to this eatery. See review pictures.

First of all, I hate give The Cheesecake Factory a one star, just because their food is truly good. I&#39;ve been dining with them for years in San Francisco.<br><br>        On Sunday, June 25th, we were visiting their Santa Monica location. They had a 20 minute wait which is their usual time for a table of 4 plus a kid. We got sat in 15, but waited 10 for our waiter to say Hi. Our waiter eventually came and took our drinks down. We order our drinks plus a kid&#39;s water. He seemed rushed so he asked if we were ready to order right away, which we said yes. He then told us, &#34;wait, never mind, I&#39;m not ready.&#34; He spend 2 minutes at our table looking for a pen in his apron, then finally took our order. We ordered a calamari to start and their bread which are both delicious. Our waiter brought our drinks and calamari but forgot about our kids water and bread and took down our entrees. Our Stella came with a dirty glass and which we told our waiter, he told us he would bring a new one in two minutes. Which was okay, since he seemed busy, so we just patiently waited. <br><br>       When another staff dropped of our food, our waiter quickly came to check everything was okay and took our calamari before it was even half done. We all work in the restaurant business and we know how busy it can get, but pulling food before asking if the guest are done is just rude. We asked to speak with management at this point, the manager promised us a new Stella plus another calamari on the house. We got the other calamari dropped of by yet another staff member but still no Stella. We asked them about our kids water which they quickly brought. The waiter passed by about 10 minutes after, not to ask how we were doing, but to sarcastically apologize about taking our appetizers, we just ignored the comment. <br><br>     The waiter brought our bill crumbled up in his hand, while shrugging and apologizing for not having any books. I get that, but come on! A crumbled up bill. We told the waiter we never received our second Stella and the first one was never drank so we wanted it taken off. He said it couldn&#39;t be done so we asked if the manager could stop by. After waiting for 5 minutes, we see our waiter and the manager walk by us laughing as if we never asked to speak with him. Maybe our waiter didn&#39;t tell him. Lucky we flagged down another manager. We told them we were really upset at the whole experience and both the manager and waiter were immature. She said she was very sorry, but would try handle the situation. <br><br>       We finally payed and were about to leave our table when the waiter brings us a new Stella, which we refuse and he followed back by rolling his eyes. At this point we just wanted to leave and never come back.  Not only did our waiter not care about us, but neither did Carlos, A Manager. This place definitely needs better customer service, and that has to be taught from the top.

Review is based off service and food, not dessert!<br>Tip: call in for reservations if you&#39;re planning to get dinner here on a weekend!<br><br>I didn&#39;t mind the wait to be seated since I didn&#39;t make a reservation. When my friend and I were seated, the waitress took our drink orders and came back to take our food order. The appetizers came out fairly quick, but we waited about an hour for our actual food to get there. I asked the waitress about 30 minutes after our appetizers if our food was coming out and she told us that it would be out shortly because she wanted us to enjoy our appetizers. I thought I was just being impatient, but another 30-40 minutes later our pastas finally came out and by then I wasn&#39;t even in the mood to eat.<br><br>The stuffed mushrooms were okay, but they were a little cold by the time they got to our table. I do recommend the fried calamari, though. I ordered the farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic (Bow-Tie Pasta, Chicken, Mushrooms, Tomato, Pancetta, Peas and Caramelized Onions in a Roasted Garlic-Parmesan Cream Sauce). The roasted garlic-parmesan cream sauce was delicious, but it was a little too watery for my taste.<br><br>Overall, the food was okay compared to other Cheesecake Factories I&#39;ve been to. Probably won&#39;t be coming back to this location.

As I am writing this I am attempting to place a to go order for the Cheesecake Factory. The phone was answered immediately only to place me on 8 minute hold and still waiting. Let me start off my saying I&#39;ve been to the location multiple times and had really given up on Cheesecake Factory but then someone gave me a gift card and I hated to waste it. I should have regifted. The service is terrible. They ignore customer especially in the to go line you will literally have workers talking and laughing nearby meanwhile there&#39;s only one person who is checking out to go orders. The food is mediocre. One time I got a salad and the veggies were disgusting I had to throw it away. The rest of the food is bland, the menu is expansive which leads me to believe most of it is just being warmed up. The only good thing about he Cheesecake Factory is the Cheesecake and it&#39;s not worth putting up with the service for it. I do not recommend this place and I would not come back.

Awful service, it is unbelievable, I used to love Cheesecake Factory, definitely not the one on Santa Monica . Food has changed too. I really miss the Cheesecake Factory on San Vicente. <br>Dirty mugs and hair in the Cheesecake. Unbelievable
Worlds worst customer service! Truly terrible experience and I was just trying to use my gift card lol

No, things don&#39;t go well at all. I absolutely wanted to try The Cheesecake Factory as we don&#39;t have it in Italy and I love cheesecake. I ordered one slice original and one slice mango/lemon to go. The service was really bad: not smiling and not friendly. The guy (July 11th, about 4 PM) didn&#39;t even say goodbye after giving me the bag. They had forgotten my order as after 10/15 minutes wait had to remind them about it. As for the cakes nothing special. Had greater expectations and was unfortunately disappointed.

Britnee is the most AMAZING server on planet earth. I am returning on a week night just to sit in her section again and experience customer service on a level that is heavenly. Now why 4 stars? Because the folks next to us had a fake service dog sitting with them that barked and was fed an entire grilled chicken breast from your restaurant. It was gross, disturbing and unsanitary. California law states to put the customer out of its a pet and clearly this dog was a pet. Service animals have a respectable demeanor. This was NOT a service dog. That was nasty. Other tables requested to move tables. Get this dog situation under control Cheesecake Factory. Thank you.

I&#39;d like to give a shout out to Kyshon Moore- the guy who made our day with his service. He was kind, fast, professional and sweet. He gave us an excellent example how things should be in the restaurant industry. What a pleasure it was!<br>Rachel came after Kyshon left- she was a great replacement too!<br>Hope these kids get a raise soon!

Me and boyfriend went there on January 1st. I know there were not enough staff and the restaurant was packed.  First, we were told to wait 15minutes, but we had to wait more than 30 minutes which was today fine for me. However, we waited another 15 minutes to order food and drinks. Some staff were just standing and talking and did not pay any attention to customer. We ordered pasta for us and came without forks. It took 10 minutes to ask and waited 5 more minutes for just forks. The food was good but hospitality was terrible. <br><br>By the way, the inside dark and a family next out table was using iPhone lights to look menus.

Not the best experience here, especially for a late Valentine&#39;s celebration. I&#39;m so used to OC and fashion Valley and north county SD locations and did not expect this from beautiful Santa Monica. Ending the promenade going up the elevator to the terrace, got to the hostess table with a 30 min wait. I checked out the busy bar and noticed the main entrance busied with awaiting patrons. With no buzzer we redeemed our little ticket to get one after a line before us. Another 45 min wait to get seated in the cold draft outside of a small table for 2. We kindly asked to get seated elsewhere and assured a table was being bussed. That was false hope and after briefing a manager we got sat and that wasn&#39;t over. Food came out late and the Cajun pasta was crunchy. They re-fired my dish. Something&#39;s not right with the hostess table and the kitchen, no communication and the servers and managers are somewhat doing most of the job, evident problems with the team at this one.

Our party of ten was seated immediately because it was completely dead inside the restaurant, but it took 15 minutes for someone to come take our order and another hour for the food to even begin to come out. We were all starving and had to request bread 20 minutes in. Once the food finally came out, my farfelle pasta was so salty it was inedible. The waiter took it back and I sat there for 30 minutes waiting for my food while everyone else finished theirs. The pasta sauce was once again too salty, but at this point everyone was ready to leave so I requested to have it to go and fixed it myself at home. Would not recommend this location.

Avoid this location. This is by far the worst in the chain of restaurants. The entire experience was horrible. Multiple employees had an attitude. Instead of apologizing for their mistakes- yes more than one mistake, they had attitudes. Poor quality and poor presentation of food. Violations of food handling. This is how and why people end up sick. <br>As you see below the restaurant invites you to take the discussion offline to discuss further. They request you contact them and give them a couple of days to respond but they never do. They obviously believe the issue has been resolved by their empty meaningless reply on Yelp.

Well here is my sad Cheesecake Factory story. The food is bomb! I had the chicken Bellagio my kids had the chicken meridian with steak combo and a spaghetti and meat balls. Our waiter who&#39;s name name is Michael was scary. He was very intimidating and I don&#39;t think he realized how rude he was being. Pushy and loud which I&#39;m not fond of. It may be my personal choice but it made myself and my family totally uncomfortable. The manager came to our table without me even requesting him. Not sure if the manager cared but I ended up telling him that his waiter was crazy. I will have to be craving Cheesecake Factory really bad for me to stop at this one here in Santa Monica. I think I&#39;d rather travel 20 miles to the next one

Just by looking at the other reviews I can see that I&#39;m not the only person that had a problem with this place. Mostly the blond waitress. We got the table outside that we wanted, the Hibachi steak was very good but the waitress was a little strange with us. Felt like she wanted us out the door already. She passed by and put her hand on my sisters plate that still had food on it and told her if she was done. And she did some other stuff that made us feel like she was rushing us. July 19, 2018 6:39

You will be the judge of this simple hamburger sandwich from cheese cake factory. i asked for medium well and came out not cooked at all. I thought it will get better but honestly it was a raw ground beef. I can even smell the blood on this sandwich. I only ate the bread.

I been to this location a few times. Not by choice. I personally don&#39;t enjoy their food, I only go if Friends plan to go. Before this last visit, I was there A couple months ago. The service was so bad. It was unreal. I couldn&#39;t believe how horrible we were treated. The server even kept my credit card, and he lied about  returning it. I spoke with management and she was just as nasty and defensive. It was very odd. My credit card couldn&#39;t have disappeared on its own. I tried getting the general manager info, but the hostess was no help and was just as bad. The following day I spoke with another manager, by the name of Morgan. He was apologetic about the incident and asked that I come back and he would show me the real wAy Cheesecake Factory treats their customers. I thanked him, but told him I wouldn&#39;t return, the experience was beyond bad. They stole my credit card. <br><br>I made my recent visit on 11/15/18, a friends sister loves Cheesecake Factory and it was a late birthday dinner. Santa Monica location is the closes one, therefore, sadly, I had to return. At first our server was nice. However, he never came back for refills, didn&#39;t bother checking in. we made a birthday request, he asked me if I wanted them to sing, I said sure, he laughed and he completely ignored our request , we had to ask for desert menu, he was rude about it. We decided to skip on desert and get the check. As we were getting ready to leave, he and another server came up and started to sing, which was odd, because we were seriously leaving. Bill was paid and we had waited half an hour. <br><br>I will never go back. The place is also poorly maintained. The woman&#39;s bathroom is disgusting. It&#39;s odd because it&#39;s a nice location, but it  seems like management has low standards for employees. Customer the worst!

Cheesecake Factory is always a favorite of mine. My family and I went to The Cheesecake Factory on St. Patrick&#39;s Day. As expected, the place was packed. The employees were very polite and efficient despite the chaos. <br><br>I ordered the burrito grande, which is what I usually order. The only reason I deducted one star is because this place was very understaffed. We weren&#39;t angry, but I think it would have been easier on the staff if there were more waiters. Overall, my food was delicious and I would come back again.

Our waiter was great however, the food was cold and not presentable whatsoever. I ordered the jambalaya  (which usually comes looking very appetizing) but it surely didn&#39;t look like it taste like what I ordered. The sauce given was yellowish, when usually it&#39;s a red sauce with red pepper but that was absent. The shrimp looked extremely white as if it were cocktail shrimp or it was uncooked. I had to end up sending it back and I love coming to cheesecake for that dish so I was very disappointed. This was my first time at this particular location and will probably be my last time. Like I said I had a great server who kept a smile on his face, but the food was awful.

I haven&#39;t been to Cheesecake Factory is a long time do I decided to have brunch here after doing a little shopping. Our server was nice she greeted us with smile and brought us some warm bread which was good. I ordered French toast, it was okay. The bacon was greasy and chewy even though I requested crispy bacon. The so called &#34;fresh fruit&#34; was still partially frozen and soggy. My daughter ordered a monte cristo, the bread tasted soggy or partial cooked, she only ate 1/4 of it. The hot chocolate she ordered, although looked Delicious, tasted powdery so she didn&#39;t drink it. We were both very disappointed in the quality of the food and would not recommend coming here. Our server although nice, never checked on us, I had to ask for the bill.

I was there dozens of times, trying to find something really good.<br>What I found:<br>Grilled Salmon is great. The only plate I can eat and pay for without regret. <br>Steaks  - not for this place. It is not you are there for. <br>Burgers - great choice. Choose one of them and make your stomach full and brain happy. <br>Pasta  - epic fail. <br>Cheesecake supposed to be best thing there. Sweet, Creamy, Aromatic and Sweet , sweeet ...hm...sweet.

I usually enjoy going to the Cheesecake Factory and enjoy the food. However this time I went along with other people and the service in general was disappointing. Not only was the bread cold and hard but when asking for new one we were met with an unpleasant attitude from our waitress. There were also a few other problems but instead of complaining I ask for them to improve the general experience for the costumer.

I ordered a apple martini it was super sour I asked for the server to remake which he went to get manager which the manager came over and said I would have buy another drink to have it fixed. This place does not believe in customer service and if the staff makes your order or drink incorrectly then you are screwed. My mouth is super sour and will never return to this establishment. I recommend u stick with beer and pray everything is made correctly if you decide to eat here. This matter could have been handled differently. Corporate needs to reorganize the way service is handled before technology replace with Artificial Intelligence .
They don&#39;t accept reservations over phone and once we give our names, we have to wait more than 2 hours. This happened on a Saturday, so beware before penning down your name.

I was so disappointed by the service at this cheesecake. I was so excited to bring a group of friends who were visiting from abroad and had wanted to try it. <br><br>To begin with the girls at the front desk were very unwelcoming, and as I&#39;ve read in other reviews, I&#39;m not the first to experience this.<br><br>They then quickly turned hostile towards us when I mentioned we had puppy. Mind you, It wouldn&#39;t have been an issue for me that they didn&#39;t allow pets. However, one girl (out of nowhere), interrupts her coworker and started making my friend and I feel so unwelcomed and uncomfortable, claiming we couldn&#39;t eat there and it&#39;s &#39;California law that no restaurants have pets in patios&#39;  (FYI that law changed in 2015). I have been to plenty of restaurants with pets in outdoor seating areas. <br><br>Again, it was more the attitude we received by the staff than anything else. I&#39;m conscious that some places aren&#39;t pet-friendly, but there are ways in communicating that across, especially in places where you&#39;re constantly dealing with people.<br><br>So either this place needs newer/friendlier staff at the front desk, or the current ones need to be re-trained on their customer service (and &#39;California law&#39; for that matter).<br><br>It&#39;s such a shame. I&#39;ve never had to write a bad review, but this place left us all with such a sour taste, especially it being the first impression.

The Cheesecake Factory is our favorite spot in Santa Monica. Our server Pam was on point and delivered excellent service. She went out of her way to give us the dessert we like, the way we like it. <br><br>Thank you Pam.

I wish I had read the reviews posted here before I came to have dinner tonight with my mom. First of all, I agree 100% with most of the negative reviews here because I also experienced it first hand tonight. We arrived at this location in Santa Monica  few minutes before 6pm, a little before the rush hour dinner and the hustle and bustle of the holidays.
