We got seated right away after a few minutes wait since it wasn&#39;t that crazy busy yet. We sat outside the front patio area and had a server named Tim. At first, he seemed attentive and nice to us. But oh boy was I totally wrong. He did get to ask if we wanted drinks and asked what our orders were which went fine. He gave us water and some bread. We ordered an avocado egg roll which came out a lil after 15 mins. We ate them but didn&#39;t finish because we waited for our main course meal which was a burger and I ordered the chicken madeira. So long story short, my mom and I have been waiting for our food over 20 minutes (which quite frankly not acceptable) because the couple sitting next to us who arrived later before us, had their food already, had eaten and was already being given To Go boxes already! So they were already eating dinner and finished...while my mom and I&#39;s food still haven&#39;t arrived in our table. Our server named &#34;TIM&#34; tall, skinny, dark haired white gay with glasses came over to the couples table sitting next to our table a few times helping them out,.. while he continously tries to ignore me and my mom. He DID NOT even asked how we were doing or how is the food like a good server does to its customers waiting for their food. So, I waited and past 20 mins over, I walked up to him and he tried to turn around and pretend that he couldn&#39;t hear me. I literally had to chase him down near the front desk area, called him Sir Sir... I asked him &#34;Where is our food?&#34; and he said out loud, &#34;It&#39;s really busy, can&#39;t you tell?!&#34; while he points to the many customers walking inside the restaurant. So, I said to him, &#34; You don&#39;t have to tell us that because we came here first than any of them and we have been waiting for more than 20 mins for our food, I would just like to cancel it because we have been waiting for so long. And then he just leaves me there without even apologizing to what happened. I found it very rude and unacceptable. So I asked for help from the front desk staff, and I asked one of them if I could speak to the restaurant manager. I told him that one of his waiters named &#34;TIM&#34; was VERY RUDE to us, did not even come back to check up on our food, did not apologize at all and ignored us. The restaurant manager named Ryan came over and talked to me and apologized to what had happened after I told him the story. His waiter definitely was rude and should not have said that oh we have so many customers so the food was delayed. But that wasn&#39;t the case for the couple who sat beside us who got their food before we did even if we got there earlier than them. (Also the other people who came after me and my mom had their food as well already) The manager was nice enough to apologize and offered to pay our appetizer bill which was very kind and gave us free cheesecake to go home with. I was not very happy with the entire cheesecake factory experience here. I really like CF and have been going to many locations over the years. But I told the restaurant manager Ryan that this is my worst experience at a cheesecake factory. I know nobody is perfect and everyone has flaws. But I would and never could tolerate a bad attitude server/waiter to it&#39;s consumers/customers especially if the customer is right. The manager in return said that server will be going home after his last tables at CF. He has done enough for the day. I hope you guys will avoid being served by that guy, I am not sure what his problems are and that is not an excuse to treat other customers who just want to have a nice dinner at CF to be treated poorly than others. I understand he doesn&#39;t know when the food might be ready but at least try to check up on the tables that he waits to makes sure they are being taken care of and checking if their food was good or if we have gotten everything which we didn&#39;t. Sadly, we left CF not eating dinner so we went somewhere else instead. I felt bad for my mom because she was really hungry and tired. I do not know if I am coming back to this CF location but maybe not unless they all pull their acts together and provide better service like other CF. Shame on you &#34;TIM&#34; (TALL, SKINNY, WHITE GAY WITH GLASSES AND SOME BEARD) You know who you are! If you are reading this! You give cheesecake factory a bad name like the other bad servers. If you HATE working for customer service or being a server then QUIT! A lot of good people need jobs out there! Customers don&#39;t deserve to be discriminated or even treated RUDELY. CF act now before someone reports to you to the BBB!

I came here in a group setting, ordered the Cajun Jambalaya pasta. Beautiful presentation matched the nice outdoor seating we had. But the jambalaya pasta lacked flavor. More pasta than sauce/juice to suffice... so of course I added pepper even salt (I never add salt) mmmh and hot sauce. Looked nice though, next time I&#39;ll ask for additional sauce. Maybe if more of the paprika was actually in my plate.. perhaps..<br><br>Btw, the 4 stars is for the ambience and retry food. Taste was a 3 after my additions. Service, well let&#39;s just say I don&#39;t remember good nor bad service. I&#39;d give a 3.5 if possible.. but I guess I&#39;ll round up for good favor.

At $9 per slice of to go cheesecake, you would hope they get it right...ordered one slice with cherry, one with strawberry. Get to the car and it&#39;s one plain, one strawberry. <br><br>Having employees cut to the front of the line on a busy Friday night on top of all else doesn&#39;t create a great impression.  With what they charge, can&#39;t they just comp their servers&#39; food?<br><br>I&#39;m not a fan, but my kids love it so I suppose I will be back at some point.  Two stars because the cheesecake is really good. Just wish the service matched up.

Rushed us on our order, claiming that he was about to go on break.<br><br>Sat down waited for drinks for 30 mins plus<br><br>Appetizers after one hour was not serve.<br><br>Ask to speak to manager but never arrived.<br><br>Got all food at 1:20 hour.<br><br>Actually<br>3 out of four orders came<br><br>Forgot about the simplest<br>Appetizer <br><br>We are now at 1:35 minute<br><br>Manager came by and said shrimp was over cooked. So they are making a new one.  <br><br>So we have one guest at table that has not been served yet.<br><br>Help us <br><br>Wrong place to come enjoy a occasion with family!

Terrible Service! Don&#39;t waste your money, or time at this Cheese Cake Factory! I have eaten at many locations! This one is the worst! Cold food, terrible service! We sent food back, still didn&#39;t  get it right! I think my nine year grandson can prepare a better restaurant experience than this place!

Service is horrible I expect to wait at my table for at least 15 mins before being greeted. They usually take that long just to bring the drink you ordered and by the time that happens your cheesecake is about 10 mins behind that. So just expect an hour at minimum. Only reason I go is cause I love cheesecake!!!!

My family and I have given this place so many chances and they always fail. <br>We even emailed them and got no reply so it shows how much they don&#39;t care. <br>Ty served us in the bar area on a weekday morning. He was so rude to my Mom who had a few questions about the menu and some of the meals. She&#39;s almost 70 and has medical issues. <br>When he left our table I was ready to get up and leave. <br>The only saving grace was that he went on his lunch break and Alicia saved the day. She was a nice waitress and made up for all of his mistakes. <br>Either way we won&#39;t be coming back here anytime soon which is a bummer because we are Santa Monica natives.

Love their skinnylicous menu!! But horrible service,<br>The waitresses took so long to get our order and and looked confused at times. We got<br>The salmon plate and the steak medallion. The salmon plate in the skinnylicous menu was good but without the creamy white sauce. The steak medallion plate was by far delicious but very small portion compared to their other typical plates. Food was good but service was not.

One of my best friends in the whole world (from South America) came to visit me for the first time in 6 years, and one of the first places she wanted to go was Santa Monica and the Cheesecake Factory. This location didn&#39;t exist when she lived here, and, I was a little hesitant given the not so glowing reviews...but I elected to give this place a shot.<br>Nestled in an upscale shopping center adjacent to the promenade, we arrived a mere few minutes before they opened and thereby avoided the huge CROWD we waded through waiting up front when we left 90 mins later. This place is busier than busy.<br>The hostess that seated us was a doll. our waiter Charlie was an affable pro, and our food was on point. <br>I can see the downsides to a location like this and I&#39;m very happy we avoided them.

Not what it used to be.<br>We&#39;ve been going regularly to the Cheesecake Factory for years and were generally happy with the service and the food.<br>But lately we&#39;ve seen things change to the point that we cannot take our friends any longer.<br>We arrived at 6:30 Pm (on a Friday) and they were plenty of tables available. We were told there was a 10 min wait and were given a beeper. 1/2 an hour later I had to go ask what was happening because we were still not seated.<br>Once at the table we had to wait another 15 min for the bread to be served, and the food took a good 40 minutes to arrive.

I love the Cheesecake Factory, but was extremely disappointed with my recent visit. I&#39;m not sure if the server was upset since we were his last table of the night or just having a bad day. But he did not greet us, mention his name, or even offer us bread to begin with. Our appetizer did not come before our meal even though he specified it would. It took forever for him to refill my water after asking him, and as soon as he closed us out he came and asked me if the check was signed and ready for him. I am a server myself, and found that super disrespectful.

The one thing that you can count on from Cheesecake Factory is familiarity. I wish I could I could say consistency but that has not been the case. My visit to the SM location left me completely disappointed. I ordered the Chipotle Grilled Shrimp salad and I think I may have received one large spoon and cocktail shrimp... not grilled! It was so poorly constructed. The arugula was wilted and they added tomatoes which were not listed as one of the ingredients. However, peppers and farro wheat were and they were not included.<br><br>Now the worse part of all this was the black hair I discovered in the mix of my salad. Well, you can imagine how grossed out I was. I get that restaurants like to offer large selection of food options and large quantities to satisfy the customer. I think customer service gets lost. <br><br>The server did apologize and offered to make a new salad, but all I could think of was that black hair peeking through!
The most horrible experience. I rather starve to death! <br>Order came in after58 minutes of waiting and it was wrong!

Oscar is one of the nicest most humble waiters we have come across in a long time. <br>Being a server myself back in the day and now a Multi Unit Manager for 16 stores, I really appreciate someone who knows how to give service!<br>Props! Props! <br>Major Props!!!!! <br>I will most definitely be back, and will ask for Oscar to be my server! :) <br><br>Host kept my girl and I waiting for 10 minutes, <br>But Oscar most definitely slid in for the win!

Although the food is amazing the service is somewhat mediocre. It took a very long time to get our food and then our order was wrong and delayed because they failed to inform us that theu were out of veggie burgers. We had about 4 different servers/waitresses. Not going to return to this particular place.

Ya know...it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory haha what you see is what you get. I came here because I was on a really awkward bumble date and she had a migraine. It was quiet and dimly lit so that was the main reasoning for picking it.<br><br>We each ordered off the skinny menu and it wasn&#39;t half bad! We shared the Tuscan Chicken and Burger. Really good. I would probably recommend the Tuscan Chicken over the burger.<br><br>We then got the red velvet cake for desert. It was good...and 1,600 calories. Yes, that&#39;s right, 1,600 calories. Yikes. <br><br>Next time you&#39;re at the Cheesecake Factory, look around. It&#39;s not exactly the world&#39;s healthiest people that eat there. <br><br>With this said - I enjoyed the chicken and the waiters were nice. I might even go back sometime.

I have to say this first: The Cheesecake Factory is my favorite restaurant. <br><br>This location is beautiful. You can see the ocean from the outside seating. The inside is gigantic as well with a nice bar area. <br><br>Dinning in: On a weekday it will be normal wait time. Food is absolutely delicious. Their menu is a book - and if you think i&#39;m exaggerating you obviously haven&#39;t been to The Cheesecake Factory. They have a great happy hour too. Amazing drinks and every combination of food, why wouldn&#39;t you be happy? On a weekend, expect to wait 30-45 minutes and it will be PACKED. Good luck finding a seat at the bar. Still worth it though, ha ha!<br><br>Dinning out: The only reason I gave this place 4 stars. I work in the Promenade, so I really come here 4-5 times a week for my lunch. I order takeout because I don&#39;t have enough time to eat in. I also want to say this: It is NOT the workers fault. They are very fast and generous when it comes to dealing with the lines. I have no idea why their management would put ONE person in the takeout AND bakery section. This place gets PACKED and one worker will be dealing with cheesecake orders, to-go orders, orders for online apps, phone orders, and running back occasionally getting food. Way too much for one worker, you&#39;re a chain put 2 workers at least. Would be 5 stars if I could rely on it for takeout. <br><br>Food: 5 stars <br>Workers: 5 stars

Great place, friendly staff, and delicious food. Last I went there with my mom and a friend. We enjoyed a long Sunday brunch in a great atmosphere, super comfortable and relaxing.They have everything you want.Breakfast, lunch, brunch, dinner, coffee, bar... One stop for everything. Also conveniently located near 3rd str Promenade.

This place sucks. The service was bad, every single dish from my fork, plate, and wine glass was DIRTY! The table was sticky when I touched it. Ugh. Complained to the manager and he didn&#39;t seem to be concerned. DON&#39;T EAT HERE!!! All the servers are idiots and slow. Would give zero stars if I could!!!!

If I could give a 0 star I would. Me and a couple of my friends came to this location in Santa Monica and by far I had the WORSE experience. We walked through the entire restaurant and no one greeted us or offered to get a us a table. We literally passed by 3 stations before we finally got help. My friends and I sat outside and the seats with filled with dried up food and dingy seats that looked liked that hadn&#39;t been cleaned in months. I LOVE cheesecake factory but this location is TRASH! I was so disgusted by the flys flying around that I left and went to BENIHANA !!

Food was good, steak a bit too well done, but the sides and cheesecake was bomb as usual. What peeved me was that we had to stand up to find our waiter. If we waited for our order and ate in an hour then we had to wait for the waiter the other hour. Ended up not being able to hit any of the stores the mall cuze we got out too late.

Service: I was very happy with the service at this Cheesecake Factory, despite all the negative reviews about slow service. The hostess greeted us as we walked in and we were seated immediately. Afterwards, the waitress ensured that we had a great experience, by checking in on us periodically and attending to us with a friendly smile. I was also pleasantly surprised at how fast our food came out considering there were a lot of people in the restaurant.<br><br>Food: I ordered the thai coconut lime chicken, expecting a dish similar to thai curry as the name and description suggests, but to my dismay the dish was completely different. The chicken and vegetables were coated in an oily pesto like sauce. I didn&#39;t taste any trace of the coconut milk or lime which was very disappointing. All in all the flavor in the dish was mediocre, and I wouldn&#39;t recommend ordering this.<br><br>Overall, I would come back to this specific Cheesecake factory but wouldn&#39;t recommend the Thai Coconut Lime Chicken.

First of all, I must say that our waitress was incredible, helpful and prompt but I am<br>not reviewing her incredible smile, her helpfulness or how apologetic she was, so here we go.....<br>This place is soooo unprofessional, one of the rare 2 star Cheesecake Factory establishments, in matter of the fact, only Santa Monica Place and Cerritos Cheesecake Factory are waaaaaaay below the expectations.<br><br>Our Kale Grilled Salmon Salad was missing avocado, brussell sprouts and arugula (three very important ingredients) so when we complained manager Katia brought us dry ingredients so that we can continue builting our salad at the table. Ridiculous. <br>Our Angel Hair Shrimp Pasta was dry, untasty and cold, we were very surprised that Cheesecake Factory is serving unfinished, unsupervised and untasty dishes. When I asked the manager to bring me just liiiiiiitle extra marinara so that I can &#34;fix&#34; the dish, she brought me cold marinara, to make my dish even worse. <br>Horrible. <br><br>Way too many options for incredible 3.5 or 4 and even 4.5 star dining in Santa Monica. No need to wait 40-45 min for table, another 20 minutes for your dish, just to find out that you wasted one hour of your life waiting for below mediocre food. <br>Wow. NEVER AGAIN.
They have the best banana cheesecake ever. Came here for the first time with my friend and service and it was excellent!!! Definitely coming back!
It&#39;s a good Cheesecake Factory, I&#39;m from Rhode Island and the service and quality of food is so much higher!

POOR SERVICE !!!!!<br>My Asian friend and I had a RUDE possibly RACIST &#34;Waiter&#34;. No fun when you spend over a hundred bucks for a casual dinner and get RUDE service. <br>We both ordered the steak. Hers was fair tasting. My steak clearly had tons of extra PEPPER placed on it, which I didn&#39;t request.  Server did nothing about it. Crab balls became COLD after 2 requests for mustard (which usually comes with it). Didn&#39;t enjoy the appetizer. Waiter says they were out of our 1st request of Crab Dip. Did I really need to request steak sauce? Well yeah we had to 3 times before finally getting a completely EMPTY BOTTLE !  <br>Wouldn&#39;t a good Waiter be able to feel the weight of an empty bottle?. Later when he bought it my friend asked that he not slam it on the table as he did!!! Geez...He wasn&#39;t done yet though. We noticed he introduced himself by name to the guests beside us. But not for us. After ordering cheesecake to go in the bag, we noticed the strawberries were sloppily in the container instead of neatly dressed on the cheesecake as usually given. Wait---&#39;he had 1 more rude trick. He placed the check in front of my friend instead of me. <br>We saw the Manager addressing another tables complaint but we just decided to leave. <br>I paid the check and wrote RUDE WAITER with a $ZERO TIP. <br>This is the 1st time in my life that I never tipped a Waiter and hopefully my last. <br>Cheesecake Factory Santa Monica please get it together.

On a Friday for a party of 10 we were seated pretty fast and the restaurant is pretty empty for dinner. While the service and food were all fine, I was not pleased when the waitress came forcing me to give the tip that&#39;s on the &#34;suggested tip&#34; on the bill. For one thing, I calculated a 20% tip before tax. The suggested tip is calculate after tax. She chased me down insisting on the suggested tip. It is called &#34;suggested&#34;. She blocked my way out the restaurant. Not wanting to make a scene because i was taking my family who are visiting from out of the country, I did redo my calculation with the suggested tip, and then she let us leave. But I would never ever go back to Santa Monica Cheesecake Factory. Felt I got bullied into the tip. What happened to tipping being a gratuity. What happened to the meaning of a &#34;suggestion.&#34; Why do I have to put a tip based on after tax? If I didn&#39;t have 9 guests waiting for me, I would definitely have stood my ground.

Wow people are really hating on this location!!! So first off the service sucked but I just really like their food. I got the skinny menu lemon garlic shrimp and my guests got chicken romano with veggies no pasta and green coconut curry with brown rice. I like it there. Can&#39;t go wrong with desert but we didn&#39;t get any this time.

Totally unpleasant place. I&#39;m not recommend for visiting. We waited 10 minutes on front when this cafe was full after that we waited 20 minutes just to make an order and when waiters come (he was not be able to got the order)What?!?!On photo all waiters than looked on us and didn&#39;t do nothing....

Food was good enough ... what you would expect from Cheesecake Factory.  But the service was sooooo slow. We ended up skipping dessert because we figured it would take 30 minutes to order and receive, then another 20 minutes to pay.

We ordered Cheese Cake factory to go last night. Everything was good minus the chicken and biscuit&#39;s. How are you going to give us one decent and one burned biscuit. The burnt biscuit was so hard we couldn&#39;t even bite into it.

A couple of bad experiences here - disappearing wait staff and poorly prepared food... Today was the worst, were showed a table next to customers running around on scooters... asked for a different table and was told it we would need to go back into the queue, 20 minutes.<br><br>I get this is casual instructional dining, but this is the worst run of any Cheesecake in the chain... it had been long enough for me to forget how awful this one is.... won&#39;t forget next time.
The beast - banana cheesecake all people should try))<br>And really cool view from this place)

There was a hair on my pasta yambalaya, no body in the restarurant was really concerned about that, I have the impression that the waiter was expecting me to eat the hair on my pasta as he asked me if I want a new one. <br>It was my wife&#39;s birthday so I didn&#39;t want to make a problem there, but the entire experience was bad and finding a hair in my food is lack of respect to the customers.

Made a mistake of ordering take out from this place. That&#39;s a BIG NO NO! Half of my food is missing! I wonder if this was someone&#39;s left overs. YUCK! <br><br>Old review:  Having a bad experience dining there, I decided to order take out. BIG MISTAKE! The chicken was burnt &amp; there was no sauce. Paid $25 for a couple of asparagus pieces &amp; a spoon of mashed potatoes! Won&#39;t make the mistake of setting foot here ever again!

Giving you a 5 today because our server was the BEST. I had surgery to remove skin cancer from my jaw yesterday and had limited options (can&#39;t chew.. I am black and blue with stitches and bandages). Our server went out of his way and brought me a sample of the soup which made my day. Definitely not at my best... It was 3pm and I hadn&#39;t been able to eat at all that day. I didn&#39;t order soup because I was worried the potatoes would be too large to chew. It was perfect and delicious. Our server was thoughtful enough to figure out what would help and showed a rare kindness I don&#39;t see these days. My daughter was happy with all her choices too.  Of course she has no issues chewing, and loved her HUGE ice cream sundae as well as her meal.  My pot stickers were great too. When I can chew again I&#39;ll eat the outside and not just the inside as they were totally delish!   THANK YOU!!

Well this is the first Cheesecake Factory I did not see crowded. We got seated really fast and we sat out door which was very nice because Christmas music was playing downstairs. The food was delicious but it wasn&#39;t a typical Cheesecake Factory where they give you a lot of food and you always have food left over. They gave you just the. right amount, that means you ate it all and nothing left over. The service is very well and the waitress recommended a good pinot noir

Sherri, the hostess, made our night. When we walked in she was happy and helpful. She made us feel like friends coming for dinner. Even though we expected a long wait, it wasn&#39;t and she got us a great spot! Sherri even checked in on us during the meal. We enjoyed visiting this cheesecake factory, dinner was delicious and the service was awesome. Not to mention the cheesecake of course, yum!

Got sat by a clearly unhappy and very rude hostess (blue eyeshadow is pretty unprofessional to wear at a restaurant as well). <br><br>We sat at our table for about 10 minutes with multiple waiters, bussers and hosts passing by. We were not greeted, given waters, or even acknowledged at all. MIND YOU, this is 4:00 pm, a very slow time for restaurants.<br><br>I finally pulled the hostess aside (since we were sat about 15 feet from her podium) and asked if anyone planned on helping us. She said she would ask, but then just scurried over to the computer. Finally after about 15 minutes a waitress came over. We were able to put in our entire order in, but we still didn&#39;t receive our drinks until about five minutes later.<br><br>I&#39;m usually a pretty big fan of Cheesecake Factory, but the employees here really miss the mark on customer service.

They are sososososo slow if there&#39;s not that much people. If you go this place, you need patience. I visited so many cheesecake factories and this place is definately slow and servise is also bad.

Everything everyone else has said already made the point, and to not be redundant I&#39;m going to skip my experience and just say DO NOT GO HERE. Health Score A, but there are still FOOD STAINS on my FRESH SILVERWARE. <br>PS DO NOT GO HERE

It was my first time eating at the Cheesecake Factory and I was super excited for the cheesecake! Well... I did get what I came for. Their Fresh Strawberry cheesecake was delicious and filling! If I only ordered their cheesecake alone, I would have given 5 stars. Unfortunately, the actual food wasn&#39;t too exciting. I had the truffle-honey chicken. The chicken tasted like Chinese orange chicken. The asparagus and mashed potato was just average. The price was a bit too much for this average qualitied food. In the future, I would definitely come back to this retaurant ONLY for dessert, but would skip out on the overpriced food.

Service: <br>Our waitress refused to refill my drink and wanted to charge me extra because she said that she saw  my boyfriend was drinking it. The reality is that my boyfriend only took a sip..This really made me feel uncomfortable..<br>Food:<br>Most of the foods that we ordered was cold. The portion of roasted chicken was smaller than other locations that I have been to!<br><br>Will never go back to this location again!

Food was good service was just ok the reason why I give it 2 stars is because people are allowed to take dogs inside the Restaurant. I have 2 dogs of my own I love them to pieces but I DO NOT take them to Indoor Restaurants. There are parks, outdoor Restaurants ext.... this is not sanitary !!!!!!

We wore there for my wife&#39;s birthday and service wore the worst.. Except for the waiter he was really nice and patient and understanding. But the rest starting from the hosttes and the buzzer, we felt discrimination, cuz they gave the best tables to not spanic people.. She lie to us about the tables... Only white people were sitting in the good tables outside... I&#39;m really disappointed, no wonder you guys have 2 stars.. Not coming here any more.
Hostess Sherri was incredible!  Best on the planet  she was so helpful in making our experience top notch.  First time to Santa Monica and we won&#39;t forget it!

One star, frankly because I didn&#39;t even get to eat there. Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite spots whether I am enjoying it at home in Vegas or what I thought would be better ... enjoying it in Santa Monica on vacation! I had my pup in tow so I decided to call just to ensure that we could sit on the patio without any issues. I called and said &#34;hi, do you guys allow dogs to sit on the patio and how long is the wait&#34; the girl who answered stated they did and it was a 45 minute wait so after shopping we headed up to put our names on the list. When we went to check in they asked &#34;is he a service dog&#34; mm no. (Side note: I do not expect all restaurants to accommodate a dog, I get it but don&#39;t waste my time when I called ahead to ask) <br><br>I think everyone needs to come in on a Saturday AM and have a staff meeting to ensure everyone is on the same page!

Weekend brunch here is great with the variety of food choices and a nice view.  We sat in a booth on the rooftop with a view of the third street promenade and the ocean.  The best part of brunch was the staff.  Our waiter, Leo, was friendly and efficient and the rest of the waitstaff worked well as a team.  The highlight of the day was Sherri!  Her infectious energy started when she greeted us but stayed with us even after she sent us on our way!

Underwhelming experience. <br>Avocado egg rolls - the avocado was NOT ripe, it felt like chewing on steamed broccoli stems. <br>Even though they weren&#39;t that busy the server took forever to do most things.  He was mostly nice but it felt like we were an after thought for everything.
Utensils are very dirty and looks like is not even washed. I told servers and not a apology ?! I would not come back here again.

Sherri is the absolute best. Such a professional and cheerful personality. My terrace queen for today as she made my great niece birthday special on the great California Saturday. Serving staff was awesome and good quality food

We came here for the first time to eat one of their famous cheesecakes. They have a large selection and it`s very hard to decide since all of their cakes seem to be so delicious. We chose the &#34;mango key lime cheesecake&#34; and the &#34;lemon raspberry cream cheesecake&#34; and both of them tasted sooooo good. The waitress was friendly too and introduced us to our new waiter when her shift seem to end. The location at the patio was very nice and cozy.

Just as warm as their bread and butter that greets you at the table. The hostess with the mostest Mrs. Sherri made our first trip to the Santa Monica location a pleasant one. Despite a side note for your maintenance team. Our first initial reaction was a bit sour, as the entrance to the elevator reminded us more of a deep trenched New York subway station due to the smell of a urinal. Despite that faux pas, as soon as the elevator beamed us up. Our party of 7 was met with a warm welcoming smile while most would be intimidated by the group size. Sherri recognized our party as one that would bring on the appetizers and drinks surely to make any waitstaff swoon. Her warmth was like that small town feel where everybody knows your name and invites you over for a bite to eat or a cup of sugar. THANK YOU, Mrs. Sherri. We will come again just for you and the cheesecake. She was so sweet I stopped to take a picture with her. As I had seen so many others on Yelp do. She is like the Mayor of the Cheesecake Factory in SM... Keep her on Management She is a Gem.

My friends and I come here on Saturday and Sunday for brunch. Always Great food and lots of space. The best part  is seeing Sherri.  She stops by to say hi, makes my buddy&#39;s baby laugh, and makes the visit enjoyable. Thanks for all the fun times!  See you next weekend!

Great service. I know they were short-staffed when we visited, but staff was attentive. Food came out quick. We were in a hurry. The mojito was bomb dot com. Avocado rolls...yum! We didn&#39;t get cheesecake this time, but they always have the best flavors and their strawberry shortcake is beyond this world.

Love Cheesecake Factory and love this location even more for its beautiful patio and lovely hostess, Sherrie. Taking the elevator up and being welcomed by her cheerful smile gets the meal started right. We were seated quickly and made to feel at home. Big fan of the endless menu. Try to resist seconds of the brown bread to leave room for the dutifully delicious main course.

Great service when we had arrived. No wait time, good sized booth and excellent food. Location is a little tricky with parking and all but it&#39;s in the main complex, (top floor). Pretty good in comparison to other locations! One of the classics, with affordability.

OMG.... Had the best time here. This hostess (Sherri) was so nice and the life of the party. If you come here make sure she is close by. She made the night so much fun for us. The food was great also. So so happy with them.

Why in the world does this place have such a wait?  There are plenty of other options for places to eat in the area, do yourself a favor and skip this one.  A lot of staff walking around, but the one whose helping you never seems to be around.  We ordered a couple of kids plates, and only received one.  When we asked about the second one, they said the fish was dropped and they would make another one right away.  All the rest of our food came out, but still no sign of the second plate.  Suddenly the story was that the ordering system must not have worked correctly, and the kitchen must not have gotten the order in correctly.  What?  Really?  Are you actually figuring out what happened, or just making up excuses.  In the meantime, our friend&#39;s son is starving, nibbling off of everyone&#39;s plate.  By the time his food came, he wasn&#39;t even hungry.  <br><br>Yes the noise of the restaurant helps to drown out your noisy ids noise, but it&#39;s far from a relaxing meal here.  Go somewhere else...
The waits here are a bit long and sometimes there isnt even a host to greet you or help you!

We had an AMAZING experience after the LA Marathon! We were seated immediately and treated like rockstars! Sherri the hostess sat us in a large booth and made sure we were taken care of and continued to check up on us throughout our visit! The staff was so nice and the food was great! Absolutely recommend this location!

This is one of those chain restaurants that operate on volume rather than quality.  Considering this mall location with the exception of one has had every restaurant turn over due to the high cost of rent....together with the terrible service and sloppy food this will end up with what Eater LA says &#34;El Dunzo!&#34;<br><br>Came here for lunch with four people and ordered the BBQ Chicken Salad and specifically asked for no tomatoes.  The food comes out and had chopped tomatoes all over the salad.  I sent it back and 15 minutes later (after everyone was done with lunch) my salad arrives.  Wouldn&#39;t you think the kitchen would expedite this order as it wasn&#39;t a heavy lunch crowd.<br><br>The salad arrives and the lettuce was DIRTY, the &#39;crispy onion rings&#39; were not cooked, and the salad was just disgusting.  <br><br>Forget this location, as I had better food at a hot dog cart.... ONE STAR for disappointing food!

Awesome time at Cheesecake Factory in Santa Monica with our hostess Sherri.  Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp, and Bistro Shrimp Pasta was delicious.  Sherri started the party off by dancin&#39; us to our tables!

I had dinner at Cheesecake Factory at this location Saturday night. I was seated on the outside patio. It has a really nice outdoor view ! I particularly like this location because it&#39;s located in a shopping center third street promenade Santa Monica. They have a large menu. Anything on the specialties menu is good. I like all the pasta dishes here. They also have a good selection of drinks and desserts.

Had a great experience at Santa Monica Cheesecake Factory. Our party of 7 came in after a long bike ride on the beach. Sherri, lovely Sherri, the hostess, went above and beyond (including chasing me down the length of the restaurant) to get us a great table on the patio. Thank you Sherri!

Came here for a graduation brunch and it was fabulous!!! Not only was brunch delicious and the views were gorgeous, the hostess Sherri was beyond fun!! Gave us a &#34;VIP&#34; table, came by continuously to check on us and kept a smile on our faces! Great morning!! (Also, LOVED our servers and Sherri)

I didn&#39;t believe it was 2.5 stars till I went with a group of friends. When I entered the restaurant, it felt like every other cheesecake factory but no wait line. How is that possible? Lol  When we met our waiter, I can tell she was taking care of us but in a rude manner. The tone of her voice and the things she says to you is a bit aggressive.<br><br>The food comes out and they mess up on my gf&#39;s order. That happens but again with the way she talked to us. I think this Cheesecake Factory also cuts down on portion because my Cajun Jambalaya Pasta looked appetizing but a lot smaller than I thought. I probably wouldn&#39;t come back.

The menu is extensive but it always takes forever for everything. At this very moment, we&#39;ve been here for 20 min, and we haven&#39;t gotten bread or our drinks and we see our server through the glass talking to another server laughing. Maybe they are talking about our order (I&#39;m trying to be optimistic).  Luckily, another server saw us concerned and delivered our items. Jose, their new server, was amazing and was very attentive. <br><br>The atmosphere is pretty if you sit outside. There are heaters and booths available. <br><br>Have fun!!

The Grove location is way better. Go there if you want professional receptionists, better drinks and food. The whisky smash is bland and the spaghetti meatballs are undercooked. The place has no character.

I came here during vacation and when I got seated the spoon that was already there for appetizers was super dirty. I&#39;m not sure if they even washed it. The person I was with went to the restroom and the waiter came and asked if we were ready to order our meals even though it was only me.

We found Nemo! He was a fun and enthusiastic and everything came out on time and delicious! I do not really understand why the stars are so low. Every cheesecake factory we have gone too has superb customer service. <br><br>If you expect fast service good luck this cheesecake is near 3rd street promenade so expect delays. But the customers, food and service are great. So if you are gonna give poor stars due to timing I would probably chose a less popular cheesecake!<br><br>On a positive note, the gumbo was delish! The wraps were good! And try the bread with balsamic dressing is amazing I highly recommend it and once you have tried it let me know!!! Bomb!

So far so good, got a seat outside. The view was nice and very romantic for me and my hubby. Our server has been sweet and very attentive. I give it four stars, because our food hasn&#39;t come out yet. BTW, This has to be the nicest cheese cake I&#39;ve been to.<br><br>So disappointed in my Louisiana chicken pasta. Noodles were under cooked, dry and too salty. My sweet waitress brought me more sauce, which helped. <br>My hubby got the Jambalaya Pasta, he said it was delicious. So I&#39;m going to put 5 stars.

Love the steaks here. They always have fresh steaks. The line is long which makes people give up eating easily. The service here is very professional. The waiters always come back and ask if I needed anything else which they cared about my dinner. That was a good point that every restaurant should have. This place deserves a five-star for sure. If there was a six, I would willing to give it to them.

They are all the same, and all fine.  Usually. This location is big and bright. But GOOD LORD, the aggressive angry server &#34;training&#34; another new server was awful. It was painful to witness. Then she was super aggressive with our table.  Absolutely unnecessary, it&#39;s just lunch. I had a decent meal. The salmon was fine. I do like their cheesecake, always good. It&#39;s an ok addition to the mall. I will probably not go back, unless forced to. Maybe for a slice o&#39; cheesecake. To go.

I had to wait 20 minutes time    To get salad dressing for my salad. And I had to wait over 20 minutes for some brown bread in spite of flagging down about five different Waters.  It wasn&#39;t even that crowded just Poor Service

Just wanted to share my amazing experience at this particular restaurant.  From the time I walked in, the experience was amazing starting with the beautiful hostess Sherri. She was friendly and kind and welcoming.  From there, the waiter was a delight and kind. The food was AMAZING so kudos to the chefs. Sherri came back to check in on me and that made me feel so special. She is one of a kind  I&#39;ve been to a few Cheesecake Factory&#39;s and although they were nice, they didnt provide an experience. I look forward to going back and bringing friends to  enjoy a wonderful time and hopefully starting with Sherri.  I encourage everyone to stop by Santa Monica Cheesecake Factory and hopefully Sherri is there to start your experience with her warm welcome!

Horrible! <br>1) Ran out of ice to serve water (at least that&#39;s the excuse that we were given when we had to ask 3 different staff members to serve us water after we had gotten seated and were waiting forever!) <br>2) Waitress BLUNTLY let me know that she can only divide our bill into 3 checks for our party of 11<br>3) Food was subpar - bland <br>4) Pricing was ridick $100 for 4 people <br>5) Value proposition- none delivered: crappy service, rude wait staff, bland food<br><br>1 GREAT THING: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION (they will probably be out of business soon because of not being able to pay high rent, see #5 above)<br><br>DON&#39;T WASTE YOUR HARD-EARNED MONEY OR PRECIOUS TIME TO COME HERE! REMEMBER, YOU&#39;VE BEEN WARNED!<br><br>PS I see that their social media person only replies to positive Yelp reviews...THINGS THAT MAKE YA GO HMMMMMM??????

I highly recommend to visit this place. Convenient location. Delicious desserts. Good service. But especially I want to tell about Sherri Wilson, who met us at the entrance. She is very attentive, guessed every our desire. Friendly with all. We got great pleasure to see how she&#39;s working! She arranged a whole performance for the birthday party at another table. It was very fun and interesting for everyone. She paid attention to each guest. Thank you Sherri Wilson for the wonderful time and your excellent work!

Two stinkin&#39; stars... and I&#39;m feeling generous right now.<br><br>My girlfriend and I visited this location in May 2016 while on vacation. Yeah, I really don&#39;t know why I went here during vacation. Anyways, it was a weekday lunch hour and not busy. Generally, the place looked neat and clean. The workers - not so much. Uniform and appearance do not always reflect service, but I felt like that was the case during my visit. Cheesecake Factory, Santa Monica - please (enforce) some kind of hygiene / appearance policies on your workers. Long fingernails, an unkempt appearance and a sloppy uniform are just not acceptable.<br><br>After ordering our food, we were served essentially room temperature water. As if that was not enough, my plastic cup obviously had some leftover food particle. I almost always use a straw when drinking from restaurant cups - and this visit was not going to be an exception. A second request for straws had to be made, but it eventually arrived. I forgot what we ordered, but I remembered I did finish my plate (they&#39;re fortunate I was hungry, or I might&#39;ve been more critical of their food). I believe my girlfriend finished her plate too.<br><br>My biggest gripe during our visit had to be our utensils (see photos with knives and napkin). I cleaned my knife by dampening my napkin with a little water and vigorously rubbing the knife. The knife on the right is the one I cleaned, and the knife on the left is the one I was about to clean (my girlfriend&#39;s). The napkin shows the dirt that was removed.<br><br>I believe this location attracts more tourists than locals and constantly has different customers. Hence, this establishment&#39;s inability (or unwillingness) to improve their service; they don&#39;t really &#34;lose&#34; business as a result of their poor service. Yes, poor service (see that 2-star review?). Lastly, I wish I checked Yelp before I visited their location. Spend your hard-earned money elsewhere!
Service is friendly and food is nice and almost reasonable. But the pizza conversion into a small(!) &#34;flatbread&#34; is not appreciated. Please put those pizzas back on the menu.

If I could give this place a zero, I would. We came in about 3:30pm on a Wednesday and there weren&#39;t many people inside the restaurant. We ordered two lunch portion of food. Kept getting told our food was coming right up for 40 minutes. Got up and left without food!!! Get it together cheesecake factory! Do not go here!!

By far the worst Cheesecake Factory I have ever been to. The service is beyond slow and the food is mediocre. <br><br>First, the waitress and waiters seem very unhappy to be here. They often ignored us, spoke only to each other, and moved extremely slowly. When our waitress took our order, she did not write anything down. Therefore, it was not surprising when our orders came out all wrong.<br><br>My friend ordered pasta with no onions --- it came with onions. My other friend ordered the salmon and it was cold by the time it arrived at the table. I ordered an omelette with spinach, tomato, ham and avocado. There was no avocado and mushrooms instead of tomato. 3/4 of the orders came out wrong. <br><br>When I asked them to fix this, they took twice the amount of time to bring me my omelette back --- and it still had mushrooms in it with one piece of avocado. I gave up and just ate this. The potatoes that came with the omelette took another 20 minutes to get here, which by this time, we were completely done and waiting for the check. In fact, the check arrived before my food even got here. The waitress seemed very grumpy to have to fix these mistakes. <br><br>Definitely avoid going here if you can. Unless you want terrible service and poor food, I recommend going to all the other restaurants third street promenade has to offer. It will taste much better and probably will be cheaper.

I have never been to this location was excited to try it. Sat in the bar area for Happy Hour and waited over 10 minutes before asking what appeared to be a manager in all black who my waitress was. She had no idea! Very loud and chaotic. Finally got service. Sweet girl wasn&#39;t aware of wines on Happy Hour. Received cold hard bread not impressed. Do not recommend this location

The location is good and the restaurant is huge. I also like that they have an elevator that goes from the ground floor next to Nike directly into the 3rd floor restaurant! You can check in from where you get off the elevator, you don&#39;t have to go to the front lobby to check in, so you could potentially bypass a line for checking in! <br><br>The restaurant is standard for a cheesecake factory, but there&#39;s also an outdoor area which is nice. They have ample heating so it&#39;s not cold, even when it&#39;s 50 degrees outside at night! <br><br>As far as the food goes, it was ok. It&#39;s what I would expect from a cheesecake factory, so the food is pretty good, but nothing special or particularly interesting. The portions are giant, which is weird for Santa Monica, so expect to have leftovers!

Food was good, but service..... oh, slow, super slow!!! <br>We asked about refill and extra cheese, we finished our food and they didn&#39;t even remember about that! <br>FOOD GOOD, service BAD!!!! <br>Think twice before...

Oh my, reading other people&#39;s reviews and I feel bad they all seem to have had such an awful time. <br><br>Myself and my family on the other hand was okay with how everything came out and was impressed by a few things. <br><br>I forgot the name of our waiter but he wasn&#39;t that bad. With the occasional leaving our table unattended for a slight prolonged amount of time, the service was great. <br><br>It&#39;s weird to hear my mom praise anything that is western food but right off the bat she really enjoyed the whole wheat-oat bread. One thing I have learned is to always trust my mom&#39;s palate. Like mother like son, the bread truly was good. Is it weird that the first thing they put down for starters would foreshadow the rest of our meal?<br><br>My aunt was feeling for some orange juice so she got that while my little brother got Diet Coke and the rest of us got water. Water service was great, other than the Diet Coke our water was always filled in a timely fashion.<br><br>As appetizers we ordered the baked mac and cheese and wings. The wings looked dry when you look at them, but they were alright. I was impressed with the baked mac and cheese balls, that came with a nice serving of marinara sauce. It was delicious.<br><br>I ordered the Cajun jambalaya just because I ordered it before. I forgot what my little brother ordered but we ordered miso salmon, herb crusted salmon, and then charbroiled steak. <br><br>The miso salmon is the only one I do not recommend. Although the salmon was cooked really well, the amount of sugar in the dish was just so unappetizing to me. My dad who loves sugar even thought it was too sweet. The rest of the dish was good.<br><br>Oh I also ran into two of my high school friends which was neat. <br><br>Overall great place to eat. I had a great time. We ended it with a nice serving of cheese cake with a little ice cream on the side.

I went to the Grove the Other night &amp; Decided to stop by this Location with my friends. It was such an Awesome Choice, we sat with our Server &amp; her name was Brittney F. She Was So Fun &amp; has Such a Big Personality. She took really good care of us &amp; made sure our Food Came Out So Fast. It was so delicious &amp; then when it was time for Dessert we told her to make a choice for us &amp; she made such an incredible one. They Lemon Meringue &amp; Strawberry Cheesecake. They were both Incredible &amp; Delicious As well. We want to definitely thank her.

Fair price.  Great service.  No free parking.  Great for groups.  Great for couples.   Fresh food.  Healthy options.  <br><br>I love Cheesecake Factory.  I think it&#39;s great that they have so many options on their menu.  Because I&#39;m doing a low carb diet I like to get the grilled salmon plate there.  It&#39;s delicious.  I also ask for slices of lemons on the side so it&#39;s even more yummy.  I also get salads there sometimes.   The salads are huge, fillings, and healthy.  And of course, you can&#39;t go there with out at least trying one of the cakes.  I personally don&#39;t like the complicated looking cheese cakes, such as the Oreo cheese cake.  It&#39;s way too sweet for me.  But the standard cheese cake or the strawberry shortcake are delicious!!!! I will be eating there many more times.

Just had to sit and listen to employees gossip for about 50 minutes next to my table. Right next to me! <br><br>I understand that you are excited to see ex employees or friends but I shouldn&#39;t have listen to your chatter for 50 minutes. And when I complain to a manager about his employees socializing, he discounts their 95 dollar tab. I&#39;m the one who should be discounted.<br><br>Ridiculous! Definitely contacting corporate! Be professional, this is Santa Monica. I should not have your butt in my face.

Just an individual shoutout to our waiter, Peter! His attendance was by far the best service I&#39;ve ever received at Cheesecake Factory. He was very polite and ready attentive!! He was also very quick to offer any help, regardless of us asking for it or not. We were talking about how we wanted a photo and he overheard us, and immediately offered to take a picture! Overall, a great experience. (:

I was shocked to see all the negative reviews for this location. <br><br>Dined here yesterday for lunch and it was like any other Cheesecake Factory. There was a 20-minute wait for outside seating, but we actually waited only for about 10-minutes (yay!).<br><br>Our waiter was super friendly and nice. I have dined at The Cheesecake Factory many times, so I knew already what I wanted. I ordered the lunch portion Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pasta and my husband had breakfast/brunch (yes, they serve breakfast until 2:00pm). <br><br>The food was fine and the waiter was great.
Our hostess, Sherri, was so nice! And did dance party with my girls :-) Food was as expected- it&#39;s consistently good at Cheesecake Factory :-)

We are in Santa Monica Cheesecake Factory now. We got our table at 4:30 pm and at 5 pm they said that they&#39;re gonna bring some bread. At 5:30 we got our breads and after that they brought our food. We complained about this and a manager came to our table, she said she&#39;ll bring sundae for the kids. It&#39;s 6:12 and we are still waiting. The food was average and this super slow service or ignorance made it worse. Even though the manager lady was cute and friendly. Still disappointed...<br>They brought somebody else&#39;s check to us and we paid for it and we realized when it came to sign the slip. Now they went back to fix it. Still stuck in this place and the time is 6:38... it&#39;s been more than 2 hours!!!! They took the whole amount of the check, didn&#39;t do anything for us after all this awfulness!!!

Our service was extremely slow, my silverware still had food in it so I had to ask for clean silverware, my breakfast potatoes had no flavor, and my English muffin was a hockey puck. All the employees were really nice, but we won&#39;t be returning.

Favorite place I&#39;ve ever ate at! Food &amp; desert was beyond delicious &amp; amazing. Sat on the roof of the building with a beautiful view. Phenomenal birthday dinner for myself. Super jealous I don&#39;t have a Cheesecake Factory located by my home!

This is one lunch that really left a sour taste in my mouth. When you have a negative first impression, it&#39;s really hard to work your way back up. It began with the seating arrangement. After waiting for 15 minutes or so, we were told that our table was ready, so we stood up and was told to wait next to the host stand. No one came to get us, and instead we had to wait in standby line of other people waiting who were told their seats were ready, too. There was no reason why we had to give up our waiting seats if we just had to stand for another 5-10 minutes. When we were finally taken, the hostess said we&#39;d be sitting outside. We didn&#39;t particularly want to sit outside because it was rather chilly and breezy that day, but she abrasively told us that if we didn&#39;t take the open seat, we would have to go to the back of the waiting list. We were never asked what seat we preferred, and it would have been nice if we had our choice before it was made for us. The hostess was rude, and put on a real fake, almost pompous attitude. We settled for the outside seat since we didn&#39;t want to wait again, only to find out someone was already sitting there! We ended up having to wait an extra moment while she hunted down another host to find a seat for us! Completely unorganized and unprofessional if you ask me.<br><br>Like I said... a bad first impression. Beyond that, the rest of our experience is what saved this from being a disaster 1-Star of a trip. Our waitress was very kind, the food was delicious, and service was on point. If I go to another Cheesecake Factory, I&#39;m definitely ordering the carbonara again.

Ordered delivery. The food arrived cold and we were short changed on the chips for the spinach dip.  Caesar salad with salmon was ok, but nothing special.  The need to start using grub hub or Uber eats. Door dash is notorious for having drivers do multiple deliveries and food is always cold by time it arrives.

I give zero star if possible. The waitress is kind. Service a little bit slow because of so many visitors and she had to do everything. I got my first med-well ribeye steak after 40 minutes waiting and found it over cooked, it was burnt, tasting bitter. The waitress helped me change. Later I got the second medium one and it was over-dressed, I am tired of arguing and cut the steak into small pieces, my friends tried it and cannot endure the salt on it. I had to wash it in my cup!!!!!!!When we took the order, we told the waitress about reducing the salt on steak, then came a manager told us they didn&#39;t add any salt on the steak. We were so unsatisfied about the explanation. Hope you can improve.

I can&#39;t believe the experience i just had. I&#39;m usually so happy with this franchise especially because they have gluten free options. However, my server was not the best. I understand things are busy on a Saturday night but to constantly screw up is beyond me. I ordered a GF Americana Burger with a side of caesar salad, lemons for my water and a glass of Michelle Sparking wine. I had to ask for lemons 3 times the 4th time I got it from a different server who I pulled over. Finally the meal comes out and I asked for my wine again. Meal came out and the bun looked to good to be true and he brought me fries instead of the salad I requested. I saw a different server who appeared to be more higher up and told her that this isn&#39;t gluten free bun I am highly allergic. She apologized and grabbed the plate to go replace it. At this point I was over the experience and I&#39;ll just leave at that.
Checked in at sunset AMAZING Hostess Sherri set us up with a beach view table on the Promenade! Beautiful view great service an amazing food as always!

Horrible service. We first showed up with a party of 12. The host advised that should be around a 40 min wait, since they did not allow for us to make reservations. It literally took about an hour and a half to be seated, we did not have an option to get up and leave, or else we would have. We sat, took another 30 min before we can order our food, another 30 min to get the food. Our waitress was okay, but only came around the table once for refills. Although we still left a tip. <br><br>Please save your time and money and go elsewhere. There is another cheesecake down the street in Marina Del Rey. Im a fan of cheesecake factory, but this place is trash. I understand they have large amounts of people wanting to eat here, but the Anaheim location had tons of more people and did a way better job in organizing and being more friendly.

Terrible Service. Not very attentive. The waitress also rounded up her tip-- my total was $83 dollars after tip &amp; it posted on my bank account as $85 dollars. I ordered the Steak Diane (medium) &amp; it came well done. When I asked to change it the waitress did it no problem -- but a few minutes later the Manager came &amp; tried to argue that MY steak was actually cooked Medium with a very condescending tone. Ruined my appetite. They did change it out for me (I decided on orange chicken since steak is clearly not their specialty) but I just cannot believe that they tried to tell me , the CUSTOMER, that I was wrong. Just avoid this place.

Food was good- services started off great and then feel apart- the guy disappeared for probably 20 minutes- the tables all around us were talking and wondering were he went- we even asked the manager- which she just got refills- but then thankfully the bus boy found him!!
Very nice and easy place!!! Good dinner and lunch. Can come with a big party. They are always busy, but will serve you and about 15 minutes!!!

I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory like most of the world at some point. However this is the first time I&#39;ve eaten here with the intent to eat healthy...it seemed like a daunting task but I think I may have succeeded.<br><br>After doing research and looking up calorie counts, ingredients, reviews, etc. I opted for the Tuscan Chicken dish on the Skinnylicious menu. I ordered this for take-out and was pleased by the simplicity and ease of the process. I arrived 15 minutes after ordering by phone and my meal was ready and payment was painless. I then ate about 10 minutes after that back at my office.<br><br>The food honestly surprised me. For just under $20 I got a pretty substantial dish of chicken breasts, artichokes, a ton of tomatoes, and asparagus (I substituted the farro for more veggies). The flavor was great, albeit just a little salty. There was some more oil than hoped for too which made me doubt the &#34;under 590 calories&#34; claim of the menu, however. <br><br>That said, if I&#39;m looking to experience some new flavors with a $20 budget and want to be pretty satisfied as far as portion-size goes, Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t a bad option!<br><br>If you&#39;re looking to eat healthy here just make sure to avoid the carb side options (potatoes, rices, etc.) and load up on veggies. I&#39;ll try more of the menu over time perhaps but as shot in the dark I&#39;m pleased!
Our waitress was super nice! Food was good - same as every Cheesecake Factory. Bread came out nice and warm.<br><br>*** 1/21/2017 <br>Incredibly slow service tonight. For no reason that I can see.

I don&#39;t even have the energy to write out why this place sucks balls... all I&#39;m going to say is, if you value being trawlers with respect and getting at least half way decent service then don&#39;t ever, EVER come here. SERIOUSLY. <br><br>If you don&#39;t mind being ignored, feeling invisible and waiting till the next solar eclipse for someone to finally acknowledge you and wait on you (even when it&#39;s not busy) then please by all means give them your money. <br><br>You&#39;ve been warned!

This was the worst Cheesecake Factory experience I have ever had. We just went in for drinks. We made it clear when our server took our order we were here for drinks only. We chose to sit outside. The weather was a little chilly, so they had outdoor heaters on. It was miserably hot because of the heaters. We ordered our drinks, my usual strawberry martini!  My husband ordered for us while I ran to the restroom. It took 15 minutes to get the drinks. This drink is always the same no matter what Cheesecake Factory you visit. Not this one. I noticed the pink wasn&#39;t quite the right shade. It was too light pink. The strawberry on the side was hard and bitter. I guess the ones used to make the drink were the same. I drank it. I mean who wants to throw a drink away. That&#39;s  alcohol abuse. But it wasn&#39;t good.  <br><br>Our server never checked on us after the drinks arrived. It took 20 minutes after we finished our drinks to get our check. The bill was near $30. It wasn&#39;t worth the price or the time. And we weren&#39;t even offered the bread service. <br><br>I would probably give it another try because the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s strawberry martini has never disappointed me until this one. It was the service that was the true let down. The patio wasn&#39;t even busy. There we only 4 other tables being serviced.

I&#39;ve been to this location multiple times being as I work on the promenade, I&#39;ve gone with my family and have never had problems, however every single time I go in with my friends we get HORRIBLE customer service. I don&#39;t know if it&#39;s because We look younger and they think we won&#39;t tip or what but we always get rude waiters. Went in today and our food took 50 minutes to come out. I&#39;m pretty sure she forgot to put in our order because everyone around us (who were older) got their food with no problem. I use to work with food so I do understand that sometimes things happen so I&#39;m not too upset about the food taking long. No big deal. But I do think it is unacceptable that my friends and I don&#39;t get treated with the same respect as everyone else. We tried to address our issue to the manager because this is a constant thing, he was very nice to us but he also sounded like he just wanted us out of there, he cut us off half way and said &#34;you gotta bear with us&#34;...probably won&#39;t be returning to this location any time soon.

First let start off my saying that I love The Cheesecake Factory. But the Santa Monica one is just horrible. The only reason we go here is because we live in Santa Monica, I have to go to Nordstroms for work sometimes, which is next door. I&#39;ve had numerous bad experiences here. I&#39;ve never Yelp&#39;ed about them, ever. But after this last bad experience, I had to. <br>I ordered what I always ordered at the CCF, which is a lunch portion Chinese chicken salad. When it was brought to me the first thing I notice was the size, or how small it was. I never order the bigger portion, so I know what size it should be. Then it was so dry I had to order more dressing. No biggie. I can deal with those two issues. But after a few bites I noticed that there was more red cabbage then lettuce. So I told the waiter who then said he would send the manager over. The manager Alyssa came by and to listen to my concerns. She gave me an excuse that how she thinks it&#39;s the inexperience of the kitchen. (Well isn&#39;t that the managements fault) I believe this particular Cheesecake Factory has been open about five years. It&#39;s not the first month or even first year of being open. I Explain to her how I&#39;ve been going to the Cheesecake Factories since the 70s when there was only one, in Beverly Hills. I also told her that I went to the Grove Cheesecake Factory two days ago and my salad was way bigger and more delicious.  She told me she make sure and talk to the salad &#34;chef&#34;. That was it. She offered me absolutely nothing to make it right. No dessert, no drink, no comp, no half off the salad, nothing. Not that I was looking for a freebie, but come on.  Do something to make it right. I don&#39;t want to heat how you&#39;re going to talk to the salad &#34;chef&#34;. <br>I&#39;m not sure if I will ever go back to my local Cheesecake Factory ever again. <br>Number one, they need to learn how to make food on consistent basis like all the other Cheesecake Factories. When you go to a restaurant you want you meal the same way, every time, that&#39;s why you go there. <br>Number two, this isn&#39;t the first bad dining experience I&#39;ve had here, it&#39;s about the fifth or sixth. <br>Number three, the manager Alyssa needs better customer service and management training skills.

I love Cheesecake Factory but this location really bites. The problem is in the kitchen. We ordered 2 miso salmons and one plate was missing the miso sauce. Our server brought out the miso sauce on the side and it was cold. The rice was really undercooked, almost inedible. One of our salmons was raw in the middle and the manager tried to tell us that&#39;s how it&#39;s supposed to be. No - we get this dish all the time and it&#39;s never like that. They tried bringing us a new salmon and it was a piece of dried out grilled salmon - that&#39;s not what we ordered. Our chicken Madeira was unseasoned. Our steak Diane which we ordered medium, was raw inside. Literally EVERY dish we ordered was not cooked right. Being frequent CF guests, we know how these dishes are supposed to be and clearly this kitchen staff does not know how to cook. We will not be returning to this location.

I have been to a few different cheese cake factory&#39;s, and this one is the first time it&#39;s ok. <br>My daughter requested a grilled cheese. She didn&#39;t want something big. The waiter said we can&#39;t order off the kids menus, asked him why not and didn&#39;t have an answer except that we can&#39;t order off the kids menu. So daughter ordered chicken with the other girls. 5 minutes later, they ran out of the chicken the girls had ordered. That was that cause that was the only gluten free item they wanted. My biggest complaint, if I want a kids menu grilled cheese, then as the customer, you get me one. The cheese cake factory in LA is not a friendly one.

What a great restaurant experience.  From the time we were greeted by the hostess Sherri and seated promptly on the terrace over looking Third Ave Promenade we knew we were in for another great meal at The Cheesecake.  Marco our waiter was attentive and we ordered our favorite: the 1/2Herb roasted chicken.  We devoured the warm bread.  The chicken was delicious as always. No visit to Santa Monica is complete without dinner here.

The waiter was rude and inconsiderate. He did a lot of talking (the table next to me loved it, so &#34;different strokes&#34;, I guess) and not in a good way. He kept sitting down next to my boyfriend and touching my shoulder which made us uncomfortable. Halfway through (after we had already ordered and been waiting for our drinks) he began to tell us and every other table nearby that he was going on his 30 minute break. He told all of us over and over before finally taking the well announced break. He came back towards the end of our meal. We wanted cheesecake but opted out because we couldn&#39;t get out of their fast enough.

I had dinner here Saturday evening and inadvertently left my credit card behind and this is when the nightmare ensues.  I called in at 10:30pm the following night to make arrangements to come by and pick up my card and I&#39;m not exaggerating when I say, the phone rang 20 times before someone answered.  I knew that they were still opened because I had googled their hours and they were not closed for another 30 minutes.  I proceeded to inform the hostess that I left my credit card behind and gave her the necessary information for her to locate my card.  She then put me on hold and again I&#39;m not exaggerating, for 15 minutes!  I decided that she must have forgotten about me and called back in.<br><br>The second time, I let the hostess know that I had called earlier and someone left me on terminal hold.  She then told me she would need to put me on hold yet again.  I had a feeling I would get better results if I drive there and sure enough in the 11 minutes that I was on hold, I was able to drive to the mall, find parking and walk to restaurant.  In fact, when I got to the restaurant I told them that the person that they have on hold was actually me and showed them my cell phone which showed I had been on hold for over 11 minutes.<br><br>I again informed the hostess that I left my credit card and asked to have the names of the managers who were working that night:  Mariana Lopez, Carlos Williams, Arianna Toledo and Wayne Maflin were the managers on duty that evening.  Yup, 4 managers and they still cannot get their act together.  Needless to say by this time, I&#39;ve lost my patience.  Not one manager came out to address me but 10 minutes later, the hostess came out with my credit card.  I did not leave the restaurant until after the place was closing down.  Hence my Yelp review.  <br><br>It is my personal belief that they were again understaffed that night as they had been the night before when I was dining there.  If they weren&#39;t, it wouldn&#39;t have taken 20 rings for someone to pick up the phone.  I would not have been placed on terminal hold twice for a combined total of 25 minutes and it wouldn&#39;t have taken them another 10 minutes to get me my credit card.  <br><br>I have left my credit cards behind at other restaurants and none of them have been this horrific of an ordeal.  I call to tell them I&#39;m coming to pick up my card, by the time I get there it&#39;s waiting for me and I&#39;m in and out in less than 3 minutes.  <br><br>Yes, it&#39;s my fault for leaving my card behind but I&#39;m sure I&#39;m not the first nor will I be the last to leave my card behind.  They seriously need to get their act together because this understaffing is going to severely affect their customer service, their Yelp reviews not to mention their repeated business.  <br><br>Maybe the problem here is they don&#39;t care all that much about the regulars or the repeated business because they can survive on walk-in business from tourists?!?  Well if their reviews are low enough, they will lose some of that business as well.  I intend to post this review on TripAdvisor.  Hopefully someone in their corporate office will read this and care enough to make a difference in customer service.  It all starts at the top...if management sucks, if the restaurant is repeatedly understaffed, the service will suffer.

If you do not want to be humiliated by the employees, do not go there. They will ruin your day. <br><br>I had guests from overseas and I wanted to take them out for dinner. We decided to go to the Cheesecake Factory in Santa Monica on Tuesday at 9 pm. (11/27/2018) We asked the hostess (She said her name is Angie) to seat us on the balcony because we wanted to enjoy the nice LA weather. There were bunch of empty seats but she said there were only two waitresses taking care of balcony and they are occupied. We were not seated there. She walked us inside to seat us. I asked her if we can choose where to sit but she said no. Anyway, once we were seated we were given the menus. We just tried to focus on having a nice time with our guests and forgot about it. However, our waitress never came back. We waited for 20+ minutes. I know this place gets busy sometimes but on that Tuesday night, more than half of the seats were empty. The waiters were just walking around and chatting with each other. We could not get their attention. Then we had to approach the manager and explained to him what was going on. He said &#34;ok I am gonna send someone&#34; without any apology. The waitress came and said &#34;ok, so what do you want?&#34; while giving us an attitude. We decided to leave. She turned her back, walked away and said &#34;ok, bye.&#34;<br><br>If you are building a brand name you should spend some time on your workers&#39; training and teach them customer service. They literally ruined our night and we felt ashamed for our guests. <br><br>Please do not send me any gift cards or free meal cards. I will not accept it. I do not want to spend my money and time where I am not respected.
Went to this location for some desserts and there was a long wait but the hostess Sherry was very welcoming and accommodating by seating us directly, knowing that we had a baby with us.

Sherri &amp; Kayla we&#39;re both so sweet! Kayla was an awesome server, she even accommodated our fries because they came out a little late. This was our first time at this Cheesecake location, definitely coming back soon!!! They made us feel at home

I didn&#39;t have the experience that everyone else seems to be having with the terrible customer service. Although the worker at the welcome desk did not seem friendly or nice. Our waitress was really good. We went around 9:40pm, seated at 10pm. But another reviewer was right, no1 usually comes to a restaurant with avg reviews of less than 3 stars<br><br>Food- It is good but nothing over the top since this is the Cheesecake Factory. I ordered the 30th anniversary cheesecake and chicken and shrimp gumbo. Everyone liked their food except 1 friend ordered a pasta dish that was really bland. Don&#39;t remember the name of it. <br><br>Price- decent restaurant price. Cheesecakes are expensive but it&#39;s like a 1 time order so whatever. I spent 34$ with tax and tip for those ^^^^^<br><br>Customer service- our waitress Chelsea was really nice and attentive and kept refilling our bread and water, got the orders right and was fast. Best part of meal<br><br>Venue- the place looks super nice and upscale. Bathrooms would look the same if they cleaned them often but there was stuff like gum in the sink, full trash can, etc. The utensils seemed old and somewhat not clean but idk if that&#39;s the texture of the metal or calcified food...<br><br>Crowd- it does get crowded and everyone looks well dressed unlike us who just had a roadtrip for 14 hours. Oops

Utter disappointment. <br><br>We went to the new cheesecake location at Santa Monica place a few days ago for a weekday lunch <br><br>We ordered the Luau salad, chicken scampi pasta, sweet corn tamales and a BBQ chicken pizza. This is our go to order, we have ordered this many times before at other cheesecake locations. <br><br>1. The waitress, Rochelle? Michelle? Rachel?, was so soft spoken we couldn&#39;t even hear her name. When we ordered the pasta dish, she asked us to specifically point out the name because it seemed as if we were describing a dish, not ordering one. Aren&#39;t the staff supposed to memorize the menu? <br><br>2. We got the bread, which was warm and tasty like other locations. Then the food came out, after a seemingly longer than usual wait and the waitress took away the rest of our bread. WTF. <br><br>3. The food was not that hot, if anything lukewarm. The salad was anemic. See side by side pic for the luau salad we had at the Newport Beach location in November vs the one we had in Santa Monica. Where is the salad part? Seriously it was all wonton skin. And no, it&#39;s not the lunch version because there is no lunch version on the menu. <br><br>4. The pasta. We cut into the chicken and it was raw. Not pink verging on cooked, but RAW. So we flagged the waitress and she had them fire a new one. In the meantime we finished the rest of our food, another waitress tried taking our plates, even though we were still waiting for the pasta. Finally what it seemed like the manager in red came over with a new pasta, asking us to see if the pasta is to our liking. It&#39;s not that we were picky about the taste, we were bothered by the fact that it was raw and risks bearing disease. Anyway yes, the chicken was finally cooked. But now there was an issue with the taste of the pasta. The sauce was not cooked all the way through, just tasted like cream and raw garlic. At least with the first pasta, the sauce was an actual scampi. Midway through this pasta, another waiter brought out another chicken scampi dish, even though we already got one. <br><br>5. We were so sick of this place that we didn&#39;t even order a cheesecake. We thought we would at least get comped the pasta dish because we had to wait again for another one that was subpar to begin with. But nope. We were &#34;comped&#34; for the second pasta dish that was brought out by mistake. <br><br>All in all, throughly disappointing. Terrible representation of the brand, and of the locale. Luckily tourists will surely let it thrive. Next time you are at the promenade go to any other place to eat, seriously.

I don&#39;t understand all these low ratings. <br><br>Came here several times for lunch and it&#39;s been a great experience. <br><br>Ordered steak medallions lunch special but asked for angel hair pasta and sauce on the side. The food came out just the way I ordered it and it tasted great <br><br>Got an ice tea and free warm yummy bread. <br><br>Staff was great and when I asked for anything like lemon slices. I got them. <br><br>I definitely plan to come back and to bring my friends. <br><br>Location clean. <br>Staff super friendly<br>Food was great
