They made us wait double the amount of time they had promised and when we complained the manager came over to tell us that we didn&#39;t need to eat there. So after waiting all that time we were insulted as well. No thanks, never bothering to go ever again
The food it&#39;s always good I order the chicken Parmesan cheese pizza style and dulce de leche cheesecake was really good and the service is excellent.

Absolute horrible service...forgot we were waiting for a table, so to make up for that they stuck us outside. It was freezing outside and our table was the only table without a working heater above it. Took forever to get the bread sticks, and when we finally ordered food they forgot my friends soup and salad. It was brought to him with his entire meal and got his meal after everyone else had finished there&#39;s. Pretty sure we all were sick this morning too. Avoid at all costs. Spend your money elsewhere. Food was average at best under the guise of &#34;gourmet&#34;.

first time dining at this particular location.  came fairly early for lunch on a Saturday; place was fairly empty and we were seated right away.  our server was good, no complaints there.  our table, however, was filthy.  it was obviously not wiped down as i could see the sheen of grease all over both tables.  my wife and i wiped it down ourselves.  the silverware were also quite dirty with old bits of food stuck to them.  since my kids didn&#39;t need their forks (they got chicken tenders and fries) my wife and i sourced the cleanest looking silverware to use and put the dirty one&#39;s aside.  <br><br>then the food.  wife and kids&#39; meals were fine.  my poke dish with rice, however, was extremely anemic in the tuna department.  super tiny mini pieces of fish, hardly any shiitake mushroom, and just mostly rice and fried onion strings on top for $15.  not all Cheesecake dishes are created equally, i suppose.  not sure if we&#39;ll be back to this location again.

We came about a year ago were told the wait would be 25 mins and ended up waiting for almost 40 mins. There was no seating in the back host area coming from the elevator off of Broadway. When we were finally being seated someone was sitting at our table so we had to wait yet again to get another table. When we were finally seated our waiter was tony. He took forever to come to our table to take our drink order. They were out of bread so we got it pretty late since they had to make more. I got the pizza which wasn&#39;t very good. we paid for our bill with friends half cash and half card and we left. Turns out our waiter kept the cash and charged our full amount on the card. unbelievable! Took about a week for the manger to fix the issue.

the service was great, i have to mention that this review is nothing to do with service but more the quality of the food. we spent nearly $100 on our meal and it was just, subpar. we ordered the &#34;chicken and biscuits&#34; and instead we received a watery, unsightly, mushy concoction of veggies and chicken. the biscuits were hard and the sauce was runny and bland. we also ordered the &#34;pasta da vinci&#34; and we received the same quality compared to the other entree. the sauce was runny and flavorless and the bits of chicken were burnt, all i could taste was that distinct burnt flavor. we ordered a lemonade and that was just sickly sweet. it was clearly obvious that the kitchen was prepared to go home for the evening and that showed in the quality of the food that evening. the only thing they managed to get right were the &#34;avocado eggrolls&#34; and &#34;dynamite shrimp&#34;.

Why is the service always consistently so bad here??  I forget until I get seated. Waited in a booth for 10 mins until I had to flag someone down only to find out we&#39;re seated in a section with NO waiter. WTF. Wasn&#39;t offered any bread either. I don&#39;t know how this place stays in business. Pretty pathetic.  NOT coming back

Update- 7/22 had a terrible experience and no reply from website feedback form. Will never return.<br><br>The waiter was nice. Food was not up to standards. They cut my grilled cheese sandwich in to 8 strips. Then gave me one quarter the normal amount of fries in a little tin cup.<br><br>Big let down.<br><br>Edit: I got a few comments saying it was the kids grilled cheese. I did not order the kids grilled cheese and was not charged for a kids grilled cheese. I was charged full price. I got a message from the cook saying it looked like I had gotten a kids grilled cheese and next time he would make it right. I still don&#39;t like the fact  that 2 years or so ago they started putting french fries in a cup and serving you half as many on all the meals. I&#39;m hoping that next time I&#39;m able to get my fries on a plate and get a proper amount.

When you order an appetizer and you wait for it 45 minutes , while the waitress comes and tell you that your order will be ready in couple minutes , but 45 minutes later he tells you that they run out ! After we had to wait 20 more minutes on top of the 45 minutes , to get the blend shrimp scampi with over cooked shrimps ! <br>We got there at 5:10 pm , it wasn&#39;t even lunch or diner rush ! <br>The worst part is that my son a 2 years old had to wait too , but thanks god i had snacks for him , he just got full on snacks before we got the food ! <br>Waist of time and money !

I went to the counter to get a couple of slices of cheesecake and Michelle was awesome. She help me and got me out the door and literally like five minutes. She was smiling and in a good mood and made me feel good about being such a fat ass.

Had an average experience. Was seating right away and had the waiter come to take our drinks. We placed our orders while asking he waitress for recommendations. She had told me that the chicken madeira was the same thing as the chicken marsala just without pasta. I ordered it as thats exactly what I wanted. However when it came out I noticed the chicken madeira has cheese all over it (not great for someone who doesnt eat dairy) so I had to ask for it to be remade. The waitress did apologize for not mentioning that however the dinner experience was ruined as I had to wait another 15 minutes for it to be made while my boyfriend&#39;s food got cold because he didnt want to eat without me. 3 stars simply for the food quality, would have been more if it wasnt for the mixup.
Shawn H, Sheri W, Jose Dubon and Marco, were unbelievable awesome!!!! They made our experience just great.  Best server and hostess ever
We loved our time at the Cheesecake Factory tonight. The staff was awesome, especially Jose D., Michael, Sherri and Shawn. The food was great and the experience was amazing! Thank you!!

I have been taking my family to cheesecake for years in the oc. I never have I been to a cheesecake with horrible service.  It&#39;s 11:00 am on Sunday and it&#39;s empty.   It took us 30 mins to order, the waiter kept walking by us and ignored us on multiple occasions.  The table we were seated was dirty and I asked for it to be cleaned, silver was dirty.  Seriously  I am feel sorry for the coporate office.  This place is making you look bad. I spent a hundred bucks for 3 people and we all left out places full.  You guys need to fix this place.  I will never come to this place again.

This eatery is located in the heart of Santa Monica and blocks from the beach. This location is surrounded by shopping stores and offers an excellent view of Santa Monica.<br><br>Upon locating this location, from the street level, one has to take an elevator to get to the actual restaurant.<br><br>Once arriving to the hostess stand, I remained standing waiting to be greeted for about two minutes before any acknowledgement. It felt awkward to be in a full eating establishment and no one there to greet you at the hostess stand.<br><br>After being seated, about six minutes later, a male came by the table and dropped off silverware. He actually placed it onto the table with no napkin or paper to protect silverware from substances on the table. That was upsetting to see and disgusting. Request was made later for new silverware. Consideration of germs please! <br><br>The server arrived and food was ordered.<br>The server seemed like she wasn&#39;t excited to be working. No facial expression of excitement. <br><br>The food arrived promptly after placing the order. However, there were no drinks with the food or straw therefore, had to wait for drinks and straw to arrive before being able to eat. Personal preference, but staff for the most part seemed rushed and unhappy. <br><br>The sandwich ordered was a southwestern as requested. Tasted fresh and the presentation was quality looking.<br>The sandwich was filling. Another person at the table ordered a chicken plate. The chicken was tasty and presentation looked appealing. <br><br>Unfortunately, on this visit, the little things mattered though. Having to wait for the check for 15 minutes after eating was also not appreciated. Training could be considered to benefit sales and constant quality level of service to guests. At this point, there is no reason to rethink of visiting this location. Improvement on their level of service should improve.

You know when a establishment has low reviews, there really is a reason for it. <br><br>Came here around 9 pm and got the veggie burger with no bun and mayo <br>Several times before I noticed that my burger had mayo in it, the server came and asked how we are.. <br>By the time I realized it was super late and my friend had finished her food and the sever didn&#39;t come.<br><br>Finally the server comes BUT he comes to present the desert menu lol. Until I told him about the situation <br><br>Then the manager came n took it off the bill which was nice

I enjoy Cheesecake Factory, but I think this location is subpar. I have visited this location twice, once back in February and once today.<br><br>In February, my friend, husband, and I visited on a busy night. The wait to sit actually wasn&#39;t too bad, but it was a nightmare after that. Our waiter disappeared, we waited for our food for over an hour, several managers came to apologize for the wait. Also had to wait another half hour for the check. We were never comped and it was a bad experience. Food was just okay. 1 star for that experience. <br><br>I thought I would never come back to this location, but I was in the mood for Cheesecake Factory for my birthday today and this was the closest location. Parking is also cheap here too. We went before the lunch rush. We were seated quickly. I ordered my favorite dish (Chicken Di Pana) but this location either doesn&#39;t carry it or the franchise decided to stop serving it. That was disappointing, but I found something else on the menu. Took a while for the drinks. We got our appetizer before the bread. Then waited for a while. Manager apologized for the wait again. I don&#39;t understand why there was a wait because we were there before the restaurant was busy. Food was good, but then had to wait twenty minutes after our meal to get to go boxes and pay the bill. Better service than the previous time, but still 3 stars for this experience.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory has large portions and pretty good food, but the service at this location is subpar and you will end up waiting a long time.

The design of the restaurant is very nice! I guess you can say they have an outdoor rooftop patio along with indoor seating! <br><br>Service here is nice and the food is even better! 5 stars for the Louisiana Chicken Pasta and Chicken Marsala

My wife and I ate here last weekend while visiting the area. <br><br>We sat in open seating because they were very busy since it was a Saturday night. Our food was hot and fresh. <br><br>We had good service and enjoyed our time there. Our food arrived in a timely manner. <br><br>Next time we are in the area, we will return.

Sherri saved the night!!  We were seated outside and she found us seating inside as the weather had turned quite chilly.  She continued to check on us throughout the meal.  Food was good!  But, Sherri made it a 5 for us!!

I&#39;ve been to many of the locations and I&#39;ve never had an experience like tonight. The Santa Monica location offers a terrible customer service , my family and I had to wait forever to get a coffee and even longer to get the food we ordered. I asked to speak to the manager and I was told that she didn&#39;t want to come by, Managers are supposed to help the clientele and make sure that everything goes well but we were ignored. I&#39;m very disappointed and I doubt I will come back.

I had such a bad experience tonight, which is disappointing because I consider Cheesecake Factory my favorite restaurant. <br><br>To start, our party of 2 waited an hour when told it&#39;d be 40 minutes. We noticed people getting seated before us despite getting there after us. I brought it to a hosts attention &amp; he said &#34;oh okay you guys will be seated right away!&#34; Again we wait a while &amp; I walk up to finally complain &amp; they instantly sat us, explaining that we were not found on their seating list &amp; the buzzer was not functioning. It was all black I assume it uncharged.<br><br>We sat, request water, &amp; get it with no straws. Straws are requested &amp; brought. I had to request a bread basket because they weren&#39;t bringing it. Bread comes, no utensils. Food comes, we request Utensils. Utensils come, no napkins. Napkins come, no salt &amp; pepper. I had to ask for EVERYTHING. To make matters worse, we order a salad &amp; it didn&#39;t come with the ingredients listed on the menu. We brought it up to servers attention, &amp; she told us we might be mistaken. She then checked the menu and see&#39;s we were correct. She asks us if we would like the other ingredients on the side. Seriously? You can&#39;t just make it right the first time? Terrible experience. I&#39;d never come back to this location.

HORRIBLE FOOD! HORRIBLE SERVICE! HORRIBLE MANAGEMENT! I&#39;m not sure why this place is even open anymore. Literally every person who works there has a HORRIBLE attitude problem. I just can&#39;t believe the kind of experience I had here. There&#39;s absolutely no excuse for this! Shame on Cheesecake Factory! <br>Let me explain; first off, they have elevators located on the side of the mall for easy access for customers and of course we waited for about 10 minutes and we called the restaurant to see if the elevators were working or not, and of course the hosts&#39; response was &#34;oh it just stopped working 5 minutes ago&#34; ok yeah right. Then we had to ask her how to get into the restaurant because it wasn&#39;t common sense on her end to explain to customers how to get in. <br>2nd, we told the host our name and how many people were in our party. So we waited and waited and waited for them to call our name, and the restaurant was starting to fill up already, but name was never called and then all of a sudden they call out a name similar to ours with a different party amount, when I asked how long is it for our table she said oh we called you. Yeah whatever. They sat us down. And this is where the serious problems began. <br>We ordered our appetizers, which were mediocre, then we ordered our entrees which were beyond horrible. <br>My mother ordered a skinnylicious fresh vegetable salad with chicken and dressing on the side. When the salad came out, it looked disgusting, the salad was only lettuce edamame and nasty pale looking beets. I know what beets look like and I know the different colors they come in, but come on, if the beets don&#39;t look presentable don&#39;t put them on the plate. It&#39;s common sense. Of course we told the waiter JUAN, this is not acceptable and we don&#39;t want this , instead of being understanding and re-making the salad, he decided it was his place to educate me on what beets are and what they look like. No Juan, I&#39;m sorry that&#39;s not the right thing to do. So he left and went to bring a salad again, this time it was whatever. They just added the chicken and added the red beets. Then he gave attitude and I explained to him that that we aren&#39;t trying to be difficult but we just want what we were expecting. Then he just walked away. After 10 minutes, one of the managers decided to walk to our table to ask what was wrong, I&#39;m sorry but you are way to late to try to rectify the situation. We explained the situation but I guess it went over her head because she was clueless. We decided to take our check and just to leave. Then on the way out we decided let&#39;s grab a whole cheesecake to go. We order a strawberry cheesecake but the person taking the order had a horrible attitude problem when I asked if the strawberries were sweet or sour. Obviously I&#39;m asking because I want to know if I want strawberry or plain. Whatever I paid for the cake and waited. After sitting and watching the girl with her bare hands reaching into a container full of strawberries and putting it one by one on my cake, she stuck a strawberry in her mouth and continues to put my cake in the box! OMG I was in utter-shock! I couldn&#39;t believe my eyes. I&#39;m paying $60 for a cheesecake that someone is putting her hands on it after she stuck her fingers in her mouth. As soon as she said my cheesecake is ready, I politely asked her, did you just stick a strawberry in your mouth and touch my cake? Her response was, oh yeah but after! I was flabbergasted! I couldn&#39;t believe it. I responded no you didn&#39;t do it after you did it while you were handling my cake and her response was sorry. Then the gentleman at the counter said oh I&#39;m so sorry I will make you another one and I said no, it&#39;s ok thank you I just want a refund please. So the woman who took my order (the girl with attitude) said no problem and called the manager over to process the refund and when the manager came over she said that we want a refund for the cake because we had an issue and didn&#39;t want it. And I intervened and said, no please explain to your manager why I didn&#39;t want it, she didn&#39;t want to explain to it because she was friends with the strawberry eater, while I was trying to explain to the manager, the girl started yelling at me while the manager was standing there saying &#34;why are you asking me to explain if you&#39;re going to explain doesn&#39;t make sense, blah blah blah&#34; and I said you don&#39;t need to be rude to me, and of course the manager processed the refund and  said sorry and it was unacceptable but whatever. She obviously didn&#39;t really care. I&#39;m just shocked at what kind of people work there! NEVER again ! This place is not worth it! Please take this review into consideration, if you want to be treated like a low class person, then enjoy this Cheesecake Factory, if you don&#39;t, then don&#39;t go here!

Came on a Wednesday evening. I didn&#39;t experience any bad vibes like the rest of the Yelp posts. My server was Emil who was very attentive and always around. He knew the menu inside and out and answered all of our questions well. My appetizers and food for me and my wifewas very good. I had Steak Diane cooked medium just like I asked. I had a good experience here. I&#39;d come back.

I literally come to Cheesecake Factory once a week and order the same meal at first this place was my go to but after this last experience I won&#39;t be spending my 20.40 here anymore I order a the same meal I get all the time. Pasta di Vinci  &amp; the past two time it was not made with love honestly I think this location hires anybody to cook because the chicken was bland &amp; there was barley any sauce on my pasta. I called the next morning to ask for more sauce the gentleman on the phone was nice but however after going up there to get extra sound because my pasta didn&#39;t have any at all (I order angel hair pasta) specifically so I could taste the sauce.  Gave me half of a little counter of sauce didn&#39;t even fill it to the top still my pasta is dry and I had to throw it in the trash waste of my money Never again

Worst service @ SM Place: Employees are totally clueless, like never been a waiter/waitress before and never trained to try now; This was the case on EVERY visit so far since they opened. We keep trying to meet friends there or go before a movie, but its just been a miserable experience each time at THIS location. <br><br>CCF in general has Usually consistently good food for decades, we&#39;ve been to BH, MDR, and Brentwood locations MANY times (+Take out too) over the years, but some new changes to the menu we discovered last year at the SM place location that made us doubt their future (and the frequency and purpose of our continued patronage) like they replaced the beautiful and delicious Luau salad with a really sad substitute, and added a weird &#34;pizza&#34; that tasted like soggy cardboard. <br><br>Hoping the other standby&#39;s stay great. But who knows at this point. <br><br>Definitely not very likely to try THIS particular location ever again. Unless we are desperate and somehow get stuck being forced to go. But even then, we wont be happy about it. Its truly been awful here. Its nothing like the classic (awesome) CCF&#39;s we have known at all*. <br><br>*Totally disappointing version of CCF.

I&#39;m puzzled as to why the reviews are so bad. As an SM local I was happy to see this beautiful new Cheesecake in the city. I was mostly taken aback by its grandeur -- very nice date place, and its huge. Adrian (I think) was our waiter and he was kind. Its tough though, because big location = lots of servers running with their heads cut off because = lots of mouth to feed = you&#39;ll have to wait sometimes. But eating is not just about food, right? If you&#39;re in good company, its really also the conversation. (Ie = if you are starving, likely do not come here, lol, although wait wasnt horrible). They didn&#39;t have my fav sourdough bread at first but Adrian ended up getting it for us. All of our food was great and kept up the Cheesecake standards.

I ordered the Hibachi steak. They were out of mashed potatoes and substituted for Macaroni and cheese that looked like plain pasta. After waiting an hour to be seated and 40 minutes for my food, everything was cold. I expected a quality meal for the price of the food as well as the time I had to wait for the food. However, the food was not even decent. The tempura asparagus was soggy and cold. One of the most disappointing restaurants I have ever been to. 10/10 would NOT recommend.

Well a very disappointing dinner at the cheesecake factory in Santa Monica. We had been here before this week so we got back to repeat the experience. Unfortunately, we might have chosen the wrong night. I had a french country salad. The salad was supposed to consist, besides other ingredients, of goat cheese, candied pecans and vinaigrette. The goat cheese was missing entirely. Pecans I had one and a small fragment. Vinaigrette? Never seen. The salat &#34;tasted&#34; accordingly. I let the waitress know these points. Her comment: too late! Thanks Alisha. Too late for a tip then, too. I doubt that I will get back here again. Most likely, I&#39;ll check if there&#39;s a customer service worth this name at the Cheesecake Factory. We&#39;ll see.

This place deserves no star at all. I took my mom to this place for her birthday on August 23rd lunch time. <br>First I had to wait for the front desk lady to finish talking on her headphone to another worker. It took her some time to notice I was standing right in front of her. <br>After less than 10 minutes I gave her the shaker and she asked me to step aside, a server will ne with me shortly to take me to my table. Normally they print your name and place it on the counter for the servers to pick in order .<br>After 15 minutes I asked her if these papers are un order because I&#39;ve been waiting for 15 minutes and if she can check on my name. She said &#34;they&#39;re supposed to be in order so please wait&#34; . I said ok. <br>Another server came and grabbed 4 papers and only one paper left on the counter. I looked at the name and it said Judy not my name, so I assumed the server has my name. She called all 4 people except my name. <br>I went up to the girl in the front desk and asked her if she printed my name because I dont see it and how come I&#39;ve been waiting over 20 minutes after my shaker vibrated? <br>She looked at me and asked my name and she said &#34; oh I remember you&#34; ... I said good for you,but they domt go based on what you remember, the servers go based on what you print and you have not printed my name yet after 20 minutes. She said sorry well give you a table. Wtf? Seriously? <br>I asked her to write down her name which she denied to do so. Why are scared of giving me your name?<br>I asked to speak to a manger, they someone who was not a manager and in fact was a sever. All he said was yeah the front desk lady is new, but we can give you a table now.  <br>I was more frustrated with his answer, <br>All she has to do is take name and print name. If she cannot do these two simple tasks then she is not trained enough and not ready to be on the floor. <br>The &#34;manager&#39;s&#34; reaction an response was even worse than the front desk girl&#39;s response. <br>I am disappointed to get a service from this place . <br>It&#39;s such a disappointment to have an experience like this and worse it&#39;s how the workers try to handle the situation. When I asked for a manger suddenly the server got promoted to a manager! Wtf? Seriously? <br>A birthday lunch which was supposed to be a memorable time turned out to be a disastrous day. <br>But I ended up going to Nordstrom cafe and I had the best service and best food ever.
Very bad reception. They told us a table will be available in 15 minutes but kept extending our eating time to 50 minutes and still nothing was guaranteed. So we left.

I love Cheesecake Factory and it&#39;s unfortunate that I even had this experience tonight. I totally understand that it&#39;s a Friday night and it gets busy so I usually cut them slack. But tonight was bad. First we order spinach and artichoke dip as an appetizer that our waiter forgot. Then he didn&#39;t even bring us bread. What got me was he gave bread to the people right next to us. I didn&#39;t understand that at all. It took him forever to get me my drink and for a while I thought he would forget that too, but it came eventually. My food took a long time to come out but I expected that since it was so busy. If it weren&#39;t for the fact that I was hungry my boyfriend was ready to just pay for my drink and we were going to leave. Like I said I love cheesecake. When we eventually got our food it was great. I just wish our waiter would have at least made some sort of an effort.

Santa Monica is my probably my favorite CF location. The last few times we&#39;ve enjoyed the same waitress (Dustina?). She was polite and knowledgeable re the vegan menu and even remembered our names from sev weeks ago. Service at this location is above average and we&#39;ll definitely be back.

My go to place whenever I am at Santa Monica Place. My girlfriend love this restaurant compare to the rest of the Cheesecake Factory chain because of the outdoor seating there is heated.<br><br>Well we always order two dishes each time dining here. The two dishes we always get is Pasta Da Vinci and Miso Salmon. Both are our favorite dish and we never get sick of it. We ended the night with an Oreo dream cheesecake.

Excellent location and service! Super crowded night, but only had to wait 5 minutes for a table for two (with my wife). A pager was given to waiting patrons that buzzed when the table was ready.<br><br>Location was excellent. Amazing views when having dinner.<br>Service was great. Refills and anything we asked for was delivered promptly.<br><br>I would definitely come back again!

Regardless of the overall rating - which should have been our clue - we had a really poor swrvice experience last night.  Here in Santa Monica for the weekend celebrating our anniversary.   We ordered, the food came really slow - like 40 mins... and then was wrong.  Waitress apologized, said it was her fault and she would put in the order again and rush it, like 10 mins.  It took 25 more minutes, and it was just a burger,  no fries this time.  I was done eating, waited for my husband to eat his and he felt rushed... then we got bill and she charged us for the burfet that took 1hr 10 mins to get!<br>Topper, when we got wrong food, waitress was more upset she had to throw away burger than us... and no manager ever showed to apologize.   <br>Sadly, our seats would be filled in 20 mins or so by another couple, so do theyreally care?

I had my birthday dinner here and I had a great experience. Party of 10 with kids and a baby. I was nervous about the customer service from reading the reviews, but I had a very attentive waiter who made sure our needs were met and was almost always in view in case we needed something. Thanks!<br><br>I think so long as you&#39;re not in a rush, you&#39;re enjoying the meal conversation, and you&#39;re polite to your wait staff, then you&#39;ll hopefully have a good experience here!
Food tastes fine, makes you feel like shit after. Waitress was nice but service was terrible.

I just came to this restaurant and had the worst experience. My wait to be seated was roughly 20-30 minutes which wasn&#39;t anything to worry over. However I ordered a drink and received the menu to order something for dinner. We waited about 10 more minutes for the server to come back and we were all ready to order. Excited to finally get my order in so we could eat the server pulls out his long list of items that were 86&#39;d for the day due to the restaurant not having a shipment that was due. Everything that we wanted was not available to eat. When we got to the 4th item that was 86&#39;d we gave up. Keep in mind we were still waiting on our cocktails. We then told the server that we might as well go somewhere else to eat. The server left and went to the bar. I noticed the mannerisms of the bartender looked upsetting that we weren&#39;t taking the drinks. All of this could have been avoided if we were just told upfront that there wasn&#39;t everything available on the menu. We  wasted almost an hour of our time to just have to leave empty handed. I also work in the customer service industry and time is so valuable to people. I hope in the future your employees will be more upfront with their guests.

I realize this location is new, so I will happily change my review if I happen to go again and have a better experience. But seeing as this is the second time I&#39;ve gone since they opened, I decided to write a review this time. <br><br>The Restsurant was very busy, as it was a Saturday afternoon, so I&#39;ll give them an extra star for that. But seeing as every person on our table of 8 had something wrong with their order, the kitchen needs to get themselves together. <br><br>I ordered a burger, pretty simple, I figured it was a safe bet. This burger didn&#39;t come with lettuce, so I asked if they could put some on, no problem! (By the way, our server was very nice, my problem was with the kitchen.) So, the burger comes with the choice of a wheat bun, which I chose, but when I got it, 1) no lettuce, and 2) it was on a roll, like they give you in the basket when you sit down. I ignored the roll part but did ask for some lettuce. When I got it, I realized there was only tomatoes and cheese on one half of the &#34;roll&#34; I wouldn&#39;t call it a burger. And the other side just had meat, lettuce and a bun. <br><br>My brother in laws sandwich was missing the sauce, my father in laws salad didn&#39;t come with dressing, and my mother in laws didn&#39;t have the right one. The only meals that came out fine were the kids meal 1/2 pizzas, however it was one pizza that they made together (makes sense), but they didn&#39;t put it on 2 separate plates for the 2 separate kids. <br><br>Overall we were there for almost 2 hours. <br><br>Our family was in town visiting and had never been to Cheesecake Factory.  We had convinced them to come because we&#39;ve had excellent experiences at the one in Marina Del Rey, but they left very disappointed. As did we. <br><br>We live a few blocks away, so I&#39;m sure in time we will try this location again at some point. Hopefully they can get their act together.

We usually trying to stay positive with our reviews, but this time it really was too bad to keep quiet. I would like to share my last night experience with you and let you decide on how many stars this place deserves. Most of it is service related.<br><br>Six of us checked in for dinner last night and we were told that it will take 30 minutes to check in. In about 30 minutes our pager invited us to the restaurant. So far so good.<br><br>We were told to wait to be seated. While we are waiting we can hear &#39;party of 4, party of 4, party of 6, bla bla bla, with different name called. After 15 minutes of waiting we had inquired about OUR table and girls are visibly surprised to see us. 10 more minutes and we are finally at the table.No apologies, just like &#39;ok, here is your table. Only 5 plates? Ok, wait for 15 minutes we will find extra set of utensils for you. Where is it? Ok, we will keep looking, etc&#39;<br><br>We have ordered food, took nearly 40 minutes to get it delivered, we were told that one of our salads (Chinese chicken) was holding order up. Really? Run out of mandarins? Arrived later anyway when we were nearly done<br><br>One of the grilled chicken breasts dishes came raw ( literally uncooked), we asked waiter for reason and THE MANAGER was called.She kept asking us what is wrong with chicken , just refused to admit that there is an issue. I have offered her to have a bite. Then she had asked us if we want replacement, but frankly we were nearly done and not ready for another 45 minutes of waiting.<br><br>Since we had kids with us - we had to finish with cheesecake, and crazy us! - we had asked for coffee. Two of our cappuccino coffees had never showed up along with glass of water we had requested. <br><br>By that time we are done with this place and  had simply asked waiter to just bring the bill and forget the coffee, response was ok, no excuses for losing our order, just &#39;ok&#39;<br><br>Order showed that cheesecake was complimentary, but we had pointed to the waiter that chicken dish was refused and requested it to be removed from our bill. New bill showed chicken removed, but they had now added cheesecake full price!!!!! We had never asked for comp cake, but really, how can you be so cheap??? Added to insult were new rates at parking structure in SM which added $8.50 to our bill as our dinner took over 3 hours to complete ( restaurant conviniently does not validate)<br><br>Such a low level treatment  shows poor management and horrific customer service, along with issues thru out entire restaurant layers in this location, from wait staff and cooks to managers. (And i hope the  dishwashers are exempt.)<br><br>I have a note to corp managers - this is prime spot, don&#39;t lose it because of bad staff selection -  there are many places in Santa Monica to eat, we will definitely skip your joint for now.

I Must Say This was the Best Cheesecake Factory Me and my Family had been too. From the Moment we walked in the Hostess Sherri Greeted us with such Warmth, she had such a Beautiful Smile and Personality !!! the Food was Delicious and the Service was Great as well. . We will be back.and make sure we tell all of our Friends that Cheescake in Santa Monica is the Best !!!  <br>We Thank You and Your Staff <br>The Walker Family

I came here with 4 kids and they were so attentive and kind to us. I was disappointed that they messed up my salad I said no chicken and substituted salmon but they brought chicken. Took a while for them to remake the salad but they were so apologetic and didn&#39;t charge my salad in the bill. They were generous with bread and helpful with ordering. Great customer service despite the mistakes that could happen anywhere!!

Been to a lot of Cheesecake Factories, and have liked them for consistency, broad menu options, and good service. This one is an exception. I live a few blocks away and have been multiple times, but the service is just poor here. Long waits, little follow up, a chore to get a waiters attention. Our entree today completely lacked seasoning/flavor, which I haven&#39;t experienced at this chain before. There are a lot of food options available in this area, would recommend going elsewhere.<br><br>Two stars because the menu has a lot of options.

Wow what happened to the restaurant,  we sat down and waited for 20 minutes nobody came to take our order,  since we waited I noticed that all silverware and plates were extremely greasy and dirty.  Finally a server showed up and I pointed out dirty dishes he apologized and called over the manager.  The manager also apologized and placed  clean silverware on table,  not a napkin or a clean plate but on a dirty table!  Definitely it&#39;s the last time we ever go to cheesecake factory.

I normally love Cheesecake factory. Beautiful location, great outdoor seating and view. The food took around 45 minutes to arrive though and my kids had eaten so much bread they were full by the time the food came. The people behind us were sat 15 min after us and got their food first. Food quality was pretty good but the time thing ruined the whole experience for us.

If you have celiac, crohns, or a gluten intolerance DO NOT GO HERE! The staff do NOT know the difference between dairy free and gluten free. They kept saying my &#34;gluten free&#34; pasta was gluten free because it didn&#39;t have cheese on it. They kept insisting the pasta was gluten free when it wasn&#39;t. I checked the brand that supplies them with gluten free pasta and they don&#39;t even make the type that was served to me. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

We ordered a stuffed cheeseburger with no onions when it came it had onions when we told waiter he asked are you allergic to onions if not just scrap it off. I would not have expected this from a high end restaurant. Also another person in our party got the wrong kind iof salad. Did not expect this kind if bad service

Horrible delivery service via Door Dash. Took 1-1/2 hours and restaurant gave no condiments with my order. I ordered fish and chips! No ketchup, tartar sauce, vinegar, etc. Plus freezing cold.<br>Called restaurant and they blamed everything on delivery service. Never will order online again or go there, manager inadequate and could not even give her name.<br>Don&#39;t go or order from this restaurant!

I can see why this Cheesecake Factory has terrible reviews.<br>I had the worst experience ever at any restaurant EVER.<br>My wife and I arrived here with our 3 year old son.<br>We ordered a burrito and Children menu fries.<br>30 minutes later our food was not here. I noticed the table in back of us that was seated 15 minutes later that ordered a large fries had their fries brought to them. 5 minutes later the waitress Saphire finally brought out our burrito.<br>I asked her what about my 3 years olds fries. &#34;SHE SAID AS YOU CAN SEE I ONLY HAVE 2 HANDS. What a rude, mean, and heartless individual when asked about a 3 years olds food. This is unacceptable!!
It&#39;s a cool place. Its new and the happy hour menu is the best in the city. The service if good but they need work on The art of turning over tables.....

Terrible service. We came in at 4:30 and left at 6:00 omg!! The food took FOREVER. The food was cold and the waiter kept telling us that it would come any minute when it wouldn&#39;t. The manager OBVIOUSLY didn&#39;t care. Won&#39;t come here anymore! It took one hour just for broccoli to come and that was my side order of a whole meal that wasn&#39;t even that good. I can your two times and didn&#39;t enjoy it why do I keep coming I tell myself. Maybe it&#39;s because I&#39;m hungry and this mall only has cheesecake and a food court.

Somewhere in the 3-4 star range is probably the right rating, but I&#39;ll lean towards he generous side with 4. <br><br>The place is huge! The ambiance is nice. The food is good but the service is mediocre. <br><br>We came for brunch and had the Chilaquiles, pancakes, chicken &amp; waffles Benedict, and a breakfast sandwich. Everything we delicious and the pancakes may have been some of the best we&#39;ve ever had. <br><br>The only reason to rate this place lower is because the service is greatly lacking, particularly for a chain that should have the formula down.<br><br>That aside, the food is great, so we&#39;ll be back... hopefully we&#39;ll experience better service next time.

I&#39;m very disappointed at this place. I go here to hang out with my friends and just relax, but last night was different. 3 of my friends decided to go here and eat by the bar. We sat at the round table by the bar waiting for service and not one server greeted our table. We waited for 20 mins and no one came. I was starting to get annoyed and I was also starving. Not cool at all. Finally after 25 mins of waiting a server arrived to drop of 3 cutleries and 4 plates and that was it. THAT WAS IT. No menus were given. No &#34;hello&#34; from a server. THAT WAS IT. Since it is taking too long to get service from the round table we decided to move to the bar counter. There we were greeted immediately. We got our drinks. And finally we got some service and time eat. Now this is the messed up part. Two costumers sat on the same round table my friends were on and They were greeted immediately. IMMEDIATELY. They were given menus as well as complimentary bread. This is ridiculous!! We sat at the same table for 25 minutes and no one greeted us. This is one of the reasons I&#39;m giving this review. <br><br>The second reason is the food. I ordered the fried cauliflower as appetizer and the chicken bellagio as my entree. One of the bartenders offered us some complimentary bread before as well. It&#39;s the timing of the food was upsetting. The complimentary bread arrived 10 minutes later then my chicken bellagio. My appetizer has been forgotten. I had to remind one of the bartenders that my fried cauliflower was missing. So the timing of the was off. I&#39;m already very disappointed with the waiting for service and now the timing of the food. The pasta of my chicken bellagio was dry and not cooked through. The sauce was bland. My chicken was alright. The only food I enjoyed was the fried cauliflower. The flavor was rich and truly makes an impact as an appetizer. <br><br>Overall, I hope this never happens again because I&#39;d like to come back to try there desserts. And plus this is a hang out spot with my friends. I&#39;ll give this place a second chance, but if this happens again. I&#39;m never coming back even though it&#39;s close to my work. I&#39;ll find another hang out spot with better food and service.
Worst Cheesecake Factory. No bread for 30 min then it went to a different table. Greek salad came undressed with no olives. WTHeck!?!?  I&#39;ll never be back here. Writing the corporate office.

This was my first time visiting Santa Monica with my two best friends. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the host, who than asked if we&#39;d rather sit inside or outside, we sat outside, so that we could see the view of the city. Our server Summer, already had a horrible attitude upon &#34;greeting&#34; us. She gave us the whole spiel, introducing herself, and quickly left, no smile, no personality. Throughout the night she payed no attention to us as we watched her continuously talk to other guests. She dropped off our food, and ran away before we could request anything. And when we did request something, she would throw attitude our way. Requesting straws, lemons, and ranch, seemed like the most annoying task to her, practically throwing it at us or on our table. What really was the last straw for me was when we paid for our meal. We split our ticket to where I was paying with cash while my friend was paying with card. She had to go up front and get change for me, we waited for another 10 minutes, just for my change while we watched her once again go around talking to every other guest but  us. Once she finally got to our table to give me the money, she said nothing and threw the money into my hand, no &#34;thank you have a good night&#34;, no &#34;I hope you enjoyed your meal&#34;. Now being a server myself I understand multitasking and taking care of other tables, however she was incredibly rude from the start, and followed through with the entire visit. This was the worst service I&#39;ve ever received. And Cheesecake Factory already has a bad taste in my mouth because of the impolite, unbothered service from past visits, not just in Santa Monica, however this was by far the worst. We left paying our bill, without leaving a tip. Servers automatically assume that because we&#39;re young (20 y/o), we&#39;re not gonna leave a tip because we &#34;don&#39;t have the money to do so&#34; on the other hand I like to take pride in my tipping for excellent service, because it is a hard job. If it wasn&#39;t for the lack of attention, rude interactions, and over all lack of respect, I would&#39;ve been completely satisfied with my meal and service, unfortunately that wasn&#39;t the case, and this should be looked into.

Don&#39;t know why this Cheesecake Factory has 3 1/2 stars. It seems a bit low to me. I come here about every 3 months or so. I always received good service and good food. There&#39;s usually not a long wait but then again I get the early birds special around 5:30pm or so. I don&#39;t really get anything else besides the Louisiana chicken pasta and fries. I think Cheesecake Factory has one of the best fries. Today, the chicken pasta looks different. Different is good. It came with fried chicken cutlet stacked mile high. In the past, I think it only comes with 2 pieces of chicken steak instead of 5. It looked pretty and impressive. I loved my experience here today. Cheesecake Factory is consistent everytime. Never had a bad meal and hope never will.

Hate to write a bad review about Cheesecake Factory since it is one of my favorite restaurants but unfortunately the one in Santa Monica is by far the worse ones I have eaten at. The customer service was absolutely terrible, very rude and unprofessional. Will not be eating here again.

Our food took so long to come out we had to take it to go. <br><br>The drinks we ordered were disgusting because the bar tender was to busy to make them correctly. <br><br>The food was in fact awful. <br>The fried cheese was not cooked all the way. The calimari smelled like fish and gave us food poisoning. <br><br>They were on a 40 minute wait. I couldn&#39;t find a manager anywhere.<br><br>Wasted a night out and about $100<br>Disappointed

First time ever going to the Cheesecake Factory! The service was good and the food was delicious and we can&#39;t leave the cheesecake factory without getting cheesecake, which was delicious also. I would love to go back soon.

Ate here twice, once for happy hour and the other for lunch. <br><br>Pros <br>Clean <br>Friendly staff <br>Good menu choices <br>TV in bar playing sports <br>Located in the mall <br>90 mins free parking in parking garage attached <br>Food <br><br>Cons <br>Busy <br>Slow service

The food is really good as always, and I really love the paste here, but I got a horrible service for my first time in Santa Monica Store. Firstly We wait a long time for order. Secondly we got the starter bread when we almost finish the main dish. How can it happen in a high end restaurant? Thirdly, I order a dessert but the the server bring the bill to us before the dessert, I feel really bad on this , I cant understand how can it happen in a famous restaurant . Lastly, our cup is empty but no one try to refill the water. The service such as the 1 star restaurant in China town. And the service is no sequence, main dish come early then starter??? the bill come early then the dessert?? The Cheesecake Factory in pasadena is much better on the service.
Their cheesecakes are the best ! Got the banana one which I love ! <br>Food is alright buy always comes in pretty big portions .

The food, table service, and atmosphere deserve 5 stars. The hostess counter deserves 2 stars. We arrived and checked in and received a pager and was told it was a 20 minute wait which was great for a busy Sunday night. 20 minutes later our table was ready. It took another ten minutes to get any of the host to acknowledge us trying to tell them our pager had gone off. It was as if we were invisible. Finally we were seated and had a wonderful waitress and great dinner. Please address the chaos at the front and everyone will have a much more enjoyable experience.
Been several times as a local to Santa Monica. Bad service, rude employees, always busy. Food is great but this location is not to my liking.

Worst customer service EVER. It takes 3 people (take out section) to get ONE order ready. Asked to speak to manager and I doubt they informed him or her I wanted to speak to them. Mind u.....its a DAMN TAKE OUT ORDER

Why Yelp dose not have a 0 stars? That place deserved! We wait outside about 40 min. And group of people went follow the lady , who gave tables to everybody.And then next step - waiter. But , for everybody else .Except my self and my wife. After 30 min. some young waiter ask - Any one take your orders already? Answer -Nope! He got our orders and gone. Food arrived after another 30-40 min. What kind of service it that? Such a mess.<br>Never again, i will tell everyone about . Shame on you!

Opening day! <br><br>Place looks like every other location, nice sized and same decor. Perfect for the Santa Monica Place. Definitely what it&#39;s been missing since every other establishment has closed down. <br><br>Sat at the bar and was instantly greeted by Andrea. I had my usual, BBQ Chicken salad, and glass of Pino Grigio (happy hour can never steer you wrong!) <br><br>Awesome and quick service. Food tasted as it should. Andrea was a pleasure to talk to. I had a perfect spot right in front of the TV to watch NBA opening day games, so I can&#39;t complain. <br><br>You would never know this was their first day to the public. Will definitely be back again.
The hostess Teresa, is amazing and so full of energy. Great smile and greeted my friends and I with so much enthusiasm. We came here for a friends birthday and Teresa made it special.

Azaria was our server today! She was so kind hearted and sweet! As a server, I really appreciated her service to us. She was very knowledgeable too! Especially with the bread!!! I&#39;ve ALWAYS called the honey oat wheat bread(I think I got it right) rye!!! She&#39;s the first one if ALL the cheesecakes to tell me what it&#39;s actually called! So now I know!!! She always had a smile. She&#39;s definitely someone special! She&#39;s a rare find and quite genuine too! Thank you for just being you today! You&#39;re being made my day! The food wasn&#39;t all that great on my end even though my friend&#39;s was pretty good! But Az&#39;s hospitality made all the difference in the whole experience

Honestly, I&#39;m surprised that such a large scale restaurant can even function at all.<br><br>I came here two days in a row (Yes, I am now obese). I was first served by Sean as well as another server who was female. The next night, I was served by Sean again! He was super supppper courteous and attended to our every need before being called by us. <br><br>Granted, I came on a Friday and Saturday night, so the food took a little bit before coming to us. I also happened to witness a disappointed customer demanding attention my first night here with my mans and she was dealt with quickly through a server, then by the manager.<br><br>It&#39;s a nice restaurant with a beautiful setting and environment (beach, helloooooo). I&#39;d definitely visit again!<br><br>Sean&#39;s a legit waiter fams.
Adriana the manager is a dumb bitch. Avoid this place like the plague. Awful customer service, horrible management!

We had great time there.<br>We had crispy shrimp and small salad for starter.<br>The shrimp was crispy but a bit oily.<br>We had a steak with mushroom sauce and mashed potato and it was really good.<br>We had also a hazelnut cheesecake and it was a blast!<br>At the end we waited for 30 minutes for our check to be provided just because apparently it was lost or mistaken!

My friends and I came here to celebrate my friend&#39;s 19th birthday. Although we came in pretty late at night, we were welcomed with utmost generosity and care. Our server, Giana, was the sweetest lady ever. She made my friend&#39;s birthday more special and memorable. The food was amazing as usual, the people were super genuine, and we were super happy that we were able to celebrate here.
Disgusted by the way my food was given to me for take out. I have never been to a Cheesecake Factory with such poor service. Unbelievable!! I attached a photo.

Pretty sure this was the worse service from Cheesecake Factory . The manager came by stating the food will be out. It took 45 minutes for the food to come out . Very bad service!!!! Never come here if you want service. The manager is so horrible

I came here for a work lunch with a group of five other women. I&#39;m not a huge CF fan simply bc there&#39;s always a wait at the locations I go to and the menu is overwhelming. <br><br>Thankfully there wasn&#39;t a wait since it was Monday at 12:30 but the menu was still overwhelming lol. <br><br>The buffalo blasts are a go-to for me and once again they didn&#39;t disappoint. The only part I hate is that there&#39;s so much &#34;crust&#34; and very little chicken. <br><br>Everyone at my table asked for some type of substitution and the waitress accommodated everyone which I thought was pretty freaking awesome. But then again it is Santa Monica aka land of &#34;I don&#39;t do [insert whatever food trend here]&#34;.<br><br>It did tale a little while for all the food to come out but everyone was satisfied with their meal with not one complaint. So bravo CF for a solid experience.

Went to get 2 pieces of Cheesecake in the afternoon on NYE, insteaed of paying $16, Cheesecake Factory deducted $100.00 and told me that &#34;they are sorry this happened to me&#34;, and that I should follow up in 10 days from now to see if I got my money back. Did definitely expected a quicker and more professional handling of this situation from such a &#34;big&#34; company.

This by far has been one of the best Cheesecake Factories that I have been to! The lighting is perfect and everything is clean. The food was nice and served hot! The best part though was the impeccable service given by our waiter, Freddie! He was very attentive and friendly! I will definitely return and ask to sit in his section!

Freddie was the best waiter and showed legendary service!!!  He was very attentive and showed exemplary service.  I frequently go to Cheesecake Factory but due to him I will frequent this location if he is working.

Had dinner here last night with a group of friends. Not only was the food good as always, the service was excellent as well. I ordered off of the &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu and i was really happy to see some lower calorie options. The two hostesses, Teresa and Mariah, were incredibly friendly, accommodating, and patient. They made the overall experience so much better. It&#39;s so mice to see people doing their job well.

Huge and multiple  patios, yet they don&#39;t allow dogs (unless service dogs) outside. I am not one to lie about my dog being one. Not to mention they are located in one of the most dog friendly cities and locations. Sooo bogus. And to boot the woman in the front was very rude about it. It&#39;s ok, bc Nordstrom&#39;s cafe was more than accommodating and the food was amazing!!!

Overall, horrible. My friends and I came in on a Sunday, so we were expecting a wait but we were told the wait for 8 would be 2.5 hours, so we decided to split up into two groups of 4 for a shorter wait. I was with the first group that walked to the table and passed a 6 person table in the same section that was open. I asked if we could sit there with our group and he said it was for another group so I didn&#39;t insist. <br>Anyways, it turns out they sit our other half of friends at that 6 person table and they threw a HUGE fit over us joining them and adding two extra chairs on the side. Besides, we had given up a prime booth but just wanted to sit all together. <br>After the horrible seating arrangement and the inappropriate hostess, our waiter was okay. <br>Service from wait staff: 3/5<br>We didn&#39;t have all our silverware, he didn&#39;t come by as often as the other tables since they had bread delivered more often. After our waiter went home, Cristine finished taking care of us and she was very patient and sweet.<br>Food: 2/5<br>I order the same dish every time I come to cheesecake and here it was pretty bad. My noodles were dry and all clumped together and the pasta carbonara didn&#39;t have any sauce. But obviously the cheesecake is always perfect, which is the only reason I deal with the awful service and mediocre food.
So disappointed in this location. Terrible service, rude customer service and filthy bathrooms.

I tried their shrimp tacos, the taste was good! However, the tortillas were not fresh and the tacos would break easily. The staff was ok, a little too much I&#39;d say! I didn&#39;t hate this place it&#39;s just ok

I love the Cheesecake Factory. Just not this one. It seems that at this location the only thing they can get right is the cheesecake. Everything else like SERVICE is non existent. I waited 10 minutes for my server to show up. Once my cheesecake and coffee was served, service ended there. No coffee refill no nothing. I eventually had to flag my waitress down just to get my check.

Our server literally left and we waited over an hour for food, never got our check I had to get up and ask someone for my  check because thwre was absolutely no one coming around. Awful customer service will never be back. I&#39;ve never tipped 0$ before but this was a first.

The food was super good but The customer service made me feel a bit disappointed. I like salt caramel cheesecake. It was so nice. I think they should find more server to take care of customer. The rest is already good.!
It was a really nice place to eat and enjoy. The wait time was about 3-5 minutes and food came fast as well. Great service overall. The food was good and their mashed potatoes are amazing!!!
My favorite location... they don&#39;t make me wait too long, even if they do, it&#39;s worth it because the food is amazing. Highly recommend their Mac &amp; Cheese Bites!!!

Just want to thank our server Alexander for his excellent customer service, his recommendations and attentiveness last night.<br><br>As always the Chicken Costoletta was delicious and the Chicken Bellagio with fresh baby arugula and grated parmesan cheese was full of flavor.

Jake Stam is AMAZING.  He is so friendly and outgoing.  He is awesome at what he does and is the reason we will come back again and again.  We appreciate you!   Thank you!  The food is amazing too!   Love the Chicken Madeira.

We came here on Sunday we came to Cheesecake Factory  and we had to wait only 2 minutes our waitresses she was excellent and the food excellent my husband love the food so do I he said that this is the best Cheesecake Factory I haven&#39;t been and I agreed like always
Great service, and Great food our server name was Kyshon he was one of a kind. He was polite and had amazing energy. Best service i have had in years..

i&#39;d like to update my review to reflect my latest experience. i was in the area so i decided to give the cheesecake factory another shot. the service was good (even though the hostess on the outside patio had an &#34;i dont wanna be here&#34; vibe), the food was good and came out pretty quickly. i&#39;ll definitely be back whenever im in the area and need my cheesecake fix.

I love the Cheesecake Factory, but I have been at the Santa Monica location 3 time, twice I have been disappointed both times. The Service is horrible, the food quality and quantity is the worst. My advice is go to another location, you will save yourself the headache!!!!

Great service, great food, squeaky clean bathrooms = 5 stars from me.<br><br>My cousin and I ordered the Lemon Garlic Shrimp Pasta and it&#39;s amazing as always! My dad ordered a salad; he asked for the salad dressing on the side and came out like so. So thank you for doing that! Many restaurants fail to complete this simple favor. <br><br>We ate on the patio and the ambience is really nice! Scenery of the promenade was very relaxing and it was sunny and people having good conversation and music was nice too. Just happy vibes everywhere.<br><br>I will definitely be back! Perfect for a date. :))

You now have two veggie burger patties...AND THEY BOTH HAVE WHEAT IN THEM. It boggles the mind how a restaurant that has a veritable book for a menu doesn&#39;t have more options for gluten free vegetarians. <br><br>Everyone else that wants a gluten free burger gets the option of ordering a gluten free bun because chicken, beef and turkey patties aren&#39;t made with wheat. No so for the vegetarian despite there being two veg patties offered. Surreal.<br><br>Heard of the Beyond Meat patty? I suggest you familiarize yourself with it since you can&#39;t create an in house recipe without wheat.<br> <br>Screw you gluten free vegetarians.
Good food, but terrible service. If you like the food but want to be ignored and wait 30 minutes to get your check by the HOSTESS!!! Then this is the place to go.

If you want to NOT enjoy your meal and have a terrible customer service experience of the worst variety, go here. Negative stars if the option were available, so leaving one star for the kind host and server (even though she got our order wrong). Everyone knows you don&#39;t go to Cheesecake Factory for Michelin quality food. The business at this location on Santa Monica Place rooftop lately seems to survive on one-time tourists. Have been to multiple locations of Cheesecake and even have been to this particular location for happy hour in the past. This was my WORST experience at a Cheesecake Factory and possibly at any restaurant so far. Doubt I&#39;ll ever walk into any Cheesecake Factory anywhere ever again due to this. Not worth it.<br><br>Brought a service dog and was seated outdoors. Ordered our dinner for two and a beer. Ten minutes into the experience, a man from the restaurant came by to tell us the dog must be kept under the table at all times. We have been to numerous restaurants with our dog but had never been told that before. However, I took his word, and we further shortened the leash. Never once did our dog bark, run to other tables, or harass other customers. She did not fit entirely under the table due to her size and table leg in the way, but she remained quiet and near our laps. We were served our meals and discovered one dish was not the one we had ordered. So we notified the server and upon being told that it would take another ten minutes, we decided to cancel the dish. We weren&#39;t rude about their incompetence; simply decided to cancel. I ate as quickly as possible because I was getting the vibe our dog was not as welcome as we initially thought, when close to the end of my meal, the restaurant manager (did not get a chance to catch her name) came to us to recite her interpretation of the law about service animals at restaurants. My mother had given our dog a piece of breadcrumb under the table (because that was where the dog remained), and if she saw this happening just one more time, she would report us to the Department of Health Services. Was she joking! I was so flabbergasted, I wanted to regurgitate my food. We immediately paid the bill and left leaving two thirds of my bottled beer untouched.<br><br>If they want to offend customers, bully them with absurdly petty claims, treat them like criminals for giving their own dog a morsel of bread (not having offered any water for the dog as most other restaurants kindly do), and continue to receive majority negative reviews from Yelpers, please do continue with current poor management and awful customer service approach.   And the manager had the worst attitude of all...seems to resonate in other reviews. Great hiring decision, guys. Good luck with your two star (soon to be one star based on their recent and not so recent review trend) rating.

This review is for the manager - we are sitting at the bar watching this girl who by the way is AMAZING yet the &#34;boss&#34; is giving her shit. YOU sir made our dinner experience on 7/1/2017  very uncomfortable. Get off her ass already!!
My hostess was very nice and warming butttttt the food was cold and I don&#39;t know but I&#39;m never coming back eowwww

Theres The Cheesecake factory, and then there are Cheesecake Factorys. Ive tried this spot in Santa Monica a few times and everytime I do,I regret giving it a chance.. every single time. <br>Waited about an hr between our server finding some time on his chaotic run ( cant blame him) and receiving our simple chicken rings and fries plate.. 1 hour! Clearly a screw up, at least the manager came and apologized.. but our night out with the now impatient kiddos had gone down the tube. <br>In all honesty, for the money spent, not really worth it.. Id probably make the effort out to Marina del Rey location

Our waiter Oscar was awesome.  Fan of the Factory already, but my waiter was on point.  Kind, respectful and made an honest mistake and misheard me on my order, but quickly fixed it and truly cared about my experience.  If you come here, ask for Oscar and get 10 star service.  I could go on all day, but you get the point.  Be kind to people and experience the universe giving it back with people like Oscar.  Thank you Oscar!  The food is always good here, I recommend the Chicken Madeira.

Went in, and immediately noticed ALL of our silverware was dirty. And not like water spots dirty their was dry food all over the spoons and forks. When our food finally arrived my bfs pasta had hair in it. Just a terrible experience honestly
Amazing food!!! Amazing service!!! Definitely recommend!!! Here&#39;s me and Sherri!! Sherri was so fun to talk to and extremely out going!!!

Came in sat down with friends, said they were going to attend us in a couple of minutes and they took over 20 minutes. We came in around 10:50 &amp; left at 11:07. Not saying the food is bad but the service could be better.

Been coming here 3x in a row I will seat by the Bar as always I will observe the employees, Ashley is exceptional I like her style, on point, smiley and foood in remembering people. She will turn your night into a good night she&#39;s very good at her job .by the way the Bbq pork belly slider is to die for. Omg ... the texture and sauce oh wow. Salute to the chefs

Only stopped in for cheese cake and a drink. We sat at the bar. It was around 3 pm on a Saturday and there was a huge wait outside. The bar tenders were friendly and quick. Cheese cake of course was delicious. I would highly recommend going but I&#39;m not sure it&#39;s worth the wait since there are so many other great restaurants nearby.
this place is trash and has terrible customer service! waiting for my corporate email to respond back to me.

Pam the waitress is very kind and I liked her service. she was very pleasant and extremely nice with such a wonderful personality! I will definitely be going back because of also the delicious food they have.

I love Cheesecake Factory.  This was my first time at this location.  And I was very very pleased. Our Food was just right we had no complaints. The service was amazing.  Our waitress was very &#34;attentive &#34; to all our needs. Brittnee&#39;s customer service skills did not go unnoticed..We would definitely come back &amp; suggest her again. Thanks Cheesecake Factory

in any other place with such huge turn around, you&#39;d find at least one or 2  employees exhausted and in bad mood. I have been to Cheesecake Factory at Santa Monica Place several times. First of all, you get seated in 20-25 minutes in the busiest day! I know, I have been there. 2nd, you get a server saying hello with a smile in minutes. I have never found server or hostess who did not smile or had an attitude. And food is always good and cooked perfectly. This is my most favorite Cheesecake factory.
i love this place, i guess i got lucky with my timing because i didn&#39;t have any waiting issues at all, service was quick and delicious food!

I&#39;ll never understand the plain Santa Monica dining scene...everyone complains about the decent spots but the inedible places are 4.5 star-worthy...cheesecake factory is a chain restaurant people and affordable eateries are scarce in Santa Monica (which has an endless assortment of mediocre-at-best dining options). Out of about a dozen Cheesecake Factory locations I have been to over the years, the Santa Monica location is by far the best. Extraordinarily cozy on the inside and a truly superb outdoor patio for those warm weather-friendly outings. Portions are big enough to share (louisiana chicken pasta) and split costs, parking is plenty at the free nearby public parking structures, the cheesecake is great especially if you have a major sweet tooth as are the cocktail selections (flying gorilla and georgia peach). Give &#39;em a break, yuppy Santa Monica Yelpers.
Friendly waiters but the time it takes to get your order was a bit to long for a cheesecake factory.

Walked in tonight with my girl and the wait to sit inside was roughly 5 min. We were expecting to sit outside but the wait was said to be 25-30 min. Our waiter got our drinks. He did not introduce himself so I never got his name. His energy was completely dead. No smile, no enthusiasm. He came back and got our order. The waiting game started... We had to wait 30-40 min for our food to get to us. Our orders were fairly simple and I&#39;ve been to much much busier locations before and I got my food in a much quicker matter. Our waiter failed to ask how our food was or if we needed anything. When our food came the enthusiasm finally shined from a different waiter bringing our food. He was also the one who got me a refill. After some time our original waiter came to inform us he was going on a break and introduced us to a different waiter. Our food was overall pretty decent but our experience was not the best.

Placed a order the beginning of the week for a 7 inch cheesecake. Come to pick it up today and it&#39;s not ready at all. They offer to give it to me now half frozen. They don&#39;t even offer a discount for there screw up. Last time I come to the Santa Monica location!
Worst experience ever, they have messed up all the the dishes didn&#39;t try help spoke with the managemer and the manager had some attitude on her and was disrespectful
Drinks cool, customer service not so much. Waitress was no help at all, with pissed poor attitude.
Very fast service very good food our food was great and we love the Chinese chicken salad &amp; the chicken tostela

It was the worse experience I&#39;ve ever dealt with in Cheesecake. It was my first time there. It took 15 minutes to take drink orders after we sat down. And 30 minutes after our order, the manager has to inform me that they burned my burger, which took another 40 minutes to make. No apologies, no word of anything and they all acted like nothing had happened. And not even &#34;can we bring a salad since you&#39;re waiting,&#34;Terrible management, terrible service. Never again.

The Cheesecake Factory is always a solid chain restaurant when you want giant food portions. I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factories all over the country and all of them are the same. The chocolate bread that they serve you here is the best bread of any restaurant. My favorite item has always been fetuccini with chicken and sun dried tomatoes, but they have taken it off the menu!!<br><br>This night I tried Chicken Chipptle Pasta which was delicious and it was actually a tiny bit spicy. I don&#39;t know why it&#39;s almost imppssible to find spicy food in America? I also tried the grilled coulotte steak. What a mistake, don&#39;t order a steak at a pasta place. Service was fine as always and the wait goes fast as they have so many tables.

This is basically a generic Cheesecake Factory. They were acomidating and made y2k food without mushrooms (I&#39;m allergic) and got it right the first time, which I am always happy about. The food was great, the cheesecake was good and our waitress was very nice. No issues and no long waits for anything

I went here on a busy Saturday afternoon and had the best lunch with my daughter! Her chicken piccata (the lunch portion) was SO TENDER and my truffle honey chicken was SUPERB! Sherri, the hostess for the day, had a line extending all the way to the elevator but as she walked each table to their seat with expert agility she made sure to interact with everybody and it was so welcoming to not just have a hostess drop menus off at the table! She definitely started my lunch off right! The ONLY downside was my server who was pleasant during service time but upon my payment of the check with a $100 bill asked me &#34;how much change do you want back&#34;....uh...all of it?! That was extremely inappropriate and just a sign that she needs to learn more etiquette when serving. I waitressed for over 10 years so I know a restaurant in and out and she was a low point to the lunch. Thank you to the busy chefs who prepared such a wonderful meal with such great flavor and most importantly thank you to Sherri who did her job from A to Z...she was even kind enough to check back upon our table during the lunch! Much appreciated Sherri.

Not comparable to any other Cheesecake Factory. Had really poor customer experience both over phone and in person. Waisted the better part of a Sunday night trying to get a table but time frame kept getting pushed back and really rude treatment by the management team.
Food takes an hour to receive. Ordered a salad waited 1 hr. Didn&#39;t come for years will not be coming ever again.
Bad customer service. Don&#39;t have some of the dishes the offer on menu. Food takes to long to receive.

Cheesecake factory ruined my birthday dinner. They lack professionalism and customer service.<br><br>Our waiter, Gerard, was either inattentive or inexperienced as a server. We ordered appetizers and requested plates to share. Our plates came 20 minutes after the appetizers, and when they arrived, they were dirty and had finger smudges all over them. We let the manager know and he brought over &#34;different&#34; plates, which I&#39;m pretty sure were the same ones we sent back. The food was mediocre.<br><br>The servers need a crash course in food service. From our table we had a view of the cheesecake counter/area. I witnessed a server (African American male with thick red glasses) plate a slice of cheesecake and lick icing off his fingers. Then he proceeded to carry it out to a customer. Gross! If that&#39;s what they do in public, I&#39;d hate to see what they do in the kitchen. The servers all hang around the cheesecake counter and socialize, while you&#39;re waiting 10-15 mins. for a refill, utensils, food, etc. And by the end of the night, the servers walk around the dining area (people are still eating) with slippers on, pants sagging, and their shirts untucked... I&#39;ve never seen this before, ever. As a customer, it just leaves a bad impression. <br><br>I let the manager know about my experience and he just brushed me off. I will be calling corporate and filing a formal complaint.

I am long over due on leaving a yelp review here but as tradition I eat here every year on my birthday. And the service here is always splendid, friendly staff, positive attitudes and superb customer service. My server today Kyshon was very energetic, funny, and on point with his service. Thank you Kyshon.

This was the worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to. We wait 20 minutes for just a server and the staff was on her phone openly. When the server finally came he was rude and blunt. If I could give 0 stars I would, highly do not recommend!!
Great quality food and and very fair price. Definitely one of my favorite places to go for a nice dinner. I went to this place to my three straight birthdays.

The hostess near the elevator yesterday around 12:30 was terrible. Barely greeted us, showed us to a table and lost us a few times while other employees cut us off and she never once bothered to see if we were following. Server was another dud. Just drops 6 drinks in front of one person so we had to pass them around. Food took so long and we ordered appetizers. Manager actually came over to state food was taking long and coming but no comp or anything to apologize. Overall this location is terrible and we will never be back. We love other locations though - just avoid this one.

I don&#39;t think I&#39;ve ever given a business one star before. If there was a way to give them zero star I would. Now you have to first understand the full situation. I was so pregnant about to pop (tired was an understatement) a friend came in town that I haven&#39;t seen in years so I decided to meet her at the food court for our kiddos to play. I wanted to eat healthy and there was no line at the Cheesecake Factory so ignoring the bad review I went in. I mean how bad can take out be? WRONG!<br><br>The lady at the bakery was friendly and nice. My husband wanted something different it was basically buffalo chicken strips with the sauce on the side. I wanted the standard Miso salmon. Mine turned out just right they got him the wrong thing after already missing my friend for 15min waiting I had to go back and tell them it was off. Honest mistake.<br><br>I waited maybe 10-15 just for the manager and he reentered my order this time correctly. Me being pregnant I had to stand (no more room to sit) another 15min waiting. Slightly annoying no big deal. Except when I got the order it was wrong again!!! I didn&#39;t realize it until I got to the food court. Back I go to let them know. I ask for the manager right off who didn&#39;t show up!!!!!! I waited and waited standing again<br><br>The lady who was nice that helped me finally after 15-20 minutes ran back to the kitchen to start a new one acknowledging the kitchen screwed up. Now this is 45min missing out of my quality time with my friend while standing there 9 months pregnant where the manager did not show up to speak to me until I asked for him 3 times!!!! <br><br>I finally got the correct order 1 1/2 hours after placing the initial order. By then hubby famished already ate poor daughters pizza from the food court. I voiced my frustration with the manager when he finally came over. He said he will send me a gift card as an apology and got my address promising to mail it immediately. It never showed up.<br><br>A week later I called for the principle to complain spoke the main store manager said she would look into it and give me a call back for sure. No surprise never heard from them again.
