We were hesitant to have lunch at this location due to the bad reviews, but we didn&#39;t feel like looking around for something else.  I told my husband, &#34;how bad can it be?&#34;<br><br>I&#39;m glad the bad reviews didn&#39;t discourage is from stopping by.  We had a really pleasant lunch.  We sat at the bar because we didn&#39;t want to wait for a table and service was prompt and our waitress, Andrea, was friendly.  Our food arrived at our table in a decent amount of time and everything was great.  Our experience was the same as in any of the other locations.  We had a great meal and great service.

Cheesecake is one of my favorite restaurants and this location is good. The restaurant is located on the third floor and outdoor seating is really nice. The atmosphere of this location is a plus. The staff here is really nice and our waitress was especially nice.

Seriously surprised to see so many negative reviews. We had a great experience yesterday. Our host and server were super friendly and very professional. My hubby had the Jamaican shrimp dish &amp; my son had a kids pizza. I tried both and they were delicious! I had one of my favorites; Pasta DeVinci. I&#39;ll have to admit, something was lacking in the flavoring...but not enough to ruin the dish. The restaurant was clean and NO flies, not one....&amp; we sat outside so I&#39;m sure we would have noticed.

First, kudos to the waiter who didn&#39;t shy away or blink twice at me while nursing my infant openly in his section. He took our order and was helpful with getting our drinks to us quickly. Other than that, this Cheesecake Factory visit was disappointing. First he said they were out of the wheat bread, which is really everyone&#39;s favorite. Eventually he brought some out, but oddly it didn&#39;t taste fresh baked or warm or anything.<br><br>Next I ordered the reason I come to Cheesecake Factory the few times a year I&#39;m in a city that has one, the Chicken Bellagio. When the food came out, he apologized because they were out of Arugula, which is like an important part of what makes the dish. I wish he had told me WHILE placing the order, so I could order something else. I didn&#39;t have the choice to return it as my toddler and I were hungry and nap time was approaching. (They were out of arugula before the lunch hour, which seems like bad planning?)<br><br>The waiter didn&#39;t offer to discount the meal, and I was also charged for the half lemonade/half water my toddler drank, which seems silly for a family restaurant to charge so much for something that costs them virtually nothing. I could have saved a few dollars just letting her share my lemonade, but seems like limiting the spill factor with a smaller cup with top was for their benefit.<br><br>Dissatisfied with this visit, which is disappointing because I rarely get a chance to travel to a big enough city to have a Cheesecake Factory.

Around the neighborhood.  Food is ok but the waiter didn&#39;t pay attention to us for what we need.  We had party of 4.  No napkins on the table at first.   When we asked, he provided small paper napkins like for drinks.   When we emphasis that we never have clothes napkins, he brings 3 napkins in but still missed 1.....<br><br>When he asked the water,  it didn&#39;t come until we asked for 2nd time......

Horrible customer service. They will not allow for reservations of large parties.  Waited hour plus and hostess was very rude. Do not come here unless you have a party of one or two. I understand Saturday&#39;s are busy so why not allow for reservations for large parties?

I know, I know a chain restaurant in a mall....gasp! Still, I like me some factory sometimes.  Everyone knows the food at Cheesecake Factory. (I happen to like it, for the price.) So, my review, however halting, is about this particular location.<br><br>I have no pride/shame for likin the &#39;cake. Don&#39;t hate.<br><br>This review is based on brunch at 11:30 on a Sunday.<br><br>Service: let me get this out of the way, the hostess was great. And then there&#39;s this....I&#39;m doing what I dislike so much on yelp, accurately assessing the service when it&#39;s dreck. Needless to say, not awesomeness. Had to ask 3 times for our server for basic drinks..3 times. Food items were all about 30 mins late. The worse it got, the more scarce our server was. <br><br>Ambiance: great for the mall; we were outside on patio.<br><br>Food: ordered a couple staples for apps aka spinach dip and Southwest egg rolls. Both were as expected. Entrees: brioche breakfast sammy and chilaquiles, and what appeared to be 2 kids meals. Everything was wrong and cold when it arrived. We even had to ask multiple servers for syrup for the kids French toast . Oh, and they just decided to ignore some components of the order. <br><br>Begs the question, why not complain? I don&#39;t want to deal with the crap of correcting a crap experience on a nice Sunday morning. Plus, I didn&#39;t want to ruin the day for a clearly bad staff and manager. Paying it forward, as they say.<br><br>If you&#39;re in Santa Monica, do not go near here. The one in the Marina is better if you insist. There are better places in Santa Monica.

Paulina was the greatest server when I visited Thursday <br><br> night. She was very attentive and refilled our drinks whenever necessary. The food was good but the service is the reason why I&#39;d go back! Her personality was so warming that I felt like I was at home. She is the reason why I&#39;d go back and service like that is dime and a dozen.

Not a fan of this branch, service is slow and even left the menus after food was served. Seems like they forget you once seated. Hope they up there service like the other branches in the valley. Food is the same tasting. Just to tap my drink took too long. Not good, instead of enjoying the experience, were like hunting for our food.

Worse cheesecake factory I&#39;ve been to. Food before drinks and bread Twice dirty silverware,  ordered chicken case salad and chicken wasnt cook all the way. Walked out and 2nd manager tried to make it up by taking longer then the last service I had. No drink waited 10 minutes without her in sight so I walked out. Hostee was soo awesome I wish I had her name but she was African American and spoken such words from checking me in to walking me to my table so I she deserved this star on this or it would of been 0 stars left up to me

Been a few years since we were there and won&#39;t be going back. The food was mediocre at best and the service was sub par to lousy.  <br><br>I rather not go in to all the details but this place has gone downhill. I wonder if David Overton has got  too big to handle the quality he once demanded. <br><br>Next day update:<br>Just got home to grab my leftover slice and the server was so bad that she just threw it in upside down. So sad.

I&#39;ve had a good experience every time I&#39;ve come here. Service and food are exactly how I experience the other locations.. glad they opened this restaurant and happy to eat here!<br><br>The ONLY slacking part I think is the bread... why aren&#39;t they always stocked on what makes them so famous?

The Cheesecake Factory is always an easy choice when choosing were to eat. This time I wanted to try something different and was surprised by the waiters&#39; willingness to recommend dished based on your taste. The service was fast and efficient and the staff was kind. I could not ask for more.

Horrible experience...I was there on a Sunday but there were plenty of tables. My waiter was pleasant &amp; I ordered a diet coke &amp; a water while I looked at the menu. He brought a glass of warm tab water...no ice or lemon or straw! He forgot the diet coke. I ordered a very lousy burger...it took 10 minutes to get my drink order....awful ....the &#34;hostess&#34; was creepy...

I love this place but after the experience I had tonight I don&#39;t think I will be coming back here. Not only was the waitress bad at her job she made my family and I feel low, for example we were under dress didn&#39;t think we were going to eat out just walking the promenade. But of course we got hungry. We got seated the guy was wonderful up until we got our waitress Rosa A yeah I got her name! I watched her while she went to check on her tables and mind you we were here for 2 hours and only checked on us twice smh... we told her it was our kids birthday and all she did was give us desert menu towards the end of our dinner we asked for refills and Togo boxes. What does she do? She gets the boxes, n gives it then goes to 2 other tables and has her conversations mind u were still waiting on the refill that&#39;s in her hand that she hasn&#39;t filled and we also told her we were in a hurry cuz the garage parking is closing, well that was pretty much my experience and we waited 15 mins for a refill that we never got cuz she was a busy talking to her other tables but had time to turn around and grab the tab when we were paying stereo type is what I felt bucks her other tables were all dressed classy n of course we look low class...

Probably one of the worst experiences I&#39;ve had at a restaurant. I wouldn&#39;t recommend coming here unless you plan on drinking only 1 glass of water (no refills) and waiting 40min for fries that you ordered on the side.

I&#39;m so happy that we get delivery through Door Dash!  We love the food and desserts here and it even arrives hot!!<br>Try the Romano Crusted Herb Chicken and pasta, you won&#39;t be disappointed!  Even if you&#39;re a teen-ager!

Fantastic location and space, but something is seriously off with the food and drinks at this Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve eaten at several other locations across SoCal, and Santa Monica manages to consistently ruin classic items. Here&#39;s what&#39;s wrong with the happy hour here. <br><br>Fried chicken sliders: These are usually fantastic and really help scratch that Chick-Fil-A itch. Here, the chicken is overcooked.<br><br>Hamburger sliders: Again, usually excellent but dry and overcooked. <br><br>Crab and artichoke dip: The dip is fantastic, but the crostinis are...you guessed it, dry and overcooked. <br><br>I could keep going, but you can pretty much apply this to most items on the menu. The food is still plenty edible, but this Cheesecake Factory needs to step up its quality control.

I normally don&#39;t review before I get my food but this is terrible. ..the service totally sucks...the group next to us who came in 15 mins later got their orders and almost done with their food :(...not sure what&#39;s happening but I&#39;m ready to eat them with my words..shhsh..I&#39;m usually a cool chic and normally don&#39;t complain but this is unacceptable. ..uggh..don&#39;t go here

I don&#39;t know where to begin. Was it the massive flies around the entrances? Was it the horrible service from the host who we thought was a host? Was it the lack of organization? Was it the attitudes from the employees? Well, it was all of it - and more. If I were able to rate this less than a 1, I would.<br>It was a Wednesday afternoon, my party and I wanted to celebrate a friend&#39;s birthday. Just as we thought we were going to experience quality hospitality at a fine dine, roof-top restaurant in Santa Monica, things went downhill. <br>The majority of the staff that we encountered had the most inconsiderate, unacceptable, and inappropriate attitudes. The language and dialogue were unprofessional and the speed and service were unsatisfactory. <br>Overall, this whole encounter was a disaster and was very disappointing. There needs to be an improvement on basically every aspect of decent customer service for everyone that works here. That is all.

Normally I don&#39;t write reviews because my boyfriend and I are both in the food/restaurant industry and we get it- things can get busy and it&#39;s hard to juggle tables but last night was the worst service i&#39;ve ever had at any restaurant. We got sat in the bar area and had a bartender/barback take our order we asked for the tex-mex egg rolls to be out first and I had a feeling he was going to forget. Every time we would try to ask him for something he would walk away as we were talking. Then we were waiting for bread and asked another server for some and she said &#34;you&#39;re server will bring it to you&#34; and walked away. We never got the bread. Then, our entrees came out and there was no appetizer in sight. We told the food runner and he said he would bring them out as soon as possible. Our food runner brought me a strawberry lemonade refill because I had been trying to flag down the sever for one but he never came. The food runner did more for us than the server did and I can&#39;t remember his name, it started with a B I think, but we tipped him because he was so helpful, we wish he was our server! We ended up having to ask our server for the check and boxes and then we left. We weren&#39;t the only ones being ignored because the people next to us were trying to flag down the server for some bread- good luck. I understand that you can be busy but all It would take for us to be understanding is one apology and we didn&#39;t get that. We probably won&#39;t ever return here which is sad because we really enjoy driving down here for the beautiful view but the bad service is not okay.

Great décor and great location. <br><br>Service wasn&#39;t very attentive, and the food was what you&#39;d expect from a Cheesecake Factory (neither here nor there). <br><br>Big plus at the bar... they now have some good Scotch and Bourbon offerings (Booker&#39;s, Oban, etc) so I was able to settle into a nice drink.

Bad service, and too expensive.<br>Had to ask for bread after meal arrived, was never offered to us.<br>Coffee arrived without sugar, had to wait and catch a waiter to ask for some.<br>Desert arrived without fork or spoons, had to reuse my coffee spoon.

My whole experience has been horrible from the beginning. I never liked coming to tho place because the  wait is always ridiculous. Arriving at the restaurant we were told that there was going to be a 2 hour wait. After waiting for over 2 hours and 45 minutes we were finally seated. It took another 15 minutes for our waiter to take our order and another hour for our food to actually come out. But here&#39;s the kicker we were a group of 8 and they brought our food out in 3 separate batches so we weren&#39;t even able to eat all together. We arrived at 8pm and didn&#39;t get our food until after 11pm. Just ridiculous.

Service is really really really bad compared to other cheesecake factories. You sit at the table for 10-15 minutes until the waiter comes. Drinks come at the same time as your entree, bread never shows up, and appetizers when you are about finished. The service is bad across several visits here

Tonight we went to the new cheese cake factory in Santa Monica, it was awesome first let me say the Manager Kati Ana was incredible she was so warm and welcoming, checked in on us always was on top of everything! We sat in the back patio that has a great view and seats , the food came our hot and yummy , and my lemon drop martini was the bomb . Best part always is dessert the pumpkin  cheesecake is what my kids wait for so yummy ! We will be back !!

This is an awesome location for The Cheesecake Factory. The wait is NDB because there&#39;s a ton of window shopping you can do during that time, if you&#39;re into that. We walked around, but sadly for me and to my wallets relief, I didn&#39;t buy anything. We timed it perfectly, because when we came back up, it was our turn to be seated! <br><br>I love the set-up because there are so many cute little booths all over. If you get a window seat, you may be able to nom and people watch. It&#39;s the BEST!<br><br>I don&#39;t like to be too adventures with this menu. I go with my oldies but goodies. Avocado egg rolls for apps (the sauce is yum!) and chicken madeira for the main dish. Never disappoints.<br><br>The only thing that really sucked and almost made me give them 3 stars is the service. Sooo slow. SO nice! But sooo slow. Good thing they&#39;re consistent with my usuals.

Poor Cheesecake Factory in Santa Monica. We ordered lunch all WRONG, we called and are told &#34;it&#39;s the delivery service Post Mates problem&#34; and there is NO telephone to contact PM. Well, never again Cheesecake Factory in Santa Monica.  Boo, zero stars for you.  Minus the star I selected in order to make this post!

Worst cheesecake factory i ever go. The host on the balcony is very grumsy and unhelpful to everything waiter  and the rest of the crew is also unhappy. I will not coming here anytime unless the crew change.

I have loved cheesecake factor since I was a kid. I was in Santa Monica and decided to eat there. What a big mistake.<br>Food was bad I got sick and throw up. The pasta was under cooked. Service was the worst I have ever seen anywhere. <br>I guess I should have believed the guy that stood outside with a sign saying worst cheesecake ever. <br><br>I hope Cheesecake Factory does something to this location fire management and hire someone tat cares. Shame.

The WORST experience I have ever had at any restaurant by far. I don&#39;t really like cheesecake in general.. but the view is what sold me here. Me and my boyfriend came here during our vacation, and got seated a seat on the patio upstairs.. we requested a spot near the window but the section was &#34;closed&#34; but their was clearly other people sitting in that section. So, we asked if we could possibly move to the window as we saw a table that was emptied but had to be cleaned, our server still didn&#39;t come to our table after 15 minutes so we just asked a random server and she said ok. Eventually we moved to a table that got cleared before the one we wanted... and then we were asked to move and I have to add VERY rudely and we felt unwanted at this point. We were also told that we had to go stand in the corner because we couldn&#39;t sit at the table while they were cleaning it. We were considering to just leave, we really should have. <br><br>We then asked to see a manager who seemed uninterested and like she hated her job (I don&#39;t blame her I wouldn&#39;t want to be working with a bunch of jerks who can&#39;t do their job either).<br><br>Finally we ordered &amp; our food took ONE hour to come out because something happened to go wrong to us specifically.. ironic. At this point 3 tables had already eaten and left except us... And we were there before all of them. After finally receiving our food their was a LARGE hair in my dish.. <br><br>We didn&#39;t even eat anything, the food was gross and greasy. We informed the manager before we left and again she didn&#39;t care and didn&#39;t say much... I didn&#39;t really like cheesecake before but now I really hate it. After this we went to another restaurant and it was great and the customer service was suburb unlike cheesecake.

Very rude slow service <br>Place was empty yet they made us wait<br>To be seated. Waitress came and left without taking order. Place seems to feel customer is a burden <br>Cannot see how this place stays in business.<br>Utensils dirty <br>Makes dinning a bad experience

I didn&#39;t know this Cheesecake Factory served entrée&#39;s as kid meals. I&#39;ve been to many cheesecake factory&#39;s and their entrée&#39;s feed 2-3 people. Most of the time I have left overs from such a big portion. I do not recommend coming here if anyone has a big appetite.

Waited 20 minutes and our server never came. Meghan and Andrew who were promptly serving other tables near us kept saying they weren&#39;t our server (after I waived them over and asked). They also kept saying that the other person was our server... 30 minutes later a manager came and said &#34;hey I&#39;m sorry I&#39;ll make sure you get some bread and your server is Andrew&#34;. It took 10 minutes to get bread from Megan who was not our server... <br><br>45 minutes later my moms food never came. We asked for the check and another manager came out and offered my mother a slice of cheesecake to apologize... <br><br>Our entire experienced which I didn&#39;t even capture was shitty and all my mom was offered was a slice of cheesecake. I guess. This location sucks and my food was gross.

I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake factory a few times now. Although its really busy and the wait is always long, the service is generally anyways good. I mostly come here for the amazing cheesecake. Its really heavy so I recommend splitting one with a friend and definitely have a glass of water with it. Great for dessert and a nice dinner.

Should have read the reviews before having dinner here! We got seated quickly but that were it ended. Food came out before drinks! Food came out before bread!<br><br>Cheesecake rule 101 <br>Bread and butter 1st or at least second to drinks<br><br>Manager (Keith) came over and said sorry and that was it.<br><br>Take your $ to another nearby Resturant, you&#39;ll thank me later

Everything was sooo wrong!  Worst experience ever. <br><br>I order my plate without any seasoning since I&#39;m allergic and they brought it wrong. Then they decided to inform that they could not do it without seasoning since its pre-made.  At this point all my friend started to enjoy their meal and they offered to bring me another plate. When I thought they were bringing my meal the waiter just came to inform that my plate was on the fast queue and he wanted to confirm my order. What???? I thought it was done already! At this point my friends were eating desert and I was starving!!!! The waiter brought the check even before my plate arrived in a clear suggestion for us to leave!  <br><br>To sum up, I had bread and butter for dinner and I asked my salmon to go since everyone has already eaten by the time it came.

The Cheesecake Factory is such a fun and inviting atmosphere!  I love coming here for dates, it has the feel of an upscale restaurant without the accompanying rigidness and uptight feel.  I don&#39;t understand the complaints that I see on here, I&#39;ve never experienced anything but excellent service and food from this location.  Inside, the aura is dim and romantic, while the seating outside has lovely views of the promenade and his very well heated.  The servers here have all always been very accommodating and sweet, I love so many of them!  They helped my boyfriend surprise me on my birthday with some free cake.  The menu is HUGE, and has a vast array of options, all of which are delicious!  Loses a star only because many of the items on the menu seem rather overpriced.  This isn&#39;t a gourmet restaurant.  They&#39;re nice, but I wish they wouldn&#39;t act like they&#39;re so fancy.  Still, I love the atmosphere and the food here!  And the staff are always so friendly and sweet.  An excellent choice for dinner by the promenade.

Believe the bad reviews! We ordered takeout from this place and they packed the wrong thing. It was only 2 items so I&#39;m not sure how that happened. We were so disappointed when we got home and found out the food was wrong. By then it was already too late and we weren&#39;t going to drive back all the way to SM just to have them correct it. Gentleman at the bakery (doing the takeout) was really nice though, so I guess 3 stars for that.

The rice was not cooked all the way, i&#39;m literally using a toothpick to get the rice out my teeth. Mad as hell!! Then it was dirty inside, my silverware was not properly cleaned. I don&#39;t know why i did not take a picture of it!! This location was an embarrassment!! My lady was not satisfied at all!

They have 5 people at the counter to help. We were told 15 minutes and I said really wait is the true wait time???<br>She assured me wait for two was only 15 minutes.<br>Without expressing my true feelings here, the wait so 47 minutes. I went up to the counter twice and we were told we were next. I pointed out the empty table for two and finally got seated.<br>Star rating is seating service not food.

First there was weird stuff in my boyfriends cup of Coca Cola . There waitresses admitted she didn&#39;t even know what that stuff was. Then they swapped waiters and forgot to put our order in for the appetizer. It took them one and half our to bring us out appetizer. We kept asking to cancel they refused. Our meals came and then the appetizer after we asked to cancel it already.  <br>There were nice they brought us bread and butter twice but we weren&#39;t there to eat bread and butter. Right after I left I started feeling weird from the meal I got four cheese pasta. There something wrong with this location because of cleanliness and how they prepare there meals. I will never come back and hopefully we don&#39;t get food poisoning. Also we would have left but we already waited so long to be seated and we had movie we had to catch. Hope you read this review we didn&#39;t even bothered to yelp the place before walking in what a big mistake.

I have loved Cheesecake Factory since the first time I ate there almost 20 years ago.  Fantastic  extensive menu. Something for everyone.  Fairly priced.  Nice atmosphere.  You can dress up and be more casual. They also have one of the best happy hours ever.

I am not crazy about the cheesecake factory restaurants but the one in Santa Monica is one of the lesser ones.  The food is mediocre and the noise level is really high.  Overall, it was not a pleasant experience.

amazing food, amazing service. 5 starsz.<br><br>dbr. g hje d f. tenkfnfn r t r f. dndnesnd. r f gnfnrlfkfbrkekfnfnfnf r. f d de e mdlfmfngnfwriting stuff so it counts as review. skrnrkckfncne f eigkendnc. dnffkne. f ff foflfndkf

I was skeptical to go here since the reviews were so bad but I had a great time. <br>Our waitress was so nice and made sure everything was perfect. Our food was delicious. The only negative part was the host in the front was rude, she wasn&#39;t very welcoming but we still enjoyed ourselves.

Pretty sweet location in a cool outdoor mall. Perfect to enjoy the sunny LA weather. Went in the late afternoon and was able to grab a seat for 2. The service was great, as our waiter was very friendly and attentive.<br><br>We had drinks and the factory nachos. The drinks and food both took a little long but the nachos were legitimately the best I&#39;ve ever had. The chips were seasoned well enough to be eaten alone and were strong enough to not break despite the heaps of cheese, guac, salsa and sour cream. Some chips felt legitimately heavy in my hand from all the toppings. Finished the meal off with a strawberry cheesecake and it was delicious as they always are. The cheesecake came out almost instantaneously, evening out the wait for the other items.<br><br>Took a while but was well worth it so I&#39;ll give it 5 stars. Need to see if the nachos are of the same quality at other locations.

I hate this location. Went in last night for dinner. Our waiter was too busy to check on us. Only checked on us when we were done eating our food. By then we were out of drinks and ready to go! I ordered the shrimp scampi. And it came with half the pasta that I usually get. It looked like a kids meal. I spent good money for food I didn&#39;t even get to enjoy. And again I couldn&#39;t even find my waiter to let him know. We kept having to ask other workers to help us. And when it was time to pay he tried charging us more than he should have! My friend had to go to the ATM to take out money because he wasn&#39;t charging the right amount. When we did pay he just handed off the cash WITHOUT the receipt. Talk about an inconvenience and a waste of money. I&#39;ll just stick to the Marina location where the potions are normal and the service is 5 stars EVERY TIME.

Horrible. I would NEVER EVER come here again. Service sucks, waiters don&#39;t want to be there and management acts like we are asking to do the something that is such an inconvenience for them when I  return an item they got wrong/did not taste good. They didn&#39;t even offer to fix the fettuccini Alfredo. He just took the plate and said &#34;Ok&#34;. Neither did he offer a replacement or a percentage off of the shitty food. Don&#39;t go to this excuse of a restaurant !!!

This restaurant is ridiculously long &amp; big. Despite that, we had a great visit. I always order the same thing at TCF, chicken/shrimp jambalaya with a extra sauce on the side. We ordered a new-to-us item. Avocado, portabella mushroom and zucchini fries. YUM! I highly recommend it. I also order the same dessert every visit: Godiva chocolate cheesecake. Great service was provided by Haley on the bridge patio.

I love Cheesecake Factory. Bistro Shrimp Pasta! Read bad reviews about this location so we were hesitant but decided to go. Bread on our tables immediately, drink orders done, food was quick and delicious as always. Mahalo for the great experience. This was a first CF experience for a few in our party. Everyone left with smiling faces and full stomachs.

No winder the rate is soooo low !<br>Im not sure why they are not making sure that the managers doing the right job! I was amazed with this locations manager ! Me and not my family will go here again! Never !<br>Great waiters ! Snd they had to apologize few times for the horrible manager attitude ! Disappointing for such a wonderful company ! <br>We had to take the burned pepperoni! <br>The manager she said : PLEASE EAT THIS SO YOU ARE BUSY AND I&#39;ll make another one ! How long? She said 5 mins ! I start timing her. After 12 minutes she cane back and shocked that i timed her ! Very rude responses BUT WITH LOWER TONE OF VOICE ! I manage 15 banks and i know what type of manager she was ! I dont think she ever has been in training !

I&#39;m a big fan of the Cheesecake Factory franchise and have eating at several location.  However on this occasion at the Santa Monica location guest service is lacking.    We were handed dirty silverware to eat with and after being sat down at our table it took over 30-40min just to put in an order with a waiter that was waiting on another table next to use.   <br><br>Then after an hour from the time we checked in (On Yelp) and we still didn&#39;t have receive our food i had to track someone down to speak with a manager.   I see why this place only has 2 1/2 stars.  It not what anyone would expect from the Cheesecake Factory chain.  This location need a lot more training in customer service.

The food selection and the food is excellent. It takes a while to get seated because the restaurant is so busy and it took 10 minutes after we were seated for the waiter to get to us. Great location and place to eat if you are not in a hurry.
Ryan S was the best! Loved the Cheesecake Factory ...<br>It&#39;s so big and so pretty. We came for awesome dessert and we were pleased as we knew we would be. Thank

WORST experience ever! I love going to this CF, my boyfriend and I were actuality excited to check out this new location. It was a beautiful Saturday afternoon,  our day was going great and we were looking forward to having a good lunch. When we walked in things were going good, we got seated really quickly, but that all changed as soon as we got seated. Our server came introduced herself and asked if we wanted anything to drink. Things that went wrong:<br><br>1. Dirty silverware <br>2. Our server magically disappeared<br>3. It took 45mins to order<br>4. It took almost 30mins to bring out our food<br><br>Yeah this was the unfortunately the first and our last time at this location

An average of 2 1/2 stars is way too low. My review would probably be 3 1/2 stars, but I&#39;m rounding up.<br><br>I came in here for lunch today and had a fine experience. There was no wait for a table (it was about 1:15 on a Monday afternoon), and the only reason service was a bit slow at the start was because the server in that area was tending to several large groups. I can absolutely forgive that since that&#39;s out of anyone&#39;s control.<br><br>I ordered the chicken parmesan sandwich and thought it was tasty. It wasn&#39;t cheap, but it&#39;s certainly a better-made sandwich than you&#39;d get at a chain sub shop. The fries that came with it were fine, although I did have to ask for ketchup. All told, I was in and out in about 45 minutes, which goes in stark contrast to many reviews I&#39;m reading now. It&#39;s almost as if I went to a completely different restaurant!

Always YUMMY with AWFUL customer service......ALWAYS.<br>Ordered for appetizers:<br>*Crab Wontons - 5/5<br>*Calamari - 5/5<br>Main course:<br>*Steak Diane...shrunk?!?! Steak used to be larger. Ordered it well done but was served medium! Salmon also bland this time around. The mashed potatoes and asparagus were perfect. Overall 3/5<br>*Three shrimp soft taco combo. Was sadly dry. Rice was tasty! The tacos looked like they had a generous amount of shrimp but really it was all an illusion because they were sitting on mostly lettuce, it was ridiculous! Wasn&#39;t given salsa, had to ask. The salsa was super salty though. 3/5<br>Desert:<br>* White chocolate macadamia ....divine...5/5<br>Waiter service - 5/5. He was nice and attentive. Took almost 30 mins to get out our main course because no one covered him when he went on his break. But, still he tried his best.<br>Hostess - 0/5!!!!!!! ALWAYS!!!!!<br><br>Attn Management: We come here often ( at least several times a month) and it&#39;s always the same old story.... Great food, unfriendly hostess. Our hostess was very rude and unaccommodating, she lacked good customer service, the majority of them do. It&#39;s always the people leading you to your seat who seem to have the biggest issues in their life. ALWAYS! If you&#39;re not happy, please go somewhere else and stop trying to project you&#39;re misery unto others! Seriously, you need better management and supervisors to keep your subpar employees in line. How your customers are treated is unacceptable, read the other comments. Something needs to change.<br>Also, the restrooms are always dirty.

I&#39;m a fan of The Cheesecake Factory and would expect the same quality of food and service no matter what location I go to. Unfortunately, this restaurant is horrible and I&#39;m surprised it&#39;s called The Cheesecake Factory.  My salad was missing 4 ingredients, my daughters order was incorrect, and my son&#39;s order was also missing ingredients.  It&#39;s as if the just tossed some things together and figured we wouldn&#39;t notice. Since it was a to-go order, I couldn&#39;t easily take it back so I called the manager and she said no problem, I will send you a gift card. Well in 2 months and 4-5 calls later, I never received it. In My last conversation with them they suggested I call their corporate office and gave me the number.  Well guess what? It was a bad number but at that point, I wasn&#39;t surprised.  My recommendation is that you not waste your time at this location because from the service to the food to the management, it&#39;s ALL bad!  1 Star is too much!

DONT COME HERE ON A FRIDAY NIGHT!!! I REPEAT DONT COME HERE ON FRIDAY!!!!! Where do I start from? First it&#39;s super busy, because it&#39;s so busy the customer service sucks!!!! They took forever to ask for our drinks then I had to ask for bread since we were hungry. Bad choice it was super hard and nasty. The drink wasn&#39;t good which was like 14 dollars, food was beyond nasty. It was so hard to get a hold of my waiter... if you want good food and good service don&#39;t come here it&#39;s a waste of time and money
Was made to wait for more than an hour for cold food, then a waiter dropped a tray of drinks on my lap.  Just awful.

Not one of the better Cheesecake locations.  I enjoy Cheesecake factory and have dined at many locations usually ordering from a few select items that I like.  The same items ordered here were sub par and the service is slower as well. I recently moved to Santa Monica and I thought this location would be a go to once a week but unfortunately it has disappointed<br> me too many times.

This location is right in the shopping area of Santa Monica at the mall. The staff is always so friendly and attentive, the food is delicious and well prepared, and it&#39;s always such a great experience. The chicken quesadilla is so amazing it&#39;s almost absurd!

Don&#39;t order to go because you will wait FOREVER. I used to always order on Postmates Until they got my order wrong and refuse to make me a new pasta aft r DRIVING to the location. Employees are snooty and rude and you have to search and search ffor your host. Beautiful views but horrid service

The wait time was acceptable, it was a busy Saturday.  Our server was polite, service with a smile.  We had chicken pop stickers, I had a Greek salad which was excellent, and a sampler of egg rolls which was also Good.  I had the avocado egg roll which was different but good.  I might make them at home!

The steak cheese sandwich had no taste whatsoever. That&#39;s an achievement! How is it possible to get to a completely neutral bland taste if you have so many ingredients? <br><br>Secondly, why is the music so loud? If I want to hear music, I&#39;ll put on my headphones. No need to ruin the experience with Adele whining through the speakers at 300% volume (she annoys the hell out of me at 3% already).

New Manegemant , that&#39;s what this location needs,<br>As a cheesecake loyal costumer ( 4 times only this week) .<br>Came here with  family, 25 minutes after ordering the food the waiter came to tell us that they out of what we ordered . The New Yorke steak,When I asked for the manager why he didn&#39;t inform us when we order he just said that he didn&#39;t know,<br>Instead of offering discount on the outer steaks they have  that we  &#34; had &#34; to order.<br>Our waiter Mik&#39;a was very nice and efficient and I&#39;m sure it wasn&#39;t is fault. <br>Needs better management!!

Burnt fried Mac and Cheese and hard-like-cardboard chicken sliders showed up to our table 45 minutes after we ordered. Worst Cheesecake Factory restaurant I&#39;ve ever been to. And the worst part is, this is not the first time I&#39;ve had similar experiences at this particular location. Thank you for ruining our dinner.
Always slow service, don&#39;t listen when you ask to be seated somewhere, and they will lose your order.

I usually never think Cheesecake Factory is overpriced because of the large portions and decent food. But this location is pretty bad, I took my parents a while back and to start out the hosts are extremely rude, service is ok but not even close to good enough for the prices they charge. They need WAY better management. I&#39;m going to keep going to the Marina Del Rey location instead.
Received my Long Island Iced Tea with a fly resting at the bottom. To say I was disgusted would be an understatement. I will not be coming back.

If you have three hours on hand and a taste for bad service this the place to go. Waiter changed partway through the meal, wasn&#39;t introduced to second waiter, ignored for 15 minutes at the end of meal and still waiting to be acknowledged and giving a check. Disgusting.

First off, I&#39;ve never been to a cheese cake factory with such bad service. This is the first one to make me have to write a review. Kylie was our server and from the minute we got drinks she was so rude. We asked for room temperature water and her immediate response was &#34;I can give you water with no ice&#34; smart ass remark, obviously that is room temperature. Second she didn&#39;t bring out any bread... We all know that&#39;s what cheesecake factory&#39;s do. I had to ask Don&#39;t we get some bread with our order. All she had to say was I can bring some out? A runner had brought out our food, she seen we had our food when bringing the bread.<br><br>Not once did she ask if we needed anything grated cheese crushed pepper? I had to again ask for some... She just walked around bring items without talking. <br>If you don&#39;t want to service people work behind a cubicle, and don&#39;t talk to anyone. <br><br>I had to ask a hostess for her name but found it on the ticket when we got our bill. <br><br>NEVER had I have to go through experience like this. Either get retrained or smile to your customers.

We really like this location specifically because of the ambience; it&#39;s so spacious (we love the intimate booth seating throughout) and the nice patio w/views of the promenade. <br><br>Unfortunately, happy hour is only in the bar area, it was such a beautiful day we set out on the patio. Nonetheless we enjoy cheesecakes food... Tasty and consistent.<br><br>What cool place to nosh, a couple drinks and be merry.... Of course after shopping til you drop...<br><br>Enjoy!
The wait can be a little crazy due to the fact that it&#39;s in a heavy traffic area, but the service I get is always worth it.

I waited 45 minutes for a table when the restaurant was less than half full (at least 20-30 empty tables).  When I was finally seated, the host walked me and 2 other groups to our tables at the same time.  He handed me a menu and told me my table was &#34;over there&#34; as he gestured to the next aisle.  He said he&#39;d be over in a minute and never came.  I expect more out of a Cheesecake Factory.  Go to a different location.

I ordered the shrimp and sausage pasta on the lunch menu. The shrimp was not cooked. They offered me other options, but once you&#39;ve been served uncooked seafood or meat, the whole experience leaves a sour taste in your mouth. The manager was very apologetic and offered me cake, but I politely declined. The cooks should really be more responsible about plating uncooked seafood.

WORST CHEESECAKE FACTORY EVER!!! I always love going to Cheesecake Factory and have always had only good experiences until going to this one. Our server was very nice but my mashed potatoes were cold and my steak was not only cold but so raw it might as well have been alive. My friend ordered the avocado toast and it was so hard that her mouth tasted like blood after taking a bite. After sending back the avocado toast and the steak to get cooked more the manager came over and proceeded to talk to us like we were children. Everyone at the table felt very disrespected and disappointed. I was not surprised to see that this Cheesecake Factory has a lower yelp rating than the others in the area. CORPORATE NEED TO GET INVOLVED WITH THIS LOCATION. NEVER GOING BACK!! :(

BEWARE OF BAD SERVICE. <br><br>Cheesecake typically delivers a wide variety of decent food and service, except at this Santa Monica location. <br><br>This is the 2nd time I&#39;ve had horrible service at this particular location. Both times one person in our party did not receive a portion of their meal. This specific visit was the most offensive since it was the actual meal. <br><br>Wait staff is nice and friendly but very extremely inexperienced. <br><br>The manager is equally inexperienced in managing such situations as they offered a casual apology but nothing beyond that. I frequent many restaurants and the manager sets the tone and standard for level of service. I&#39;ve even been to restaurants where my meal was accidentally delivered to another guest and the manager profusely apologized and not only removed said item from the bill but also gave me a giftcard to use at my next visit (I&#39;ll be visiting Snooze in La Jolla without a doubt). The manager today and my previous visit only offered a lackluster, half heartfelt apology.  <br><br>The best part of my visit was when I told the server to wrap up the salad only to have him say but I asked them to rush it. Sorry pal, I waited for over 45 minutes for my salad to never arrive. They are lucky I left a half decent tip.

I have come here several times this year to celebrate friends&#39; birthdays. The menu here is very wide and offers a vast selection of foods. The service here is good and all the waiters are helpful even if at times it takes a while to get their attention. The atmosphere is very nice, but the restaurant is too dark inside and it&#39;s hard to see who you&#39;re talking to and the menu. Food is very tasty!

So i have been to cheese cake factory before but unfortunately this location didnt have good service. Our server took awhile to take care of us. We had to ask three times for our water and beverages. By the time our appetizers came out the server still took their time to take our meal order. The ambiance is really nice i like how its on the rooftop and u can see over the promenade. The food was ok, took awhile to come  which was also disappointing. If im craving cheesecake i know now not to go to this location!

Some of the absolute worst food I ever had, not only did it take forever to come to the table but it was cold. I felt bad because the server was sweet, but the utensils given to me and two plates with food on it had DRIED food from previous meals. I will absolutely never come back here. It was gross. Honestly for the prices it&#39;s not worth it. I&#39;m disappointed in the food. It used to be good maybe 10 years ago? Now, it&#39;s completely disgusting. Save your time. Eat literally anywhere else.

So my boyfriend and I came in for a quick bite and to watch the Penguins Stanley Cup finals although it took our entire meal to get the game on everything else was fine. We were taken care of a guy named Minor(spelled wrong) and a lovely lady named Lauren. They took great care of us. We were in the bar area and from being in the industry I know that part is always busy. Our food came out fine... the chicken wings looked weird inside so we asked and turns out it was the vein which I completely agree with I just wanted to make sure. They both were very tentative about our needs and made sure we were take care of so on their part they&#39;re both amazon servers and the kitchen did great. That&#39;s all I want (I am also a corporate trainer in a large east coast chain) <br><br>I wish you the best

As soon as my cousins and I walked in the hostess was not that welcome and told us which was a 20 minute wait which we decided to wait for. However our waiter(not sure of name) was absolutely professional. He checked up on us very often and gave us great recommendations. I ordered the four cheese pasta which was very delicious. After, being stuffed we decided to get cheesecake because that is what they are know for. We got the red velvet and salted caramel cheesecakes and Oh My God it was the best cheesecake I have ever had. It was the type of food where your in a commercial to act like how good the food was but in this case we were not acting. Overall I would recommend people to this place if you have 2 hours to eat and are looking for an amazing cheesecake.
horrible service. ordered the cheese pizza flatbread and was given literal cheese sticks, what a joke! no sauce on my &#34;pizza&#34; whatsoever. never coming back to this particular location again.

Excellent service! My friends and I (party of 14) went in to celebrate our friends bday. John, (it think that was his name) our server for yesterday 02/25/18, did an excellent job. He made sure everyone&#39;s order was accurate. The food tasted great. Everything turned out fantastic. Will be back for sure.

Came last night since only a few restaurants were open at 9pm.<br><br>1. Waited for service - 15min (no one came, few customers, but she was &#34;very busy&#34;)<br>2. Ordered hot tea - no pot (should have), just a cup <br>3. &#34;Signature&#34; bread - upon request<br>4. To go box - did it ourselves where other cheesecake factories always do this for &#34;you&#34;(again, she was &#34;very busy&#34;)<br>5. Attitude - average (not in a good way)<br><br>Conclusion: <br>Worst experience ever. This cheesecake factory seems not here for business and no training for at least, &#34;our waitress.&#34; I will go to the food court or any other restaurant around next time. Absolutely will NOT come again.

One star because large chains should be banned from lovely Santa Monica, but I gave it a shot nonetheless! It was no surprise that it currently has a 2 1/2 stars on Yelp, which is generous. The food is average at best. When I asked the server about the turkey burger, the response was, &#34;I hate burgers&#34;!  Not what I would expect from the staff. However, I ordered it anyway and it was pretty good. The space is large and lovely, but service was lousy and the food was mediocre. The &#39;bacon tater tots&#39;were a misnomer since they were effectively deep fried mash potatoes and didn&#39;t taste anything like a tater tot. I will be avoiding this place at all costs.
Got the chicken tacos they were tasty - no wait but we were here on an off lunch time.  My friend got spicy chicken sandwhich and said it was tasty -- we are both full now!

I would like to state I have been a waitress for over 5 years. We sat near the bar on the tables with the high chairs. If facing the bar we were the table second from left to right. Directly behind the host.<br><br>Last night 07/17 my boyfriend, cousin and her boyfriend went out to eat our favorite place The Cheesecake Factory. We have been to the Topanga and Thousand Oaks locations great service every time.<br><br>However, our waiter (male, light skin, spoke Spanish, not positive on his ethnicity) gave us THE WORST SERVICE!!!!!!!!!!&#39; You ask why? Hmmm well we immediately got seated out our table, not greeted, table was completely empty. No napkins or utensils. Okay, of course as a waitress I understood they were busy no problem. 25 minutes later STILL no idea who our waiter is at the time because we have yet to get a simple &#34;hi so sorry, I&#39;ll be right with you or even greeted us.&#34; I waited 5 more minutes now sitting on 30 mins. Finally went up to the host and asked who our waiter may be to let him know we&#39;re ready for him or her. She apologizes and says I&#39;ll go find him so sorry for the wait. <br><br>Again, no problem maybe there was a misunderstanding. Finally, our waiter comes up to us and apologizes and asks what we would like to order. <br><br>First I said can we please 4 waters all around AND may I get fettuccini pasta no chicken, later my cousin, boyfriend, and her boyfriend ordered after me. We also ordered drinks. <br><br>Another 20 mins and we ask the waiter when we will be getting our drinks? He said oh that&#39;s right LET ME GO GET THEM. Honestly, our patience was starting to run out with this guy. <br><br>Everyone got their pasta EXCEPT ME! I asked the our waiter how much more time until I receive mine. HE TELLS ME I NEVER ORDERED ANYTHING. EVERYONE AT THE TABLE HEARD ME WORD BY WORD ASKING THE WAITER FOR MY PASTA. <br><br>He later orders me my pasta and apologizes ok, a bit upset at this point because once again the service just getting worse and worse. The pervious busser who originally brought out the food for my boyfriend, cousin, etc finally came with my food. Great, awesome at this point I was relieved to finally get food in me.<br><br>We noticed our waiter coming with another plate of fettuccini Alfredo and quickly turn around noticing I already had my food. Aka I did order my food it just came late okay that&#39;s fine.<br><br>THIS WAITER NEVER ASKED US HOW OUR FOOD WAS, OUR DRINKS WERE EMPTY BEFORE WE GOT OUR FOOD AND DIDN&#39;T ASK FOR A MORE, AGAIN WE DID NOT HAVE ANY PLATES, BREAD, NOR UTENSILS. <br><br>I STILL HAVEN&#39;T EVEN TOLD YOU THE BEST PART.....<br><br>MY COUSINS BOYFRIEND PAID FOR THE ENTIRE MEAL AND HE SAID TOLD US, guys I&#39;m sorry I&#39;m not going to give this guy a tip the service was trash no excuses.<br><br>I will admit we did leave a tip $1.75.<br><br>We start to leave the restaurante and my cousin and boyfriend are left a little behind so they could quickly finished the two drinks they ordered.<br><br>THE WAITER RUDELY COMES US TO THEM WITH THE TIP BACK AND PUTS IT IN THEIR FACE AND SAYS &#34;YOU FORGOT YOUR CHANGE.&#34; THEY RESPONDED WITH KEPT IT AND WALKED AWAY. <br><br>FEW SECONDS LATER, THE WAITER COMES BACK AND FLICKS US OFF.<br><br>HONESTLY, AGAIN I&#39;VE BEEN A WAITRESS FOR OVER 5 YEARS. YOU GAVE US TERRIBLE SERIVE THE WORST WE HAVE EVER HAD IN OUR LIVES AND NO APOLOGY FOR YOU LACK OF SERVICE AND YOUR COME BACK TO US IS FLICKING US OFF IN FRONT OF THE RESTAURANT AND CUSTOMERS.<br><br>NOT PROFESSIONAL AT ALL.<br><br>I&#39;m blaming it on the company I solemnly blame it on the waiter. <br><br>After leaving the restaurant I immediately called the store and asked to speak specifically with the manager and let him know about what happened. He apologized and I said thank you however, it was not his fault but his waiter/ co-worker. I will be contacting headquarters and complaining about this situation.

It was really a pleasurable and delicious experience. We have been hosted by revered, vibrant, and kind girl named Laura Ann. She was very helpful and energetic as she always precedes our requests with amazing suggestion and  met our full satisfaction.<br><br>Many warm thanks Laura.<br><br>With love,<br>Abdurhman

Horrible service, not only did the server not provide good service, but our food took extremely long to arrive and our orders came back wrong. Very disappointed with this Cheesecake Factory, I highly recommend not eating here.

Worst service ever..!!!  My party waited for an hour and half with out have a waiter checkin us, and when when we talked to a manager about he just walked away for 20 mins.! 2 hours later and we had enough. Manager was useless. Never again.!
I always order the chocolate cheese cake at the end of the meal to close it with full satisfaction of a cheesecake factory. Miso salmon is good.

The Good:<br>The Alfredo was out of this world!  My daughter and my wife thought so as well.  My salmon was very flavorful, but a little too wet for my liking.  Someone else probably would&#39;ve loved it, but I prefer my salmon to be a little more firm. The rest of the meal was ok...nothing spectacular, but nothing to complain about either.  I would not have left a review at all if it wasn&#39;t for the service.<br><br>The Bad:<br>Service.  OMG!  I initially thought our server simply didn&#39;t have a clue.  We had a party of 4, my wife was still deciding what she wanted to order when the server approached.  My wife asked the server to get everyone elses order in our party first so that she could decide between 2 meals she was contemplating, and the server responded that she would come back to the table when everyone was ready to order.  WTF?!?!  We&#39;re not easily angered, but found the waitress&#39; response odd to say the least.  The rest meal was peppered with stand offish comments, unpleasant attitude, long waits(drink refills and bread), and overall just bad service.  As I mentioned before, I assumed the waitress simply didn&#39;t have a clue, however after we paid (including an undeserved tip) and left, my wife admitted to me that she overheard and witnessed server giving very good service to a table adjacent to ours.  <br><br>I wont speculate as to why we received such poor service when a table next to ours received the exact opposite from the same server.  But I have absolutely no desire to return.  This is a management issue.  As a business owner, I am completely aware when one of my employees is providing subpar customer service.  You guys really need to step your game up.

Generally really love eating at Cheesecake but this place had such slow service even though it was a slow day. Bread was cold and stale and waited 10 minutes just for some straws. This slow service might be because there was only one server out on the Terrace taking care of 8 tables? Why is there only one server regardless if it was a a slow day or not...

I have been at this Cheesecake Factory before and our experience was better than today. They took a little over 30 minutes to bring our food. My plate was the spicy cashew chicken it was so salty I could not eat. My husbands Americana hamburger had a &#34;special ingredient in it&#34; as the manager called it a &#34;HAIR&#34; he did apologize also for my plate he said oh maybe the chef &#34;added some salt&#34;and he removed it from our check but it sure took our appetite away! We are Never coming back!

One of the worst experiences I&#39;ve ever had eating out. First the hostess tried to seat us while also seating another table. It took 20 minutes to get water and then another 20 to get the drinks we ordered. 10 minutes after that we finally got the artichoke we ordered with our beverages. Really 30 minutes for an artichoke!?! Another 30 to finally get entrees and the salad my sister ordered came out with frozen edamame. We spoke to a manager who didn&#39;t really seem to care and still ended up paying the entire bill. Literally the worst!!!

Why 5 stars? Love love love the location. It is upstairs like why hate? You can oversee the view of the promenade. I have been here like 5 times. I even went here on my birthday and I love it! I sat outside right on the view side. It was gorgeous outside. The wait is long but its not like there is nothing to do. There are shopping areas outside that you can walk around in.<br><br>I was greeted promptly and the hostess even accommodated my seating suggestion. I HAVE to sit outside next to the window/wall. They have nice heaters so I wasn&#39;t freezing my butt off. Bring a jacket when you&#39;re going to this location. Being next to the beach is extra cold. The ambiance is very chill. Some are having loud conversations and some are having quite intimate conversations. I hate awkward places where everyone is whispering. I want to enjoy my food without the awkwardness.<br><br>Food took a while but it was because it is a Saturday night out at SM. We had bread at all times and the waiter checked up frequently so we would not run out of bread. I ordered the Kobe burger. OH MY DELICIOUS! It is about $14 and comes with a side. The burger is juicy, and it melted in my mouth. The bun was a plus to it as well. Soft and chewy. <br><br>Overall, I don&#39;t see the problem with this location or cheesecake. I really like it. My favorite location by far!
I like the the Cheesecake Factory very much. But this location is horrible. Service is very unfriendly. The food is raw. That was the last time at the Cheescake Factory at Santa Monica!!!

I wish I could give Cheesecake a better review. This was a takeout order. I liked the salmon kale salad my husband got. But the chicken lettuce cups I ordered arrived without chicken....Um...really? Isn&#39;t that a main ingredient? So I called to ask for a reimbursement,  and was told that they&#39;d get back to me....Monica did not apologize for the mess up. She simply told me there was nothing she could do and that someone would cell me when they weren&#39;t busy...SAD

This Cheesecake Factory is located in the 3rd Street Promenade so expect lots of tourists. The food is consistently okay. We had club sandwiches yesterday and they were just so boring! The sandwich was very dry and hardly had any turkey or bacon. We like CF but will go to our neighborhood location.

The service, the food, the place was excellent. Everything was delicious, and didn&#39;t take lots of time. The waiter was very attentive, and was checking on us a lot, but not to the point to drive us crazy.<br>I ate Chicken Stuffed Tortillas and it was amazing. The portion was really big, but the food was delicious and light. It was not heavy or greasy, and the mood there was amazing too.

While Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t have the best food in the world, for a big restaurant chain it excels at offering a variety of foods that are pretty decent. I enjoy coming here with friends on occasion and the desserts are always tasty to boot!<br><br>All that aside, service is the ultimate defining feature of a restaurant, and this place excelled at that. Molly was the Hostess and was very patient with me despite a bit of a wait. She was clearly doing everything within her power to make sure I get my table and I really appreciated that type of care and attention. <br><br>I was then sat at the terrace overlooking the third street promenade with Anthony as my server. He was also very attentive and easy-going. I tend to be a bit annoying at restaurants because I ask for a lot of water, but he made sure I was always cared for, and that speaks volumes of the service.<br><br>The food was standard but the service was exemplary. I&#39;d definitely come back here given the opportunity. Way to go!
First time here and I think it is pretty good.No waiting for four people table. I ordered the salmon dish under 590 cal. It was healthy and I like it.
Typical Cheesecake Factory cuisine but lovely atmosphere. In downtown Santa Monica, on top of a building with a lovely view of the promenade.

Horrible service. Rude front desk staff. Dirty beverage glasses. Had to request parmesan cheese for our pasta orders.<br><br>On Sunday, August 27, my wife and I arrived with our son and three of his friends for lunch to celebrate his birthday. We checked in at the front desk and were given a pager to alert us when our table was ready. Then, we waited outside with other customers.<br><br>And waited.<br><br>And waited.<br><br>After 30 minutes passed, I went inside to check on our table. Brittany the front desk greeter said the system was down so the pagers don&#39;t work. She claimed to have called us for our table but we weren&#39;t there so she gave our table to someone else. Her solution? Put us back on the list to wait another fifteen minutes.<br><br>She lied. She did not call us when out table was ready. Other customers outside had been called for their tables - we were not.<br><br>Brittany&#39;s did not accept responsibility for the oversight, and instead lied. When I objected, she screamed &#34;You can&#39;t talk to me that way! Do you want the manager?&#34;<br><br>What I wanted was a table. At that moment in time, a an employee, she was the Cheesecake Factory. Rather than accept blame and be accountable and correct the mistake, she became confrontational. Was I upset? Yes. I had a right to be. It was her mistake. Rather than try to solve it, she became rude.<br><br>My advice, if you want to eat at a Cheesecake Factory - avoid the Santa Monica location.

Changing my review. I come to cheesecake quite a bit. The kids do love it. We had some issues last time we were here. But looking at all these other reviews giving one star is extreme. <br><br>Many said the food was good, the atmosphere was good. So they need to work on the service a bit. But Cheesecake Factory is better than 2.5 stars. Come on people. <br><br>I guarantee most will be back. Give them some time to line things out. <br><br>I remember when the new one opened at topanga plaza it was the same thing. <br><br>Back again tonight and it has gotten better. Not 5* Better but better. I&#39;m giving the 5* to counter balance some of the reviews that were excessive one stars. <br><br>There are still many good things about this Cheesecake Factory. Let them work on it and give them another shot in a month. <br><br>It will get better. Just like the one at topanga plaza. <br><br>Food is good, ambiance is good, cheesecake is good. <br><br>Besides, James has been busting his butt to please us and props to James. <br><br>The fact is last time I was here I was pissed and over reacted and shouldn&#39;t have written the review without settling down. <br><br>This is my 3rd visit and they have improved 200% from last time. So they are on the right track. <br><br>Cut them some slack. It&#39;s a big place and takes allot of staff. Patience is a virtue.

I ordered the fish n chips and it was really bland. I couldn&#39;t finish the whole thing even though I shared it with my brother. My mom enjoyed her pasta, but the thing that bothered me was that the people who came in and seated 10 minutes after us were served their food way before ours.

I love Cheesecake Factory but this location was not on point with their food today. The service was phenomenal and very professional. The ambience with the low lighting and outside heating made for a romantic and comfortable evening. We ordered the buffalo wings, firecracker salmon, and factory chopped salad. The chopped salad was a little overdosed with dressing to the point where it overpowered all the other ingredients. The buffalo wings barely had any glaze and was borderline burnt versus being crispy. The firecracker salmon was the only dish that was on point and was amazing. It was a perfect dish with perfect presentation. Overall, nothing was disgusting but just fell a bit short to the usual level I experience as a frequent customer to this chain. I still highly recommend this place and believe that tonight&#39;s experience was a fluke. You must try the firecracker salmon!

The food is fine, like any other Cheesecake Factory. However, the wait you&#39;ll experience is day/evening killing. The food always takes over an hour to get to your table, even if your one of a few people in the restaurant. There are much better, less time consuming places to eat on the promenade, don&#39;t waste your night here.

I don&#39;t know why this Cheesecake Factory gets only 2.5 stars!!! I&#39;ve been to many Cheesecake Factories, and all have constant food and great service with reasonable prices. I particularly like their BBQ chicken salad, bistro shrimp pasta, white chocolate raspberry cheesecake and strawberry lemonade. They never fail!

I was here 2/28/2019 to have lunch with my high school friend and my cousin visiting from Maui.Our Server Andrea was the best, great customer service,very attentive, always love Cheesecake Factory, great ambience and great food! Once again , Thank You Andrea,Arnie(Carson, CA)<a href="mailto:smthjazz02@aol.com">smthjazz02@aol.com</a>

All I can say is: Laura! She was fantastic, my family and I came here for a birthday, she was extremely attentive and helpful. Made sure we always had what we needed, and made this party of six very happy!

The Cheesecake Factory was alright. My older sister and I went here to celebrate our birthdays since they are two days apart. The salted caramel cheesecake was delicious and so was the other food we ordered but it took forever for the service. We ordered our beer and got it awhile after we ordered and then we waited forever to get another. They were too busy for their own good. The server was super nice but they were too busy.

I love Cheesecake Factory. I always get the hibachi steak. It was great as per usual. The issue comes down to service. The gent that was serving my girlfriend and I was more MIA than present. From our perspective, it seemed as if the restaurant wasn&#39;t busy. My girlfriend and I looked over at the surrounding tables in the server&#39;s section, and we all seemed lost that we were not getting taken care of. Another issue was the bathroom. It&#39;s Cheesecake Factory, they pride themselves over having a clean bathrooms and kitchens. This bathroom was gross. Maybe I needed to pee at a really inconvenient time for the staff to do their job and clean a messy bathroom. The bathroom had used toilet paper on the ground, a mirror that looked like someone spat on it. And of course the traditional pee all over the floor... Check your tables. Clean the bathroom. Food was incredible.

I usually love The Cheesecake Factory. This location however has the absolute worst service. From forgetting to seat us after our buzzer went off. Left us standing at the front for 15 min. To seating us. We sat for another 10-15 min before the server finally brought us our drinks. (He had visited the table 4 times after he took the drink order without bringing them. Then we waited almost a half hour to get our food. Asked for napkins and was forgotten. I get it&#39;s not an easy gig but when you drop $100 for dinner, you expect better service

I&#39;m writing this as I sit at the BAR because despite the fact there are four people working back there, service is poor at best. We waited forever to get acknowledged and then never had our waters refilled. Not even once. This is at the bar. Where you are directly in front of the wait staff. Are they blind? It can&#39;t be that they&#39;re understaffed. There&#39;s a million wait staff walking around to the point it&#39;s hard to walk through Cheesecake Factory without having to dodge through them like its the Super Bowl. Oh no, they don&#39;t move of your way. You make room for them. <br><br>Maybe because they just opened but from the reviews below, they&#39;ve got a long way to go. <br><br>Also, thanks bartender when I told you I WASNT finished with my burger, you looked me right in the eye and took it away.

Such a bad experience. Came here on a Tuesday afternoon to enjoy a meal with my mom and niece.  We were so excited because we love the restaurant in general. But our presence was not welcomed. We had a &#34;waiter&#34; named Connor who seemed to bring his baggage to work. He was very distant and hardly interacting with us. Literally took our order, brought the water, and came back with our bill. When we asked him for my nieces apple juice that came with the meal that she did not receive he got angry and defensive stating that we didn&#39;t tell him we wanted it. What happened to &#34;sorry about that mam, I&#39;ll bring out the juice right now&#34; instead he stood around for a minute chatting to another waiter. Im a manager in customer service and I would be upset to see my employees talking this way to customers.<br><br>We received &#34;more help&#34; from other waiters walking by vs Connor. When we let the food runner know we were splitting our plate he said &#34;ok&#34; and walked away. No extra plate? <br><br>If you want a nice dining experience do not go here.<br>30 bucks I could have spent to make a meal at home and be treated with respect. We didn&#39;t even stay for dessert. We took our service elsewhere.<br><br>I&#39;m unsure if this restaurant is for trainees but it seemed like everyone was just hanging out at the registers vs engaging with their customers. <br><br>This place needs Gordon Ramsey from kitchen nightmares.

They always have long lines around dinner time.  We sat outside, and it was really nice.  I would recommend their loaded tater tots!  They are really good and crispy.  I tried the avocado egg rolls for the first time here.  It was pretty good, but I wouldn&#39;t say I would actually get it again.  But it&#39;s definitely something new to try.

I was skeptical about coming to this Cheesecake Factory because of the negative reviews , however because I&#39;ve never been to this location before I decided to check it out for myself and I&#39;m glad I did. <br><br>First we only had to wait 15 minutes which was amazing for a Friday . Upon being seated our waitress immediately came and got our drink order. Once the food came everything was delicious . Our server Corinne checked in on us regularly to make sure everything was okay . Overall great customer service from the moment we walked in. Everyone else around me seems pretty happy too so I&#39;m not sure what the negative reviews are about . <br><br>Service was so good that it inspired me<br>To write my first Yelp review .

The food is really filling here, although it is quite expensive but it is a Cheesecake Factory so one can&#39;t complain. Getting seats might but difficult especially if you come with a bigger party but reservations should help out. The floors were slippery the day I went and I don&#39;t know if it&#39;s a common thing or someone spilled something so just be careful, sometimes people come in heels and you wouldn&#39;t want to slip! Service is quick and there are two main exits, though the elevator is usually congested. The lighting in this location is very dim if you want that to set the mood; however, it&#39;s pretty bad to take pictures in.

I was so excited to see the new place at santa monica. Went to the bar looks likes all the the cheescakes nothing much has change there. Bartenders were great food was good to. They were out of tex mex eggrolls:(. <br>       The only thing that did bother me was when they told us we had to leave. There was more guest inside the place as well so why can they stay and I had to leave. Felt very uncomfortable as they were rushing me down the elevator to leave. As a manager you have to know how to talk to guest in different situations. And theese two guys we&#39;re not professional at all.1 star for management he ruined for everyone.

I&#39;m giving this a 5 star rating only because of the face that I had a very amazing server.  I sat on the terrace in Kameron&#39;s section. He was very attentive to me as well as the other tables around him. He was very kind, and was not ashamed to show off his beautiful smile. Anytime I return to this location I will make sure I request his section every time. Thank you Kameron for making my experience here a great one.

Hello,<br>I recently visitied the Cheesecake factory Santa Monica and had an awful experience. My family and I went in for dinner around 450 pm.  We waited for 1 hour and was never served our complete meal. Our waitress checked in on us  approximately 5 times ensuring that our dinner was on its way. Our 2 kids meals came out and they looked old as if they had been sitting under heat lamps.  Next, we were told there was an accident in the kitchen and our pasta had been overcooked, so we chose a different noodle for our 4 cheese and Tomato basil pasta.  In about 15 minutes my Daughter recieved her 4 cheese pasta. With the ruined noodles! it was not what she reordered. We asked to speak to a manager to find out what was going on and what was taking so long. They came to our table in about 5 minutes with another 4 cheese Pasta (not my order of tomato basil). This was the worse resturant experience I have ever had. Im still in shock. Not to mention through the entire hour we spent waiting my Husbands Salmon/Steak meal was never mentioned, I doubt they ever prepared it.
The food is always good there but the wait times for service is way to long. Every time o visit Santa Monica this place is packed and I can&#39;t really enjoy the atmosphere .

Bad service. Both forks had dried food on it. The chicken was not a good cut. There is a reason why this restaurant has a bad rating. Other cheese cake factory&#39;s ive been to are good. Choose a different place to eat in the area if you have the option.

Our food was out of this world....besides that.....our server was completely nuts....she three different accents that she faked. British...Australian ...I think...and American....she was up my rear to take my pate..3 times asking if I was done. Coming too many times to the table...my fork was literally in my mouth...&#34;are you done&#34;? Just weird.
Get your act together. Your customer service sucks. In the middle of the day in the middle of the week a girl can&#39;t get any service sitting in the bar area with hardly anyone else there.
This place is huge and awesome place to socialize! The server is so awesome and cool! Name is Tyson!  Great place for big gatherings.

By far the worst Cheesecake Factory I have ever been to.   The service is horrible.. I mean horrible. All you have to do is follow the other 10 million cheesecake factories and you should be okay,but apparently that&#39;s also hard to do.  This place is ridiculous.  Maybe the last time I will ever go to a Cheesecake Factory.

Very disappointed  with the food and service. First the hostess seats us at a table and when the waiter comes over he said we would have to move to the bar area for happy hour. We move and sat down. Second waitress comes over and said we would need to talk to the hostess about moving to this table because it was not set up for happy hour. Go to the hostess and she could tell by now I was starting to boil over. She took us right back the same table and we started all over again. We order the Nachos, a Greek salad, Macaroni balls, and some Tex Mex rolls. OMG!! the nachos were disgusting with that cheap wax cheese that can last a nuclear war. The salad was nothing special and the macaroni balls were below average. I would not recommend this Cheesecake Factory to anyone.

This was my first time at the Cheesecake Factory- and while I know it&#39;s a hotspot for celebratory dinners- it is a really good &#39;casual&#39; lunch spot. I do love how they give you a bread basket, especially since I was starved and couldn&#39;t wait for my food! I ended up ordering the veggie burger (from the regular menu) they have one on the skinny menu but for $1 more you get fontina cheese and a bigger patty...yes please. The party is made from mushrooms and quinoa and isn&#39;t a traditional garden burger which I appreciated. It was flavorful and had great texture and was very satisfying. I got it with a side salad and that was ehhhh, probably should have gotten fries. Overall, I would come back for the veggie burger :).

They are new, and the staff isn&#39;t well trained enough, or the waiters have too many tables.  The wife flagged down the manager to take our order.  The food is good.  We both got the salmon.  Mine was bigger and the correct temperature, while her was the smaller one on the skinny menu and a little overlooked.  I gave her mine.  <br>I&#39;m sure they&#39;ll get better help, or the waiters will get better over time.  Also the estimate on the wait on a Saturday night was accurate, and we waited less than 20 minutes.  Totally acceptable.  We will be back.

Worst cheesecake dining experience we&#39;ve ever had; food great, everything else on par with McDonald&#39;s. Overkill on wait, empty tables everywhere (tells me the didn&#39;t staff right). Once beeped to go to the counter, had to wait again for another five min while they cleaned the table we&#39;d be sitting at... Then sat down only to wait another ten min for drink order, another 7 for drinks to show up and 30 for our app. We left after that, decided not to eat, ran out of time!

One the biggest CFs I have ever seen. I came in for half-priced cheesecakes so it was crowded. Our table was wet and the silverware was laying in the water. Gross. Service was lagging and I am going to blame the crowd for that. My food was okay and my cheesecake was great. My waitress seemed like she was trying her best so I am willing to give this location another chance.

The portions seemed to have been reduced on the Santa Fe Salad and the Cobb Salad. They were too small compared to other times that I have seen at other locations. It seems that the quantity is not consistent at all locations. The Cobb Salad was not chopped and I found hair in the Santa Fe Salad. Also, it was my wife&#39;s birthday and she got a small cup of ice cream with whipped cream, in the past you got a cheesecake.

I visited this place only once and it was not very good experience. We reserved table outside, but it turned out to be under scorching sun. All this fuss with tables took about 20 min and finally they found a place for us inside. <br>About meal - everything was OK. We ordered chicken with mushed potatoes, some rice, vegetables and something else. The portions were quite large<br>Oh, and I almost forgot to tell about the dirty utensils. The restaurant should carefully monitor the cleanliness of tableware.<br><br>So, I put 3 stars only because of delicious food and a good waitress. Actually they deserve 2

Tried to place my order ahead of time so I could come and pick it up quickly. I called and immediately got transferred. The next 15 minutes, the same time it took me to get there, I was on hold.
