I managed to get to the Santa&#39;s Monica Place shopping center, walk all the way up to their counter, and was still on hold. This would be fine if it was packed, but no, it wasn&#39;t. All the employees (host and bakery) were just sitting around chatting, literally doing nothing. Yet, for some reason, I was on hold? What&#39;s the deal Cheesecake Factory?!?

The bartender is alone so it takes about 5 minutes until he get to you unless your a women then the service was there for her. while you keep waiting on this bartender. my food came out and had to wait on the bartender for service so my food got cold and then waited some more because he acted like the server couldn&#39;t help him out.... SAD!!!!!!! so he can eat while I waited that long for service. wow... next you poor a drink or help someone try washing your hands and help the guest.... the food was okay the Nashville hot were over cooked and I am just trying to eat it and leave. I am still Hungary and can&#39;t even get service
I love cheesecake but this one totally turned me off ..... I had hair in 2 food items ! And on top of that our server was rude .

If it wasn&#39;t for the great service that I got from the waiter, I would be much more pissed. We ordered two different burgers off the menu. Both had beef that was overdone. It was burnt. There was fat dripping out of the burger. There was no bacon from which fat would be dripping from. The fat was coming out of the beef. The gluten free bun was completely soggy and after two bites turned into a mush. The waiter apologized, but it is obviously not his fault that the kitchen was not up to standards. There were tables next to us that were also having issues with their meals and unfortunately for the waiter we had, it was also his table. I haven&#39;t been to this location in about a year and this has been one of worst meals that I&#39;ve had at this chain.
So far not good guys---didn&#39;t get any service at all not even water and bread.  4 servers were free and chatting, Ive made eye contact and nothing.  Tsk tsk.  done with this location.

I dined for lunch with my friends on 8-20-19. We had Corwin as our server. It took about a good 20 minutes to get our brown bread and our drinks. The Ice Tea was never refilled. I had the Grilled Pork Chop was hot in temperature. My sides were the Mixed Greens Salad with the Balsamic Vinaigrette and the side salad was fresh. I ordered the sweet potato fries with no seasoning and no sea salt. The sweet potato fries that was on my plate was still lightly seasoned. I was not the only one at my table that ordered the sweet potato fries with no salt and no seasoning. All three of my friends had lightly seasoned on there sweet potato fries so we all mentioned to our server to redo another batch. The manager came over  without the other batch to give us the attitude that the second batch was the same as the first and wanted to argue with the whole table.  We were too hungry to argue with the manager!
Very good view, very very BELOW average food and service. I would pick any other Cheesecake Factory over this one and so should you lol

I really enjoyed this Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s definitely unlike any I&#39;ve been to, and we decided to dine outside with a rooftop view of the Promenade. <br><br>For a Sunday evening it was not too busy, surprisingly. The food was highly enjoyable and service was prompt. I gave it four stars because the hostess was snobby and rude (I don&#39;t know her name but she&#39;s African American- a fair warning to not get turned off by the place if she&#39;s having another bad day). If it wasn&#39;t for her, I&#39;d have nothing bad to say about my experience here!

I can&#39;t believe that the restaurant Zengo and Sandia closed down so that a Cheesecake Factory can open in there place. I went in for dinner and it was super busy but it didn&#39;t take long for us to sit, after that everything went down hill. The food was Ok not horrible, the starter was better then my actual entree, we got the nachos. This review is mainly for the service, I only saw my server 2 times, when she took my order and dropped off my check she never refilled my drink or cared to see if I needed something else. I should have not tipped her because she certainly didn&#39;t deserve it, but I left her 15% and she should be happy because other people would have just walked away.

Overall experience was great. Had to wait like 20 minutes to be seated and then 15 to get my order taken. Our servers name was Yolanda. She came by took our order and that was that. Another server came by and asks how we were doing and asked if everything was ok his name is Ryan, and I called him &#34;Ryan to the rescue&#34; he seemed to always be there when we needed something. The food was absolute amazing I had the Chicken Marseille and my girl had the Chicken Tostallo ( I might be mispelling the name). We sat in the patio area overlooking the mall, the atmosphere was great, an overall great ambience. I definitely recommend.

We had a great waitress and I regret that I did not get her name. I will say the service tends to be a bit slow but I feel it was excellent service, and since we were not in a rush and my cousins were in town, we simply enjoyed the slow service. This cheesecake factory is absolutely a very busy place and our food was great. I&#39;m definitely not digging the way they do the better now though. It used to come in small little packets and now it comes in a big fat slab. We always enjoy the lemon herb roasted chicken with extra carrots instead of potatoes, this particular time we also had the macaroni and cheese balls which are pretty good.  This night we ate out on the patio and it was really nice change from eating inside.

Getting serviced was a hassle. My gf n I had to keep an eye out for our server to attend us  and top of that when we sat down the silverware were dirty. It had coffee stains  and hard crumbs . And took forever to get checkout

Having so many restaurants to choose in the area, Cheesecake, is often not at the top of our lists, but it&#39;s a great place for large groups. The menu is still as large as ever, but I was pleasantly surprised by the lettuce wraps (which was enough for a meal), and the salmon lunch special. I didn&#39;t feel like I left feeling like a whale!

If I could give this location a negative (3rd street) I would. The service was out of this world horrendous. Our food literally was sitting under a hot lamp for at least 45 minutes. The food came out dry and crusted. The children&#39;s pizza was like cardboard with melted cheese. I did my best to keep my cool; however it was just impossible not to be upset.<br>1. Stale, dry bread.<br>2. The waiter spat on me whilst taking the order.<br>3. He also had a disgusting booger hanging from his right nostril.<br>4. The food was late, cold, and crusty.<br>5. Management was subpar and the waiter had the audacity to tell me my food was comped. No sir it was not, the gross stale food was returned untouched.<br>6. The bathroom was a bloody disgusting mess.<br>This experience left me unbothered mostly due to hygiene and the lack of quality in management. If management is less than great, then so will your staff. I will never return and they need to be closed for grossness.
Great cheesecake, but the waiter forgot my latte after asking for it twice. Opening week jitters I guess. Great patio, lovely décor.

Stopped at this location for the first time to grab dinner with my wife after work. Arrived at 8:15 and promptly seated in a beautiful view seat. That&#39;s where the beauty of this place ended. Ordered drinks and an appetizer immediately. Appetizer arrived within 5 minutes. Drinks never arrived. I finally walked up to the bar and retrieved 2 glasses and fillet them with water myself. Waitress finally came after 25min and asked why we had a picture of water. I told her why and she had the audacity to tell me they use different cups for water. Duh. There&#39;s more to this waste but long story short we got up and walked out. I should have looked at the Yelp rating. There&#39;s no reason that location should be rated so low. Time to replace the management at this failed establishment.

Im only giving 1 star because I took my parents and my 5 year old son out to dinner last night at this Cheesecake Factory down the street from my home, during our dinner one of the waiters (not ours) dropped an entire tray of glasses right next to our table, they cleaned It up we had to call them back to clean extra pieces they didn&#39;t see which is okay, 20 min later my mother put her hand on her booth cushion and there was a piece of glass there that cut the top of her finger causing It to bleed, one waiter came by took the glass away then apologized, our waiter came by and apologized again, I believe she was the manager or supervisor but her name was Marina and she came by to ask if my mother was okay then our waiter brought her neosporin and a bandaid which I do appreciate. However, We asked for the bill after and when I checked It nothing at all was comped. If I am a manager at a restaurant this big and known I am going to do whatever is in my power to make sure my customers are okay and have a great enough experience to want to keep coming back! If one of my customers cuts their finger on some glass that my staff not only broke but failed to clean up properly, I am going to take care of them to ensure they felt comfortable enough to return. Unfortunately I do not feel that way at all and I am truly disappointed. Hopefully they will handle future situations like mine differently!!

Our server Pam was very nice and funny she made us feel like we were back home in Boston. We got our food and drinks really fast and everything was perfect. Thank you Pam for making our experience great!!
Long wait as usual but went to the bar and found seats quick. Service was great food came out fast, drinks were on point !!  Came to celebrate a birthday it was a great choice

Looks like I only have to warn people if there something wrong with a place. Restaurant was 30% full and we were denied to sit at the outdoor patio for no reason. The hostess was not welcoming or accommodating us at the place where we wanted to sit. In fact, she left her station and never can back.

This place looks great but the service is terrible. The servers aren&#39;t very friendly and they take forever to bring your drinks bring you your bread. They are slow to put in your order for the food and it can take up to 20+ minutes just to get the food that you ordered, even when it&#39;s a salad or a sandwich and soup. They are often out of the ingredients that you need for example when I went for lunch today they were not serving anything with turkey and did not offer to substitute the turkey for anything else so we had to order completely different items off of the menu. The last two times I ordered soup came out and was not appetizing. The servers really check in to see how the food is doing. This place needs some help!

One of my favorite locations.  Sure its new, but the environment they&#39;ve created both indoors and outdoors is not only welcoming, but aesthetically pleasing.  The food we ordered was tasty and items that we would definitely recommend.  The crab cakes are a must.  The pasta carbonara was filling and delicious and the lemon herb roasted chicken with the mashed potatoes was well seasoned and flavorful.
Very dirty! Check your plates and utensils. We change our utensils 3 times! Imagine how clean they prepare their food.

Most unusual and memorable restaurant experience I have had. Not in a good way. The customary process of sit, order, eat and pay was a challenge here. We went to the bathroom between dinner and dessert and when we came back the dinner dishes were cleared. A moment later, a hostess tried to seat a party at the table. We told her we were waiting for our dessert, and - by the way - had not paid our check. Over the ensuing minutes, a series of increasingly responsible restaurant staff came over and confronted us, accusing us of various and sundry misdeeds, including &#34;self-seating&#34; and demanding that we leave the restaurant. A young woman did an exceptional impersonation of Columbo, demanding that we describe our waiter in detail and explain - if we had eaten - where the dishes and our drinks were (&#34;We don&#39;t clear the drinks after dinner&#34;). Finally the manager came over and started the same routine, I responded as before. At this point I didn&#39;t even care about the desserts, but kept reminding them that I had not paid a check. Finally, they located the waiter and the manager came back to explain that there had been a series of mishaps: table number was in the computer wrong, then the bussers thought we left when we went to the bathroom, then the desserts fell over before they could be served. I don&#39;t think he really apologized for those mistakes, and hey, things happen. But he definitely did not apologize for several members of the restaurant staff accusing us of all manner of misdeeds and crimes and trying to kick us out of the restaurant. He &#34;graciously&#34; took one of the desserts off the check. For having been embarrassed, interrogated and accused (because of their series of mistakes), I got $8 off. And since this is an entirely honest review, I conclude by saying that the carrot cake was awesome. <br><br>Don&#39;t go here. If the front of the house is in this much disarray, the kitchen must be as frightening as the attitudes of the staff.

The food was okay and the server was good. However, the hostesses were totally incompetent. <br><br>The line was out the door and all 3 hostesses were staring at the screen. None of the hostesses were taking down guest names or greeting any guests. Then they misquoted the seating time.<br><br>However, the worst of it was that they didn&#39;t even ask if it was okay with us to sit on the patio. Had it been a warmer day I wouldn&#39;t have minded, but it was FREEZING cold and extremely windy. They didn&#39;t even ask &#34;are you okay with whatever is available first.&#34; They pretty much gave us zero warning that we would be sitting outside. <br><br>As we were being seated at our table I complained to the hostess that it was too cold to sit outside and she was very dismissive. I don&#39;t even understand why they were seating any guests outside when it was so cold, especially when I passed by at least 15 open tables inside. <br><br>This pretty much ruined the entire experience because it was so cold and windy that my food got cold. They really need to re-train the hostesses.

The Cheesecake Factory is one of our favorite spots no matter where we are. I halted that though today when we went to the Santa Monica location. We arrived at 11:30, nobody in the bar area, which is where we usually find quick seating. It took a very long time for someone to acknowledge us, and when he did, it seemed we were of a bother to him. While he brought out water right away and an appetizer, he brought our iced tea and bread well after we finished the appetizer. Meanwhile several others seated in the bar area at the high tops where he attended to their needs quickly, forgetting to attend or follow up with us for our order. After 15 minutes or more, he took our order, then the other tables and then disappeared for what seemed like at least 20 minutes or more. He brought out food to the table next to us which sat well after we did, and then brought one of us our order which was a cold flat bread pizza. While one of us waited and watched other tables being served their food, I saw what appeared to be the salad that I ordered go to another table. When I mentioned that we have been waiting, the waiter, &#34;Basil B&#34; said they were waiting for a component of my salad to be made. I said then how did the table two over receive the same salad when they sat well after us. &#34;Basil B&#34; completely passed over my comment and said that he was waiting for my salad, well after my friend was already done with his pizza and salad. Never apologized and when the salad finally came, didn&#39;t have any dressing on it, which I asked for extra on the side, then brought me the wrong dressing. When I asked &#34;Basil B&#34; for the right dressing I got an attitude as if I was bothering him. Of all the times I have been to The Cheesecake Factory I have NEVER been treated so disrespectfully. When I looked over at the Manager, he seemed to not even care as well. I was so pissed off with this experience, no body even trying to make it right makes me want to never go back to Cheesecake, at least at this location. Terrible experience!

$78.00 tip charge onto my card  for a $21.00 check? Lol Really? I had a few issues in the past with either my food or service at other locations but this tops it. I had to go through a hassle trying to clear that up. Thanks!  (But no thanks) plus the food this time around was mediocre so with that being said I wish I can give &#34;0&#34; stars.

To start off I rarely take the time to review anything positive or negative. However my experience at Cheesecake Factory was awful. I&#39;m not a fan of most chains as I try and eat at smaller scale establishments. Before you say he&#39;s another snob that only expects the best experience at only the coolest joints, I&#39;m a huge fan all kinds of out of dinner and comfort food as much at the sushi I eat on a regular basis. I&#39;m rambling ...<br><br>I went into the new CF after watching The Reverent (great gritty film) with my fiancé. She asked if I would want to go to CF (she knows I&#39;m not a fan) jokingly. And I actually said, &#34;sure!&#34; To her surprise. The hostess promptly sat us in the bar table area. My fiancé went to the restroom and I returned a call while waiting at our table for her to get back so we could order.  She came back sat down as I continued my phone conversation for anther 3-4 minutes<br><br>My fiancé and I chat some more after the call and we hadn&#39;t been asked out drink order or had approached us yet. We looked around to make eye contact with a server since we didn&#39;t know which was ours. We saw a table next to us that had 4 waiters around it with one waiter rubbing the shoulders of someone at the table. I assumed it was someone that worked there and everyone was stopping by to say hi.<br><br>My fiancé and I both tried to make eye contact and my fiancé even tried to get their attention by saying &#34;excuse me&#34; with one of these servers standing next to us. And when we did they avoided our gaze and probably didn&#39;t hear her since it was loud, they walked away for us.   At this point we realized it had been a while since we sat down with no on approaching us.  I looked at my phone to see how long it had been since my phone call and realized we had been sitting at the table for 18-20 minutes and no one approached, dropped off water...  NOTHING.  <br><br>We told the manager Ernesto on our way out. I&#39;ll say he tried to make it right by offering us a new seat, but we weren&#39;t willing to stay any longer. I was resistant before I went in and now the nail is in the coffin.  Systemic poor service along with a menu that fosters obesity....never again!

People need to take it easy on this place; it&#39;s a new restaurant with new employees that are doing their best. I went in today &amp; had pretty good service. I not only had one server attend to me, but two! So there you go, the servers want to make sure that your being helped. My food came out quick &amp; right. The salad was delicious ! I got the lunch portion which was still a big portion. I&#39;ll be coming back here again hopefully with the same staff I saw today :)

Cheesecake Factory you deserve these 5 starts thank you for your great services and keep up the good work..over all great service..what people are complaining about is just ridiculous..thank you for making our night great

Your standard Cheesecake Factory experience. Large portion sizes, great ambience, and fantastic service (albeit slow - be prepared to spend at least an hour in the resturant over a proper meal). Couldn&#39;t really ask for much more. I personally think the food at The Cheesecake Factory is a little pricey and could better be improved on the pallete, but overall a fine resturant to go for brunch, lunch, or dinner.

The wait was for 20min on Sunday night. Our waiteress was really nice. I tried americana cheeseburger with fries. I loved it. I recommend velvet cheesecake. It is so big I had finish it at home. We were seated next to the window under AC and it was pretty cold. I was sitting in my jacket the whole time. The thing I don&#39;t like about this place is the smell it has inside.

Sure wish I read the reviews before going last night.  Let&#39;s be clear- the problems with this place are due to poor management. Yes the service is the worst but I blame management. Seriously hire more servers and kitchen staff and a lot of your problems will be solved. You walk in and a very frenzied woman is at the front who hardly looks up from her screen and forget being greeted with a smile and any eye contact. It&#39;s a long wait time when inside and outside had a lot of empty tables and you&#39;re told they don&#39;t have enough servers. We ordered as soon as we sat but it was painfully long for everything to come.  After taking our check and walking the city block size restaurant to find someone we could pay and leave so the bad experience was over I found our server and he understood our frustration. He said he has had other server jobs and this is the worst place he has ever worked. Food was decent but didn&#39;t really matter after the poor service. Bottom line- don&#39;t eat here!

So today I went to the Santa Monica cheesecake. I have been here before a handful of times. And the service has always been good. Today though was a different story. After watching a movie at arclight with a friend, we decided to pass by and have something to eat. We were promptly seated at 3pm. But, by 3:21 we had not been acknowledged by any one beside the hostess. We informed the hostess in the front and said she would get somebody to help us. Nobody came once again. It wasn&#39;t that busy and we even saw some waiters standing around and talking. At that moment we decided to leave and decided to to go to Sonoma wine which is right next door. I love coming to the cheesecake factories in the marina and the grocery. But, santa Monica is off my list now. Very disappointed since it&#39;s in my neighborhood.

My boyfriend and I were visiting from Washington State, so it was our first time at the Cheesecake Factory in California. <br>The waiting was fairly short, about five minutes when the restaurant was barely full (6 pm). Waiter took a while to greet us, but we had our menus so we were browsing. We ordered and received our waters. The food arrived fairly quick as well and tasted delicious. <br>But, the reason for my low review was the service I received from the waiter. We did not receive a napkin until we asked because no one had come by. We got a napkin when we were about 3/4 done with our food. We also did no receive any bread for appetizer. I thought it was just a Washington State tradition so we did not request it. As we were walking out of the restaurant I noticed that only our section of the restaurant with the specific waiter did not receive bread. Service should be the same throughout the restaurant and I feel like receiving napkin and break should be the basis of it. <br>Also, waiter gave us our check before we were finished with our food and we felt extremely rushed and unwelcomed in the restaurant.
Came for a lunch service. Server barely gave us any recognition. The bread was incredibly stale. Food took forever. Server completely ignored me twice. Do yourself a favor and do not come here.

The food was incredibly delicious (we took chicken Madeira) and the plates were really big. One plate will be more than enough for two. The cheesecake was delicious as always. The service was good too. I don&#39;t know why they have a low rating on yelp, I think they deserve more.
This place is always crowded. The service was nice and friendly, but slow. I ordered farfalle pasta, very delicious. I recommend it. They always serve bread with butter. Overall, everything is good.

The worst experience ever! The plates and napkins were dirty, the foods were very greasy, they did not have any avocado in the kitchen! The only good thing in the restaurant was the friendly hostess in back door.

If I could give this place a zero star I would. Genuinely, the worst service I&#39;ve ever experienced at any Cheesecake Factory... like ever!!!. I really wish I&#39;d yelped it before, then I would have seen the 2 and a half stars. The hostess greeting us looked sullen and miserable, not even a smile. They were not family friendly, I had to ask for a high chair. The place was empty and yet it took them 1 hour to serve us the food. By that point we were all starving and fed up. My kid knocked over a soda and I had to get someone to mop it up and they still left the mess on the floor, which became slippery and dangerous. I also had to ask them twice to get a soda refill for the spilt soda. To make it worse, my family were in town and I suggested this place, so we wasted two hours of our life here and it really ruined our day. I wish I&#39;d just gone straight to the Pier and bought a hotdog, at least I would&#39;ve gotten a smile. DO NOT EAT HERE... and they had the nerve to ask for a tip LOL!!!!

Our waiter Conor was great even though the place was busy! The food, however, was not that good. I had the Bang Bang Chicken &amp; Shrimp, and it wasn&#39;t as good as I&#39;ve had it at other locations. The brown rice was undercooked and crunchy. The sauce was too sweet and not slightly spicy like it&#39;s supposed to be. The portions seem to be smaller at least at this location. My plate had only 2 shrimp so I felt like it&#39;s misleading to call a dish chicken and shrimp when there&#39;s barely any shrimp and barely any chicken. For 4 people, we spent $100 plus tip, and just didn&#39;t feel we got what we paid for. They don&#39;t even do anything special for birthdays anymore except clap.    Very disappointing for a birthday dinner. Nothing special about the food either. The rest of us had burgers and pasta carbonara. They forgot to bring the fries with the burgers until we had to ask for it. It makes no sense for them not to leave condiments like ketchup, mustard, and sugar at the table so the waiters don&#39;t have to keep going back and forth. We were all dissatisfied with the food so we tried to fill up on the bread instead because we hadn&#39;t eaten all day. At least, the bread was ok. We won&#39;t be coming back here. The management and cooks need to be swapped out.

Waiting for my food as I write this review. Second time coming here and I regret it. Absolutely no plates on the table with the butter and bread and my drink came dripping in a mess and I feel too disgusted to drink it. I was asked if I want water and I said no and it was still brought. Maybe I&#39;m being picky but idk... my food better be good..... nope it was BAD... never again!!! Wow...even the orange juice I got for my mom tastes like water. Waste of my money!!!

This place is nothing like a cheesecake factory. After waiting 1hour we sat is a tight place, and we were offered only 1 basket of stale bread. When we complained to our server he was too nice to just through the wheat and bring back the same two pieces of sour dough instead of changing it with fresh bread. The Nacho was sloppy and cold. All the food was just heated and was not freshly cooked. I asked for the management to hear the excuse for the bad food and service but no one bothered to come and talk to us. <br>I should say, this place is an embarrassment for cheesecake factory corporate. They should fix it or close it before more people have this impression about cheesecake factory restaurants.
Very bad service. I had to wait for my order more then one hour because they mixed some orders. After that they charged me two times for the same thing. I am not coming back there.

Our server, Bianca, provided the best service for us on Friday at lunch time. She took my wife&#39;s vegan order so well, that my wife was elated when she took a taste of it. My wife is an extremely picky eater, but this vegan sandwich was exceptional. She told Bianca, that it was the best vegan sandwich that she ever had. My wife is also an excellent cook, so she can tell the difference between good and bad food. Great place to eat and we are going back definitely.

I tried to stay away from reviewing because I usually dont care for it but these are one of those times I feel it necessary. A week ago I went there with my family and we were celebrating my new job. Usually its crowded but this night wasn&#39;t so bad which is why I dont know why the servers were having such a hard time listening to my wife and me. To get their attention my wife literally had to shout to stop the waiter we had been sitting for a long time without anyone getting anything we asked for overall we got our food and it wasn&#39;t even prepared the way we asked. When we tried to ask nicely for the adjustments we were either forgotten or ignored. In the end I sent a review via the receipt survey and we were called by the manager to return. I spent about 80 that night and they tried to buy me back with a 20. I hate to waste my time with this nonsense but this wasn&#39;t the first time they screwed me and my family over. Sure as hell will be the last.

DO NOT RECOMMEND <br>-Rude Service <br>-Rude Hostess<br>They say customer service is key to the success of any client based establishment &amp; first impressions or customer greetings go a long away. Went on a dinner date with the hubby early Sunday evening called ahead &amp; was told 10-15 minute wait for a table for two. Got a pager &amp; waited &amp; waited &amp; waited several minutes passed &amp; we noticed someone had left their pager behind on the lobby seat &amp; it was going off so we decided to turn it in &amp; be honest about it that though it wasn&#39;t ours we wished to turn it in &amp; since we were waiting for a table &amp; whom ever had left that pager behind wasn&#39;t going to use the seats could we take their place?? Blonde hostess double checked with another dark haired girl behind the hostess counter to see if it was ok &amp; 2nd girl said NO, mumbled something under her breathe &amp; gave us her back umm O.K. we figured there wasn&#39;t much time left to wait on our pager anyways &amp; gave them the benefit of the doubt perhaps it was a table seating larger group whom the pager we turned in belonged to. We waited &amp; waited &amp; waited saw other groups being called, we were so hungry by this point &amp; noticed a couple whom had arrived long time after us called to be seated I couldn&#39;t believe this?! I spoke to the blonde hostess again asked for an explanation why was there a hold up on our pager when we already had been waiting 20minutes if not more after double checking our phones on the time &amp; other couples were being called who&#39;d arrived later. She tried double checking our pager to see what happened &amp; apologized for the process, she asked the same Rude dark haired girl with the receding hair line, blue eyes, &amp; brown matte lipstick from last time behind the hostess counter who seemed to be in charge of monitoring the pagers on the computer screen, I asked to know what happened, the dark haired girl just muttered you&#39;ll be seated O.K. that didn&#39;t answer my question obviously something is either screwed with their system or pagers are falling off the grid, I persisted can you tell me what happened I don&#39;t understand earlier we were nice to return a forgotten pager &amp; honest to admit it wasn&#39;t ours but request the table paged because we&#39;d already been waiting little over 10 minutes which had been granted was the wait time anyways for us &amp; was blatantly without regard denied &amp; now your dismissing our request for an explanation?! again she replied you&#39;ll be seated pursed her lips &amp; gave us her back wOw. I was stunned this was the most disrespectful disregard to clientele satisfaction I&#39;ve ever experienced, no apology, no B.S. excuse at the least for having dropped the ball &amp; not having called us, no restaurant courtesy compliments for the faux pas plus blatantly rude behavior from the dark haired miserable hostess with receding hairline. Computer error can be easily dismissed, rude miserable attitude towards dining customers??? I don&#39;t think so. It&#39;s sad that that girl is one of the first things you meet because otherwise the rest of the staff, ambiance, hostesses, servers are totally on pointe on trying to make your dining experience elegant &amp; tasteful, but that dark haired hostess just totally brought the experience to shoot down the drain from the start. (2 stars out of consideration for our wonderful waitress &amp; the blonde hair hostess, she was super nice otherwise this would be 1 star review).

CANCEL ALL OTHER PLANS IF YOU COME HERE. Number worst cheesecake factory ever. They cant handle more than 10 people in the resturant which there always is. Quoted 25 minutes for seating took an hour just to have the buzzer go off then was told to wait to the side they never even printed out our paper waited ten more minutes just to realize that told them and then they still put my placement last. After seating took another 30 minutes just to get water !!! Another 10 mintues to get bread which was uncutable put our order in right away been at this cruddy place for over an hour and theres still no food. If you want to be turned off from the Cheesecake factory this is the place to go. Seriously don&#39;t waste your money here

I was last at The Cheesecake Factory in Santa Monica was maybe a year ago and I found both service and food very good. When my party of six was ready to feast after completing the Alzheimer&#39;s walk I suggested Santa Monica place and everyone was ecstatic about seeing The Cheesecake Factory as the perfect choice . First , I must say we were seated promptly in a booth. As we read over the menu, my friend felt a drop of liquid on his head. We looked up and vents , I&#39;m guessing air conditioning vents, had droplets of condensation. We told our server we needed to be moved and why. He said he had to check with his hostess/manager. So about 5-7 mins later the server and manager , thankfully, moved us to another table and we were not seated under anything dripping. Secondly , our new server was wonderful and our food was quite tasty. You may ask why only two stars, well ,  the management did not cordon off the booths and let other dining guests be seated along that side of the restaurant  before the issue with their vents could be fixed. Dripping condensation over guests and their food is totally unacceptable.

Gluttony at its best...you will never be disappointed. Order what sounds good and it is! Very large portions. I&#39;d recommend splitting the meatloaf then you&#39;ll have room for dessert. Always a busy place so don&#39;t expect lingering service.

This is the worst Cheesecake Factory ever! Food is bad and old! Service is terrible! Manager is rude and unprofessional. The restaurant was dirty, looked like they haven&#39;t cleaned for months. The manager is not helpful. She didn&#39;t care when I told her my order is missing and old. I used to love this franchise, now I am considering it .

This Cheesecake Factory has seemed a bit off both times I&#39;ve gone. I eat at this chain frequently when travelling and they are always consistent. The food at this location seems to not be prepared as well. Service was slow and not very friendly both times Ive been. Hopefully things improve soon!

All of our food was so salty. The only thing we enjoyed were our beer, wine and the bread. All of our pastas, fried calamari and kids pizza they were all so salty. Love the cheesecake at the Grove. Never coming here again.

Terrible management skills from ADRIANA ARREOLA!! Went here with my friend for happy hour, we ordered several things on the list, one thing we didn&#39;t care for and asked to take back and she refused to refund us the money because &#34;there was nothing wrong with it&#34;. I&#39;ve never been to an establishment where they didn&#39;t accommodate you not liking something. I felt like she was very discriminatory towards us, and not helpful at all as a manager.

Giana is the coolest waitress ever! She put so much effort into making our time here amazing. After we were done eating she wrote everyone of us notes and went the extra mile to make our experience amazing. If you get her as your waitress consider yourself lucky!
Went to Santa Monica for a mini vaca trip for a few days  . Best food and service I&#39;ve ever had at a Cheesecake Factory !
Omg it&#39;s a cheesecake&#39;s paradise. For cheesecakes lovers. It&#39;s so delicious cake here and pasta. Nice roof top view patio.

I really like this place, specially the balcony sitting area that has nice views to the promenade. <br><br>Food as always really good. I always get the Santa Fee salat and the lemon chello cake for desert. Delicious.<br><br>Definitely coming back.

I left here and never want to return. I sat at the bar and Sal was my bartender and he was terrible. Everything I asked him was a slow struggle for him there was no sense of urgency nor did I feel like he wanted to serve/bartend which is crazy because You never know who is going to tip you well or if your dealing with a shopper. Tuesday at 3:45 super slow I was the only person at the bar and he made me feel like he didn&#39;t want to be there nor did he make me feel like I wanted to be there, being promoted to the bar is a privilege not everyone gets that opportunity. I have never felt unwanted at a restaurant that I am paying and tipping well at. One hundred percent zero stars if I could.

We came in for drinks and appetizers at the bar area. It wasn&#39;t very busy since it was around 3pm. We sat at the bar high tables for a while and no help. Waiters and staff running around but no one available to take our order. We stopped a waiter and asked who services our table. He went to find out and never came back with an answer. Finally, a waiter said it wasn&#39;t his area, but that he would help us. That was nice, but when it came time to pay again no one around to help. We stopped a different waiter and asked for our check. We had to be chasing service. What a disappointment. Usually the service at CF is pretty good, but not here. There are so many nice restaurants in Santa Monica why bother with this one.

The cheesecake factory is always good because there&#39;s something on the menu for everyone. However, when planning to go to the cheesecake factory make sure that you were prepared to wait because there&#39;s always a long line for the most part. From time to time, I still find myself dining and enjoying the cheesecake factory.

One of the most terrible restaurant I have ever been in entire of my life. Terrible food, terrible service. They just do not care about customers. Takes forever to replace a dirty folk to clean one. You never get a steak knife once they forget to bring it with food. Not only servers, whole staffs including manager are not willing to listen our complaints with service. Avoid this location if you don&#39;t want to ruin your dinner time.

Love the decor, service, ambience and especially the food. Tried the fettuccini alfredo and mac and cheese glamglow burger and absolutely loved it! Couldn&#39;t eat a desert this time. The service is prompt and quick. Definitely recommend!

I understand this restaurant is new but being such a large chain restaurant I thought they&#39;d have it more together. The hostess told my party a 15<br>minute wait, which I thought was great for a Sunday night. We waited 35 minutes and then decided to check with her on the status. She informed us that she made a mistake and did not program the beeper. I thought okay mistakes happen and it&#39;s a new place. We were seated in a large booth right away which was great. We then waited for over 15 minutes. My wife finally got up to go and find a Manager to alert him of the lack<br>of communication taking place. He came over apologized and offered to buy is an appetizer which was nice. After he took our drink and food order our server finally arrived. She seemed flustered and immediately started to apologize. I felt bad but my immediate thought was why didn&#39;t the Manager communicate to the server that he took out order. Our food came out timely with 4 people bringing our food including the Manager. Unfortunately, one of the serve handed me my plate of food which was extremely hot. I dropped it on the table before I got burned. The Manager didn&#39;t see but walked up as soon as all of the food was put on the table. He asked how everything was so I made him aware of what just took place. He apologized and offered to bring me an ice bag.  I refused but asked him to coach the server so this doesn&#39;t happen again. The key is that their communication is very poor amongst their staff as well as their training. Hopefully they&#39;ll improve but I just can&#39;t believe how unprepared they were. I will not be back. <br><br>Food is typical Cheesecake Factory quality. Huge portions and nothing great by any means. The ambiance in the restaurant as well as the patio are really nice and the only highlight.

The worst.  Let me repeat the worst.  I honestly live right  across the street.  Like right across the street.  Like right across the street.  They are terrible and terribly managed.  I try to give them a magic Johnson fast break layup order for pickup for 9 people.  They won&#39;t even take my order because they bakery is to busy.  I ordered four weeks ago for my wife and son, same idiotic respond.  Like grow up as a company. Maybe hire people who work. Btw I was forced to eat there four months ago too, it&#39;s 2017 get wireless.

Wanted to try this place out since it was nice , first the host was not very happy at all . I asked how long the wait was and she said there no wait . We wait 15 mins to sit down .<br><br>When we were seated he waited another 10 mins before a waiter came to help us . The waiter was okay nothing to special . The food in the other hand was just average . First and last time I will be dining here at all . Overall service was bad

Cheesecake Factory, that&#39;s what&#39;s up <br>They got me in quick, no holdup<br>Got the Mac N Cheeseburger, with some pop<br>Tasted so good, it made my world stop <br>Next was the filet mignon, this meat was premium<br>So juicy and tender and cooked to medium,<br>Seasoned just right, no need for more sodium <br>Flavors so amazing, it caused a pandemonium. <br>Finally came dessert, cheesecake made to perfection<br>I&#39;ll definitely come back, no objection. <br>Word.

The service from staff at this location, from server that answered the phone to the manager that never apologized for my food being 1hr and 34 minutes late from 3rd to 16th street. I had a bad delivery that the store made worst with their condescending attitudes! After the put a 54 dollar hold on my funds they talked rude on the phone and didn&#39;t offer to compensate me with a free coke or something. I love the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s Food but it arrived cold. I&#39;m really disappointed and if the staff had just apologized I probably wouldn&#39;t be giving them one star! The male serve that takes the train and told me that the roads were closed, I hope you learn about the saying &#34;the customer is always right&#34;! Next time apologize!

We had the ribe eye and carbonara while my kids had pizza, cheese sandwich and mac and cheese. Generous portions! The steak was a bit dry but the carbonara was creamy and rich! The strawberry cheesecake was too yummy and just the tight amount of sweetness! Will definitely be back on out next visit!

If I could leave a review with a negative star I would.... the food was fabulous the first waiter was phenomenal but then she switched with another waiter and we got our check paid and were waiting for the elevator to leave and I&#39;ll be Damed if the waiter didn&#39;t come chase me and ACCUSE ME OF STEALING HIS PEN.... to the point that I opened my purse to show him the inside.... seriously dude!!! Another less than stellar visit to the Cheesecake Factory!!! When will I learn?

We (co workers)  were invited to attend the Training Service prior to Opening Day. So, we were prepared for possible slow service , there to be kinks &amp; lunch may be a little long. We were greeted by a Happy &amp; friendly hostess &amp; seated quickly. The trainee server was shadowed by an experienced server. Service was Very Slow &amp; Orders were wrong..but, the meal was free anyway &amp; we were apologized and given Cheesecake &amp; more appetizers! Yay!<br><br>Soooo, today after being open for at least 2 months we thought the Kinks were out. We had reservation for 1145 we were seated immediately..so far Great. We all knew what we wanted &amp; placed our orders (just in case it was still Kinky!) After receiving our drinks &amp; bread...45 MINUTES UNTIL WE RECEIVED OUR LUNCH! I had to ask a passing busboy to find our server! <br>Well, food arrived, salmon salad, chicken wraps, Cobb salad &amp; avocado/chorizo omelette  (me). Everyone enjoyed their food, except my potatoes were overcooked. <br>Our Server hadn&#39;t even apologized for the late service or the potatoes. <br>I Love Cheesecake Factory...but, I think I will wait awhile before trying Santa Monica location.

Don&#39;t really go to large chains, with all the great local places in SM. But figured we&#39;d give it a try since they have some nice salads.<br><br>We sat down today at 7 pm. Our server J comes by soon after, and asks us for drink orders. We order around 7:25 as that is the first opportunity to do so after we had put in our drink order. <br><br>Time goes by...I ask one person (who I thought was a manager) after another about what&#39;s going on. Each person say they will get a manager, but no one comes. Then the final straw was another couple of people sitting at an adjacent table, who had sat down AFTER we had ordered, gets their food at 8 pm. We still had not gotten our appetizer. J keeps trying to tell us that various foods take longer. Apparently I look like I&#39;m an idiot since he feels that I will believe that 2 dishes of hot food will take longer to make than 2 salads. (The people looking like managers were trainers who were supposed to help the staff keep on target with their tables, but clearly this was a fail.)<br><br>The only reason I did not give my review 1 star is because of the manager Rebecca. She was soo sweet, and acted like a true manager, taking responsibility for what was poor service, and making it right by us tonight.<br><br>I will amend if we ever try going there again. I will just ask for someone besides J.

I took my family to eat a couple of day ago and we got an amazing server. Her name was Pamela, very polite, great service. She made sure we had the best experience and i have zero complains. Food was amazing. We definitely coming back and asking for Pam to be our server again!

Good food, good server. We got a nice spot  outside in the sun and it suited that day. Wouldn&#39;t rush back purely because it&#39;s not really somewhere I&#39;d frequent and the greeter was a bit rude.  I find The Cheesecake Factory same same but different location and all a bit ho-hum.

Ambience is the best of it, both outside patio with 3rd st promenade view and/or inside are both very cozy and pleasant. Customer service is just non-sense and rude starting from the host at the door. The food is not a regular cheesecake factory delicious meals, it&#39;s blah, and Cold. The drinks are ok, cocktails are more like juices than alcohol, which does not happen at the Cheesecake Factory from Sherman oaks or Redondo Beach. I think the patio should have a movable celling cover for the rain because I had to run with my food and drink when it started raining out of a sudden (imagine the scene). I feel like I am being generous with my 3 stars, this place is more likely 2 stars, but I really enjoy the ambience.
We had a great experience, the patio area was very comfortable with the heaters, our server was friendly and attentive, food delicious! Very pleased with this location.

TERRIBLE TERRIBLE SERVICE!! this is by FAR the WORST Cheesecake Factory!!! The one in Manhattan beach is the best. EVERY time me and my family come here they mess up SOMETHING!! The manager finally accommodated us but next time I will box my own food!! THE WAITRESS threw half my meal away!!! Never again!! Save your money! go to a better Cheesecake Factory!!!! Terrible!
Worst cheesecake experience ever. Food was OK. Took my waitress 15 min before she took our order,45 min for food to come out, and she never came by once during the 1 hour we had our food. Wtf

Horrible experience. To kick off the shit show, once my buzzer went off to let me know my table was ready I handed it to a host and he just grabbed it didn&#39;t say anything and sat another party. Came back, sat another party. Come to find out everyone&#39;s buzzers were going off yet their tables weren&#39;t even ready. 10 min went by so I asked the host how much longer? She told me I&#39;m next to go get seated outside (it was freezing) so I asked can I just sit inside. She gave me an attitude and said ok well you&#39;re gonna have to wait. She then handed me another buzzer to what seemed like she wanted me to start back from square 1. Another party of 2 was called (they got seated outside). Then a 2nd party of 2 was called and they got sat INSIDE. I asked her wasn&#39;t I suppose to get the next available one? And she said no you weren&#39;t waiting for an inside table. Like what? Is there a separate wait list for indoor seating?? When I finally got sat the waiter took forever to come. When i ordered I specifically told him NO chicken in my entree just shrimp (I&#39;m pescatarian) when the food came I bit into my food to find out it was MEAT! He came back 15 min later even after I asked multiple people to get my server. He wasn&#39;t apologetic. The manager came and apologized and offered me cheesecake. Cool I guess (would have preferred $ off the bill). 20 min later my food arrived (my bf was already done with his meal so I had to eat alone). Once we finished our food and cheesecake we got the bill and the server didn&#39;t even take the cheesecake off the bill! I seen the bad rating before we dined here but ignored it. WORSE MISTAKE.

I&#39;ve always liked Cheesecake Factory. I hope the new location at Santa Monica Place can be as good as or even better than other locations.<br>---------update---------<br>Today is Oct 27, the first day this new location open to public.<br><br>Visited there today for dinner. I&#39;ve never seen so many waiters and waitresses in a restaurant, of course I know they are being trained .<br><br>We walked inside and were led to our seats. After a while our server came and ask us what to drink.<br><br>After the drinks came we waited for more than fifteen minutes for the breads to come. Too bad our server forgot to bring the breads, which are my favorite food at CF. I asked one of the servers to bring us the breads and finally they were on the table.<br><br>Foods are very delicious as usual.<br><br>One more thing I need to point out: it was 70 degrees outside. Why did you turn on the heaters??!! I asked them to turn it off, and 30 minutes passed by it was turned on again. One of the managers came ask if it was too hot. All the customers said YES.<br><br>Maybe in the near future it&#39;ll all get better. <br><br>Love,<br>L<br><br>To be continued.

THE FLOORS ARE SUPER SLIPPERY!!!<br><br>I saw a young girl slip and fall bad a few months ago. I had a hard time walking in the restaurant. I was wearing New balance shoes with gummy soles. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory should do a better job to make sure the floor are safe for patrons.

The Cheesecake Factory is always good no matter where you go. The food tastes amazing and the menu is huge. The wings are fantastic. We also got the crab and artichoke dip and it was so good but they give you only 6 small pieces of bread of go along with it which is definitely not enough unless you are scooping up 2 tablespoons of dip per bite which is too much in my opinion. We also got the crispy fish tacos - AMAZING, the carbonara - pretty good and the burrito which is just average. Service was a little slow but the place was packed so I understand. Either way, a great dinner and no room for the famous dessert unfortunately.

I hate to give only one star but this has been the worst Cheesecake Factory that I have been to. There was a total of 3 of us in our party. The waiter was a really nice person but don&#39;t think he had the best training to be out on his own. Had to ask 3 times to get water, and another her 3 times to get some lemon and when he finally did bring it he brought it on a napkin wrapped up. I believe in a restaurant like this I should have received it on a small plate.<br><br>The cleanliness of the dishes was really bad as well. Both forks and spoon I had was really dirty. You were able to see the crusty stuff on there from before. Finally after getting clean utensils the plate the food came on was dirty. <br><br>I don&#39;t think I will ever return to this location again.

Good food. Horrible service. Rude, disorganized and snoby staff. Orsered a cheesecake witjout cream, came with cream. Asked for it to be removed due to me bei g lactose intolerant.  Tbey decided to give me a crash course on what a cheese cake is. Sad

Shawn was a great server except for their lady manager who does not smile the more worst thing she did whenI complain that a lit of people complaining how dirty their restroom is , no toilet paper she replied in a poker face , seems irritated someone told me that already not even saying thank you. She should be accommodating to all her customers. I  and my family love cheesecake but my first time to encounter a manager as grumpy as she is.

Beautiful. Our waiter Pephanie was amazing. Even though ive been to cheesecake factory a million times i still asked for her opinion and u took her recommendation and it was delicious she knew her menu and approched us with kindness even when we saw her busy. She was sociable and didnt just treat us as regular guest. We felt very welcome. She is just wonderful.

Cheesecake Factory is usually pretty good but the service has disappointed me once again. Just because I am young, I am looked down upon by the staff. I have been sitting at my table for 10 minutes and still have not been served bread or water. Wow.

Junior is the best I went with a friend and she loved him as well saying that he&#39;s funny. The servers are extremely busy carrying heavy trays of food and taking orders but he went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and our order was received accurately, our food came out so quickly  &amp; he made sure our needs were met without us having to ask for anything.

Our service was excellent. It was a busy Friday night and the staff handled the crowd really well. Food tasted great. We were full, so we took Cheesecake to-go. Probably eating it for breakfast!   Ha!

Food was great! My boyfriend and I ordered the chipotle chicken pasta (spicy) my pasta was cooked to perfection, asparagus still had some crunch and my bf ordered Parmesan herb breaded crumb chicken. Chicken was very bland/ plain, mashed potatoes were great! I did call to make reservations before, but they told me that they do not take reservations, when we came in and asked for a table with two seats we waited for about a good 30 to 40 minutes although while we waited there was an open bar available and that is where I ordered my piña colada drink was great as my waitress was ok but next time I would rather order it and eat at home .

Although this place is new, I should&#39;ve got at least decent service. The only reason why I&#39;m giving a star is because we got seated right away. Other than that, this cheesecake experience was the worst. Service was horrible and you could easily tell that the staffing is new. <br><br>1) While my boyfriend and I were eating, a server wasn&#39;t paying attention and he was leaning on my boyfriend.. He quickly apologized, made an &#34;oh shit&#34; face, and walked away.<br>2) Our server didn&#39;t come back to see if we were ok. Didn&#39;t refill our water. <br>3) We were waiting so long for her to come back so we could ask for the check, so we asked another server. So that server gave us our check and we paid. Then the original server comes back and gives us our check again.. No communication amongst the staff whatsoever. <br>4) Last but not least, servers were very rude with no smiles on their face and not greeted properly. When we were handed our check, they just quickly threw it on our table with no words. <br><br>Hopefully we could come back here when the staff is better trained because they need a lot of work.

So my family and I went to CF in Santa Monica on a Tuesday evening to celebrate my daughter&#39;s birthday.  This was our first time to this particular location and I have to say that the service was horrible.  My daughter ended up throwing up and nobody bothered to come to Check up on and offer to clean up the mess on the table.  Then when I tried to get the MOD attention to see where our waiter disappeared to, let&#39;s just say she pretended that she didn&#39;t see us waving at her.  Then when she came by she said &#34;I didn&#39;t see you &#34; and didn&#39;t offer to give us any kinds of compensation for the horrible experience we had there.   I reached out to corporate via their website and of course nobody ever got back to us via email or phone.   We will never come back to this location and it seems like they hired people that don&#39;t know what customer service should be.  Don&#39;t come to this location if you want decent service. Try the marina del Rey location.

It pains to me to have to write this review.  After coming to TCF opening week and having a great experience..... the experiences since has been BEYOND TERRIBLE. If there is a problem or a bad experience at a restaurant that I frequent a lot - I will never write just on bad review. But this location is NEEDS to get their act together. The past 3 times I have come the restaurant is an unorganized mess.<br><br>We waited on Sunday for 20 min before someone even came (after flagging them down) to be greeted. We then in the next 10 minutes had 3 different staff members come up to our table to either bring us bread, water or greet again!<br><br>It then took our last and final server 10 more minutes to bring out 4 waters. We were there for 45 minutes without even ordering food yet.<br><br>At this point- we left.<br><br>And sadly won&#39;t be returning.

My son and I went to this location last week during our summer vacation. We asked for the rooftop because we like the scenery. This is the second year ina row we have come here and the same thing happened. We got seated and no one came by for over 20 minutes. Finally I got up and asked where our waitress is. Again 20 more minutes. We only wanted Cheesecake which was good. Worst service ever. Second year in a row. Over an hour to order 2 slices of Cheesecake? Not worth it.

I have family here from israel and decided to choose this location and drive about 45 minutes from the valley. We arrived approx at 745 pm and were told to wait about 15, minutes or so, after seating down at 8pm we were approached by a server who introduced himself but failed to take any drinks orders, he said he will be back. <br><br>About 10 to 15 minutes later the server came and took our drink order and food order. we then waited 15 minutes to get the drinks which is unacceptable. The drinks came at 830 and as he placed them on the table he spilled the skinny margarita on me, the guy felt so bad I told him not to worry and dried myself off, at this point I&#39;m a little upset it took 30 min to get drinks and no appetizers. Roughly 10&#39;to 15 min later we received my drink and had to wait a few more min for appetizers which was unacceptable. I then asked about the food and received it around 850 approx , the steak and burger were asked to be medium rare but both came well done, when I asked the manager how they look he said well done and took them to be replaced. Meanwhile we had to wait till about 915 to get the food at that point I was starving and even thought the steak now came cold I just ate it. Also forgot to mention had to send my drink back 2 or three times as it was made incorrectly, also we asked for napkins and Parmesan cheese about 3 times. When we got the bill the manager refused to take the steak off because he said I ate it.. I told him it was cold and he started trying to negotiate with me, this was so embarrassing, he then said he will give me 50 percent off which was unacceptable, when I refused he said ok I&#39;ll take the steak off but add the 50 percent back, this isn&#39;t let&#39;s make a deal!! You guys clearly messed up spilled an alcoholic drink on me and now want me to pay?? I left 45$ on the table and walked out with my family. <br><br>Note the manager twice said we are a new store we only been here for a year.. I&#39;m sorry but that&#39;s not acceptable, I was so nice about the drink spilling on me didn&#39;t make a big deal at all about it but the fact that I was treated that way was very Embarrassing especially around my family who is visiting here from israel.

This was probably my worst time at Cheesecake Factory. The service was a disaster. When we sat down, part of the table was wet. Then when they brought the tea and the coffee they didn&#39;t bring the sugar. They brought ir like 15 minutes later because we ask for it. The tea cups were dirty and we had to ask the waiter to change them. The only good thing is the cheesecake but the rest a deception.
Ate lunch here today, the orange chicken and cucumber mojito was amazing. We sat in the bar area and the waitress who took our order was just as amazing as the food. Will definitely be back.

Hanging around the Santa Monica Promenade and my family and I decided to eat here. 30+ minute wait after 8:30pm on a Sunday night. The wait was extremely long for us to get our food but the customer service Molly R provided us was worth the wait. We bugged her so much and she kept a great attitude. That made our evening better so we gave her a generous tip. Thanks!
Having lunch with my family. The place is huge, great ambiance but the service is slow. It takes awhile for the food to arrive. Hope they will improve their service.

Came here on a second day after their grand opening! <br><br>The food and decor is very similar to other locations, but the best part is their patio area! The patio is so spacious and dimly lit, and you get a great view of the Third Street Promenade. The heating lamps warmed me up and it was just a perfect Santa Monica evening! <br><br>The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Maybe they&#39;re just helping out from other locations this week but had great service.

I should&#39;ve read the reviews before I came here. DIRTY AND BAD SERVICE! Just like everyone else is saying, the silverware was disgusting. I would&#39;ve told my waiter, but he was nowhere to be found. I went through four different place settings before I found some clean silverware. My waiter had no knowledge of the menu, I had to tell HIM what came with my order! And not to mention him and another waitress just swapped halfway through? And then she didn&#39;t really care much either. They need new management and probably a new team entirely. I will not be back.
If you want to waste money on terrible service then this is your place. Stay away. Don&#39;t come here. Is this long enough Yelp?

Update: tried it again after my last experience almost 6 months ago.  No improvement,  in fact it&#39;s got worse. Customer service does not exist in this restaurant. Management give some generic &#34;Oh no [insert name], hope this is an isolated event, give us another try&#34;....clearly these are not isolated events, and without improvement people will still be disappointed.

I&#39;ve been a customer of this company for sometime now over the years. Not a frequent visitor, but occasionally, nothing outstanding or terrible. This occasion however, actually stood out and wanted to take the time to give credit where it&#39;s due. While waiting for our food, which I didn&#39;t even think was long, the manager came out just to apologize for the wait time. I simply replied it was no problem at all. That simple acknowledgement made me take time to give Cheesecake Factory a 5 stars. Sometimes, it&#39;s the simple things. Waiter was fantastic as well!
Amazing staff everyone was so kind and helpful BIG shout to Antoinette such a sweet and welcoming server. Looking forward to visiting again soon.
Service was terrible! 20 minutes for our beverages and 30 minutes to have the server come back to take our order.  Seriously? Food was moderate too!

HORRIBLE SERVICE! The wait was ridiculous and there were so many empty tables. Our buzzer went off after 30 minuets just so the lady at the front could tell us &#34;o no it&#39;s just dying that&#39;s why it vibrated&#34;. When we were finally seated our server Jose finally decided to greet us after 10 minutes ,not friendly at all we ended up waiting 45 minutes for our food I asked for the manager a total of 3 times, finally she showed up and was absolutely 0 help. The food was ok but definitely will never return to this location again. DO BETTER!!!

don&#39;t expect to order on the phone for pick up because NOBODY will answer. I&#39;ve been waiting for more than 10 min on the phone, called back again twice but the rep simply says &#34;busy&#34; and transfers the call which will never be answered.

I Stopped in for a Slice of Cheesecake &amp; ended up making the decision to just dine in. I went in with my sister &amp; we got the Louisiana chicken Pasta as well as the salad our Server *Jr* recommended the Kale &amp; Quinioa salad with Chicken &amp; Avocado, it was so good! Our experience was just so good from start to finish, we also got the Strawberry cheesecake.  Our Server was amazing, the service was really good &amp; the food was so tastey... I will be back to this location because he made our forst visit so good

I went to The Cheesecake Factory yesterday (Tuesday 08/20/17) and I had an amazing time. My boyfriend and I got to sit in one of the beautiful outside booths. The weather was amazing as well as our service. Adrian, our server, was quick and always there when we needed him. I am only writing this review because he was so great. The food was also crazy delicious, as usual. The fried mozzarella and spicy chicken sandwich are to die for. My boyfriend went crazy for the Steak Diane. It&#39;s also crazy filling, we could barely finish our plates. We really did have an amazing time thanks to Adrian and the chefs. Thank you! :)

Decided on this Cheesecake Factory location with a wonderful view of the bustling 3rd st Promenade for a Birthday Celebration Dinner last night. The wait was minimal and seating accommodating. Unfortunately the endless menu selections and the manicured inviting interior didn&#39;t match the less than truckstop quality tableware. Among being totally scratched and dinged up it was dirty with spots and had ruminants of food on them. The Hostess was extremely attentive and courteous delivering exceptional service. I ordered the Tortilla soup and it arrived totally Cold !!!!. Was told the pot where it was kept had no water under it. I&#39;m guessing this is used as a method to transfer Heat to the pot. The soup was taken back and returned warm at best. Not sure if it was the &#34;exact&#34; soup heated up. After eating it my stomach was upset the rest of the evening and until the next morning which included many not so pleasant restroom trips. The Evelyn pasta was fine. Was  also disappointed that a Birthday Dessert could not be delivered without a choir to accompany it. Overall I was totally disappointed with the experience and it&#39;s after effects from an establishment that strives to Display an attractive facade.

Hi my name is Fred i have work there before it some nice people that work cheese cake but job was bad they treated me bad am a black man i seen raceis there at the grove i am a chef an they make me a pot washer a i did as long as i could an went home i needed my job but not that one

This is one to miss... Went at 5pm to upstairs patio for some drinks with friends<br>Eight tables open four sets of guests waiting. After 15 minutes I interrupted the male and female Host&#39;s conversation to ask &#34; why so long with so many tables open?&#34; He very matter of factly told me &#34; I don&#39;t get tipped so I don&#39;t buss tables! Really??? Unacceptable! I talked to the manager but seemed staff was running the show...

I eat Cheesecake atleast once a week but i got to tell you the service and the service not good at all compare to other Cheesecake locations. The food is pretty much the same. But my waitter only took my order and we never saw him again, Anything we wanted we had to ask any random waitter walked by. We never got refills on any drink. And at the end I spoke to Danny the Manager and all he had to say is i am sorry and its only been a few weeks that he is working in this location and he is trying to fix it. But not once did he say can i do anything for you or let me get a slice of Cheesecake. I asked him where did my waitter go he said maybe on his break. So the whole time he left our table was with no waitter,  we never saw our waitter anymore but we dod see him walking around so we knew he was there.

I was so happy this location opened , close by my kids school. Usually go to the Marina Del Rey location and will be returning there. Unfortunately for me and my son we visited this location only to find out the kitchen is extremely slow Alexandra our waitress was apologetic my food came out a whole 10-15 minutes before my sons chicken strips ( nothing fancy) than waited another 5 minutes for his French fries! Very poor experience for having so many employees almost ran into them twice on the way to the rest room ! Smh hope you fix the kitchen issues soon.

I have no idea if it they were understaff or need it extra buss boys, tables weren&#39;t flip in a quickly manner and groups of people were standing around waiting for their table after waiting for about an hour to be seated.!! <br>Waiting for Jenn or Veronica to come and see us..

Yesterday evening, we celebrated my daughter&#39;s 16th birthday with 12 of her friends.  We weren&#39;t able to make reservations, so this stressed me out as my daughter specifically requested to have dinner at the SM Cheesecake Factory. So, we winged it. <br><br>We arrived about 45 minutes before we asked the party to arrive. By the time everyone arrived, we were getting called for our table. That worked out perfectly!<br><br>The hostess forgot about our separate table for 3 (for parents and little brother). They sat us quickly and gave us a nice sized booth. Again, that worked out!<br><br>Our waiter in training was excellent. The food and martinis were great and of course, dessert is the best.<br><br>It all worked out in the end. I would do it again.

Service was mediocre. <br>I&#39;m very friendly and understand this business. <br>Regardless....<br>Hostess and waitress has the word &#34;Attitude&#34; written on their foreheads. <br>Asked hostess if we could be seated outside and you would have thought I asked her to solve world peace with the look on her face. <br>Waitress handed me a drink with food on the sipping end of the straw, Sprite that tasted like soda water to my son.... when I asked for replacements, her face looked like &#34;really?&#34;<br>Was only given sourdough bread instead of the pumpernickel combo had to ask the waitress who brought the kids meals for the pumpernickel. Started with one waitress, then mid-way, got a different waiter who looked exhausted with no explanation and then the original waitress comes later asking for an order we already gave the waiter in the looooong interim. <br>Waitress saw my credit card on the table when we were done and asked if she could take it to the register without giving me the check first. <br>I was so shocked. <br>Didn&#39;t ask if we wanted desert or anything....<br>Gave it to her but watched her go to register.<br>Food was ok. Not delicious. <br>I always tip at least 20% -even for &#34;ok&#34; service. <br>This was the first time I tipped only 10% in my life.<br>The Management I saw seemed nice but overwhelmed and rushed. <br>2 stars because we ate.
Best experience for ever , I try different places but this location was wonderful nice stuff and great food

My girlfriend and I went there for brunch. Absolutely horrible service and the food was even worse. My girlfriends food came out 15 minutes before mine and the manager noticed and offered a free piece of cheesecake. WE ARE EATING BREAKFAST. Who wants cheese cake after eating eggs? The bill was $53 for two people, we will never be back. If I were you I would go across the street to eat at a place called Cafe Crepe. Way better service and food.
Bad Service . Waiting forever for our food. The waiter went to get bread and butter and never came back.
The food was very good however the service could have been better. The whole process took a very long time but I would still eat there again
The good always consistent. Our waitress was great. Horribly long wait to get seated. If you want to get served quickly seat by the bar area. Otherwise be prepared to wait an hour.

My family and I visited The Cheesecake Factory this weekend.  The hostess at the patio entrance was terrible. When it was time to take us to our table she walked us to our table that had been taken by a couple. She then mumbled something and walked us to another table that was crowded in by the neighboring table&#39;s stroller. We asked if we could be sat at one of the open booths instead. This seemed to bother her. I was told that she was busy and had us stand there with our menus at hand and wait for the table. She never apologized that our first table was taken and she was rude.

Went there on a Saturday night. The wait was shorter than what I was expected. We were there at 8pm and we only waited for 15-20mins to be seated! That was way shorter than what I&#39;ve experienced in Portland (more than 45mins wait!). Their pasta and stuffed mushrooms are still my fav things to go for! It&#39;s actually my first time to try their cheesecake and it was amazing too!

My friend and I went here a week ago and received the worst service ever. Our waitress kept telling us how busy she was but when we would ask her for something she would go talk to her coworkers or wait on her other tables and then pass us and completely ignore us. I was so appalled by the service we just got up and left. Right after I called to speak to the manager and he said he would talk to her and get back to me and he never did. I doubt he ever talked to her. Never going there again. It was my second day in California, my first time in Santa Monica and it ruined my entire experience.

First of all we were placed at a table that was not meant for two children to sit at. Waiter finally comes to take our order never brings the drink, food finally arrives ordered a steak have no knife to cut the steak, and one  of the orders were served in a to go platter. Waiter never comes back to check on us much less ask if we need drinks how food is nothing. When he finally comes past our table we stop him and ask him for the check another man walks right behind him and grabs up our plates while we&#39;re still trying to eat. Waiter takes the card to go do our payment And comes back and hands us  the envelope with receipt But no  credit card. Go and ask for a manager and for my card nobody comes have to go ask for a manager a second time 15 minutes later still no card.  After 15 minutes the manager finally comes let her know what&#39;s going on and the only thing she offers to make this right is a piece of cheesecake. At least the food was good but nothing else about that night was good and that&#39;s the only reason for 1 Star because they really have the worst customer service I&#39;ve seen.

We went out for Father&#39;s day today at this cheesecake factory location. We went early, and the restairant was not busy. It took a long time for them to bring the food, and once the brought the food, they only brought half of he tables orders. It took another 8 minutes before they would bring another dish, while 2 more dishes were still missing. After letting the manager know, they finally brought those dishes. We went there to have a good time and this incident ruined our occasion. This is not what we expected from cheesecake factor.

Love the location of this restaurant, but that&#39;s about it. I&#39;ve waited two months to give this review. I messaged them on their website with my complaints and never received any kind of message back. The service the last few times has been really bad. <br>In December I went with friends and one of my friends had to wait 20 minutes to get her salad dressing. Another friend also had to wait 20 minutes to get their fries. 4 of the 5 orders were incorrect. Just an overall disappointment. Especially since they never got back to me via email or telephone.

It was the first time I came to this location. I normally go to the Santa Clarita location and I always enjoyed the food. I had a totally different experience at this location. We waited almost an hour for our food to come out and when we finally got our food it was nasty and wrong. My boyfriends meal had hard noodles and hard chicken. He sent his meal back and waited almost 30 minutes for his new order to show up. My meal was ordered wrong I asked for no onions and my meal came with onions. My meal also had no flavor and the noodles were dry. My daughter had ordered fettuccine from the kids menu and we were charged an adult meal. I told the waiter that her meal was supposed to be a kids meal and that the food was wrong and it didn&#39;t taste good. He didn&#39;t apologize or anything. He didn&#39;t offer to take it back or make the correction on my bill for my daughters meal. This was the worst experience ever. The service was bad and so was the food. I will never come to this location again!

First time trying out the Cheesecake Factory. I thought it was amazing. Food was good although quite large portions. We couldn&#39;t even finish our cakes even though we were quite hungry. Can recommend the salted caramel cheesecake. The staff was very courteous and made us feel very welcomed. Would definitely come back.

Came by because we had a wait for our movie next door and wanted to watch the game somewhere close. It was a Friday night and we got seats at the easily and they had two TVs up. Outside of the weird lamps that block the TV views and don&#39;t move the bar was nice. The bartenders were fantastic. The food? Definitely needs some work.
