Rice was dry, appetizers way too salty, entree way too sweet. Would go back for a drink and to watch the game but not for food.

By far the WORST Cheesecake location I&#39;ve dealt with. First of all, I called to place an order, was put on hold 5 min for the bakery only to hang up, call back to be put on hold for another 4 min.  Once I complete the order and I&#39;m ready to pay with my debit card, I&#39;m told I have to go to App Store, download cake pay app to receive a 4digit code which I never got.  Keep in mind, my friend I&#39;m surprising for lunch only has 30 min. I start this process at 3:00. After calling back 3x&#39;s to finally speak with a mgr Because at this point I&#39;m here see&#39;s that there is something wrong w/app and must contact corporate. Then I&#39;m told I must go to website to purchase a gift card for this $17 order, but now I have to purchase a $25 cause there&#39;s no place to punch in amount of order. Then the processing of this becomes an issue. Finally, I have tell my girl to mow &#34;pay&#34; for it and I&#39;ll reimburse her. She gets there to pick up food, she&#39;s in the bakery for 10 min before being acknowledged, then asks for a<br>Mgr in which she waits an additional 5 min then finally has to leave because now she only has 10 left for lunch and NO FOOD. This location SUCKS!!!!  Don&#39;t go there!!! Especially if you value your time<br>!!!Mr Randall...

We sat. Waited. Ordered was very specific about what we wanted. Waiter brought the wrong drink. Appetizer came out but without the ranch. Asked for it again, nothing. I had to get up and walk into the kitchen area to ask someone to give me a side of ranch. Waiter saw me asked if something was wrong I told her my appetizer is getting cold because I didn&#39;t get my dipping sauce as requested. She go get it and the correct drink and her excuse was that the ranch was in the back. We have been here for over an hour and still didn&#39;t get our food. Food came, BUT my husband&#39;s food didn&#39;t. The manager came and stated his food was burnt and will need to make another plate. We will not be paying for his meal. Please don&#39;t come here. We definitely will not be returning.
We came here for dinner, and the food was good but the service was awful. Our took a long time to get our food, and to charge us for what we order.
The server Laura was very helpful. Explained everything that I asked on the menu including the lunch size portions. Overall, it was a great service would come back and have Laura help me again.

Me and my boyfriend thought this cheesecake would be good like all the other ones in the valley. Wow we were so wrong! Service was horrible and very rude waitress. Food sucked so bad that we have stomach aches hours after still. Stay away from this cheesecake if possible. Something was very wrong about the food too!
I want to thank our server Manuel in Cheesecake Factory Santa Monica. We had Salmon with rosted herb and mash potato plus pasta with vegetables

For first time we went here. after 55 minutes they give us very bad place to sit. food came after 30 minutes but food was uncooked!!! we asked for straws, she bring only one PC! food was very bad i wish i can give NO star not even one star.

I&#39;m not one for leaving a negative review somewhere, usually I just let it go and don&#39;t go back if it was really that bad. But man this cheesecake factory location is absolutely terrible! The food is fine, I have no complaints about that but the customer service is honestly the worst. Ive come here a few times and everytime it&#39;s the same thing.<br>We get seated but don&#39;t get serviced for almost an hour (no exaggeration, quite literally timed it this time).<br>This time was even worse! About 45 minutes after being seated and didn&#39;t even get asked for the simple things like if we would like some water while we think of what to order. Throughout the whole time we were trying to get a waiters attention to politely ask them to have someone take our order, at this point we&#39;ve been waiting long enough to decide what we want to eat but every waiter that passed us by would look over to our table but wouldnt ask if weve been serviced yet or not. Definitely not coming back to this location and making sure everyone I know never comes to this location. I would&#39;ve liked to talk to a manager on duty instead of writing this terrible review but like I said, couldn&#39;t even get someones attention.

This score was given due to my experience Saturday August 18th around 11pm. I am on a strict diet. I am unable to eat meat of any kind. I originally ordered a veggie burger with sweet potato fries. Only to discover you did not have any available. I compromised and ordered a Louisiana Chicken Pasta with no chicken. Once I received it the pasta was hard. By this time I lost my appetite and had no desire to eat. I literally came all the way from Orange County, which is over an hour drive, to watch my girlfriend eat her food. <br><br>I asked my server Andrea for the manager during this late shift. When The manager came, Davante I believe, I explained my story to him and told him I did so to help them in the future. I could have been a very negative ad mean person. I, on the other hand, Love and respect people. I love to see people around me win with a smile. I was hoping he would except my experience as a lesson for better customer service. As I explained what happened, he was staring at me like I was a kid. He had a negative vibe and sarcastic look in his eyes. I asked him if there was anything that can be done on his behalf to compensate for the bad experience. He asked what do I suggest. I said I do not know, what do you suggest. He said I can do whatever you suggest if it&#39;s reasonable. I said can you please comp the 2 cheesecake slices for the huge inconvenience of them not having what I ordered available, having a bad dish I couldn&#39;t eat and for literally paying to just sit in my seat. He said no but I can do one..... So let me get this straight. Another $8 slice cheesecake is not worth avoiding bad publicity that can cost the company thousands of dollars ? I felt that was not right. <br><br>As a result I am going to leave a bad review on all the blogs and review sites. Starting with this one. I feel a customer training session needs to occur at least once a month. <br><br>I will never eat there again and I will advise for you not to as well. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory make this right. <br><br>Thank you for your time.
I had the spicy buffalo chicken sandwich! A little dry and not enough sauce! Sweet potato fries always on point! The service wasn&#39;t great for mid day lunch!

Absolutely rude and disgusting customer service. Waitress was extremely obnoxious. She rushed us to the point where we were seated and done in less than an hour. She would be very hesitant to fulfill our requests and rarely checked up on us. Food was whatever, could&#39;ve been better. Cheesecake isn&#39;t this upscale restaurant, but c&#39;mon, have my proper customer service.

Definitely the worst Cheesecake Factory that can be conceived. I recommend taking the road trip just a little further to literally ANY other Cheesecake Factory. Wait times are ridiculous, employees are incompetent to do anything human other than stare at you. Just bad. Every time I&#39;ve been here.

Ok so I was reluctant to come to a chain restaurant but it&#39;s my first time here and I am blown away by the delicious brown bread, the YUMMY asian pear martini, the sweet corn tamale cakes (SO GOOD), then I ordered the combo plate with salmon and shrimp that came with mashed potatoes and I substituted broccoli for the asparagus. Everything was AMAZE BALLS!! Sorry forgot to take a pic!!

I came here on a Sunday night and I could say it was very crowded here! I came with 3 of my friends, so we had around a 40ish minute wait (which is understandable, due to the crowdedness). We got seated outside with a nice view, but it was super cold. Good thing there was the outdoor heaters. We were quick to order, and this is where it somewhat goes downhill. We waited around 45 minutes for our food. My food was alright: there was some random pasta in my food. My dish contains penne pasta, but there were like two bow-tie pasta and random spaghetti string pasta. My two other friends had the same situation like me. We were a bit suspicious about it, but it was okay.

I came to the Cheesecake Factory to celebrate a friends birthday and it was the WORST SERVICE IVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE. From the moment I walked in the door the hostess was EATING HER FOOD WITH HER FINGERS, disgusting. Not only was she eating but she was very rude and unhelpful. She asked us if we wanted to eat outside, I asked where the outside area was and she gave MAJOR attitude saying right here. I was astonished. She had terrible communication skills and it was very unprofessional for her to be eating in front of guests. I understand people need to eat but that&#39;s what breaks and lunches are for. Management needs to make sure they order the right amount of food because they had run out of chicken Parmesan. I didn&#39;t expect our server to be that great but she was very helpful and attentive. Something the hostess needs to learn how to be. I&#39;ve been to many Cheesecake Factories in multiple locations and I&#39;ve never experienced such bad service like the one in Santa Monica. This location is really tarnishing the franchise. I feel bad for the good servers because other customers might take it out on them even though it was the hostess and managements fault for creating such a terrible experience. If I could I would rate this place NEGATIVE 5 starts, and I would give my waitress 10 stars. I really hope this location takes what its customers are saying into consideration.

It hurts to put such a bad rating because I love cheese cake factory.<br><br>First they said the wait was 10-15 minutes for inside. When we approached the bar the waitress said you can sit here and get service right away.<br><br>It took 10 min to get silverwear then another 10 min for her to give us the menu and then another 5 minutes to get waters. It was really bad service from the beginning.<br><br>We ordered a appetizer and 20 minutes went by and i knew something was wrong. When I asked the waitress she admitted she forgot to put in the order .<br><br>The food was amazing as always but this experience was awful.

It has terrible service. We waited more than 15 minutes without anyone speaking with us about a table. The hostess had terrible communication skills and was eating in front of us while on her phone. She was not friendly at all and from there I knew the service was going to be mediocre. We sat at the table and the silverware was dirty. As an appetizer, we ordered wings and when we got them they were still pink. My colleague initially wanted the chicken Parmesan but due to lack of them he had to get pepperoni pizza as a second option. As the food runner brought out the fettuccine Alfredo, he spilled some of it on the table while setting it down. Worst of all, they played country music. The one star represents our waitress who was very friendly and attentive.

The WORST Cheesecake Factory experience EVER. Our waitress (if you even want to call her that) DAKOTA, ruined our evening. Not only was she rude and sarcastic, but down right disrespectful. Our questions were answered with smart remarks and she even over charged us. She didn&#39;t check on us after the check was placed at our table....yet she continued to ignore our many gestures to get her attention. When all else failed we spoke with another waitress to try and have the corrections made. She notified Dakota and instead of coming to our table, she waved us off. LITERALLY. She made the &#34;shooing&#34; motion and said &#34;one second&#34;....from across the restaurant. I&#39;m not sure if she thought we were blind or hard of hearing, but we definitely saw and heard their interaction. The new waitress came over to our table and apologized. She let us know that she spoke with Dakota and she would be over shortly. While we waited we watched her laughing and talking with her coworkers before slowly walking towards our table. As we politely expressed our frustrations over the mistake on the check, she interrupted my mother numerous times and then walked off. Needless to say, we will never visit this location again. <br><br>DISCLAIMER: I am a Nordstrom employee and know the value of outstanding customer service. We didn&#39;t ask for any compensation and even still left a tip, despite Dakota&#39;s actions.

Dear Mr Factory,  <br>The hostess you have that was working today 3-4pm was a complete waste of money to you! After waiting 6 minutes at the host podium I decided to call the actual restaurant to see if maybe that would help us in getting a seat. The hostest was not friendly or apologetic in any way. I&#39;m mean hunny, you have one damn job, to seat the guests. After we got a table we saw her continuously disappearing while the wait to be seated area filled up over and over. She is a TERRIBLE person to have for that position! Maybe she needs to be in the back chopping lettuce or something but hosting ain&#39;t her strong area! Yall gotta do better better because I&#39;m sure in her interview she mentioned how much she loves people, she needs to go. I don&#39;t know her name but I&#39;m sure anyone that has been here while she was there knows who I&#39;m talking about.... short, heavy set lady that likes to twirl her hair and do not work, this about you boo!

They made my 20th birthday over here a very special one! Great ambiance and we were sat right at the terrace where we can see the 3rd street promenade and it was just marvelous how we can people watch and eat! Amazing food amazing customer service and overall a 5 star deal! A definite dinner reservation will be on the way soon!
Highly recommend this place?l! Had BARBARA as our server she was so amazing! Great service! Great smile! Ask to sit in her section!

Alycia our waitress, was beyond horrible. I don&#39;t understand this girls worth ethic. My friend and I were having a beach/shopping day and decided to grab lunch here. We get seated. Our waitress alycia comes and is very uneducated of the menu. I asked her if they had a specific cheese and she said I don&#39;t know I&#39;d have to check on that. <br><br>Later when it&#39;s time to order we place our orders. The bread hasn&#39;t been brought out yet. But every other table around us got theirs. So we asked her kindly why we&#39;re having a delay. She said it&#39;s still in the oven it&#39;ll be a couple more minutes. <br><br>A couple more minutes turned into 30 min after we got our food she brings the bread and asks if we still want it. Umm no how about you drop that attitude of yours and take it back. Oh the cherry on top was when our waitress randomly avoids us and when we asked the other waitress she rudely said &#34;ask your waitress&#34; well then. Someone doesn&#39;t like their job. Absolutely worst cheesecake I have ever been to.

This place is huge, that&#39;s probably why there are no lines, it can accommodate everyone. We wear six people in a party. Each ordered different dish. I would recommend ordering appetizers, because main dish seems like it takes a little bit longer to come to the table. We didn&#39;t experience any problems with waitresses or hostess. When we got the food... OMG, it was delicious and tasted really fresh. The portions were huge. <br>I am going there tomorrow and  bringing all my family, because I know I will have a fantastic dinner.

I&#39;ve come to this cheesecake factory many times and I&#39;ve never had an issue with service but I went this Thursday and the hostess was incredibly rude. I read some reviews on here and it seems there is a common problem, which seems to be the service particularly the hosts. This host was very rude and had no idea about customer service. I&#39;m never one to write negative reviews but I thought I should because it&#39;s obvious you need to either train some of the staff better or hire better people. I noticed no one wears name tags in this place, which I think is a little odd so I had to ask my waitress, who was great I might add who the name of the rude hostess was. Her name was Jamila and I can&#39;t quite understand how someone that works in a customer service job can act this way. The food was great as usual and our waitress was great just had a problem with the horrible hostess.

First, I want to say how much I LOVE The Cheesecake Factory and that this will NOT stop me from going to other locations.<br><br>On Tuesday it was my birthday and I went to this location with my boyfriend for dinner. It was nice to that we were seated within ten minutes, but from there on, it was alllllll downhill! Our waitress was the most inconsiderate server I have ever had. We asked for recommendations on new items and she pulled things out of no where and knew nothing about the appetizers. She said that Buffalo Blasts are just boneless wings, and they came as fried wonton wrappers! Someone needs to do their homework. <br>Then she rushed us to order and got upset that during our wait to be seated, we ordered drinks from the bar, meaning her tip would be smaller. Well, acting like this doesn&#39;t get you a bigger tip either. <br>When our food arrived, the Chicken Piccata (sp?) was extremely salty, cold, and the pasta was undercooked! When we told her, she rudely replied, &#34;So what? You want them to make you a new one?&#34; as she took our plate and went to the kitchen. Everything just got worse as the night went on, not to mention the unenthusiastic birthday they sang to me while giving me a small cup of hot fudge, with no spoon to eat it with!!<br>Overall, this place was terrible! I am soooooo disappointed because I have NEVER had an experience like this at anyyy other location! The restaurant is beautiful, but unless you want cold, under cooked food, find another location to go to!

I can&#39;t believe people are giving this restaurant less than 4 stars! This is by far one of the best restaurants I&#39;ve been to in Southern California. There&#39;s rooftop sitting, the food is phenomenal, and the atmosphere is amazingly lively! The location is great, because it&#39;s close to the Santa Monica Pier &amp; main strip, so there&#39;s plenty to do before and/or after you eat. The air is filled with laughter, chatter, and friendly yelling! I love it! Not only that, but the food is amazing &amp; very reasonably priced! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this Cheescake Factory if you&#39;re in the area. I had one of their Smokehouse BBQ Burgers with bacon...absolutely amazing....just amazing.....I would give more than 5 stars if I could.

Tried out this place last night with my Brit friends that are in town. We didn&#39;t arrive until 10:55pm...5 minutes before closing. Yeah, we were those people. And I did feel bad! But the staff were lovely and let us sit at the bar, order drinks and appetizers. Great setup inside and the staff are really friendly and attentive. I&#39;d definitely come back. 4 stars because we could only order appetizers for food.

The service here was absolutely ridiculously horrible. My roommates and I waited an unbelievably long time to be acknowledged by anyone. Our server was sweet but ungodly slow. I think we were served by like 5 different people because our server couldn&#39;t handle the table on her own (possibly a result of understanding which I don&#39;t blame the server for-- she was really sweet despite being slow). My appetizer came out cold and they did bring me a fresh one.. after my meal came out, but it was nice to have something to snack on while I waited for them to bring the correct toppings for my sandwich. <br>The manager was by far the worst part of our experience. She literally argued with my roommate when my roommate brought to her attention that her sandwich was missing most of the promised ingredients. The manager did comp the meal but not before LITERALLY ARGUING that the sandwich had the correct items when it visibly didn&#39;t. Who does that?? She was like &#34;oh you asked for no tomatoes, that&#39;s why it doesn&#39;t have tomatoes.&#34; But like.. that didn&#39;t happen? Horrible service. If you wanna spend hours here eating the wrong order and wondering what day it is bc you&#39;ve been there for so long, by all means go to Santa Monica cheesecake factory lol

Wow...talk about dropping standards. Used to love coming here for the classic burger (one of the most underrated burgers in LA I might add) and my wife loved the Thai chicken lettuce wraps. Well tonight, both were so far below standard. My burger arrived cold, the sweet potatoes fries were stone cold and limp. I asked to have the fires redone but not the burger because I was hungry and didn&#39;t want to wait another 30 minutes in a half empty restaurant for another one. When my &#34;new&#34; sweet potatoes fries arrived, they were cold and limp again. Not worth eating so I left them. My wife had issues too, her chicken was cold, over seasoned and dry. All in all, pretty disappointing for a major national chain that usually has high quality food. I mentioned things to the server and she either didn&#39;t pass the information on to management, or management simply didn&#39;t care as NO ONE came to address my issues. Hey Cheesecake Factory corporate, you may wanna take a look at the food quality standards and the management at this location. Think we&#39;ll be going to the Marina Del Rey location instead, or possibly skipping your franchise all together for a while.

They gave us a dirty table, thats ridiculous. They didn&#39;t even offer to clean it. I knew this cheesecake factory had bad reviews and bad service based on the past reviews when it opened, but this should have been resolved by now.

I constantly frequent this location since it&#39;s convenient on my lunch however every time I come I receive horrible service. They either forget what I order, take forever to service. Sometimes they don&#39;t even acknowledge me until I&#39;ve been sitting for over 15 mins. For example today I ordered a drink, took over 10 mins and when I asked them they were barely going to make it but I was half way done with my meal so I ended up cancelling. I asked for no white bread, what did I receive, white bread. I&#39;ve had to ask for water refills, utensils, napkins, you name it I&#39;ve most likely asked for it. If this continues I will stop coming to this location

I used to be a server and the service we got here tonight was horrible. Laura Ann T was our server and she was rude, bossy and snippy. Treated me and family like nobody. <br>My steak Diane had mushrooms but onions. Which I asked for extra onions but no mushrooms. Parmesan crusted chicken was so soggy and cold. Only thing that tasted good were the avocado egg rolls and pasta carbonara. <br>No Steak knife, extra butter, drink refills, togo boxes and the check! At last this gettho server comes back asking &#34;whats up&#34; ? Only whats up? Really? Who does that when we need all that attention? What can i get for you ? How can i be a help? Do you never use these questions? <br><br>And most importantly we didn&#39;t come here to be bossed and told that she had whole a lot of things lined up to do before getting back to us with that nasty attitude!! Instead Should&#39;ve told us politely that she will be back with what we needed!<br><br>I would have done so if i were serving. <br><br>If Laura Ann couldn&#39;t handle that few tables and the pressure then next time she better stay in a smaller section! What a ruin of a great night

Great location at the end of the 3rd street promenade. I gotta say I&#39;m really happy with having the addition of the Cheesecake Factory on this side of town because of their delicious food and affordable prices right by the beach. Before you over indulge on that amazing brown bread and ranch dressing (if you haven&#39;t tried this, try it. You&#39;ll thank me later), try the BBQ ranch chicken salad or the chipotle chicken pasta. The salad is crisp and fresh and comes with homemade onion rings on top. The pasta is creamy with a smokey flavor and crunchy tortilla strips mixed in. To be honest, you can&#39;t go wrong with anything here! I also love the miso salmon and avocado egg rolls. Can&#39;t wait to come back to this location!

My friend and I went to this location yesterday for a dinner. It was the worst dining experience ever!!! First, even though there were several available booths on the outside patio area, but they would not seat us there, because they kept them for the special requests and the wait time would be up to an hour! Can you imagine the two ladies are not being seated in an empty booth because they are not &#34;special&#34;?! After that, we had to wait for the waiter for almost 20 minutes. He was rude and unprofessional! I have to mention that the food was disgusting!!! The avocado egg rolls I ordered were not even cooked through! Yuck! Yes, the worst place ever!!!!

I went there the other night and I felt the rush to get out.  The waiter was very impaciente and it seems that she was rushing to get us out. I had a salmon and didn&#39;t even have the time to order a chess ale because she was rushing to leave the place. I felt awkward

The service at this location is horrendous. They bring out food that was not cooked correctly at the time of ordering and did nothing to correct the mistake.  The waitress just giggled. I cannot believe this kind of service exists. I would never come back to this place!

I usually eat in Cheesecake Factory and today we came to Santa Monica and decided to eat here, the waiter has a really nasty actitud and like if we never ate here ; he told us that the bread that the restaurant serve while you wait for food, was given up to request.
The service here really needs to be stepped up! The waiters are slow &amp; incompetent and a few of the managers are straight up RUDE!

Now this is the CCF above ALL CCF! The outdoor view is fantastic, the energy is outstanding and the food is exactly what you&#39;d expect. As others have stated you may have to be on top of your waiter - due to the popularity - however its a small price to pay for such a great environment.
Terrible experience! I waited 30 min to get a salad to go without dressing and looked like everything was just thrown in the box.

The service was horrible and they said we would be seated in 15 minutes but we ended up waiting for one hour. They told us someone took our seats so we waited extra minutes for no reason. Bottom line, they are disorganized and un-professional. Would not recommend coming to the Cheesecake Factory in Santa Monica.

I just waited 2 hours to be seated as I was told my wait was going to be 40 minutes. I walked in and approached Monica and asked if I was ever buzzed. She responds by telling me &#39;No I don&#39;t think so, but how many I can seat you now.&#34; No apology, nothing. I look at her and respond &#34;that&#39;s all you have to say?&#34; She looks at me with a sarcastic face, shrugs her shoulders, brings her hands up &amp; says &#34;I&#39;m sorry?&#34; I look at her so shocked and walk out; to only look back and see her laughing which made me furious so I walk in and ask for a manager and again her laughing says &#34;no problem&#34; and rings her manager. The manager was super nice  and said she would take care of Monica, don&#39;t know how much of that was true but nonetheless she wasn&#39;t rude as Monica being just a hostess was under the impression she was manager with the way she was carrying herself. So disgusting, my god.

Very disappointed with this Cheesecake Factory location... <br><br>I ordered the Shrimp Scampi which was served on a plate whose edges had not been wiped clean prior to sending it out of the kitchen. I turned a blind eye to that in hopes that the quality of my food would make up for this. Being very hungry, I was eager to dig in. Unfortunately, part of my pasta was undercooked. The first time it was sent back, my waitress offered me some soup or salad while waiting for the kitchen to process a fresh batch of pasta. I asked for the soup, but that soup was never served to me. My food was served within a few minutes and to my surprise, the pasta had been more undercooked than it was the first time around. I immediately asked for the manager. He wanted to reimburse me for it so he offered some cheesecake. The bill was then put to our table and I was still charged for the Shrimp Scampi which I barely consumed. Again, I asked for the manager who did not hesitate to remove the Shrimp Scampi from the bill. <br><br>I expected more from this huge and beautiful location. I ordered the Shrimp Scampi and my food had to be sent back to the kitchen twice because it was undercooked. The highlight for the evening was the front desk staff who was very courteous and also the fact that I did not have to wait for a table. Overall, it was not an enjoyable dinner. I really hope they do something to improve their service and coordination.

I&#39;m kind of surprised why this location got such bad reviews honestly. My boyfriend and I came in, left our names and told us there was a 40 minute wait time. So we walked around the mall and got a notification form them saying our table was ready. We were sat immediately and our server came within a minute of us being seated. <br>The atmosphere is good, not too loud, and usual Cheesecake Factory decorations. We ordered our drinks and food and bread, of course. Our server let us know that bread is still being made and will be another 5-10 minutes and asked if we would like soup. She offered us complimentary soup since we had to wait for the bread, and it was really good soup! <br>Our food came, I got tomato basil pasta, and it looked less then usual at other cheese cakes factories. I told the server who called the manager, the manager was very nice, took my pasta and made fresh batch to add onto my pasta. <br>We got really good service, good food. Maybe we got lucky, but I was very happy with the service! <br>I wish I remember our servers name, but either way she was awesome. We will definitely come back to this location as it is much closer to my house then Marina Del Rey location.

Served us 2 burned kids Salmon dishes.  Instead of bringing us two new plates they took the kids plates and came back 20 minutes with new plates of food.  Poor kids had nothing to eat.  When we asked to see the manager she got an attitude about us complaining the kids had nothing to eat as they took the carrots and mash potatoes.  Wow what horrible service!  Never going back there.  Plus the bathrooms are disgusting.  I think a street person was living in one of the stalls.

Unfortunately I don&#39;t recall our servers name from tonight but she had a slight accent that we couldn&#39;t place. Anyway, she was wonderful, so courteous and professional. We had 4 appetizers and 4 main meals with our two daughters.  The food was very solid, especially the apps. But our server really made us feel welcome. Thank you!
Worse service ever! Waited 27 minutes for a waiter. Will never be going here again. Have gotten better service at McDonald&#39;s. Waste of my time and money.

I have been sitting down now for 20 minutes and still have not gotten any bread. I have asked four different waiters ... I don&#39;t think I should even have to ask for it. should be known when a customer is seated to have bread for them .

I really want to like this place; after all, I had waited 3 years for it to open after the Wilshire and Barrington location closed.  But overall, dining here is disappointing.   The waitresses are friendly and they try to be helpful, but the quality of the food is not what it is in other locations.  Tonight, my pizza was burned. <br><br> And after I gave my 3 eslice of joy coupons to the waitress for free cheesecake, she came back to say that she had given them back to me and wanted 3 more.  But I came in with 8 coupons and I only had 5 left, so I said she must have them after all.  She found them after all.<br><br>The french fries were too salty.  They said they had pancakes but didn&#39;t, so my other child ate the burned pizza instead.  My Cobb salad was good.  But after we left, I found myself wondering why anyone would pay $75 for the meal that we had.  Luckily the cheesecake was free, but still.............Given the wait time and the disappointing food quality, I&#39;ll wait a while before I come back.<br><br>The good thing is that I was able to pay and swipe my parking ticket before the 90 minutes was up so I didn&#39;t have to pay $1.25 for the parking.<br><br>When they opened originally, they had made some errors on my order and promised to mail me a $25 gift card.  They never did.  I guessed that they were busy, just opening up in this new location, so I didn&#39;t pursue the matter.<br><br>I just wish they were better.  My mother didn&#39;t want to come back when I offered to take her to The Cheesecake Factory on her last visit here.

This location just opened in the Santa Monica Mall on the top floor.  It actually has a very nice space and classiness to it.  On a Saturday night we had a wait of an hour for a party of 8.  However, this is pretty standard for any Cheesecake Factory location regardless of when they opened.  I guess I can&#39;t really complain about that one but I was mildly irritated.  I do have to say that as soon as we were seated though, they already had bread and butter on the table waiting for us.  That was a very nice touch and at least helped ease our hunger until our meals arrived.  Our server provided great service.  He brought out waters immediately, and was patient with us with the ordering process.  He came to check on us several times and was very friendly.  There are many good items here.  I recommend the chicken madeira, chicken piccata, chicken marsala, the chicken salad sandwich, the bbq chicken pizza, most of the salads, bistro shrimp pasta, tex mex egg rolls, avocado egg rolls, the factory burrito grande, salmon, skinnylicious shrimp and angel hair pasta, and more.  The new Skinnylicious menu they have actually has a good variety of items for those that are trying to be health-conscious.  I think this restaurant is a great addition to the Santa Monica mall-especially given the fact that none of the other restaurants at the top floor have fared very well here minus Sonoma wine Garden and Pizza Antica.  I can&#39;t imagine that Cheesecake Factory will have a problem bringing in business.  I recommend ending the meal with a classic strawberry cheesecake.

Let me just start off by saying I&#39;ve been to tons of restaurants and have never complained about one even if orders were wrong or service was a bit slow cuz I myself have been a server before. My experience yesterday was one of the work I&#39;ve ever had at a restaurant. So to start off I came in for a nice anniversary meal around 4 we were sat down pretty quick which we didn&#39;t expect since it seems to be full all the time. We were sat outside in the front patio area and patiently waited about 15 minutes until someone finally came over to take our orders.(in those 15 minutes we had a handful of people walk by ignoring us and a couple that was sat at the same time as us behind us) our server which I completely forgot her name came off pretty kind but boy was I wrong. Anyways we proceeded to order all at once since those 15 minutes were enough to know what we wanted plus we&#39;ve gone tons of times to cheesecake in Thousand Oaks closer to our house. We ordered as an appetizer avocado egg rolls, our entrees were a lunch size 4 cheese pasta and a lunch size chicken Alfredo. So we patiently waited. Our entrees came out and we asked a foodrunner if we could get some fresh cheese. She pretty much never came back. Our sever never came to check on us until our avocado egg rolls that were our appetizer came out about 10-15 minutes after our meal. At that time we finally got the cheese we asked for. To top it off our food seemed as if it was completely undercooked, pasta was hard and just wasn&#39;t pleasing. Our first server then told us she was leaving home so someone else was going to take over, this new server was a bit more kind and attentive, actually refilled my drink which the other didn&#39;t Even offer. We did tell her our food was poor though and she just replied with &#34;oh okay&#34;. At this point I was pretty annoyed and so was my girlfriend. All we wanted was a nice meal for our two year and it was horrible. In all honesty I wouldn&#39;t come back to those Cheesecake Factory even if they paid me. I&#39;ll be sticking to the Thousand Oaks location.

I&#39;m probably not going to get a lot of votes on this one since I don&#39;t normally agree with chains and tourist places but i do think this time I went they made a mean chicken parm hero. It was the best I ever had. For that one I will go back...and for all the cheesecake selections too.
The vibe is beautiful, wonderful, impressive. Had a food in the outside of the restaurant, quiet, clean and neat! The pizza and beer delicious and worth with the price! Definitely come back again :)

Slow service. Lots of people running around. Long wait for any service. Waiter needs to come back more frequently. 35 minutes just to get bread and our drinks. Order for food took also some more time. People running all over the place. I dont get it.

From all the rest of the Cheesecake Factory locations I have visited, this one has been my favorite!!! Less than 10 minutes wait, service was excellent. Food was delicious and the Mai tai was exactly what I wanted. Took a slice of Red velvet cheesecake home :)

Worst experience ever at lunch today. I honestly think our waitress was either high or really slow. First, she forgot our straws for our drinks so it took her 10 minutes to finally come back to then tell us she will have to take our order momentarily even though we were already ready to order smh...after waiting another 10 minutes she took our order finally. Then we wait for almost an hour for our food to only hear the waitress tell us she was sorry but she forgot to put in our order for the cook. Then she gets one of our meal orders wrong. Next thing the manager comes and apologizes and only offers a free cheesecake. When we were done eating we asked for the check and it took 30 minutes for us to even receive it because the manager wasn&#39;t around to put in a code in the register to give us the free desert! Worst service ever !!

Been going to cheesecake factory for many years,  use to enjoy their bread and food. However today has been the worst experience with my family. The wait was long, hostess was confused where to seat us with our stroller. The waiter came by 15mins later, we got our orders in before water or bread. My husband mash potatoes was dry, my grilled chicken and avocado club was so bland with old cold fries. My daughter has spaghetti with sauce on side. They brought it with sauce. Then they remade it with pasta undercooked. Took it back, by the time pasta ready, my daughter was ready to go to sleep. She did not get to eat while we sat. Being pregnant, I would of had dessert. But I was just so over how horrible the experience was, still was charged full, paid and left. Will not be back!

Had outstanding service tonight by a woman named Laura Ann (two braided buns on her head in case I remembered the name inaccurately). Happy, friendly, and fast! I noticed her check in on me multiple times while other parties were sitting around trying to flag their servers down. Overheard the table near me compliment our waitress as well. Never encounter waitresses like this anywhere.. had to write a her a review! :)
Just a review for the Oreo Cheesecake. OMG. Best thing ever. Life is uncertain; eat dessert first.

The customer service here is phenomenal. Our server Tyson was super cool and made sure we were taken care of constantly. Part of our order was delayed coming out of the kitchen but even though he didn&#39;t have control over the food, he was apologetic and made sure we were happy. I definitely recommend this Cheesecake Factory and you should ask for Tyson.
I have never experienced service this bad. Waitress was horrible... Food was ok, didn&#39;t have desert

First Time Going To The Cheesecake Factory And Of Course On Valentine&#39;s Day The Wait Was An Hour Long But So Worth It The Food Was Delicious. And Our Serve Michael Was Awesome Explaining The Menu Options For Us. Would Totally Be Coming Back

The worst service in Santa Monica. Food was cold. The Manager is the most arrogant person in the restaurant and couldn&#39;t cate about the customers. I would suggest look for any other options. <br>Managers response as to why service was so bad &#34;well its Saturday and its always like this&#34;

When we first got to the restaurant there were not any greeters outside so we waited and then we sat ourselves outside. We sat at the first big booth table to the right. The greeter finally comes out and tells us, &#34;the outside patio is actually no longer being seated and that she can seat us inside&#34;. Keep in mind she was very rude about it and was not pleasant!... This was March 5, around 5:30-6. I work at a restaurant that is rated the fifth best restaurant in the US and her behavior was uncalled for. We finally get in and order our food, we waited about an hour for our food to come out and the manager had to come out and tell us that our food is going to take longer than they thought because something had &#34;happened. He gave us complimentary salad even though none of us even ordered that in the first place! Our server hardly checked in on us. Until I said something to the manager and he finally was actually doing his job! I finally asked our server about the outside patio and he said, no we are actually still seating the outside patio if y&#39;all would like to move out there!&#34; So the greeter LIED to us and I was NOT happy about that! You are a greeter and your are suppose to do your job! It felt like she did not want us out on the patio or maybe she wanted to be LAZY! But after that I was highly pissed about that whole situation. our food came out and everything got better. We had our cheesecake Comped by the end of the night! But I AM NOT HAPPY about the lady that sat us down!!!

Do not expect any kind of decent service here. So many things happened I don&#39;t even know where to start. The wrong things coming early, drinks coming late, people forgetting we were there, it was simply chaos. It&#39;s like there&#39;s no staff training whatsoever. And when you ask for help from anyone else but your server, they either totally ignore you or say they&#39;ll get something and they don&#39;t. I&#39;m giving it three stars instead of two because the food was still quite good, and the location is superb. I&#39;m a little bummed that the restaurants that used to be in the space were gone, but I think if she&#39;s Cheesecake can get its service together, this will do quite well

Dining at this Cheesecake Factory was probably one of the worst dining experiences I ever had. A group of 8 of us went to dinner to celebrate a friends 30th birthday. To start we were told the wait time to be seated was half an hour, not too bad, but 45-50 minutes after we got there we still had not been seated. I went up to see what the deal was and was told they were &#34;clearing&#34; off the table and it would be 5 minutes, 15 minutes later and two check ins, we had still not been seated and  we were told it was going to be 5 more minutes. We could see a number of empty tables and it wasn&#39;t until the birthday girl went up to say we were leaving that they sat us.<br><br>Now to the actually dining and wait service. Once we actually got a table we were sitting for about 15 minutes before our waiter even came by to introduce him self and take drink orders. We had to ask for bread, which didn&#39;t show up on the table until another 10 minutes, and we had to ask for refills on our drinks. About 30 minutes in we finally were able to place our food orders and who knows how long it took to get the food but it seemed like an eternity. The order was mostly correct but they forgot the birthday girls food. The waiter never really made a appearance during our visit and we had to flag someone down to tell them we were missing items from our order. The manager at this point got involved and apologized, saying he was getting the samosas fresh and that he would &#34;comp&#34; the samosas. Good thing the company was nice or we would have all been really cranky.<br><br>When it came time to pay the check we had to find the manager to get the bill, which came back to us incorrectly, it took them 15 minutes just to process the payments and make corrections. The manager had come by again noticing that we were all agitated with being ignored and offered up cheese cake. The birthday girl ordered and we proceed to wait another 10 minutes to find out that he was going to give a single piece of cheese cake to the group of 8. At this point we had already been at the restaurant for 3 hours and didn&#39;t want to wait any longer so we left without the piece of cheese cake. <br><br>Given all of the places near by you&#39;re better off going somewhere else.

Looking at this now, it has a 2.5 stars rating.  Ouch!  I didn&#39;t read the other reviews but I had a great experience.  I&#39;ve been to other Cheesecake Factorys but hadn&#39;t been to this one yet since it&#39;s newer.  We had to wait thirty minutes but that was kind of expected.  It was busy so it took another 10-15 minutes for the server to get to us, but once we ordered food and drinks, it came out quickly enough.  The food was regular Cheesecake Factory food but I had the best cheesecake I&#39;ve had there - the tuxedo cheesecake.  I always &#34;struggle&#34; with the cheesecake menu, poring over the many choices and hoping to avoid the dreaded fomo for a different one.  But the tuxedo was sooo good!  The waitress was sweet and came back to check up frequently.

Worst service ever. Seriously the hostess Kenya had the worst attitude. We have been waiting for thirty minutes and hey called us up to take our table and then left us at the hostess stand for thirty minutes while she sat everyone in front of us. I would never come back here again. I&#39;m sure they don&#39;t care about us or how we felt it was obvious but I suggest never coming here. Go to Johnny Rockets. It&#39;ll be a better experience.

The service was fast and polite. I ordered the goat cheese and beet salad which is a refreshing light dish. As for a drink, I ordered a blueberry mojito. The food and drink were delicious. Overall I was pleased with my visit.

I  really wish I could&#39;ve given at least 4 stars. I love the Cheesecake Factory and have been to many of them. Never have I ever been anywhere with such poor service. I timed it - from the time I was seated to the time we were acknowledged by our waiter was 16 minutes. Take in mind it was 9:30 - not busy at all. <br><br>Also we were seated at a half booth and we kindly asked the hostess that was seating us if we could get a booth. She said &#34;that might be difficult as we will have to walk back up to the front to see where we can seat you&#34; totally unacceptable. <br><br>Not only did my menu have food and grease in it but so did my friends. <br><br>Food is consistent however service is the worst I have ever seen. I always see the manager going back and forth not quite sure what he&#39;s doing? <br><br>The solution to this problem is hire senior wait staff and waiters that care and don&#39;t congregate in one area and hang out. <br><br>The manager doesn&#39;t seem to care how poorly run this location is however I&#39;m sure the owners would.

Our waitress Allie was so helpful and informative. The atmosphere was so fun and we got to sit outside with a perfect view of the sunset. The food was delish and filling. Make sure you save room for cheesecake though!

We came by around 2:30 PM on a Sunday and the restaurant wasn&#39;t busy. We wanted to order take out since we had our baby with us. We ordered a burger, a lunch special pasta, and a red velvet cheesecake. We were told it would be about 20 minutes. After 25 minutes pass by my husband goes up to the desk to ask if the food was ready. They said they were waiting for the pasta to be ready. <br><br>45 minutes later we FINALLY get our food. Keep in mind...the place was practically empty. No one apologized to us...in fact the lady behind the counter seemed irritated that we asked how much longer we had to wait after 30 minutes. <br><br>We decided today to give this place another try because we figured they just opened and they were still working out some kinks. NOPE!! Once again we ordered take out. This time a salad and the Jamaican Shrimp. The wait wasn&#39;t as long as last time (about 20 minutes). When we got home we realized THEY FORGOT THE DRESSING to our salad AND the bread. WTF! Get it together! Management really needs to get their staff in order.

Warning - do not go to bathroom here before eating guys.  It&#39;s really filthy and it will take away your appetite and some of you might throw up.  I understand it&#39;s busy on weekends but can you make it a little cleaner? I&#39;m sure there&#39;s no system how to maintain the bathroom here.<br>And regarding service,  our server was not sharp at all. We asked for bread and every time,  she acted like she heard it for the first time and we could have bread after asking her 4 times. Refill &amp; drink order came in so late as well.<br>I ordered chicken piccata and it was so bland, no taste at all. My husband &amp; sister tasted it and said the same thing.  Considering we waited for 40 minutes, everything should taste good but sadly it wasn&#39;t.  <br>I&#39;ve been to other locations and this cheesecake factory is the worst.

Wow where do I start, food was cold and the service was the worst service I have ever received my whole life. We were seated and waited ten minutes for our server to bring us water and bread, when she came in with the plate holding the waters and bread she told me to grab the waters and bread from her umm ok. A little weird but still let it passed, then we waited another five or ten minutes for her to come and take our orders. When she came up to us she didn&#39;t even welcome us our introduce herself as our server. As time passed we had to ask for water every time we ran out or else she wouldn&#39;t even stop, empty plates were left on the table while we struggled to eat with the limited space. At the end when she &#34;picked&#34; up our plates we literally had to hand them over to her over the counter including our check because she was too lazy to go around and pick up our plates. Needless to say I have never ever experienced this type of service not even from a fast food chain. Avoid this place like the plague it&#39;s not worth your time and money.

Worst service: the waitress was rude and when we asked her something nicely because the kids were super hungry after 40 minutes she smiled and as she walked away said that we don&#39;t have to give her attitude. We were so patient with her but then we asked the manager that she won&#39;t service our table. We were shocked that they did nothing to remedy our experience! First time in our life We left $0 for tip.

Food never disappoints (in my mind)..... I guess my main complaint is that this place is so big and loud that it&#39;s hard to have a conversation and you feel a little overwhelmed.  Come to think of it, we went to another Cheesecake in the valley a few months ago and it was the same thing..... far too crowded and loud, but the food and the cheesecake are delicious.

We wee party of 5 had been there sit on the table for 10 minutes and nobody serve us. So we decide to leave, On my way walk out, I was try to telling the host saying nobody serve us for 10 minutes and the host just ok and bye. Such a bad service for me since I&#39;m from Vegas.
Came in for mothers&#39; day. Service was quick and friendly (our waiter, Emil, was super nice). Food was good too. Great place to take the family.

The management sucks at this place! I&#39;ve been to many cheesecake factories before but I will NEVER go back to this location again. The two girls who were at the front desk taking people in were very rude and seemed very confused. One of the girls gave me major attitude for asking her if we were going to be seated or not, after she ignored my question for the second time. After I was fed up with her attitude and her ignoring me, I confronted them about how confused they all were. The woman didn&#39;t even try to communicate with me that the person about to seat us is on the way or anything and she automatically just started defending herself. If she had just explained and communicated more effectively none of this would have happened and I wouldn&#39;t be here writing this review. One thing I know is that she should&#39;ve have at least said sorry. The manager even heard my mini outburst and just walked away not wanting to deal with anything. I don&#39;t know who hires these people and to be honest I think they need to change almost the entire staff especially the manager. I don&#39;t want to dine at a place with terrible workers who give you attitude for no reason. Byyyyeee
Wow the worst Cheesecake Factory I have ever been too, and I am a big fan normally. Glasses were dirty. Silverware was dirty.  The service was so slow.

worst experience ever. never left review on yelp despite being almost 10 year user. the service here is dismal. unless they revamp the whole place with new management, stay away. it&#39;s a shame that cheesecake factory is run like this

We came in for our anniversary dinner. Our server seemed very disinterested, and we had to flag him down for everything. It took a really long time each time for him to come to our table.  It took a REALLY long time for food to come, the kids were languishing from hunger. When I finally flagged our server down, he thought we wanted the appetizers to come with our food. Why would we want that?! After a horribly long time the food finally came. It was fine, fairly standard stuff, tasty but not extraordinary. It took a really long time for our server to refill our drinks. We wanted to take some stuff home and he brought us boxes (but I noticed that he packed other people&#39;s leftovers - not sure why there was a double standard). We ordered some banana cream pie but they brought us a lemon. When I told our server he was dubious (dude, I know what lemon tastes like) but took it back and brought us the right one.<br><br>The service sucks. We like coming to Santa Monica to walk around, but at this point we&#39;ll just go to a Cheesecake Factory closer to us. AVOID IF YOU CAN.

Horrible! Three of us went to dinner , got some drinks and appetizers. Everything was fine . It&#39;s s prime location and the roof top view was unbeatable. However , that&#39;s the only positive thing about our experience . We ordered our food and the wait was over an hour. A manager came by to apologize. No big deal . Finally the food arrives for two of us. My food however did not arrive for another half an hour. When it did finally arrive brought by Katya , it was a well done New York steak  , I ordered a medium rare rib eye. Katya tried to argue that the New York was basically the same as a rib eye , not to mind the $10 price difference . Umm no , I want what I ordered and a New York is for sure not a Rib Eye. So I had to wait again for another 15 minutes while she brought another steak , a rib eye , medium well. They tried to tell me that the steak was rare because the red lights from the outside patio was making it look red. I used the light on my phone to show everyone it was mot pink at all . Either way a steak no matter how done or rare should not be tuff and flavorless like this steak was . Even the waiter agreed with me about the steak and couldn&#39;t believe Katya spoke to me the way she did. Especially for being a manager. The way she spoke to was condescending and rude and basically made me feel like I was crazy. I am in the service industry and I know how annoying costumers can be , and I was totally not being unreasonable . I just wanted a nice rib eye steak medium rare. Instead I got a free piece of cheesecake but no dinner and I had to send my meal back twice and waited over an hour and a half. I will never go back here. I hope corporate takes a look at the yelp reviews and 2.5 stars for this place and hires some professionals to come in and take over the management . They really have an issue with training . Katya is offensive and should not be dealing with customers at all . She lacks the knowledge of what a steak is and lacks the ability to handle issues with customers in a professional manner.
We had the best of times here, the food was very fresh and tasted amazing and our waitress was very attentive and kind.
Service is extremely slow! <br>Rather make the drive to a different Cheesecake Factory than eat here.

Waited for 2 hours for a table, sat down, no waiter came to us, had to remind them literally 6 separate times for 1. Water 2. Menus 3. Bread 4. Water again and so on. Went up to our waiter and asked him if we could get water after waiting for 20 minutes after the first time and he said he&#39;d bring it right over and didn&#39;t bring it until he brought our food out 2 hours later. It wasn&#39;t even busy by the time we got our table and our waiter definitely wasn&#39;t, he was joking around with his coworkers when we went up. When the waiter finally brought the food he didn&#39;t bring up the utensils and had to ask him and wait another twenty minutes again. Worst customer service I&#39;ve ever seen at a cheesecake. Don&#39;t go here!
Nice location. The staff was welcoming and friendly. I tried their most popular chicken madeira. I liked the place more that the food.

Kinda meh.  Came here for lunch and everything was slow...took like 10-15 for a server to come and take our order.  Then bread came out...then waters...finally after 20 minutes our high chair came (they were &#34;looking for one&#34;..restaurant was nearly empty when we got there!).  Any parent of a toddler knows 20 minutes without anyway to restrain your child at a restaurant feels like an hour!  Food was ok but honestly the service you get in marina del Rey is so much better.

Horrible service ever!!! This waitress B was so rude to us without saying please. No smile no conversation compare to other customers. Of course understand we don&#39;t speak English like native speaker but does it matter? She has to be rude to us? We were totally unhappy customers. So discriminated and really sad dinner at this restaurant. Under the table some food on the floor, asked the front lady to have folks for cake( to go) but she said she doesn&#39;t work at bakery. That&#39;s it! So she&#39;s wearing microphone on her ear what is it for? This restaurant made us really bad feeling and don&#39;t wanna even come back to Santa Monica.

I ordered take out, I got the wrong order. I called the restaurant to ask if I could return the wrong order and pick up the correct order, that&#39;s when the mayhem ensued. I was put on hold and transferred to different people (4 total) and each said &#34;sorry but I don&#39;t have the authority to help you...you&#39;ll need to speak to a manager&#34;. Finally asked for manager was put on hold for another 20 mins and nobody came to the phone. Horrible customer service!! I was on hold for a total of 35 mins. Finally gave up. What a terrible restaurant....don&#39;t waste your money. NEVER AGAIN!!

The food was delicious but the service sucked. We wanted a seat outside to see the view, and our hostess was nice but she tried to stick us in a crappy spot probably because she thought we wouldn&#39;t know better to say anything. But we did and we eventually got a nice spot. Our waiter did not bring us bread or straws when we saw every other table have both. And then our waiter assigned us a new waiter named Alex, and he stole our change and literally avoided us for the rest of our stay. It wasn&#39;t much money but he still did not bring it back and he avoided eye contact, coming to our table, and even ran outside when we went back inside the actual restaurant to leave. Food was good but service sucked
Food is great. Louisiana chicken pasta is my favorite. Staff is friendly. Location is great and convenient

Came here for my 16th anniversary dinner and Unfortunately I had to bring my kids with me ... so we get there and they sat us down overlooking the promenade which was a beautiful view but then.. they took forever to bring our drinks took even longer to bring my martini the waiter said the bar was busy even though it&#39;s Monday the waiter took our order and we waited at least 30 min for our food but the forgot my son we had to wait another 15 minutes to get a waiters attention in order for them to bring it out which took an additional 10-15 minutes which by then my food was cold the waiter never came around for refills and when my husband asked for the dessert menu he let them know it was our anniversary and if they could do something extra to my cheesecake they gladly obliged .. I didn&#39;t realize that meant I was going to get my dessert last AND the waiter was going to forget the lighter to light up my sad little candle and I would still have to wait in order to enjoy my slice will definitely reconsider coming here again for anything special
Tourist trap.<br>No service. Waited 45 minutes,  the waiter said it will be maximum 30.<br>We waited 25 min with baby crying to get the high chair.<br>Bad service. <br>0 star. Won&#39;t return

Came here for a dinner with some close friends. The wait to get seated was so long and the service was really slow! It was the only place open after 9 or 10 pm, so definitely a last resort! The food was not bad, but not worth the time that we waited to get seated.
BRAND NEW RESTAURANT come in and visit and enjoy the great ambience... Weekends get pretty busy so be prepared for a wait but its a GREAT PLACE W. GREAT ppl so come check us out
Very disappointed! Came for my birthday dinner and waited 2 hours to be seated they seated our party separately and service was horrible! Never again!

Traveling for business I typically dine alone. First time I went here I sat in the bar and was served promptly. I had a Mango Chicken Salad which was great. Tonight I went there was promptly seated in the dining area. However no one came to wait on me. After nearly 15 minutes with no WIFI to amuse myself (they don&#39;t offer it) I got the attention of one of the servers. After another 5 they found my server, who apologized. However the service was still very slow, and I felt very unimportant to them. Food was ok. I am a busy person and can&#39;t be that patient especially when Santa Monica has so many other good restaurants with far superior service.

Oh Cheesecake Factory, you need some work as we all can certainly tell you are a BRAND NEW location and you just don&#39;t have it together like other Cheesecake Factories do in Pasadena and in Redondo Beach.<br><br>Our waiter was pleasant but unfortunately he did have body odor which probably bothered only me since I&#39;m sensitive about this. Every time he&#39;d pass by, I&#39;d get a strong whiff. BO is understandable after a long whole day of work but really if it&#39;s only 12-noon and the restaurant opened at 10 or 11am, really? Is it necessary to expose us all to that? Can you please use some anti-perspirant? In any other industry, maybe it&#39;s accepted if you&#39;re an athlete but if you&#39;re working in customer service, have some customer service smells to go with it.<br><br>So all was alright until we started receiving our orders....the bf ordered a chicken sandwich and they brought him the wrong sandwich. And yanno, sometimes that happens! However, what really irked me is that our waitor insisted that his sandwich was the right sandwich and since the bf has been eating at Cheesecake Factory for years upon years on end, he knew it was not the right sandwich. So, they brought it back into the kitchen. But what sucked is that everyone else&#39;s food had already been brought out and now he has nothing to nibble on. Ok, I fib, he has a tiiiny salad. But the waitor essentially forgot the dressing? What gives? <br>So now about 10-15 minutes later the waitor brings out his sandwich and it is TINY!. We&#39;re all looking at it like, &#34;Where&#39;s the rest of the sandwich?&#34; So the bf asks, the waitor looks at it, and then he *insists* it&#39;s the normal size sandwich as the bf did NOT order from the lunch menu and ordered the regular portion. Finally after about 2-minutes of back and forth, the manager walks by and affirms that it is INDEED not only the lunch portion but the SKINNY portion size. So now they&#39;ve messed up the order twice and everyone else is pretty much ¾ or almost finished with their meal.<br><br>To top off the cake, even though I had specifically ordered the lunch portion and everyone in our party had heard including the person sitting right next to where our waitor was standing, the waitor gave me the dinner size portion and charged me for his mistake. Aiyah, a little too many mistakes, Mr. Waitor--I&#39;m sure in a couple months you&#39;ll be a great waitor if you can just stop arguing with the customer when you make a mistake. That kind of just, stinks.<br><br>Pros: Food is still great!<br>There is absolutely no wait on weekends for lunch. Wowzers.

Worst run cheesecake in the world literally.  First they lie to you about the wait tell you 15 to 20 ..its more like 30 to 49 then they make you wait like you&#39;re at your doctors office for the hostess to seat you ... honestly your food will never get there your server won&#39;t make eye contact with anyone because she&#39;s over run the amazing 1 basket if bread may arrive during your stay .. just before you lose it ... I&#39;ve been going to this restaurant since I was a teen in marina del ray in the 90 s ..THIS PLACE SUCKS. I travel from LA to N.Y. to Miami regularly and will never come here and may start avoiding them elsewhere after this. Finally got our food .. fries stale .. meat dry, they sent out an app that looked ridiculous .the food runner was even laughing like at heck am I giving you... sad sad sad .. oh and if this is manager reading this ... you should be ashamed of yourself ..or hire help

Great location! Beautiful restaurant! Wonderful staff :) <br>It can get very busy, being such a huge restaurant. But I was very happy with the way my family was taken care of. We had a party of 7 and it only took about 30 minutes on a Saturday for us to be sat. Ashley was our waitress and she was there to greet us with a smile and take our drink order almost instantly. The delicious bread followed right away and all our food came out rather quickly and all of it was delicious! Ashley checked in on us regularly and took very good care of us. We were celebrating a birthday and a group sang and we all shared the salted caramel cheesecake! It was to die for!<br>Not sure about all the negative reviews, but we will definitely be coming back!

Told us the wait was 15, turns out they forgot about us even with our buzzer, then we were seated on the patio which was fine at first. Down part about that was the waitress had the crappiest attitude about everything, didn&#39;t get our WATERS! OR BREAD for over 30 minutes, and pulled the biggest fit when I asked if we could be seated inside instead since the heaters weren&#39;t working. Once we were seated inside she didn&#39;t inform our new waiter what we ordered, until she ran in last minute quickly put our drinks on the table n ran off, also forgot to mention she snapped at my business partner about moving his phone out of the way so she could put the drinks down. Over another 30 minutes we finally got our food, my guests pasta was over cooked, macaroni was drenched in water? Fries were beyond stale? We informed our new waiter if we could speak to a manager which we were introduced to a women who didn&#39;t give us her name but told us we could get new plates which later on we received our new pasta which was again over cooked. Fries were okay once they made us new ones, but overall will not come back at all due to this service. Wasn&#39;t even that busy, I&#39;ll drive to downtown LA instead to get better service hopefully.
The food is amazing. But more unhealthy than anything ever in history. I mean I could go to inn out and go crazy and it&#39;ll be about he same thing. Still a winner though.

The service is ok and the food quality is not up to standard I have visited this location various times and tried to give them and opportunity to redeem themselves, however my visit today will be my last. My food was cold and my order was incomplete missing the tempura asparagus that came with my meal. So my plate was sent back to the kitchen where the plate was warmed but my food was still the same temperature and still incomplete when it was brought back to me.  Nonetheless I was very disappointed with my experience at the Santa Monica location I hope they make the necessary improvements because this location is most convenient for me but due to their service I can not support them at this time.
This place is great fabulous,the food is good service ok.The chiken pasta is one of my favorite,also the miso salmon is the best I highly recommend this place to anyone!!!!

Run to the food court or True Food Kitchen! Two top. Monday afternoon. Easy right? Not for the team working that day. What a great location but wished it lived up to the other locations service. The waiter never came back for any refills or check on the status our order.  Sadly there are plenty of tourist that get this kinda service. FYI on this location you have to ask for the bread basket. Paid for my drink and app and as a local I&#39;ll just admire from a distance or drive to the valley.
Considering how much setting there is and how small the kitchen staff is, Cheesecake Factory brought an above par time and quality of food. I will definitely be back for more later!

I have never had worse service at a restaurant. Walked in and was told a 20 min wait for the patio, I pointed out an empty table and she said there was a wait. I said cool. 30 mins later we are sat at the same empty table. <br><br>We order our food and a hour goes by and the manager comes out and says they burnt my food and had to start over.<br><br>Meanwhile people with dogs are being sat all around us after the hostess told two people earlier that only service dogs were allowed...these dogs were not service dogs in fact they barked their heads off through our whole meal. <br><br>When our food finally came it was mediocre and not cheesecake quality. The salad was wilted and the food that was &#34;burnt and all new&#34; had half of the burnt pieces in it and was way too salty.<br><br>Meanwhile, another tables had half their main courses delayed by 20mins while the other half got their food.<br><br> The table next to us ordered chicken wings and they were raw and bloody...unfortunately the guy was half way through his meal when they discovered the raw pieces.<br><br>When the bill came 2 hours after we sat down, they didn&#39;t remove or discount anything for the horribly slow service and disgusting food.<br><br>I will never eat there again. I hope other locations haven&#39;t gone down hill.

Went here last night with my boyfriend for some appetizers and drinks and we sat in the bar. They were really busy and Katie served us. She was really amazing despite the countless people asking when we would be done so they could reserve our spot in the bar. Although they were really busy we got our food in a timely manner and Katie was really attentive to us. Thanks to Katie we will be back again and again!! :)
Worst cheesecake factory i have ever been, serving is so slowly. Also, if u want to order something, nobody come to u. Waiters are terrible

I was surprised how poorly this Cheesecake Factory is managed. Even when no one is in the restaurant, they make you wait a long time. We waited so long and the restaurant was empty! The manager made us feel that we were inconveniencing her..like her time to help me was so precious!  Forget it! With so many terrific eating options in Santa Monica, why would I want to wait for The Cheesecake Factory?!  My time is precious too Cheesecake Factory! Poor management and customer service! Doesn&#39;t the headquarters care about all of these poor reviews and their customers?  Maybe not?!
This would probably be acceptable food if I went to Norms and paid half as much money. Underwhelming at best.

This is one of my favorite spots. Nothing too crazy no reservation needed. I&#39;ve been to so many locations mostly Marina or Grove area. Excellent. Recently went out for a quick lunch with my sister at the Santa Monica location. We ordered at the same time, her food came before mine no big deal but strange. Usually food comes out at the same time. Time passes i start eating off her plate, because i&#39;m like where the heck is my food i&#39;m starving. Finally our waiter comes back and was like &#34;Sorry about the wait i sent your food bad because didn&#39;t look good&#34;. I&#39;m thinking and you couldn&#39;t have told me this ? Not even offered some water bread even a side salad?  So i say &#34;Wow i thought you guys forgot about me&#34;. He sits the plate down with two baby pieces of chicken in my pasta. Ive ordered it before dinner portion and lunch its never been little balls of chicken like this on the Louisiana Pasta. So now i&#39;m confused. I waited 30 min for this ? I ask if i can get at least a lil more chicken on the side he says i have to be charged. I ask for the manger. She sucks just as much telling me sorry you waited so long nothing i can do you have to pay for extra chicken. Mind you i&#39;m talking to her from the outside of my table she didn&#39;t even have the courtesy to walk up to my table. She&#39;s rude and rushing in a manner of hurry up so i can say no and do what i have to do. I&#39;ve worked customer service before this isnt how you act or treat people. My sisters food is done and we no water no nothing don&#39;t see the waiter again until we need the bill because our parking is about to be up so now i&#39;m rushing my food that i&#39;m unhappy with. Just so i don&#39;t get a ticket. Just horrible service. There are so many places to eat down there don&#39;t waste your time with that kind of service. It wasn&#39;t even busy in there smh. Horrible management.

By far the worst cheesake factory ever. All the food that was ordered was cold. It took more than an hour to get the food. Did not reorder the food as I could not wait another hour to recieve the food.  After finally recieving the food and leaving the very unpolite hostees is standing by the elevator saying it&#39;s closed when it wasn&#39;t even 8pm. Decide to take the stairs and they are absolutely disgusting. Cigarette buts and other trash all over the staircase. For sure will not come to this cheesecake factory again and absolutely do not recommend it. If I could I would rate this cheesecake factory 0 stars

would give five stars if it weren&#39;t for a couple things. the music was so incredibly loud it hurt my ears and worse our waiter couldn&#39;t hear us and vice versa. we shouted our order and when we got our salad to share we asked for plates and spoons. the runner who brought it looked at us like we were nuts or maybe he couldn&#39;t hear what we asked for I&#39;m not sure.<br>The Caesar salad was garlicky and delicious, the fried Mac n Cheese balls were great. The entrees were standard not bad just not overwhelming.

First time at this location in Santa Monica, and I really enjoyed it. The waiter and customer service was great. The food was reasonably priced and had a nice atmosphere. Their pasta and cheesecake are extremely delicious. I would recommend their chicken piccata and chocolate fudge cheesecake. I enjoyed my experience at Cheesecake Factory, and would recommend to eat here to anyone who wants delicious food and wonderful service.

I ordered the &#34;Vegan Chop Salad&#34; and &#34;Chicken Madeira&#34; for delivery. My husband&#39;s chicken madeira was fine, however, my chopped salad did not have the sesame seeds or almonds as listed on the menu. Furthermore, it was not quinoa, but buckwheat in my salad. This is not the salad I ordered or expected. There was zero protein in my dinner tonight. I will not order from cheesecake factory again.

RUDE!  (This review is not about the food, but the service/management).  I called to get info on hosting a party there and was put on hold to wait for the &#34;manager.&#34;  After a few minutes of holding, the phone was picked up by a curt female shouting &#34;YES?!&#34; in a very angry tone.  I could barely get my question out about having a large group of people come and she slams down the phone.  Who does that?!  If the answer was no, it doesn&#39;t take more than 15 seconds to say they don&#39;t deal with things like that.  If I wanted unwarranted disgusted attitude, I would just call my angry chinese mom, not the cheesecake factory!  I&#39;m just going to conclude that this place is managed by a terrible person and never go there.  Ever.

Great location! Looks awesome! Great food! The service is good even though there is a lot of people. Downside is the two entrance system. We were asked to get one of those wait time receivers at the other entrance. When we got there they didn&#39;t have any and they made us wait to get one. The receiver also doesn&#39;t reach past the third floor. They should just take your number and text you when your table is ready like other restaurants. This is a bummer because it restricts you from going to the promenade. Also, when the receiver finally buzzes, you turn it in only to be out in another line. The line system needs improvement, everything else is great!

WORST DINING EXPERIENCE I have ever experienced. We waited 50 Minutes for a table and we were placed outside on the patio despite our request to eat inside.  The bread that was served would have been enjoyed more by my DOG. My Cajun Jumbalaya pasta was crunchy and chewy and the vegetables were still raw. My bill for this nonsense was $62.50.  I paid $80 cash and the waitress FORGOT MY CHANGE!!!  I WILL NEVER RETURN!!! WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE AND HORRIBLE FOOD I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED! DO NOT EAT HERE!!!! The manager was NO HELP AT ALL!!!! I WILL NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Nice place with a great view. The same delicious pasta in Italian restaurants. Only have a little wait here for until a table becomes free.

I must say I was very disappointed in the service I received  today.  usually it is very good  service, but today the service  &amp; the food  was TERRIBLE.  The Waitress  served us Cold Food &amp; the Manager tried to back her up, by saying it was supposed to be served like that.<br>Then on top of that, The Manager wanted  my Cousin and Myself to pay for our drinks that we had. OUTRAGEOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
